On the night of February 26, 1917, the city was in turmoil. Fires break out in the suburbs. The mob looted shops and ransacked squares and parks. In the morning, the revolt is still brewing. A regiment of guards joins the rebels. The mutinous soldiers shoot their officers. The cavalry detachment, which must return from the front at the request of General Khabalov, has not yet arrived. City hospitals are overcrowded. The wounded and sick can no longer receive the necessary care, because most doctors and nurses, mobilized, work in field hospitals. The crowd invades municipal hospitals, like private hospitals, to steal bedding and furniture. The looters throw the sick from their beds. Anarchy sets in. The Prime Minister,

当这些事件发生时，沙皇正在莫吉廖夫的总司令部，靠近前线。被停职的杜马主席米歇尔·罗将科（Michel Rodzianko）通过电报向沙皇通报了首都的混乱情况。彼得格勒的街道上挤满了排的士兵，但他们没有领导，因为他们射杀了军官。他们不再以任何方式代表军队。他们仅凭制服就从人群中脱颖而出。他们帽子上的徽章消失了，腰带不再固定他们的夹克，肩章上也没有出现等级标记。当他们喝完酒后，他们会把枪卖给平民换取一瓶伏特加。他们不再需要枪了。谁想杀人，就用刺刀。

While these events were unfolding, the Tsar was at General Headquarters in Mogilev, near the front. The president of the suspended Duma, Michel Rodzianko, informs the tsar by telegram of the chaos which reigns in the capital. Platoons of soldiers fill the streets of Petrograd, but they have no leaders, because they have shot their officers. They no longer represent the military in any way. They stand out from the crowd only by the uniform. The insignia have disappeared from their caps, the belts no longer hold their jackets, no marks of rank appear on their epaulettes. When they've had a drink, they sell their guns to civilians for a bottle of vodka. They don't need guns anymore. Who wants to kill someone, does it with a bayonet.

2月27日晚，叛军占领了彼得格勒。口袋里装满了酒瓶和抢劫商店和私人公寓的收益的尖叫士兵成为了局势的主人。有了这些掠夺者，平民群众因他们的胜利而欢欣鼓舞。利托夫斯基·扎莫克 (Litovski Zamok) 和佩雷德瓦里卡 (Peredvarilka) 两所州立监狱的囚犯打破牢房门，逃到城市街道上。数千名被判犯有盗窃、抢劫、纵火、强奸和谋杀罪的罪犯也加入了人群。他们身穿黑灰色条纹服装，戴着圆帽和木凉鞋，看起来就像是在狂欢节盛装打扮。险恶的气氛顿时变得明亮起来。大家都知道，罪犯都是快乐的人，尤其是当他们呼吸着自由的新鲜空气时。漆黑的夜里，佩雷德瓦里卡监狱像一支巨大的火炬一样闪闪发光。囚犯们在离开前将其点燃。市法院和秘密警察的大楼Okhrana以及警察或宪兵营房都着火了。许多平民唱着《马赛曲》和《红旗》，或者一首新的革命歌曲：劳动人民起来！他们高喊口号：“无产阶级万岁！” “资本家去死吧！” 和“打倒知识分子！” »

On the night of February 27, the rebels dominate Petrograd. The screaming soldiers, their pockets full of liquor bottles and the proceeds of the looting of shops and private apartments, become masters of the situation. With these marauders, the crowd of civilians exults because of their victory. Inmates at two state prisons, Litovski Zamok and Peredvarilka, break down their cell doors and spill out into the city streets. Several thousand criminals convicted of theft, pillage, arson, rape and murder join the crowd. With their black and gray striped outfits, their round caps and their wooden sandals, they look like they're dressed up for a carnival. The sinister atmosphere suddenly brightens. Everyone knows that criminals are merry men, especially when they breathe the fresh air of freedom. In the dark of night, the Peredvarilka prison shines like a huge torch. The inmates set it on fire before leaving. The buildings of the Municipal Court of Justice and the secret police, theOkhrana , as well as police or gendarmerie barracks, are in flames. Many civilians sing the Marseillaise and the Red Flag , or a new revolutionary song: Rise up, working people! They shout slogans: "Long live the proletariat!" "Death to the capitalists!" and "Down with the intelligentsia!" »

骚乱蔓延到整个彼得格勒。在其他城市，叛军逮捕当地官员并建立自己的政府。在距彼得格勒不远的芬兰湾科特林岛上的喀琅施塔得，有一个基地，俄罗斯大部分海军都驻扎在这里保卫首都。水手们杀死了他们的上级以及最高领袖维伦海军上将，并将他肢解。

The riots spread throughout Petrograd. In other cities, the rebels arrest local officials and create their own administration. In Kronstadt, on the island of Kotlin, on the Gulf of Finland, not far from Petrograd, is a base where most of the Russian navy is stationed to defend the capital. The sailors killed their superiors there as well as their supreme leader, Admiral Wiren, whom they cut to pieces.

但距离最后的胜利还很遥远。在彼得格勒郊区，警察部队挖战壕，架起路障，拼命战斗，机枪打出名副其实的枪林弹雨。天亮之前，耽搁的步兵团就进城了。它定期开展行动，为警察、宪兵和军队提供援助。任何武装平民、任何醉酒或不负责任的士兵都会被逮捕，如果他反抗，就会被当场处决。人群迅速散去，根本不关心反抗或激战。早上，武装汽车在首都满目疮痍的街道上巡逻。忠于沙皇的军团从前线撤出并抵达城镇。几个小时后，车站，电报和电话又回到了忠诚者的手中。彼得格勒卫戍部队的兵力估计超过 150,000 人。新政府于当天上午组建并就职。由护士驾驶的红十字救护车在街上捡起尸体，并为医院维持秩序。工兵部队拆除了路障，清除了城市中的马匹尸体和被烧毁的建筑物的闷烧碎片。军队食堂给郊区的穷人分发食物：一碗豌豆汤、四分之一条黑面包和一杯甜茶。由护士驾驶的红十字救护车在街上捡起尸体，并为医院维持秩序。工兵部队拆除了路障，清除了城市中的马匹尸体和被烧毁的建筑物的闷烧碎片。军队食堂给郊区的穷人分发食物：一碗豌豆汤、四分之一条黑面包和一杯甜茶。由护士驾驶的红十字救护车在街上捡起尸体，并为医院维持秩序。工兵部队拆除了路障，清除了城市中的马匹尸体和被烧毁的建筑物的闷烧碎片。军队食堂给郊区的穷人分发食物：一碗豌豆汤、四分之一条黑面包和一杯甜茶。

But the final victory is still far away. In the suburbs of Petrograd, the police forces dig trenches, erect barricades and fight desperately, causing a veritable rain of bullets with their machine guns. Before daybreak, the infantry regiment, which had been delayed, entered the city. It undertakes a regular operation to come to the aid of the police, the gendarmerie and the army. Any armed civilian, any drunken or irresponsible soldier is arrested and, if he resists, executed on the spot. The crowd disperses quickly, unconcerned about resisting or engaging in a pitched battle. In the morning, armed cars patrol the devastated streets of the capital. Regiments loyal to the Tsar are withdrawn from the front and arrive in town. In a few hours the stations, the telegraph and the telephone fall back into the hands of the loyalists. The strength of the Petrograd garrison is estimated at more than 150,000 men. A new government is formed and put in place the same morning. Red Cross ambulances, manned by nurses, pick up the bodies in the streets and bring order to the hospitals. Engineer units dismantle the barricades and clear the city of the carcasses of horses and the smoldering debris of the burnt buildings. Military canteens distribute food to the poor in the suburbs: a bowl of pea soup, a quarter loaf of black bread and a cup of sweet tea. Red Cross ambulances, manned by nurses, pick up the bodies in the streets and bring order to the hospitals. Engineer units dismantle the barricades and clear the city of the carcasses of horses and the smoldering debris of the burnt buildings. Military canteens distribute food to the poor in the suburbs: a bowl of pea soup, a quarter loaf of black bread and a cup of sweet tea. Red Cross ambulances, manned by nurses, pick up the bodies in the streets and bring order to the hospitals. Engineer units dismantle the barricades and clear the city of the carcasses of horses and the smoldering debris of the burnt buildings. Military canteens distribute food to the poor in the suburbs: a bowl of pea soup, a quarter loaf of black bread and a cup of sweet tea.

高级官员及其下属保护由新人掌管的杜马。

Senior officers and their subordinates protect the Duma which comes into charge with new manpower.

许多城市的居民表达了对沙皇的声援，以便与主要敌人德国人的战争能够继续下去。运往前线的部队、装备和弹药的列车定期出发前往目的地。

The inhabitants of many cities expressed their solidarity with the Tsar, so that the war against the main enemy, the Germans, could continue. Trains of troops, equipment and ammunition, destined for the front, leave regularly for their destination.

两天后，杜马宣布沙皇将被要求退位。摄政王权将委托给沙皇的弟弟迈克尔·亚历山德罗维奇大公，他将宣布俄罗斯实行君主立宪制。然而与此同时，新首相乔治·E·利沃夫亲王领导的临时政府掌权。

The Duma announces two days later that the Tsar will be asked to abdicate. The regency will be entrusted to the Tsar's brother, the Grand Duke Michael Alexandrovitch, who will declare Russia a constitutional monarchy. In the meantime, however, the Provisional Government led by the new Prime Minister, Prince George E. Lvov, took power.

这个政府刚刚成立，就宣布赦免所有政治犯罪，包括恐怖主义。社会党司法部长亚历山大·克伦斯基致电所有检察官，敦促他们释放所有政治犯，并向他们转达新民主政府的问候。

Barely formed, this government proclaimed an amnesty for all political crimes, including terrorism. Aleksandr Kerensky, Socialist Minister of Justice, telegraphs to all prosecutors, urging them to release all political offenders and to present them with greetings from the new democratic administration.

还宣布，除了此次特赦外，参与骚乱的士兵将不会受到惩罚。因此，新政权受到欢迎也就不足为奇了。支持的信息正从该国最偏远的地区涌入首都：鼓励的话语、在任政治家的问候、对被称为“自由新星”的政府的致敬。

It is also announced that, in addition to this amnesty, the soldiers who took part in the riots will not be punished. No wonder, therefore, that the new regime is becoming popular. Messages of support are pouring into the capital from the most remote regions of the country: words of encouragement, greetings from statesmen in office, tributes paid to the government described as a “rising star of freedom”.

沙皇唯一的兄弟米夏埃尔·亚历山德罗维奇大公被授予王位，他回复临时政府说，只有制宪会议提出要求，他才会同意继承王位。这一消息宣布后，整个俄罗斯都笼罩在一片喜悦之中。即使是被驱逐到西伯利亚的革命者也可以从流亡中返回。获得解放的布尔什维克包括格里戈里·奥尔忠尼启则、斯捷潘·朝乌米安和约瑟夫·斯大林。

Grand Duke Michael Alexandrovitch, the Tsar's only brother, to whom the crown was offered, replied to the Provisional Government that he would only agree to ascend the throne if the request was made by a constituent assembly. A general joy seizes all of Russia at the announcement of this news. Even revolutionaries deported to Siberia can return from exile. Among the liberated Bolsheviks are Grigory Ordzhonikidze, Stepan Chaoumian and Joseph Stalin.

沙皇退位。新俄罗斯诞生了。

The Tsar abdicates. The new Russia was born.

巴库市对彼得格勒发生的历史事件并非无动于衷。早在克伦斯基的宣言宣布之前，一群石油工人就闯入拜洛夫监狱并释放了政治犯。不难理解，新运动的领导人正在走向权力的道路。贝利亚意识到，在这种情况下，他不能离开，否则他将一直与世隔绝，直到生命的最后一刻。他必须采取行动，而且要有洞察力。换句话说，其活动不能涉及风险。拉夫伦蒂更愿意把这种乐趣留给那些不在乎监禁、审讯和殴打的人。这个物种中勇敢的疯子通常会为追随他们的其他人铺平道路。如果这些先驱之一，就像奥尔忠尼启则或斯大林成为领导者一样，他是一个例外，而不是规则。即使运气好，斯大林和其他人也必须为自己的受欢迎程度付出高昂的代价。你必须在逮捕和审讯中幸存下来。他们被驱逐出境的西伯利亚偏远城市的生活当然不是开玩笑。与双方保持良好关系会更好Okhrana与叛乱分子一样。拉夫伦蒂·贝利亚（Lavrenti Beria），指标性的和革命性的，可以忠实地为双方服务，而不伤害任何一方。

The city of Baku does not remain indifferent to the historical events unfolding in Petrograd. Long before Kerensky's manifesto was announced, a group of oil workers broke into Bailov prison and freed political prisoners. It is not very difficult to understand that the leaders of the new movement are on their way to power. Beria realizes that he cannot, in such circumstances, stay away, on pain of remaining isolated until the end of his days. He must act, and act with discernment. In other words, its activity cannot involve risks. Lavrenti prefers to leave this pleasure to those who don't care about imprisonments, interrogations and beatings. Brave lunatics of this species usually pave the way for others who follow them. If one of these pioneers, like Ordzhonikidze or Stalin becomes a leader, he is an exception, not the rule. And even with luck, Stalin and the others have to pay dearly for their popularity. You have to survive arrests and interrogations. And life in the distant cities of Siberia, where they are deported, is certainly no joke. It is much better to be on good terms with both parties, with theOkhrana as with rebels. Lavrenti Beria, indicator and revolutionary, can serve both sides faithfully, without harming either of them.

1917 年 3 月 29 日，拉夫伦蒂生日那天，他收到了母亲寄来的一个包裹和一封信。她写道，塔玛拉和伊拉克利去上学，达蒂科仍在军队里。拉夫伦蒂的母亲说，她对亲爱的拉拉的学习进展感到高兴。现在，十八岁的他即将成为一名受过教育的人。

On his birthday, March 29, 1917, Lavrenti received a parcel and a letter from his mother. She writes that Tamara and Irakli go to school and that Datiko is still in the army. Lavrenti's mother says she is happy with the progress of her dear Lara's studies. Now, at eighteen, he is on the verge of becoming an educated man.

诚然，特克莱的儿子十八岁了，已经是个成年人了，但他的人生还有很长的路要走。他必须用智慧来组织这一生。毫无疑问，那些在彼得格勒分发《真理报》的人，或者组织总罢工的人，以及那些使二月革命的人，将以某种方式成为重要人物。但如果他等得太久才加入他们，他可能会发现自己在问当他们挣扎和受苦时他在哪里。那时他会说什么？

Admittedly, at eighteen, Teklé's son is already a grown-up, but he still has his whole life ahead of him. And he must organize this life with intelligence. No doubt those who distribute Pravda in Petrograd, or who organize general strikes and those who made February revolutionary, will become, in one way or another, important personalities. But if he waits too long to join them, he might find himself asking where he was when they were struggling and suffering. What would he say then?

秘密报纸《Bakinski Rabochi》现在几乎公开发行。二月革命后在巴库新创办的《巴库苏维埃消息报》也是如此。该报的编辑名叫阿纳斯塔斯·米高扬（Anastase Mikoyan），他是一位坚定的布尔什维克，自 1915 年起入党。拉夫连季必须立即做出决定：如果他想成为政治人物，就必须发现自己的意图。现在不是拖延的时候。

The clandestine newspaper Bakinski Rabochi is now distributed almost openly. The same goes for the Izvestia of the Baku Soviet , a new daily established in Baku after the February Revolution. Its editor is called Anastase Mikoyan, a convinced Bolshevik, member of the Party since 1915. Lavrenti must make a decision immediately: if he wants to become a political personality, he must discover his intentions. Now is not the time to procrastinate.

二月革命失败了。她招致了《真理报》以及巴库地下报纸的批评。所有这些日报都将其描述为“资产阶级”运动，它没有给无产阶级带来任何好处。临时政府由贵族乔治·利沃夫亲王领导。理事会的所有成员都属于上层阶级。整个政府里没有一个工人，没有一个农民。

The February Revolution failed. She drew criticism from Pravda , as well as underground newspapers in Baku. All these dailies describe it as a “bourgeois” movement, which has brought nothing to the proletariat. The Provisional Government is headed by an aristocrat, Prince George Lvov. All members of the council belong to the upper classes. There is not a single worker, not a single peasant in the whole government.

俄罗斯军队仍在多条战线上作战。他们甚至取得了一些成功。阿列克谢·布鲁西洛夫将军去年发动了一次大规模攻势，将德国人赶出了加利西亚和布科维纳。他八月份的大胆行动促使罗马尼亚加入俄罗斯一边参战。

Russian troops are still fighting on several fronts. They even have some success. General Alexei Brusilov launched a major offensive the previous year which drove the Germans out of Galicia and Bukovina. His bold undertakings in August induced Rumania to take part in the war on the Russian side.

1917年4月16日，数千人欢迎列宁来到彼得格勒。他从瑞士自愿流放归来。他的回归唤醒了布尔什维克心中的希望。但十天前，美利坚合众国参战，支持俄罗斯。有了这种解脱，战争就能很快结束。贝利亚预测，像美国这样的资本主义国家将竭尽全力压制马克思主义国家的任何行动。显然，美国永远不会容忍俄罗斯让自己建立布尔什维克政权。贝利亚总结道，在这种情况下，成为与美国人并肩作战的人之一也不错。最好的是作为志愿者加入俄罗斯军队（学生确实可以免服兵役）。

On April 16, 1917, several thousand people welcomed Lenin to Petrograd. He returns from his voluntary exile in Switzerland. His return awakens hopes in the hearts of the Bolsheviks. But ten days earlier, the United States of America entered the war, supporting Russia. With this relief, the war can end quickly. Beria predicts that a capitalist country like America will do everything in its power to stifle any hint of action by a Marxist state. It is clear that America will never tolerate Russia giving itself a Bolshevik regime. Under these conditions, concludes Beria, it would not be bad to be one of those who fight alongside the Americans. The best is to join the Russian army as a volunteer (students were indeed exempt from military service).

对拉夫伦蒂来说，被派往前线的风险似乎并不算太​​大。美国人将很快结束战争，大屠杀将在被派往战场之前结束。诚然，如果他在战争尚未结束时被派往前线，他会遇到一些危险，但如果他知道如何运用自己的智慧，他将能够避免任何不愉快的后果。受过教育的士兵很少被派往前线。他被用作普通职员中的雇员。所以，这次冒险并没有那么危险。临时政府中虽然人员发生了一些变动，利沃夫亲王仍担任总理，但前司法部长亚历山大·克伦斯基出任陆军、海军部长。他决定与西方盟友并肩作战，直至最终战胜德国。如果战后克伦斯基继续掌权，他的军队的志愿军将在面对布尔什维克时处于有利地位，他们将被视为为国家而战的勇敢的爱国者。

The risk of being sent to the front does not seem too great to Lavrenti. The Americans will quickly end the war and the carnage will have ended before it is dispatched to a battlefield. It is true that if he is sent to the front while the war is still lasting, he will run some danger, but if he knows how to use his intelligence, he will be able to escape any disagreeable eventuality. An educated soldier is rarely sent to the front. He is used as an employee in the general staff. So, this adventure is not so dangerous. Although there are some changes of people in the Provisional Government, Prince Lvov is still the Prime Minister, but the former Minister of Justice, Alexander Kerensky, becomes Minister of War, Army and Navy . He decides to fight with the Western allies until the final victory over Germany. If, after the war, Kerensky remains in power, the volunteers of his army will be in an excellent position, facing the Bolsheviks, and they will be honored as courageous patriots who fought for the country.

1917 年 6 月，贝利亚通过了 Technicum 的考试，并在下个学期被录取。距离学院毕业只剩一年了。他随时都可以得到。现在他还有更重要的事情要做。拉夫伦蒂对自己的未来进行了宏伟的展望。

Beria passed his exams at the Technicum in June 1917 and was admitted to the following semester. There is only one year left to graduate from the institute. He can get it anytime. Right now he has more important things to do. Lavrenti envisions his future on a grand scale.

在一次秘密会议后，贝利亚问梅尔库洛夫，布尔什维克党是否应该派遣更多成员加入沙皇军队：值得信赖的人，他们会在士兵中传播共产主义宣传。那样的话，他拉夫连季很乐意为了党的事业牺牲自己的学业。梅尔库洛夫对这个提议很感兴趣。贝利亚给他留下了深刻的印象，甚至让他有些羞愧。梅尔库洛夫渴望知识，首先希望获得文凭。他从未想过要做志愿者。他承诺贝利亚会将他的想法提交给更有经验的同志，特别是米高扬。

After one of their clandestine meetings, Beria asks Merkulov if it would not be opportune for the Bolshevik Party to send more of its members to the ranks of the Tsarist army: trustworthy people who would spread Communist propaganda among the soldiers. from the forehead. In that case, he, Lavrenti, would be happy to sacrifice his studies for the cause of the Party. Merkulov is enthusiastic about this proposal. Beria impresses him and even makes him a little ashamed. Merkoulov, eager for knowledge, wants above all to obtain his diploma. He never thought of volunteering. He promises Beria to submit his idea to more experienced comrades, particularly to Mikoyan.

梅尔库洛夫很快报告了好消息：米高扬想见贝利亚。由于加入沙皇军队的想法，拉夫连季很幸运地被介绍给了米高扬，米高扬虽然只比他大四岁，但已经是布尔什维克中的老人物了。

Merkulov is quick to report the good news: Mikoyan would like to see Beria. Thanks to his idea of ​​joining the tsarist army, Lavrenti was lucky enough to be introduced to Mikoyan who, although only four years older, was already an established figure among the Bolsheviks.

同一天，拉夫伦季给他的母亲写了一封长信。他赶紧向他宣布考试取得的好成绩，以及自己志愿参战的决定，这是一个忠诚公民对政府的主要职责。

The same day, Lavrenti wrote a long letter to his mother. He hastens to announce to him the good results obtained in the examinations, as well as his decision to volunteer to fight the enemy, which is the main duty of a loyal citizen towards the government.

拉夫伦蒂将信投递到固定在邮局墙上的蓝色盒子里，然后前往招聘办公室。值班中士看到一个想参军的学生既不感动也不高兴。如果他愚蠢地想拿自己的脖子冒险，那是他的事。

Lavrenti posts his letter in the blue box fixed to the wall of the post office, then goes to the recruitment office. The duty sergeant is neither impressed nor overjoyed to see a student who wishes to join the army. If he wants to risk his neck, stupidly, that's his business.

新志愿者立即被派往军事医疗委员会。这个年轻人身体健康，体格健壮。他的近视只是小事。他戴着眼镜来克服这种缺陷，而且无论如何，要开枪，他必须闭上左眼。这可以将问题减少百分之五十。拉夫伦蒂·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚 (Lavrenti Pavlovitch Beria) 被列入 A 类并收到红牌：适合现役。

The new volunteer is promptly dispatched before a military medical commission. The young man is healthy and robust. His myopia is just a trifle. He wears glasses to overcome this infirmity and, anyway, to shoot a gun, he must close his left eye. This reduces the problem by fifty percent. Lavrenti Pavlovitch Beria is enrolled in category A and receives a red card: good for active service.

第4章

Chapter 4

神秘的电报

The mysterious telegram

一长列部队的红色牛车缓缓滚动，不紧不慢。他们穿过金色的麦田和阿塞拜疆的绿色牧场。机器时不时地发出一两声哨声。因此，当接近路障守卫的小小屋时，或者当机械师出于个人原因拉动绳索时，她就会前往十字路口：为了驱散旅途中过于平静的无聊，或者只是为了改道。围观者看着火车驶过，车厢的车门敞开着。他们可能会看到马头、像黑墙的砖块一样堆放的黑面包，或者弹药箱。士兵们在门框里凝视着阳光明媚的乡村，或者唱着军歌。有几个人坐在马车边缘，穿着靴子的腿晃来晃去。它们随着火车的节奏在车轮之间摆动。它们滚动起来，就好像它们要进行某种机动，而不是在真正的战场上。他们甚至不关心自己要去哪里，因为他们服从的是自己的意志之外的意志。他们必须前往被命令移动的地方。

The cattle cars, red in color, of a long train of troops roll slowly, without hurrying. They cross golden wheat fields, the green pastures of Azerbaijan. From time to time, the machine whistles once or twice. She thus proceeds to crossings, when approaching the small hut of a barrier guard or when the machinist pulls on the rope for a personal reason: to dissipate the boredom of a journey that is too peaceful or simply to make a diversion. . Onlookers watch the train go by, the cars of which have their doors wide open. They may see horse heads, loaves of black bread stacked like the bricks of a great dark wall, or boxes of ammunition. The soldiers, in the frame of the doors, contemplate the sunny countryside or sing military songs. A few are seated on the edge of the wagon, their booted legs dangling. They swing between the wheels, to the rhythm of the train. They roll as if they were going to some maneuver, not on a real battlefield. They don't even care where they are going, because they are obeying a will other than their own. They must go where they are ordered to move.

在无尽的车流中，或许只有一个人知道她要去哪里。他就是所谓的拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚，十八岁。由于志愿者有权选择自己服务的部门，贝利亚要求成立水利工程单位。这是米高扬向他提出的建议。拉夫连季知道车队的大方向是罗马尼亚。他也知道他正在被送往他想去的地方。他加入了一个水利技术工程团，据他了解，这些部队被派往罗马尼亚，那里和阿塞拜疆一样，拥有大量石油储备。在他离开巴库之前，党通过米高扬给了他特别指示。他们这样做更多是为了考验他这个新手的能力，看看以后能不能交给他其他的任务，而不是交给他一个重要的任务。虽然俄罗斯军队的其他军团士气最低，但在黑海的罗马尼亚海岸，情况并非如此。战士们听从命令，决心战斗到最后的胜利。党意识到了这种情况，希望处理掉一个年轻、敏感、没有教化、仍停留在简单个人水平上的人。这样的人，如果行动有洞察力，可能会说出一句话或几句话，从而削弱士兵对上级或彼得格勒政府的信心。米高扬向战友们推荐贝利亚的理由是：“当新的民主政府刚刚成立、新的生活已经开始时，为什么我们要在战壕里腐烂，为一项无人知晓的事业而战死呢？”刚刚开始为人民服务？为什么要为了一个不存在的事业而牺牲我们年轻的生命？»

In the endless line of cars, there is perhaps only one person who knows where she is going. It is the so-called Lavrenti Pavlovich Beria, eighteen years old. As a volunteer has the right to choose the branch in which he will serve, Beria requested a hydro-technical engineering unit. This is a suggestion made to him by Mikoyan. Lavrenti knows that the general direction of the convoy is Rumania. He also knows that he is being sent where he wants to go. Enlisted in a regiment of hydro-technical engineers, he understands that such troops are sent to Romania where, as in Azerbaijan, there are large oil reserves. Before he left Baku, the Party, through Mikoyan, gave him special instructions. They did so more to test his abilities as a beginner and to see if other tasks could be entrusted to him in the future, than to entrust him with an important mission. While in other regiments of the Russian army morale is at its lowest, on the Romanian shores of the Black Sea this is not the case. The soldiers obey orders and are determined to fight until the final victory. The Party, being aware of this situation, wishes to dispose of someone young, sensitive, unindoctrinated, and who has remained in the rank of a simple individual. Such an individual, acting with discernment, can utter a word or make a few remarks which would diminish the confidence of the soldiers in their superiors or in the government in Petrograd. The reasoning that Mikoyan recommended Beria hold among his comrades-in-arms is: "Why do we have to rot in the trenches and die fighting for a cause no one knows anything about, when a new democratic administration has just installed and a new life has just begun for the people? Why sacrifice our young lives for a cause that doesn't exist? »

但这样的企业会给贝利亚带来什么呢？如果他想树立一个有思想、有前途的年轻人的声誉，他必须真正精明。只要临时政府是合法的，就没有理由生气。特别是，如果一个人是自愿的，那么即使他同时从事颠覆活动，他也必须被视为热心的爱国者和英雄。

But what will such an enterprise bring to Beria? If he wants to establish a reputation as a thoughtful and promising young man, he must be truly shrewd. As long as the Provisional Government is legal, there is no reason to play pet peeve. In particular, if one is voluntary, one must pass for an ardent patriot and a hero, even if one engages in subversion at the same time.

火车穿过拉夫连季的故乡佐治亚州：熟悉的葡萄园、粉红色的木兰、淡黄色的含羞草和白色芬芳的茉莉花灌木。在第比利斯大车站长时间停留。队伍在那里等了快半天了。在穿越高加索山脉的多日旅行之前，又是一个漫长的停留。火车终于抵达巴统。数千名士兵从停在港口附近支线的火车上涌出。他们把马从黑暗的马车里拖出来，带他们进入阳光明媚的日子。这些人以两到三人为一组，携带机枪，推着装满弹药或手榴弹的推车，在滚动平台上支撑人行桥，并在下面拴上马匹。最终，各排列队前往码头登船。他们留下了牛车，车壁被马踢得粉碎，地板上铺着被践踏的稻草，胡萝卜的颜色，马匹和人的粪便和尿液仍然潮湿，散落着瓶装啤酒或柠檬水，空罐头、报纸碎片和翻起的地毯。

The train crosses Georgia, the native land of Lavrenti: familiar vineyards, pink magnolias, delicately yellow mimosas and shrubs of white and fragrant jasmine. Long stop in the big station of Tiflis. The train of soldiers waits there for almost half a day. Another long stop before a multi-day trip through the Caucasus Mountains. The train finally arrives in Batum. Thousands of soldiers pour out of the train which has stopped on a siding near the port. They tear their horses from the darkness of the wagons to lead them into the light of a sunny day. In groups of two or three, the men carry machine guns, push carts full of ammunition or grenades, support footbridges against rolling platforms and lower cannons to which horses are then hitched. Eventually, the platoons line up and march to the pier to embark on a boat. They leave behind the cattle cars whose walls are smashed in by the kicking of horses, the floors covered with trampled straw, the color of carrots, still damp from the excrement and urine of horses and men, strewn with bottles beer or lemonade, empty cans, scraps of newspapers and upturned rugs.

为期三天的旅程将带船前往罗马尼亚黑海前线的后方基地敖德萨。从那里出发，仍然需要乘坐火车到达亚西，那里是罗马尼亚方面军北翼、俄罗斯第4 集团军占据的防御工事。部队必须做好大规模进攻的准备。当然，没有人知道零时会在什么时候到来，但每个人都感觉很快，也许是明天黎明时分。幸运的是，正如所有总参谋部一样，总是缺乏办事员、电话接线员、电报员，特别是那些已经通过初级阶段并接受过技术指导的人。贝利亚志愿者立即被用于这些专门任务。六月底即将到来，拉夫连季就任新职务。

A three-day trip takes the boat to Odessa, the rear base of the Romanian Black Sea front. From there, it is still necessary to take the train to arrive at Iassy where the northern wing of the Rumanian front, the 4th Russian  army, occupies fortified positions. The troops must prepare for a major offensive. Naturally, no one knows when zero hour will strike, but everyone feels that it will be soon, perhaps tomorrow at daybreak. Fortunately, as in all general staffs, there is always a shortage of clerks, telephonists, telegraphists, and particularly of people who have passed the primary stage and have received a technical instruction. The Beria volunteer is immediately used in these specialized tasks. The end of June is approaching when Lavrenty takes up his new duties.

第1 次 1917 年 7 月，莫洛杰奇诺总司令部的阿列克谢·布鲁西洛夫将军和安东·邓尼金将军下令发动克伦斯基大攻势。黎明时分，在炮火的保护下，大批俄罗斯士兵跳出来，发出可怕的呼喊：“杀！这场致命的战斗阻止了已经前进了两天的德军的行军。高喊“为了祖国！” » « 向敌人进发！“打败德国人！” 数千步兵和骑兵冲锋在前。第一次进攻，俄罗斯人就突破了德国人的防守。他们确实压倒了兰德维尔的前线，并占领了前线的很大一部分。突击时，他们跳入敌军战壕，用刺刀战斗，用枪托、用刀、用拳头和牙齿，像农民一样在盲目的愤怒驱使下进行攻击。德国人无法抵抗这样的攻击。他们的军队，以德军东线总参谋长埃里希·冯·鲁登道夫将军为首，必须撤退。俄军立即占领了兰德维尔保卫的后线。其他致命的战斗导致了俄罗斯的其他胜利，击溃了六个德国步兵师以及刚从西线调来的炮兵。以德军东线总参谋长埃里希·冯·鲁登道夫将军为首的部队必须撤退。俄军立即占领了兰德维尔保卫的后线。其他致命的战斗导致了俄罗斯的其他胜利，击溃了六个德国步兵师以及刚从西线调来的炮兵。以德军东线总参谋长埃里希·冯·鲁登道夫将军为首的部队必须撤退。俄军立即占领了兰德维尔保卫的后线。其他致命的战斗导致了俄罗斯的其他胜利，击溃了六个德国步兵师以及刚从西线调来的炮兵。

The 1st July 1917, the high command, Generals Alexeï Broussilov and Anton Denikine, of the General Headquarters of Molodetchno, gives the order to launch the great Kerensky offensive. At dawn, protected by artillery fire, huge numbers of Russian soldiers leap out with a horrible cry: “Kill! The deadly fighting stopped the march of the German troops who had been advancing for two days. Shouting "For the fatherland!" » « On to the enemy! "Defeat the Germans!" thousands of infantry and cavalry charged to the front. At the first push, the Russians broke the German defense. They literally overwhelmed the front lines of the Landwehr and took possession of a large portion of the front. During the assaults, they jump into enemy trenches and fight with bayonets, with gun butts, with knives, using fists and teeth, striking like peasants, driven by blind rage. The Germans cannot resist such an assault. Their army, at the head of which is General Erich von Ludendorff, commander-in-chief of the general staff of the German forces in the east, must beat a retreat. The Russians immediately seized the rear lines defended by the Landwehr. Other deadly battles, leading to other Russian victories, allow to break six German infantry divisions as well as the artillery freshly transferred from the Western front. at the head of which is General Erich von Ludendorff, commander-in-chief of the general staff of the German forces in the east, must beat a retreat. The Russians immediately seized the rear lines defended by the Landwehr. Other deadly battles, leading to other Russian victories, allow to break six German infantry divisions as well as the artillery freshly transferred from the Western front. at the head of which is General Erich von Ludendorff, commander-in-chief of the general staff of the German forces in the east, must beat a retreat. The Russians immediately seized the rear lines defended by the Landwehr. Other deadly battles, leading to other Russian victories, allow to break six German infantry divisions as well as the artillery freshly transferred from the Western front.

总司令布鲁西洛夫将军在卡梅涅茨-波多利斯克的总部亲自指挥罗马尼亚东部战线。该战线受到党的特别关注，因为它为年轻的布尔什维克支持者的活动提供了极好的训练场。

The Commander-in-Chief, General Brusilov personally directs the eastern front of Romania, from his headquarters in Kamenetz-Podolsk. This front is of particular concern to the Party, because it provides an excellent training ground for the activities of a young Bolshevik supporter.

德国总参谋部意识到共产党特工在俄罗斯军队中广泛颠覆所发挥的作用。他在那里看到了很多支持。这些阴谋家中的许多人都按照列宁的指示行事：“越坏越好”。列宁认为布尔什维克只有摧毁民主的俄罗斯及其领导人才能夺取政权。因此出现了破坏行为。

The German General Staff is aware of the role played by widespread subversion by Communist agents in the Russian forces. He sees a lot of support there. Many of these conspirators act on Lenin's directive: "The worse, the better." Lenin believed that the Bolsheviks could only take power by ruining democratic Russia and its leaders. Hence the actions of sabotage.

就该党而言，其行动必须削弱整个俄罗斯对其政府的信心。

The Party, for its part, must act in such a way as to undermine the confidence that the whole of Russia has in its government.

7 月 6 日至 7 日夜间，一份正式报告通过电报抵达彼得格勒；据说是西南司令部派来的。第二天，俄罗斯各地的报纸都报道了这一消息。电报称，上午十时许，第607团未接到命令就离开战壕，撤出前线。驻扎在附近的其他团也做了同样的事情，随后德军立即占领了废弃的俄军阵地。该新闻稿完全错误。甚至还写得不好。但这是战争，人们的神经已经紧张到了崩溃的边缘：这个消息震惊了全国。

During the night of July 6-7, an official report arrived by cable in Petrograd; he is supposedly sent by the Southwest Headquarters. The next day, the newspapers broadcast it throughout Russia. The telegram states that at ten o'clock in the morning, the 607th regiment left the trenches without having received the order, and withdrew from the front. The other regiments, stationed nearby, did the same and, immediately afterwards, the Germans occupied the deserted Russian positions. This press release is completely false. It is even poorly written. But it's war, nerves are stretched to breaking point: the news stuns the nation.

目前尚不清楚是谁写了这封电报，也不知道是谁亲自将其发送到首都来打击俄罗斯人民的士气。该事件有多个版本，但没有令人信服的证据。然而，在1952年的《苏联大百科全书》中，拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚政委的传记几乎占据了两页，历史学家将贝利亚在俄罗斯军队服役的时期描述为“巨大的军事活动时期”。 ”。

It is still not known who wrote this telegram, or who personally sent it to the capital to break the morale of the Russian people. There are several versions of the event, but without convincing evidence. However, in the Great Soviet Encyclopedia of 1952, where Commissar Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria's biography occupies almost two pages, historians describe the period during which Beria was in service in the Russian army as a period "of immense diversion in the army on the Romanian front”.

第5章

Chapter 5

回到学校

Back to school

经过六天的战斗，德军的几个师发起反攻，封锁了俄军。

After six days of fighting, several German divisions launched a counter-offensive and blocked the Russians.

列宁决定利用这一形势来实施他的计划。1917年7月16日，他在首都挑起骚乱。第二天，大约两万名来自喀琅施塔得的水手被布尔什维克争取到革命，从波罗的海来到彼得格勒。他们刚抵达涅瓦河港口，就听到“一切权力归苏联！”的呼喊声冲了上去。前往沙皇门徒、芭蕾舞女演员克切辛斯卡的前宫殿，列宁现在居住于此。他们一重新集合，列宁就出现在阳台上。当欢呼声平息后，他发表了反对临时政府的尖锐讲话。他在长篇大论的最后敦促水手们捍卫革命并继续忠诚于布尔什维克。人群遍布城镇，高呼“打倒临时政府！»

Lenin decides to take advantage of the situation to carry out his plans. On July 16, 1917, he provoked riots in the capital. The next day, about twenty thousand sailors from Kronstadt, won over to the revolution by the Bolsheviks, descended from the Baltic on Petrograd. Hardly had they reached the port of the Neva when they rushed to the cry of "All power to the Soviets!" to the former palace of a protegee of the Tsar, the ballerina Kchessinska, where Lenin now resides. As soon as they have regrouped, Lenin appears on the balcony. When the cheers died down, he delivered a sharp speech against the Provisional Government. He ends his harangue by urging the sailors to defend the revolution and to remain devoted Bolsheviks. The crowd spreads through town shouting “Down with the Provisional Government! »

无法放下金属百叶窗的商店立即被强行闯入并遭到抢劫。伏特加当场就喝完了。醉醺醺的水手们中加入了一群流氓和士兵，其中大部分是掠夺者或逃兵。不久之后，来自各工厂的罢工工人也加入了他们的行列。

Shops that were unable to lower their metal shutters were immediately forced into and looted. The vodka is drunk on the spot. The tipsy sailors are joined by a crowd of hooligans and soldiers, mostly marauders or deserters. Soon after, striking workers from various factories joined them.

部长们在灯笼下唱歌！人群向政府总部塔夫里德宫行进。涅瓦大街上，有几辆军用卡车驶过。他们挤满了大声威胁政府的男人和女人。人群拦住衣冠楚楚的路人并殴打他们，称他们为资产阶级。一名叛军士兵向一辆电车开枪。车停下来，受惊的乘客跑到房屋门口避难。人群掀翻车辆，堵塞交通。

Singing Ministers by the Lantern! the crowd marches towards the Tauride Palace, government headquarters. On Nevsky Prospekt, several military trucks pass by. They are packed with men and women shouting threats against the government. The crowd stops well-dressed passers-by and beats them up, calling them bourgeois. A rebel soldier shoots at a tram. The vehicle stops, the frightened passengers run to take refuge in the doors of the houses. The crowd overturns the vehicle to block traffic.

那一天，整个城市陷入混乱。列宁明白他已经释放了他自己将不再能够控制的力量。当晚和第二天，骚乱几乎达到了内战的程度。人群抢劫商店，士兵向居民区的窗户开枪。被认定为银行或工厂董事的个人被绞死。

That day, the entire city descends into chaos. Lenin understands that he has released forces that he himself will no longer be able to control. During the night and the following day, the riots almost reached the level of a civil war. Crowds loot shops, soldiers shoot at windows in residential neighborhoods. Individuals, recognized as bank or factory directors, were hanged.

然而红军还没有掌控局势。在首都的住宅区以及某些主干道或大街上，效忠政府的部队架起机枪，开始向叛乱分子开火。叛军盘踞在门口和建筑物内，从窗户、阳台和屋顶开枪。但工人们并不知道如何正确使用武器。而叛逆的水手和士兵都喝醉了，无法直射。很快革命者就必须撤退。正规军夺回了这座城市，一条又一条街道，一个又一个街区。第三天半夜之前，彼得格勒恢复秩序。

Yet the Reds are not yet masters of the situation. In the residential area of ​​the capital, as well as in certain main arteries or avenues, troops loyal to the government set up their machine guns and began to fire on the mutineers. The rebels, entrenched in doorways and in buildings, fired from windows, balconies and roofs. But the workers are unaware of the proper use of weapons. And the rebellious sailors and soldiers are too drunk to shoot straight. Soon the revolutionaries must retreat. Regular troops recaptured the city, street after street, neighborhood after neighborhood. Before the middle of the third night, order returns to Petrograd.

两天的战斗，数百人死亡，受伤人数是其两倍，激起了全国对布尔什维克的失望。由于临时政府奉行社会主义和民主政策，共产党人的受欢迎程度正在下降，甚至在许多工人中，他们的同志似乎已经白白牺牲了。

The two days of combat, several hundred dead and twice as many wounded provoke the disappointment of the whole nation with regard to the Bolsheviks. The popularity of the Communists is declining, even among many workers to whom their comrades seem to have died in vain, since the Provisional Government pursues a socialist and democratic policy.

为了向全国展示布尔什维克的颠覆作用，政府向媒体披露了此前一直保密的文件的重要段落。1917 年 7 月 19 日的报纸提供了列宁是受德国雇佣的敌方特工的证据。他们透露了与他长期接触的两名德国参谋希迪茨基和吕伯斯的名字。俄罗斯当局还引用了德国、瑞典和俄罗斯银行的名称7，德国人​​在这些银行以超过 200 万卢布的价格向列宁提供黄金，以使他能够继续进行颠覆活动。

To show the nation the subversive role of the Bolsheviks, the government reveals to the press the essential passages of documents kept secret until then. The newspapers of July 19, 1917, provide proof that Lenin was an enemy agent paid by Germany. They reveal the names of two German staff officers, Schiditski and Luebers, who had been in contact with him for a long time. The Russian authorities also cite the names of German, Swedish and Russian banks 7 where the Germans made gold available to Lenin for more than two million rubles, in order to enable him to continue his subversive activity.

列宁担心受到指控和逮捕，决定尽快离开该国。在铁路工人、忠诚的党员谢尔戈·阿利卢耶夫（Sergo Alliluyev）破旧的郊区公寓里，列宁剃掉了他明显的胡须和胡须，给皮肤上色，并穿上了铁路工人的制服。7月24日晚，他在战友兼朋友格里戈里·季诺维也夫的陪同下步行离开了这座城市。在远离郊区的地方，两名逃犯跳上一列前往芬兰边境的火车。

Lenin, fearing to be accused and arrested, decides to leave the country as soon as possible. In the shabby suburban apartment of Sergo Alliluyev, a railroad worker and devoted member of the Party, Lenin shaved his unmistakable beard and mustache, colored his skin and put on a railroad worker's uniform. On the night of July 24, he left the city on foot, accompanied by his comrade and friend Grigori Zinoviev. Far beyond the suburbs, the two fugitives jump on a train en route to the Finnish border.

克伦斯基的攻势取得了几天的成功后就崩溃了。德国人增援了保罗·冯·兴登堡将军和埃里希·冯·鲁登道夫将军的军队。新的炮兵师投入战斗。德国军队甚至使用了一种新的恶魔武器：毒气。德军发起新一轮野蛮而绝望的进攻。他们深入俄罗斯防线。从这一刻起，大撤退开始了。在罗马尼亚和西南部的前线，俄罗斯军队被粉碎。兴登堡的军队已经占领了加利西亚和布科维纳，并迅速占领了里加，向北部战线发动了猛烈进攻。与此同时，德国、奥地利和保加利亚联军进入罗马尼亚，占领了其一半领土。

After a few days of success, the great Kerensky offensive collapsed. The Germans reinforce the armies of Generals Paul von Hindenburg and Erich von Ludendorff. New artillery divisions are thrown into the battle. The German army even uses a new and diabolical weapon: poison gas. The Germans launch a new savage and desperate attack. They penetrate deep inside the Russian lines. From this moment begins the great retreat. On the fronts of Romania and the south-west, the Russian armies are crushed. Hindenburg's army, which had already occupied Galicia and Bukovina, quickly seized Riga, in a violent attack launched on the northern front. At the same time, the combined forces of Germans, Austrians and Bulgarians entered Romania and occupied half of its territory.

战场上遭受的灾难激起了俄罗斯全国的反战情绪。从1917年9月起，彼得格勒几乎每天都爆发罢工。出现了新的粮食骚乱。以托洛茨基为首的共产主义特工和破坏分子不择手段地煽动失败主义和混乱。夜间，街道上响起枪声、枪声、爆炸声。火灾发生。第二天早上，惊恐的路人经常会看到一具在夜间被杀的男子的尸体仍然躺在人行道上。

The disasters suffered on the battlefields stir up hostility to war throughout Russia. From September 1917, strikes broke out almost every day in Petrograd. There are new food riots. Communist agents and saboteurs, led by Leon Trotsky, foment defeatism and confusion by any means possible. During the night there are shootings in the streets, gunshots, explosions. Fires break out. The next morning, it is not uncommon for horrified passers-by to see the body of a man, killed in the night and still lying on the sidewalk.

十月，触发革命的时机似乎已经成熟。列宁回到俄罗斯并返回彼得格勒组织起义力量。他的使者在彼得格勒卫戍部队的士兵中成功地工作。列宁认为，这次起义只要得到军队的支持，就能成功。

In October, the situation seems ripe to trigger the revolution. Lenin returns to Russia and returns to Petrograd to organize the rebel forces. His emissaries work successfully among the soldiers of the Petrograd garrisons. Lenin thinks that, this time, the uprising can succeed, if it obtains the support of the army.

1917年11月7日，伟大革命爆发。伴随着“为大众带来和平与面包！”的呼声。和“资本家和资产阶级去死！” 叛乱的士兵和人群遍布整个城市，手持枪支、刺刀和刀具，杀害任何看似中产阶级、公务员、专业人士或雇员的人。第二天，冬宫被占领，克伦斯基临时政府垮台。一个新的政府——人民委员会苏维埃——取而代之。列宁担任新委员会主席，托洛茨基担任外交委员，斯大林担任民族委员。其他九名委员仍被任命。新政权关闭了所有私营企业、工厂和工厂。国家没收它们。它们的主人要么被捕，或立即执行。正义被委托给由士兵、工人和农民组成的特别法庭，这些法庭审判被指控叛国、破坏革命、公开发表不同意见或属于上层阶级的人的案件。判决，通常是死刑，是在二十四小时内执行的。没有上诉。最流行的口号是“打倒知识分子！” 甚至“打倒识字的人！” ”。政府设立了专门办公室来审查新闻和各种文字。大批被杀的警察的使命由新的红色民兵接手。那里 破坏革命、公开发表不同意见或属于上层阶级。判决，通常是死刑，是在二十四小时内执行的。没有上诉。最流行的口号是“打倒知识分子！” 甚至“打倒识字的人！” ”。政府设立了专门办公室来审查新闻和各种文字。大批被杀的警察的使命由新的红色民兵接手。那里 破坏革命、公开发表不同意见或属于上层阶级。判决，通常是死刑，是在二十四小时内执行的。没有上诉。最流行的口号是“打倒知识分子！” 甚至“打倒识字的人！” ”。政府设立了专门办公室来审查新闻和各种文字。大批被杀的警察的使命由新的红色民兵接手。那里 政府设立了专门办公室来审查新闻和各种文字。大批被杀的警察的使命由新的红色民兵接手。那里 政府设立了专门办公室来审查新闻和各种文字。大批被杀的警察的使命由新的红色民兵接手。那里契卡，即打击反革命和破坏活动的特别委员会，由列宁的密友菲利克斯·捷尔任斯基同志领导，他曾说过：“我们现在不需要正义。我们需要一场生死之战。他的小队负责逮捕和处决白军军官、他们的妻子和孩子、贵族和上流社会人士。Tcheka的酒窖距离冬宫不远的前警察总部里住满了这些受害者。每天晚上，其中几名囚犯被带出牢房，带到院子里，用​​机枪扫射他们。正是列宁本人宣称：“不使用最残酷的恐怖，我们就无法获胜”，“如果我们不能射杀破坏分子或白卫队成员，那么我们——我们——是什么样的革命？” ”。

On November 7, 1917, the great revolution broke out. To cries of "Peace and bread for the masses!" and "Death to the capitalists and the bourgeois!" mutinous soldiers and mobs spread through the city, armed with guns, bayonets and knives, killing anyone who appears to be middle class, civil servants, professionals or employees. The next day saw the capture of the Winter Palace and the fall of Kerensky's Provisional Government. A new administration, the Soviet of People's Commissars, takes its place. Lenin chairs the new council, Trotsky is Commissar for Foreign Affairs, Stalin Commissar for Nationalities. Nine other commissioners are still appointed. The new regime closes all private enterprises, factories and factories. The state confiscates them. Their owners are either arrested, or executed immediately. Justice is entrusted to special tribunals of soldiers, workers and peasants, which judge the cases of people accused of treason, of sabotaging the revolution, of profession of nonconforming opinions or belonging to the upper classes. Sentences, usually death, are carried out within twenty-four hours. There is no appeal. The most popular slogans are "Down with the intelligentsia!" and even “Down with those who can read!” ". The administration installs special offices to censor the press and all kinds of writing. The mission of the police, killed en masse, is taken over by the new red militia. There of sabotaging the revolution, of professing nonconforming opinions or belonging to the upper classes. Sentences, usually death, are carried out within twenty-four hours. There is no appeal. The most popular slogans are "Down with the intelligentsia!" and even “Down with those who can read!” ". The administration installs special offices to censor the press and all kinds of writing. The mission of the police, killed en masse, is taken over by the new red militia. There of sabotaging the revolution, of professing nonconforming opinions or belonging to the upper classes. Sentences, usually death, are carried out within twenty-four hours. There is no appeal. The most popular slogans are "Down with the intelligentsia!" and even “Down with those who can read!” ". The administration installs special offices to censor the press and all kinds of writing. The mission of the police, killed en masse, is taken over by the new red militia. There The administration installs special offices to censor the press and all kinds of writing. The mission of the police, killed en masse, is taken over by the new red militia. There The administration installs special offices to censor the press and all kinds of writing. The mission of the police, killed en masse, is taken over by the new red militia. ThereCheka, the Extraordinary Commission for Combating Counter-Revolution and Sabotage, is headed by a close friend of Lenin's, Comrade Felix Dzerzhinsky, who once said, “We don't need justice now. We need a fight to the death. His squads deal with the arrest and execution of White Army officers, their wives and children, aristocrats and people of good society. The cellars of the Tchekainstalled in the former police headquarters, not far from the Winter Palace, are full of these victims. Every night, several of these prisoners are taken from their cells and taken to the courtyard where they are machine-gunned. It was none other than Lenin himself who proclaimed: "We cannot win without using the most cruel terror", and "if we cannot shoot a saboteur or a member of the White Guard, then what kind of revolution are we -We ? ".

俄罗斯和德国的停战协议一个月后签署。这是一项单独的和平条约，没有得到美国、英国、法国和意大利这四个盟国中任何一个的批准。1917 年 12 月，阿道夫·约菲、列夫·加米涅夫和莱昂·托洛茨基在布列斯特-立托夫斯克签署了历史性的停战协定。

The armistice agreement between Russia and Germany is signed in a month. It is a separate peace treaty, which does not receive the approval of any of the four Allies: the United States, Great Britain, France and Italy. The historic signing of the armistice concluded by Adolphe Joffé, Lev Kamenev and Léon Trotski took place in Brest-Litovsk in December 1917.

与此同时，贝利亚可以离开克伦斯基的军队，继续在技术学校的学业。她只剩下一个学期就要毕业了，巴库还没有受到革命的困扰。拉夫连季真诚地希望获得这个文凭，特别是因为彼得格勒和莫斯科相距太远，无法提出“打倒知识分子！”的口号。能够到达巴库。

At the same time, Beria can leave Kerensky's army and resume his studies at the technical school. She only has one semester left to graduate and Baku has not been troubled by the revolution. Lavrenti sincerely wishes to obtain this diploma, especially since Petrograd and Moscow are too far apart for the slogan "Down with the intelligentsia!" was able to reach Baku.

贝利亚作为一名前志愿者，在任何地方都享有优先权。他毫无困难地回到了技术学院，全身心投入到学业中，远离了任何政治活动。

Beria, as a former volunteer, enjoys priorities everywhere. He returned to the Technicum without the slightest difficulty and devoted himself entirely to his studies, far from any political activity.

对他来说，放弃任何颠覆性的事业并把自己冒充成一个没有历史的学生似乎是有利可图的，因为在阿塞拜疆和在整个高加索地区，布尔什维克的理想没有找到丝毫的听众。相反，共产主义在阿塞拜疆首都巴库、格鲁吉亚首都第比利斯和亚美尼亚首都埃里温一样声名狼藉。在这三个国家，孟什维克仍然掌权。布尔什维克倾向和党员身份是没有用的。尤其是贝利亚的祖国格鲁吉亚，一直希望摆脱俄罗斯的束缚，重新获得独立。最近发生的事件似乎就是为了这个目的。得益于1917年11月15日苏联颁布的《民族法宣言》，承认各民族的自决权，格鲁吉亚、阿塞拜疆和亚美尼亚希望获得独立。在第比利斯，孟什维克政府主要由自由派知识分子组成。总统尼古拉·齐赫泽和总理契亨凯利在各自国家都很受欢迎。两人都是格鲁吉亚政坛的知名人物。政府与格鲁吉亚孟什维克党领导人之一诺亚·乔丹尼亚领导的工农兵代表委员会地区中心保持着良好关系。孟什维克政府实质上重组了自由派知识分子。总统尼古拉·齐赫泽和总理契亨凯利在各自国家都很受欢迎。两人都是格鲁吉亚政坛的知名人物。政府与格鲁吉亚孟什维克党领导人之一诺亚·乔丹尼亚领导的工农兵代表委员会地区中心保持着良好关系。孟什维克政府实质上重组了自由派知识分子。总统尼古拉·齐赫泽和总理契亨凯利在各自国家都很受欢迎。两人都是格鲁吉亚政坛的知名人物。政府与格鲁吉亚孟什维克党领导人之一诺亚·乔丹尼亚领导的工农兵代表委员会地区中心保持着良好关系。

It seems profitable to him to abstain from any subversive enterprise and to pass himself off as a student without history, because, in Azerbaijan as in all the Caucasus, the Bolshevik ideal does not find the slightest audience. On the contrary, communism has as bad a reputation in Baku, capital of Azerbaijan, as in Tiflis, capital of Georgia, and in Yerevan, capital of Armenia. In these three countries the Mensheviks are still in power. Bolshevik orientation and Party membership are of no use. Beria's native Georgia, in particular, has always wanted to shake off the Russian yoke and regain its independence. Recent events seem to serve this purpose. Thanks to the Soviet Declaration of the Law of Nationalities proclaimed on November 15, 1917 and recognizing the right to self-determination for each nationality, Georgia, Azerbaijan and Armenia hope to obtain their independence. In Tiflis, the Menshevik government mainly includes members of the liberal intelligentsia. President Nikolai Chkheidze and Prime Minister Chkhenkeli are very popular in their countries. Both are well-known figures in Georgian politics. The government maintains good relations with the regional centers of the councils of delegates of workers, peasants and soldiers, led by Noah Jordania, one of the leaders of the Georgian Menshevik party. the Menshevik government essentially regroups members of the liberal intelligentsia. President Nikolai Chkheidze and Prime Minister Chkhenkeli are very popular in their countries. Both are well-known figures in Georgian politics. The government maintains good relations with the regional centers of the councils of delegates of workers, peasants and soldiers, led by Noah Jordania, one of the leaders of the Georgian Menshevik party. the Menshevik government essentially regroups members of the liberal intelligentsia. President Nikolai Chkheidze and Prime Minister Chkhenkeli are very popular in their countries. Both are well-known figures in Georgian politics. The government maintains good relations with the regional centers of the councils of delegates of workers, peasants and soldiers, led by Noah Jordania, one of the leaders of the Georgian Menshevik party.

在格鲁吉亚第比利斯的第比利斯，孟什维克政府在宣布国家独立后得到了全国人民的认可。从那时起，任何想要迟早在格鲁吉亚孟什维克政府中谋取职业生涯的人都应该与这个环境接触。贝利亚相信，他能够在未来的自由格鲁吉亚获得高位，因为他并不缺乏资产：他是梅尔赫乌利村一位贫穷的格鲁吉亚农民的儿子，也是苏呼米的一个小仆人，但他仍然是一个受过教育的年轻人。工程学位和抗德战争中的志愿退伍军人。换句话说，他不能远离政治。他必须随波逐流。

In Tiflis, in Georgian Tbilisi, the Menshevik government meets with the approval of the entire nation after proclaiming the country's independence. From then on, anyone who wanted to make a career sooner or later in the Menshevik administration of Georgia would be well advised to make contact with this environment. Beria believes that he can rise high in the future free Georgia because he does not lack assets: he is the son of a poor Georgian peasant from the village of Merkheouli and a little servant from Sukhum, but he is nevertheless a young an educated man with an engineering degree and a volunteer veteran in the war against the Germans. In other words, he must not stay away from politics. He has to go with the flow.

拉夫连季来到巴库苏维埃《消息报》编辑部，要求见主编米高扬。贝利亚一走进米高扬的小办公室，办公室里有一张又大又高的老式办公桌，桌上摆满了文件，贝利亚就与这位永远微笑的亚美尼亚人进行了私人交谈。拉夫连季问有影响力的布尔什维克，拥有一个知己和一个格鲁吉亚人是否不符合党的利益！在孟什维克阵营。如果是这样，他贝利亚会很乐意承担这个危险而微妙的使命。米高扬承诺让拉夫连季与党的两位杰出成员斯捷潘·乔乌米安和奥尔忠尼启则保持联系，他们在革命后被列宁派往巴库。

Lavrenti goes to the editorial office of the Izvestia of the Baku Soviet and asks to see the editor-in-chief Mikoyan. As soon as he entered Mikoyan's small office, furnished with a large, high, old-fashioned desk covered with papers, Beria struck up a private conversation with the eternally smiling Armenian. Lavrenty asks the influential Bolshevik if it would not be in the Party's interest to have a confidant and a Georgian! in the Menshevik camp. If so, he, Beria, would be happy to take on this dangerous and delicate mission. Mikoyan promises to put Lavrenti in touch with two eminent members of the Party, Stepan Chaoumian and Ordzhonikidze, who, after the revolution, were sent to Baku by Lenin.

格里戈里·奥尔忠尼启则，他的同志们亲切地昵称为“亲爱的谢尔戈”，他本人是格鲁吉亚人，比贝利亚年长十三岁，当米高扬介绍这位年轻的同胞时，他向拉夫连季表达了他的父爱之情。“亲爱的塞尔戈”是巴库党的伟大领袖之一。奥尔忠尼启则是斯大林最好的朋友之一，在西伯利亚流放期间与他同住一室，也是列宁、托洛茨基和季诺维也夫的好朋友，奥尔忠尼启则是筹备彼得格勒七月革命和后来胜利的十月革命的人之一。在巴库这里，这位布尔什维克老卫士，一位功勋卓著的人，享有极大的权威。早在几年前，他就熟知地形，组织炼油厂工人罢工——

Grigory Ordzhonikidze, affectionately nicknamed "dear Sergo" by his comrades, himself a Georgian, thirteen years older than Beria, expresses his paternal feelings to Lavrenti when his young compatriot is introduced by Mikoyan. The "dear Sergo" is one of the great bosses of the Party in Baku. One of Stalin's best friends, whose room he shared during his exile in Siberia, and also an excellent friend of Lenin, Trotsky and Zinoviev, Ordzhonikidze was among those who prepared the July revolution in Petrograd, then the victorious October Revolution. Here in Baku, this Bolshevik of the old guard, and a man of great merit, enjoys great authority. Knowing the terrain well a few years earlier, he organized strikes among refinery workers –

贝利亚向他解释了她的计划。由于他们共同的家园是由孟什维克统治的，孟什维克想要利用列宁制定的伟大的苏联宪法来宣称自己的独立并脱离红色俄罗斯，贝利亚建议共产党人有一个人对他们来说可能是有用的在格鲁吉亚孟什维克党。这个看门狗，如果他本人是格鲁吉亚人，就可以监视他们并向“亲爱的谢尔戈”、斯大林同志和才华横溢的列宁报告。有了这个系统，布尔什维克党就可以了解孟什维克参谋部的一切动向，及时挫败敌人的阴谋。如果这样的人能够对共同事业有所帮助，那么他，贝利亚，

Beria explains her plan to him. Since their common homeland is ruled by Mensheviks who want to take advantage of the Soviet constitution, magnificently established by Lenin, to claim their independence and break away from Red Russia, Beria suggests that it might be useful for the Communists to have a man to them in the Menshevik Party of Georgia. This watchdog, if he himself is a Georgian, could keep an eye on them and report to "dear Sergo", to comrade Stalin and to the brilliant Lenin. Thanks to this system, the Bolshevik party could know everything that was cooking in the Menshevik staffs and it could thwart the intrigues of the enemy in time. If such a man could be useful to the common cause, he, Beria,

奥尔忠尼启则被诱惑了。贝利亚可以自由地首先加入巴库的孟什维克，然后返回他的家乡第比利斯。如果孟什维克掌权并顶住压力，他将留在他们身边。然而，如果红军推翻了他们，他就会成为一名坚定的共产主义者，帮助他在巴库、彼得格勒和莫斯科的前同志推翻可憎的资本家。而且，这个职位并不像看起来那么危险。如果第比利斯的孟什维克政府发现他的双重手段，他们只能把他关进监狱几年。格鲁吉亚很早就废除了政治罪的死刑，而且刑罚很轻。这样，如果最坏的情况发生，贝利亚从监狱释放或被布尔什维克释放，可以扮演为共产主义受苦的烈士角色。它没有那么坏。

Ordzhonikidze is seduced. Beria has a free hand to join the Mensheviks of Baku, first, then to return to his native Tiflis. If the Mensheviks take power and resist pressure, he will stay with them. If, however, the Reds overthrow them, he will appear as a staunch communist who will have helped his former comrades in Baku, Petrograd and Moscow to overthrow the hated capitalists. Also, the position is not as dangerous as it seems. If the Menshevik government in Tiflis discovered his double game, they could only put him in prison for a few years. In Georgia, capital punishment for political offenses was abolished some time earlier and sentences are very light. So that, if the worst happens, Beria, released from prison or freed by the Bolsheviks, can play the role of the martyr who suffered for communism. It's not that bad.

评级

Ratings

7 . 柏林的“Diskonto Gesellschaft”、斯德哥尔摩的“Nya Bank”和彼得格勒的“西伯利亚银行”。

7 . “Diskonto Gesellschaft” in Berlin, “Nya Bank” in Stockholm and “Bank of Siberia” in Petrograd.

第6章

Chapter 6

等着瞧

Wait and see

鉴于其使命的性质，贝利亚可以放弃在巴库的任何布尔什维克活动。甚至有人建议他不要向学校的秘密圈子谈论此事，以免受到怀疑。另一方面，1918 年对于巴库来说是动荡和暴力的一年。

Given the character of his mission, Beria can abstain from any Bolshevik activity in Baku. He was even advised not to speak about it to the clandestine circle of his school, in order to remain above suspicion. On the other hand, 1918 is a year of unrest and violence for Baku.

十月革命后，阿塞拜疆以《列宁宣言》为依据，宣布独立。其他高加索国家——亚美尼亚和格鲁吉亚——也在做同样的事情。在格鲁吉亚，政府仍然掌握在自由派孟什维克手中，并得到社会联邦党人的支持。在亚美尼亚，政府由基督教民族主义政党达伊纳克（dajnaks）保证。在阿塞拜疆，孟什维克有自己的组织，新政府还包括代表该国绝大多数人口的穆斯林党的民族主义者和穆萨瓦主义者（“平等”）。

After the October revolution, Azerbaijan, taking argument from the Declaration of Lénine, proclaims itself its independence. Other Caucasus countries – Armenia and Georgia – are doing the same. In Georgia, the government is still in the hands of the liberal Mensheviks, supported by the social-federalists. In Armenia, the administration is ensured by the Christian-nationalist party of dajnaks. In Azerbaijan, where the Mensheviks have their own organization, the new government also includes nationalists and musavatists ("equality") of the Muslim party, who represent the vast majority of the country.

然而，在多民族人口组成的巴库，受雇于炼油厂的俄共工人却在米高扬的领导下引发骚乱和示威。很快，尽管阿塞拜疆由穆萨瓦蒂主义者统治，阿塞拜疆委员会还是在首都成立：巴库工人代表苏维埃。1917年11月31日，他们宣布了苏维埃的权力。1918年4月25日，莫斯科新政权无视整个阿塞拜疆民族的分裂主义倾向，成立了巴库人民委员会，自称为巴库公社。

However, in Baku where the population is made up of a mixture of nationalities, Russian communist workers, employed in the refineries, cause riots and demonstrations under the leadership of Mikoyan. Soon, despite the fact that Azerbaijan is ruled by the Musavatists, a council of Azerbaijan is created in the capital: the Soviet of Workers' Representatives of Baku. On November 31, 1917, they proclaimed the power of the councils, that is to say the soviets. On April 25, 1918, ignoring the separatist tendencies of the entire nation of Azerbaijan, the new regime in Moscow created a Council of People's Commissars for Baku, which called itself the Commune of Baku.

在这个只管辖巴库市的委员会中，有二十六名苏联委员，由三人组领导：列宁的密友斯捷潘·乔乌米安、普罗科菲·贾帕里泽（又名阿里奥查）和阿齐兹别科夫先生。贾帕里泽是有权有势的奥尔忠尼启泽的好朋友，他是格鲁吉亚人。Chaoumian 虽然有亚美尼亚血统，但在第比利斯出生和长大。

In this council, which only governs the city of Baku, there are twenty-six Soviet commissioners, led by a triumvirate: Stepan Chaoumian, a close friend of Lenin, Prokofi Djaparidzé alias Aliocha and Mr. Azizbekov. Djaparidze, an excellent friend of the powerful Ordjonikidze, is Georgian; Chaoumian, although of Armenian descent, was born and raised in Tiflis.

莫斯科民族委员约瑟夫·斯大林 (Iosif Djougachvili)（约瑟夫·斯大林饰）非常清楚，如果格鲁吉亚同胞试图利用《宪法》保障的权利，他的格鲁吉亚同胞将是最适合遏制其共同家园独立的愿望的人。苏联宣言在理论上非常自由，但实际上却不然。在斯大林的全力支持下，他宣称巴库是“苏维埃政权在外高加索的堡垒”，新的巴库公社立即实行经济和政治改革，并试图在整个阿塞拜疆实行布尔什维克统治和无产阶级专政。除了巴库的这二十六名政委领导各个组织外，列宁和斯大林还派了一些其他人，通过米高扬并得到奥尔忠尼启则指挥的苏联军队的支持。然而，由反革命穆萨瓦蒂分子、孟什维克和社会主义者组成的阿塞拜疆合法政府决定公开争取独立，并出动军队对抗布尔什维克军队。

Iosif Djougachvili (Joseph Stalin), Commissar for Nationalities in Moscow, knows very well that his Georgian compatriot will be the man best suited to curb any desire for independence of their common homeland in the event that it tries to make use of the rights guaranteed by the Soviet Declaration which is very liberal in theory, but not in fact. With the full support of Stalin, who proclaimed Baku "the fortress of Soviet power in Transcaucasia", the new Baku Commune immediately introduced economic and political reforms and tried to impose Bolshevik rule and the dictatorship of the proletariat throughout Azerbaijan. In addition to these twenty-six commissars from Baku, who headed various organizations, Lenin and Stalin dispatched a few others, through Mikoyan and with the support of Soviet troops commanded by Ordzhonikidze. However, the legal government of Azerbaijan, consisting of counter-revolutionary musavatists, Mensheviks and socialists, decided to openly fight for its independence and launch its forces against the Bolshevik troops.

对于贝利亚这样理智的年轻人来说，最明智的态度就是袖手旁观，看看谁最终会获胜。

For a sane young man like Beria, the wisest attitude is to stand aside and wait to see who will ultimately win.

1918年，高加索七月炎热，巴库狭窄、上坡的街道上爆发了艰苦而激烈的战斗。苏联军队对阿塞拜疆国家军队来说太弱了。在海鸥出没的老大街上作战的布尔什维克小部队得到了一个自称为社会主义劳动青年联盟的组织的支持。这些营与布尔什维克并肩作战，只有年轻的理想主义者才能做到。

In the heat of Caucasian July in 1918, fierce and bitter fighting broke out in the narrow, uphill streets of Baku. Soviet units are too weak against the national forces of Azerbaijan. The small Bolshevik units, which fight in the old avenues haunted by seagulls, receive the support of an organization which calls itself the Socialist League of Working Youth. These battalions fight alongside the Bolsheviks as only young idealists can.

这些年轻人中走在前列的是科技学院的学生，他们是秘密俱乐部的成员。他们与他们的领导人梅尔库洛夫、戈格利泽、德卡诺夫和科布洛夫并肩作战。贝利亚小心翼翼地不加入他们，就像他不久前见过的米尔·贾法尔·巴吉洛夫 (Mir Djaffar Bagirov) 一样。自从米尔·贾法尔在一家破旧的郊区小酒馆里偶然遇见米尔·贾法尔以来，拉夫伦蒂就成了米尔·贾法尔的亲密战友，当时他坐在那个来自奥赫拉纳的人旁边，而贝利亚正在港口秘密采访他。

In the forefront of these young people are students of the Technicum, members of the clandestine club. They fight with Merkulov, Goglidze, Dekanov and Kobulov, their leaders. Beria is careful not to join them as does Mir Djaffar Bagirov, whom he met shortly before. Lavrenti has become a close comrade of Mir Djaffar since the day he chanced upon him in a seedy suburban bistro, when he was sitting next to the man from Okhrana, with whom Beria was having interviews secret at the port.

在这些充满英雄主义的令人难忘的战斗中，这些勇敢的男孩，深深地忠诚于共产党，被证明是布尔什维克最忠实的盟友。他们加入红军，以令人敬佩的牺牲精神支持苏联政府。但贝利亚没有参与这一运动。尽管拉夫连季只有十九岁，但他已经是一名经验丰富的士兵，作为一名正规军老兵，他可以比他的许多年轻战友做出更有用的服务。特别是在社会主义工青团的队伍中，有很多十五岁的男孩，不会使用机枪，甚至不知道拿枪。

During these memorable battles, all filled with heroism, these courageous boys, deeply devoted to the Communists, proved to be the most faithful allies of the Bolsheviks. They join the Red Army and support the Soviet administration with an admirable spirit of sacrifice. But Beria takes no part in this movement. Although he is only nineteen, Lavrenti is already an experienced soldier, and as a veteran of the regular army he could render more useful service than many of his young fighting friends. Especially since there are, in the ranks of the Socialist League of Workers' Youth, many boys of fifteen, who have no idea how to use a machine gun and who do not even know not hold a gun.

阿塞拜疆军队比布尔什维克及其支持者享有巨大优势。7月底，战斗结束。巴库的苏维埃政权不复存在。然而与此同时，阿塞拜疆政府意识到胜利本身只是暂时的，决定在英国的帮助下巩固自己的权威。特使离开巴库前往德黑兰，前往驻波斯的英国军队总部执行秘密任务。在德黑兰会议期间，阿塞拜疆代表建议来自波斯的英国军队进行干预以恢复和平。英国有兴趣切断苏维埃俄罗斯的油井通道，并希望侵占油田，同意给予支持并承诺派遣军事远征。随即，LC邓斯特维尔将军指挥下的英国军团占领了巴库。权力掌握在临时政府手中，该政府自称“中里海（跨里海）独裁政权”。该委员会接替穆萨瓦瓦政权。莫斯科的苏联当局试图撤离军队，但阿塞拜疆政府逮捕了他们并将他们关押在战俘营中。巴库公社的二十六名委员被监禁。权力掌握在临时政府手中，该政府自称“中里海（跨里海）独裁政权”。该委员会接替穆萨瓦瓦政权。莫斯科的苏联当局试图撤离军队，但阿塞拜疆政府逮捕了他们并将他们关押在战俘营中。巴库公社的二十六名委员被监禁。权力掌握在临时政府手中，该政府自称“中里海（跨里海）独裁政权”。该委员会接替穆萨瓦瓦政权。莫斯科的苏联当局试图撤离军队，但阿塞拜疆政府逮捕了他们并将他们关押在战俘营中。巴库公社的二十六名委员被监禁。

The army of Azerbaijan enjoys enormous superiority over the Bolsheviks and their supporters. By the end of July, the battle is over. Soviet power in Baku ceases to exist. At the same time, however, the government of Azerbaijan, aware that the victory itself was only temporary, decided to consolidate its authority with the help of Great Britain. Emissaries leave Baku for Tehran, on a secret mission to the headquarters of the British forces stationed in Persia. During the Tehran conference, delegates from Azerbaijan suggest that British troops from Persia intervene to restore peace. Great Britain, which has an interest in cutting off Soviet Russia's access to oil wells and which wants to appropriate the oil fields, agrees to give his support and promises to send a military expedition. Immediately, British regiments, under the command of General LC Dunsterville, occupied Baku. Power is in the hands of a provisional government which calls itself the “Central-Caspian (Trans-Caspian) Dictatorship”. This council takes over from the Mousavatist regime. The Soviet authorities in Moscow attempt to evacuate their troops, but the government of Azerbaijan arrests them and interns them in POW camps. The twenty-six commissioners of the Commune of Baku are imprisoned. Power is in the hands of a provisional government which calls itself the “Central-Caspian (Trans-Caspian) Dictatorship”. This council takes over from the Mousavatist regime. The Soviet authorities in Moscow attempt to evacuate their troops, but the government of Azerbaijan arrests them and interns them in POW camps. The twenty-six commissioners of the Commune of Baku are imprisoned. Power is in the hands of a provisional government which calls itself the “Central-Caspian (Trans-Caspian) Dictatorship”. This council takes over from the Mousavatist regime. The Soviet authorities in Moscow attempt to evacuate their troops, but the government of Azerbaijan arrests them and interns them in POW camps. The twenty-six commissioners of the Commune of Baku are imprisoned.

阿塞拜疆政府严厉惩罚社会主义工人青年团成员。它逮捕了其高级领导人和成员，而最年轻的十七岁以下的人则被学校开除，他们的个人文件上被盖上红色印章，阻止他们入读任何学校。幸运的是，戈格利泽、梅尔库洛夫和其他一些人凭借虚假证件逃脱了镇压。

The government of Azerbaijan severely punishes the members of the Socialist Workers' Youth League. It arrests its senior leaders and members, while the youngest, those under the age of seventeen, are expelled from school and their personal papers are marked with the red stamp preventing them from enrolling. yet in any school. Fortunately, Goglidze, Merkulov and a few others escaped repression thanks to false papers.

他的战友和当地安全部门都不让贝利亚担心。他可以安心地继续学业。

Neither his comrades nor the local security worry Beria. He can continue his studies in peace.

英国对巴库的占领并没有持续多久。邓斯特维尔将军的部队必须在进入这座城市后六周内离开该城市。正是由于担心被一支由坚定而狂热的土耳其人组成的庞大军队的到来彻底消灭，才迫使英国人撤退。第二天，土耳其人不费一枪一弹就占领了巴库。

The British occupation of Baku does not last long. General Dunsterville's troops must leave the city within six weeks of entering it. It was the fear of being exterminated to the last by the arrival of a huge army of determined and fanatical Turks that pushed the British to beat a retreat. The next day, the Turks seized Baku without firing a single shot.

在土耳其人抵达前几个小时，阿纳斯塔斯·米高扬成功说服英国释放了巴库公社的二十六名专员。他们乘轮船离开这个国家。米高扬加入了他们。贝利亚是孟什维克党的成员，无需担心遭到报复。他仍留在巴库。委员们离开巴库时并不知道船长和船员都是反布尔什维克。

A few hours before the arrival of the Turks, Anastase Mikoyan succeeded in convincing the British to release the twenty-six commissioners of the Commune of Baku. They leave the country on a steamer. Mikoyan joins them. Beria, a member of the Menshevik party, has no reprisals to fear. He remains in Baku. The commissioners leave Baku unaware that the captain and crew of the boat are anti-Bolsheviks.

经过里海两天的航行后，游船停靠在土耳其斯坦的克拉斯诺沃茨克。然而，这个地方不提供庇护。当地政府是社会主义的。他立即命令所有乘客停下来。1918年9月20日，二十六名委员被军事法庭审判并判处死刑。晚上，他们被拖到里海的沙滩上处决。该组织中只有一名成员逃脱了死亡：阿纳斯塔斯·米科安 (Anastase Mikoian)。他在监狱厨房里担任助理厨师，并逃脱了行刑队队长的注意。

After two days of travel on the Caspian Sea, the boat docks in Krasnovodsk in Turkestan. The place, however, offers no asylum. The local government is socialist. He immediately orders all the passengers to stop. On September 20, 1918, the twenty-six commissioners were court-martialed and sentenced to death. At night they are dragged to a sandy beach on the Caspian and executed. Only one member of the group escapes death: Anastase Mikoian. He works as an assistant cook in the prison kitchens and escapes the attention of the chief of the firing squad.

1918 年 11 月，战争结束后不久，土耳其不再是一个强国，英国人重新夺回了巴库。布尔什维克运动和共青团活动再次转入地下。共青团_共产主义青年团是一个新的组织，取代了已被削弱的社会主义劳动青年团。在这种情况下，几乎不可能确定谁参与了秘密活动。由于很难知道谁是或不是这些活动的关键人物，贝利亚逃脱了骚扰。他没有被起诉，甚至没有被警方和安全局怀疑，特别是因为他在他们的档案中作为官方孟什维克党的成员出现。他自己的战友们都让他一个人呆着。

In November 1918, shortly after the end of the war, when Turkey had ceased to be a power, the British recaptured Baku. The Bolshevik movement and Komsomol activities go underground again. The Komsomol, the Young Communist League, is a new organization that replaces the decimated Socialist League of Working Youth. It is almost impossible, under these conditions, to establish with any certainty who took part in the clandestine activities. And since it is difficult to know who was, or was not, a key figure in these activities, Beria escaped harassment. He is not prosecuted, nor even suspected by the police and the Sûreté, in particular because he appears in their files as a member of the official Menshevik party. His own comrades leave him alone.

1918年12月，根据新的宣言，民族委员约瑟夫·斯大林和整个苏联政府批准了三个高加索国家的自治倾向，并承认它们的民族政府。达成该协议只是希望英国在这些国家独立后立即撤离。这个马基雅维利计划完美成功。事实上，土耳其崩溃后，英国军队立即从高加索撤军。阿塞拜疆作为一个拥有国家政府的独立国家再次从废墟中崛起。但苏联政府正在等待最有利的进攻时机。巴库布尔什维克党和共青团当地接到莫斯科的命令准备起义。布尔什维克党工农中央委员会保证全力支持他们。1919 年 2 月，亚美尼亚守旧派布尔什维克阿纳斯塔塞·米高扬登陆巴库，为即将发生的事件做准备。他不久前从克拉斯诺沃茨克监狱获释并返回莫斯科。米高扬，负责剧情。1919年4月，奥尔忠尼启则作为俄共中央代表和斯大林代表抵达巴库。曾参加过 1905 年革命的热心共产主义支持者谢尔盖·基洛夫 (Sergei Kirov) 也来到这里，带头准备民众起义。

In December 1918, in accordance with the new Declaration, the Commissar for Nationalities, Joseph Stalin, and the entire Soviet government approved the autonomist tendencies of the three Caucasian countries and recognized their national governments. The agreement is given only in the hope that the British will evacuate these countries as soon as they become independent. This Machiavellian plan succeeds perfectly. Indeed, immediately after the collapse of Turkey, British troops withdrew from the Caucasus. Azerbaijan is once again rising from its ashes as an independent state with a national government. But the Soviet administration is watching for the most favorable moment to attack. The Bolshevik Party of Baku, and the Komsomollocal receive the order from Moscow to prepare an uprising. The Central Committee of Workers and Peasants of the Bolshevik Party assures them of their full support. In February 1919, the Armenian Anastase Mikoyan, Bolshevik of the old guard, landed in Baku to orchestrate the preparations for the events that were soon to take place. He was released from Krasnovodsk prison not long ago and returned to Moscow. Mikoyan, take charge of the plot. In April 1919, Ordzhonikidze arrived in Baku as a delegate of the Central Committee of the Russian Communist Party and as a representative of Stalin. The popular Sergei Kirov, an ardent communist supporter who took part in the 1905 revolution, also arrived to take the lead in the popular uprising in preparation.

贝利亚立即与米高扬以及奥尔忠尼启则重聚。然而，他并没有提供任何特别的服务，而是更愿意全身心地投入到他的课程中。1919年，拉夫伦蒂在机械建造技术学校完成了学业：获得了建筑工程文凭。

Beria immediately reunites with Mikoyan as well as with Ordjonikidze. However, he renders no particular service, preferring to devote himself to his lessons. In 1919, Lavrenti completed his studies at the Technical School of Mechanical Constructions: he received a diploma in construction engineering.

第7章

Chapter 7

打倒资产阶级！

Down with the bourgeois!

凭借他的资质，贝利亚可以在多种职业之间进行选择。他最大的愿望是完善自己的教育并成为一名真正的建筑师。要获得这样的学位，他必须在彼得格勒、莫斯科或敖德萨的一所理工大学学习。然而，这些梦想只是专业项目，没有任何情感色彩。他们并没有满足贝利亚的野心。拉夫伦蒂在翻阅《真理报》时感到一种强烈的嫉妒感，他读到署名科巴的文章，科巴是他的格鲁吉亚同胞斯大林的笔名，他出生于第比利斯附近的哥里村。当他看着这位“亲爱的塞尔戈”时，也是同样的情况，他是另一位格鲁吉亚人，来自库泰斯附近的一个村庄，现在已经成为一位向数千名工人发表演讲的领导人，无论他路过哪里，都被尊为权威，或者当他看到和蔼可亲的阿纳斯塔斯·米高扬（阿纳斯塔斯·米高扬）永远的微笑时，他对他们产生了一种可怕的嫉妒感。阿纳斯塔斯·米高扬当然是亚美尼亚人，但出生在第比利斯附近的萨奈恩村。但拉夫连蒂安慰自己说，如果这三位显贵都达到了现在的高度，他也能获得同样的荣誉、同样的职能、同样的权力。他来自同一个国家，他很年轻，甚至比他们还要年轻，他是贫农的儿子，同样出身于下层阶级。此外，他还拥有建设新世界和与过去截然不同的时代所必需的高技术资格。他有很多优点和出色的比赛。他所需要的只是明智地放下手中的牌才能赢得比赛。确实，大老板是列宁。但在前一年的一次袭击中，多拉·卡普兰在莫斯科一家工厂开枪射杀了他，列宁几乎丧命。之后，列宁并没有从伤势中恢复过来。他能否活得更久值得怀疑。在这种前景下，与老板的继任者建立关系是可取的，后者要么是托洛茨基，要么是加米涅夫，要么是斯大林。贝利亚认为托洛茨基，实际上引发了伟大的十月革命并领导红军取得胜利的人几乎没有机会，因为他的真名是列夫·达维多维奇·布朗斯坦。他是犹太人，所以群众不会长期接受他。加米涅夫-罗森菲尔德也是如此。这两个人不可能成为领导人，即使他们成为领导人，斯大林也很容易解雇他们。对于拉夫连季来说，毫无疑问，唯一可能接替列宁的人物就是斯大林。这意味着，如果能见到斯大林，他的朋友们称他为“科巴同志”或“索索”，并成为他的亲密弟子和崇拜者，那将是件好事。为了实现这一目标，贝利亚可以得到他有影响力的朋友奥尔忠尼启则或米高扬的帮助。或者，不太可能，因为他的真名是列夫·达维多维奇·布朗斯坦。他是犹太人，所以群众不会长期接受他。加米涅夫-罗森菲尔德也是如此。这两个人不可能成为领导人，即使他们成为领导人，斯大林也很容易解雇他们。对于拉夫连季来说，毫无疑问，唯一可能接替列宁的人物就是斯大林。这意味着，如果能见到斯大林，他的朋友们称他为“科巴同志”或“索索”，并成为他的亲密弟子和崇拜者，那将是件好事。为了实现这一目标，贝利亚可以得到他有影响力的朋友奥尔忠尼启则或米高扬的帮助。或者，不太可能，因为他的真名是列夫·达维多维奇·布朗斯坦。他是犹太人，所以群众不会长期接受他。加米涅夫-罗森菲尔德也是如此。这两个人不可能成为领导人，即使他们成为领导人，斯大林也很容易解雇他们。对于拉夫连季来说，毫无疑问，唯一可能接替列宁的人物就是斯大林。这意味着，如果能见到斯大林，他的朋友们称他为“科巴同志”或“索索”，并成为他的亲密弟子和崇拜者，那将是件好事。为了实现这一目标，贝利亚可以得到他有影响力的朋友奥尔忠尼启则或米高扬的帮助。或者，这两个人不可能成为领导人，即使他们成为领导人，斯大林也很容易解雇他们。对于拉夫连季来说，毫无疑问，唯一可能接替列宁的人物就是斯大林。这意味着，如果能见到斯大林，他的朋友们称他为“科巴同志”或“索索”，并成为他的亲密弟子和崇拜者，那将是件好事。为了实现这一目标，贝利亚可以得到他有影响力的朋友奥尔忠尼启则或米高扬的帮助。或者，这两个人不可能成为领导人，即使他们成为领导人，斯大林也很容易解雇他们。对于拉夫连季来说，毫无疑问，唯一可能接替列宁的人物就是斯大林。这意味着，如果能见到斯大林，他的朋友们称他为“科巴同志”或“索索”，并成为他的亲密弟子和崇拜者，那将是件好事。为了实现这一目标，贝利亚可以得到他有影响力的朋友奥尔忠尼启则或米高扬的帮助。或者，并成为他的亲密弟子和崇拜者。为了实现这一目标，贝利亚可以得到他有影响力的朋友奥尔忠尼启则或米高扬的帮助。或者，并成为他的亲密弟子和崇拜者。为了实现这一目标，贝利亚可以得到他有影响力的朋友奥尔忠尼启则或米高扬的帮助。或者，最后但并非最不重要的，甚至可能是三人中最重要的一位，谢尔盖·科斯特里科夫（Sergei Kostrikov），化名基洛夫（Kirov）。这三人来到巴库代表苏维埃政权夺取政权。他们不但要短期解决阿塞拜疆，而且还想吞并整个高加索地区。只有当拉夫连蒂以建筑师的身份凯旋归来，在佐治亚州首都建造令人惊叹的现代建筑，或者如果他以高级政治家、州长或总督的身份返回并拥有生死权的时候，贝利亚计划的返回祖国才有意义，比如一个名字让你恐惧得发抖的人。出于这些原因，在这样的时刻，拉夫伦蒂不应该把他的文凭藏在盒子里留在巴库。

With his qualification, Beria can choose between several careers. His dearest desire is to perfect his education and become a true architect. To obtain such a degree, he would have to study at a polytechnic university in Petrograd, Moscow or Odessa. These dreams, however, are only professional projects without any affective coloring. They do not satisfy Beria's ambitions. Lavrenti experiences a strong feeling of envy when, leafing through Pravda, he reads articles signed Koba, the pen name of Stalin, his Georgian compatriot, born Iosif Djougachvili in the village of Gori, near Tiflis. The same when he looks at this "dear Sergo", another Georgian, originally from a village in the vicinity of Koutaïs, who has become a leader who addresses speeches to thousands of workers and who is hailed as an authority wherever he passing by, or when he observes the perpetual smile of the affable Anastase Mikoyan, an Armenian certainly, but born in the village of Sanaïn, near Tiflis, he feels a terrible feeling of envy towards them. But Lavrenti consoles himself by telling himself that if these three dignitaries have reached where they are, he too can accede to the same honors, the same functions, the same power. He comes from the same country, he is young, and even younger than them and, son of a poor peasant, he also comes from the lower classes. Moreover, he possesses the high technical qualification which is so necessary for the building of a new world and for the coming of times radically different from the past. He has a lot of strengths and a superb game. All he needs is to lay down his cards wisely in order to win the game. It is true that the big boss is Lenin. But after an attack that almost cost him his life the previous year – Dora Kaplan shot him in a Moscow factory – Lenin did not recover from his injuries. It is doubtful that he will live much longer. In such prospects, it would be desirable to establish relations with the successor of the boss, who will be either Trotsky, or Kamenev, or Stalin. Beria thinks that Trotsky, who virtually caused the Great October Revolution and led the Red forces to victory, has little chance because his real name is Lev Davidovitch Bronstein. He is Jewish, so the masses will not accept him for long. The same goes for Kamenev-Rosenfeld. These two men cannot become leaders, and even if they do, it will be easy for Stalin to dismiss them. For Lavrenti, there is no doubt that the only personality likely to succeed Lenin is Stalin. This means that it would be good to meet Stalin, whom his friends call "comrade Koba" or "Soso", and to become his close disciple and adulator. To achieve this goal, Beria could get help from his influential friends Ordzhonikidze or Mikoyan. Or, unlikely because his real name is Lev Davidovitch Bronstein. He is Jewish, so the masses will not accept him for long. The same goes for Kamenev-Rosenfeld. These two men cannot become leaders, and even if they do, it will be easy for Stalin to dismiss them. For Lavrenti, there is no doubt that the only personality likely to succeed Lenin is Stalin. This means that it would be good to meet Stalin, whom his friends call "comrade Koba" or "Soso", and to become his close disciple and adulator. To achieve this goal, Beria could get help from his influential friends Ordzhonikidze or Mikoyan. Or, unlikely because his real name is Lev Davidovitch Bronstein. He is Jewish, so the masses will not accept him for long. The same goes for Kamenev-Rosenfeld. These two men cannot become leaders, and even if they do, it will be easy for Stalin to dismiss them. For Lavrenti, there is no doubt that the only personality likely to succeed Lenin is Stalin. This means that it would be good to meet Stalin, whom his friends call "comrade Koba" or "Soso", and to become his close disciple and adulator. To achieve this goal, Beria could get help from his influential friends Ordzhonikidze or Mikoyan. Or, These two men cannot become leaders, and even if they do, it will be easy for Stalin to dismiss them. For Lavrenti, there is no doubt that the only personality likely to succeed Lenin is Stalin. This means that it would be good to meet Stalin, whom his friends call "comrade Koba" or "Soso", and to become his close disciple and adulator. To achieve this goal, Beria could get help from his influential friends Ordzhonikidze or Mikoyan. Or, These two men cannot become leaders, and even if they do, it will be easy for Stalin to dismiss them. For Lavrenti, there is no doubt that the only personality likely to succeed Lenin is Stalin. This means that it would be good to meet Stalin, whom his friends call "comrade Koba" or "Soso", and to become his close disciple and adulator. To achieve this goal, Beria could get help from his influential friends Ordzhonikidze or Mikoyan. Or, and to become his close disciple and adulator. To achieve this goal, Beria could get help from his influential friends Ordzhonikidze or Mikoyan. Or, and to become his close disciple and adulator. To achieve this goal, Beria could get help from his influential friends Ordzhonikidze or Mikoyan. Or,last but not least, perhaps even the most important of the three, Sergei Kostrikov, known under the pseudonym of Kirov. These three men came to Baku to seize power on behalf of the Soviet regime. Not only do they intend to make short work of Azerbaijan, but they also want to gobble up the entire Caucasus. Beria's projected return to his homeland would only be worthwhile if Lavrenty returned triumphantly as the architect who comes to build stunning modern buildings in Georgia's capital, or if he returned as a senior politician, governor or proconsul invested with the right of life and death, like a man whose name makes you tremble with terror. For these reasons, in times like these, Lavrenti should not stay in Baku with his diploma hidden in its case.

基洛夫抵达巴库一个月后，米高扬将贝利亚介绍给基洛夫。故事发生在 1919 年 5 月，拉夫伦蒂获得军衔后不久。基洛夫是一个俄罗斯农民的儿子，他相貌英俊，短发，蓝眼睛，整个人散发着真诚的气息，他全身心地投入到党的伟大事业中。他是一位出色的演说家，总是充满热情，每次登上讲台开会都会赢得雷鸣般的掌声。从他的第一句话开始：“同志们！兄弟们！老鹰！老鹰！» 直到最后 « 伟大革命万岁！他俘获了屏息聆听的观众的心。他用纯正、优美、优美的俄语发表演讲，而斯大林、奥尔忠尼启则、米高扬或米尔·贾法尔·巴吉洛夫的声音刺耳、难听，带有格鲁吉亚或亚美尼亚口音。这也适用于贝利亚，尽管如此，他还是努力掌握俄语，因为他意识到大众不喜欢外国口音，并且尽可能正确地说俄语是有用的。

Mikoyan introduces Beria to Kirov a month after the latter's arrival in Baku. It takes place in May 1919, immediately after Lavrenti obtained his rank. Kirov, the son of a Russian peasant, handsome in appearance with his close-cropped hair, his blue eyes and that air of sincerity which emanates from his whole person, is devoted body and soul to the great cause of the Party. A magnificent orator, always enthusiastic, he is sure to be greeted with thunderous applause each time he ascends the rostrum to hold a meeting. From his first words “Comrades! Brothers ! Eagles ! Falcons! » until the last « Long life to the great revolution! he captivates the hearts and minds of an audience who listens, breathless. He delivers his speeches in pure, beautiful and melodic Russian, whereas Stalin, Ordzhonikidze, Mikoyan or Mir Djaffar Baghirov have harsh, unpleasant voices spoiled by Georgian or Armenian accents. This also applies to Beria who nevertheless makes efforts to master Russian, aware that the masses do not like foreign accents, and that it would be useful to speak Russian as correctly as possible.

基洛夫在巴库的办公室热情接待了贝利亚。他认为贝利亚是米高扬的年轻同志和朋友。后者热情推荐拉夫连季，将他视为布尔什维克圈子中一位非常有前途的成员。他是一位年轻的同志，只要运用得当，就能胜任任何重要的工作。基洛夫信任米高扬。他承诺一旦布尔什维克在阿塞拜疆掌权，就会记住拉夫伦蒂并任命他为负责人。

Kirov kindly receives Beria in his office in Baku. He considers Beria a young comrade and friend of Mikoyan. The latter warmly recommends Lavrenti, presenting him as an exceptionally promising member of Bolshevik circles. He is a young comrade who, used wisely, can do any important job. Kirov trusts Mikoyan. He promises to remember Lavrenti and give him a position of responsibility as soon as the Bolsheviks come to power in Azerbaijan.

活动时间并不长。1919年5月起，在奥尔忠尼启泽和米高扬的主持下，在巴库召开了外高加索布尔什维克组织会议。与此同时，基洛夫指挥布尔什维克在巴库的秘密活动。正如在这座城市以及阿塞拜疆其他地区一样，布尔什维克仅代表少数，苏维埃政权决定以武力夺取该国。

The event is not long in coming. From May 1919, a conference of Bolshevik organizations in Transcaucasia was held in Baku under the chairmanship of Ordjonikidze and Mikoyan. Meanwhile, Kirov directs the clandestine activities of the Bolsheviks in Baku. As in this city as well as in the rest of Azerbaijan, the Bolsheviks represent only a small minority, the Soviet regime decides to take the country by force.

1919年底前，英国军队撤出，将巴库置于穆萨瓦派民主政府的管辖之下，这是阿塞拜疆唯一的合法政府。盟国认为，他们的撤军可以毫无风险地完成，因为苏联的《民族法宣言》承认每个国家的独立。然而，在阿塞拜疆能够利用这一特权之前，当它不再受到任何盟军的保护时，苏联人认为是发动政变的最佳时机。1920 年 4 月 20 日黎明，由基洛夫和他的副官、总司令指挥的苏联第 11集团军盖克尔进入巴库，不费一枪一弹就占领了这座城市。阿塞拜疆民族共和国政府成员被捕并被带到拜洛夫监狱的院子里，并于同一天被处决。作为胜利的奖励，红军有二十四小时的时间在城里尽情享受。唯一的条件是，他们的娱乐对象只有资产阶级。富人的门窗立即被砸碎，修道院被抢劫和拆除。我们组织了一场表演，让修女在被强奸和处决之前被迫裸体跳舞。还有无数对上流社会房屋的抢劫和对名门望族年轻女孩的强奸。

Before the end of 1919, the British troops withdrew, leaving Baku under the authority of the democratic administration of the musavatists, the only legal government of Azerbaijan. The Allies believe that their withdrawal can be accomplished without risk, since the Soviet Declaration of the Law of Nationalities recognizes the independence of each country. However, before Azerbaijan could make use of this privilege, when it was no longer protected by any allied troops, the Soviets decided that the time was best to bring about a coup. At dawn on April 20, 1920, the Soviet 11th Army , commanded by Kirov and his aide-de-camp, the KommandarmGekher, enters Baku and seizes the city without firing a shot. The members of the government of the national republic of Azerbaijan are arrested and taken to the courtyard of the Bailov prison where their execution takes place the same day. As a reward for their victory, the red forces have twenty-four hours to have a good time in town. The only condition is that the object of their entertainment has as its sole object the bourgeoisie. The windows and doors of the wealthy are immediately smashed, the convents are looted and dismantled. We organize a show of nuns forced to dance naked before being raped and put to death. There are also innumerable lootings of houses of good society and the rape of young girls from prominent families.

巴库的许多房屋在夜间被纵火。火焰照亮了里海的海滩，建筑物在燃烧，但没有人试图从火焰中拯救出来。冒烟的废墟中躺着被刺刀或刀子杀害的居民烧焦的尸体。尸体躺在士兵们没有带走或匆忙离开时丢失的衣服和亚麻布中。

Many houses in Baku are set on fire during the night. Flames light up the beaches of the Caspian Sea as buildings burn that no one is trying to save from the flames. In the smoking ruins lie the charred bodies of the inhabitants killed with bayonets or knives. The bodies lie among the clothes and linen that the soldiers did not take away, or that they lost when they left in haste.

第二天早上六点，士兵们必须返回军营，违者将被指控开小差。与此同时，根据新成立的红军政治和情报警察特勤局特别部门的命令，立即组建了巴库安全委员会、契卡部队，出现在街头。同一天，阿塞拜疆国民军的所有军官都被逮捕和监禁，他们的家人被扔到街上，他们的住所被征用以供苏联官员使用。政府雇员也被逮捕：不仅是那些担任最高职位的人，还有小人物、邮政和港口设施检查员、站长。晚上，卡车停在许多房屋前，居民被残忍地从床上拖起来。卡车装载着整个家庭并将他们送进监狱。几天之内，拜洛夫监狱的人口变得如此之多，以至于囚犯们已经没有足够的空间躺在地上，甚至没有足够的空间坐下来。他们被迫站立 男女老少、病人成群，挤在牢房、大厅、浴室、洗衣房、厨房、储藏室和监狱医院里。所有这些地方都被改造成牢房并尽快清空，以便能够接收新一批囚犯。

The following day at six o'clock in the morning, the soldiers must return to their barracks on pain of being accused of desertion. At the same time, in accordance with the orders received from the newly created Special Department of the Secret Service of the Political and Intelligence Police of the Red Army, promptly formed units of the Baku Security Commission, the Cheka, appear in the streets. On the same day, all the officers of the National Army of Azerbaijan were arrested and imprisoned, their families thrown into the street and their accommodation requisitioned for the benefit of Soviet officials. Government employees are also arrested: not only those who hold the highest positions, but also small fry, inspectors of posts and port facilities, station masters. At night, trucks stop in front of many houses and their inhabitants are brutally dragged from their beds. Trucks load entire families and drive them to jail. In a few days, the population of the Bailov prison becomes so numerous that the residents no longer have enough space to lie down on the ground or even to sit down.
