They are forced to stand packed together in clusters, men, women, children, old people and the sick, crowded together in the cells as well as in the halls, baths, laundry room, kitchen, storerooms and prison hospital. All these places are transformed into cells and emptied as quickly as possible in order to be able to receive new batches of prisoners.

从第二天凌晨开始，两艘小汽船开始在拜洛夫监狱附近的巴库港和附近的一个岛屿：纳尔根岛之间穿梭。

From the first hour the next day, two small steamboats began to shuttle between the port of Baku, near the Bailov prison, and a nearby island: the island of Nargen.

在接下来的二十四小时里，这些船将数百名囚犯运送到岛上一个被铁丝网包围的围场。在这个营地里，人们没有食物，甚至没有面包或饮料来解渴，因为高加索五月的空气又热又咸。毫无疑问，几天后将会爆发痢疾、伤寒或霍乱的流行。但这种危险不会有时间出现。俘虏被带到这个岛上并不是为了隔离，而是为了快速死亡。第一批货物到达后不久，处决就开始了，没有经过任何审判，甚至没有丝毫的判断。机枪一次又一次地向排在长壕边缘的一两百人的目标开火。死者掉进战壕里，几名士兵立即将生石灰倒在尸体上，同时确保为第二层尸体留出足够的空间。这些将在下一次运输到达后不久落入战壕中。每天有三到四趟交通。

Over the next twenty-four hours, these boats ferried hundreds of prisoners to an enclosure on the island, surrounded by barbed wire. In this camp, people receive no food, not even bread or drink to quench the thirst caused by the hot, salty air of Caucasian May. There is no doubt that in a few days an epidemic of dysentery, typhoid fever or cholera will break out. But this danger will not have time to materialize. The captives are not brought to this island to be kept apart, but to meet a quick death. The executions begin shortly after the first shipment arrives, without any trial or even the slightest judgement. Machine guns unleash burst after burst on targets of one or two hundred people lined up at the edge of a long trench. The dead fell into the trench and a few soldiers immediately poured quicklime over the bodies while making sure to leave enough room for a second level of bodies. These will fall into the trench soon after the arrival of the next transport. Three to four transports take place per day.

这些恐怖持续了六天，在巴库革命史上被称为臭名昭著的“镇压资产阶级周”。

These horrors lasted six days and are known in the history of the Baku revolution as the infamous “week of suppression of the bourgeoisie”.

“亲爱的塞尔戈”亲自指挥整个行动。奥尔忠尼启则不仅愤怒地消灭了富人，而且还消灭了知识分子，他这个粗鲁的乡村理发师对知识分子怀有一种特殊的、近乎精神病态的仇恨。大屠杀结束后，奥尔忠尼启泽向列宁提交了一份详细报告。巴库共青团及其一些领导人在贝利亚的帮助下在这一事件中发挥了重要作用。

“Dear Sergo” personally directs the whole operation. Ordzhonikidze exterminates with rage not only the rich, but also the intelligentsia for which he, the rude village barber, feels a particular, almost psychopathic hatred. When the massacre is over, Ordzhonikidze sends a detailed report to Lenin. The Baku Komsomol and some of its leaders Dumbadze, Bagirov and Dekanov played an important role in this affair, with the help of Beria.

1920年5月5日至6日，第一次巴库布尔什维克党代表大会召开。基洛夫、奥尔忠尼启则和米高扬是主要演讲者。这三人在贝利亚的协助下，贝利亚充当孟什维克和穆萨瓦派机制中的楔子，为他提供了禁止名单，对纳尔根岛的集体谋杀负有责任。贝利亚准备了一些文件，其中列出了他视为苏维埃政权敌人的人的姓名和地址。会议期间，阿塞拜疆共产党成立。宣布阿塞拜疆民族政府最终垮台和国家自治，并消灭苏维埃政权的所有反对者。还做出了一项决议，规定向莫斯科发送一封电报，阿塞拜疆在电报中表达加入苏联体系的愿望，以便能够参加反对世界帝国主义的斗争。同日，阿塞拜疆苏维埃社会主义共和国宣告成立。

On May 5-6, 1920, the first Baku Bolshevik Party Conference met. Kirov, Ordzhonikidze and Mikoyan are the main speakers. This trio, assisted by Beria who, acting as a wedge planted in the Menshevik and Mussavalist mechanics, provides him with the proscription lists, is responsible for the collective murder of the island of Nargen. Beria had prepared documents giving the names and addresses of people whom he presented as enemies of the Soviet regime. During the conference the Communist Party of Azerbaijan is created. The final fall of the national government of Azerbaijan and the autonomy of the country are proclaimed, as well as the extermination of all opponents of the Soviet regime. A resolution is also taken, providing for the sending to Moscow of a telegram in which Azerbaijan would express the desire to be incorporated into the Soviet system in order to be able to participate in the struggle against world imperialism. On the same day, the Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic was proclaimed.

拉夫伦蒂·贝利亚（Lavrenty Beria）向他的三位强大赞助商表明，他当然可以成为一名出色的支持者。

Lavrenty Beria has shown his three powerful sponsors that he can certainly be an excellent supporter.

第8章

Chapter 8

乔治亚州的阳光下

Under the Georgia sun

苏联迈出了征服外高加索的第一步。格鲁吉亚和亚美尼亚仍需提交。首先转向格鲁吉亚，苏联政府必须解决一个非常复杂的问题。如果布尔什维克在阿塞拜疆，甚至在巴库地区只占极少数，那么征服格鲁吉亚将是一项更加艰巨的任务，因为马克思主义理想在那里完全不受欢迎，共产党根本代表不了任何东西。格鲁吉亚人知道，现在她已经在邻国阿塞拜疆建立了新政权，11红军将进攻自己的祖国。然而，他们决心捍卫它。一旦俄罗斯人越过阿塞拜疆与格鲁吉亚的边界并袭击格鲁吉亚的防御工事，战争就会爆发。当格鲁吉亚军队因边境战斗而受阻时，格鲁吉亚共产党的颠覆团体试图占领第比利斯普列汉诺夫街的国家学员学院大楼。为这次袭击辩护的想法是，如果代表格鲁吉亚国家军队中最爱国的年轻分子和旨在更新军官骨干的学员遭到殴打，整个格鲁吉亚军队的士气就会受到打击。那么，接管整个国家也不会太困难。

The Soviets have taken the first step in the conquest of Transcaucasia. It remains to submit Georgia and Armenia. Turning first to Georgia, the Soviet government had to solve a very complicated problem. If the Bolsheviks constituted only a very small minority in Azerbaijan, and even in the region of Baku, the conquest of Georgia would be a much more difficult task, for the Marxist ideal is completely unpopular there and the Communist Party represents nothing at all. Georgians know that now that she has established the new regime in neighboring Azerbaijan, the 11thred army will attack their own homeland. However, they are determined to defend it. As soon as the Russians cross the border which separates Azerbaijan from Georgia and strike the Georgian defences, war breaks out. While the Georgian army is held back by the fighting on the border, a subversive group of Georgian communists tries to seize the National Cadet Academy building on Plekhanov Street in Tiflis. The idea justifying this attack is that if the cadets who represent the most patriotic young element of the Georgian national army and who are intended to renew the cadre of officers, were beaten, the morale of the whole Georgian army would be broken. It would not be too difficult, then, to take over the whole country.

夜间，一支由五十人组成的小队在塞尔戈·马哈拉泽的指挥下侵入了学员所在的区域。奥尔忠尼启则的朋友马哈拉泽是一位经验丰富的游击队员，也是从事这种事业的老手。

During the night, a detachment of fifty men, under the command of Sergo Makharadze, invaded the quarter of the cadets. Makharadze, a friend of Ordzhonikidze, is an experienced partisan and an old accustomed to this kind of enterprise.

但这一次，在第比利斯，他的计划失败了。学员们击退了袭击者。他们通过学校的窗户开枪杀死了几乎所有学生，然后在院子里和街上用军刀攻击他们。

But this time, in Tiflis, his plan fails. The cadets repel their assailants. They kill almost all of them by shooting through the windows of the school, then attacking them with sabers in the yard and in the streets.

从那时起，事态走向了完全不同的方向。苏俄必须将其军队调向相反的方向，即向西。第一次世界大战即将结束前夕，波兰通过解除占领其领土的德国军队的武装而获得独立。现在，在俄罗斯袭击阿塞拜疆之后，波兰人明白了苏联对他们构成的危险。尽管他们承认所有国家的自决权，但苏联却准备将它们一一吞并。波兰政府并不打算被动等待。他决定采取主动。苏联政府于 1920 年 3 月提出的划定波兰东部边界的条约是不可接受的。它破坏了波兰作为一个主权国家的存在，看起来更像是一种挑衅，而不是一个真诚的提议。对苏联提议的唯一可能的回应是军事行动。4月26日，约瑟夫·毕苏斯基元帅率领的波兰军队攻击苏联军队并入侵俄罗斯。攻势之猛烈，红军无法遏制，纷纷撤退。波兰人追随溃败的军队，将俄罗斯人向东推进，并围攻基辅。攻势之猛烈，红军无法遏制，纷纷撤退。波兰人追随溃败的军队，将俄罗斯人向东推进，并围攻基辅。攻势之猛烈，红军无法遏制，纷纷撤退。波兰人追随溃败的军队，将俄罗斯人向东推进，并围攻基辅。

From then on, events took an entirely different course. Soviet Russia must direct its troops in the opposite direction, towards the west. Immediately before the end of World War I, Poland gained its independence by disarming the German forces occupying its territory. Now, after the Russian attack on Azerbaijan, the Poles understand what danger the Soviets represent for them. Although they have recognized the right of all countries to self-determination, the Soviets are preparing to swallow them up one after the other. The Polish government does not intend to wait passively. He decides to take the initiative. The treaty proposed in March 1920 by the Soviet administration, in order to delimit the eastern border of Poland, is unacceptable. It undermines Poland's existence as a sovereign state and looks more like a provocation than a sincere offer. The only possible response to the Soviet proposal is military action. On April 26, the Polish army, led by Marshal Joseph Pilsudski, attacks the Soviet forces and invades Russia. The power of the assault was so strong that the Reds could not contain the thrust and retreated. Hot on the heels of the routed armies, the Poles push the Russians east and lay siege to kyiv. The power of the assault was so strong that the Reds could not contain the thrust and retreated. Hot on the heels of the routed armies, the Poles push the Russians east and lay siege to kyiv. The power of the assault was so strong that the Reds could not contain the thrust and retreated. Hot on the heels of the routed armies, the Poles push the Russians east and lay siege to kyiv.

面对这样的激增，苏联政府放弃了同时对抗格鲁吉亚和波兰这两个敌人。尽管斯大林和奥尔忠尼启则两位格鲁吉亚人要求，但必须推迟对格鲁吉亚实施与针对阿塞拜疆一样血腥的战争计划。波兰军队的进军比征服高加索战争更危险

Faced with such a surge, the Soviet administration gave up confronting two enemies at the same time, Georgia and Poland. The application to Georgia of a war plan as bloody as that which was waged against Azerbaijan, although demanded by two Georgians, Stalin and Ordzhonikidze, must be postponed. The advance of the Polish army is more dangerous than the war of conquest of the Caucasus

列宁通过电报命令奥尔忠尼启则放弃入侵高加索，并从格鲁吉亚撤出所有军队。

Lenin orders by telegram to Ordzhonikidze to give up invading the Caucasus and to withdraw all his forces from Georgia.

第二天，俄罗斯向格鲁吉亚政府提出了一项基于不干涉和相互宽容的友好协议。

The next day, Russia offered the Georgian government a friendly pact based on non-intervention and mutual tolerance.

1920年5月7日，波兰军队占领基辅。第二天，苏联当局与第比利斯孟什维克政府签署了和平条约。通过这项协议，格鲁吉亚避免了与俄罗斯军队的血腥战斗，并获得了苏联对其政权的完全承认。然而，俄罗斯并没有放弃吞并格鲁吉亚的计划。但红军的行动变得秘密起来。这些颠覆活动需要男人来进行。这些人因其技巧和忠诚而为党所熟知。而且，这些人必须是格鲁吉亚人。俄罗斯人稍后必须能够说，这场运动纯粹是格鲁吉亚人的，新秩序是当地人制定的。

On May 7, 1920, the Polish army took kyiv. The next day, the Soviet authorities sign a peace treaty with the Menshevik government of Tiflis. Georgia avoids, by this agreement, the bloody fights against the Russian forces and obtains the complete recognition of its regime by the Soviets. Russia is not abandoning its plans to annex Georgia, however. But the action of the Reds becomes clandestine. It takes men to carry out these subversive activities. Men known to the Party for their skill and loyalty. And, moreover, these men must be Georgians. The Russians must be able to say later that the movement is purely Georgian and that the new order was put in place by the natives.

当列宁任命的苏联驻格鲁吉亚代表基洛夫住在第比利斯时，米高扬和奥尔忠尼启泽则按照斯大林的指示在巴库制定了新的行动计划。在审查格鲁吉亚颠覆特工的可能候选人时，他们得出的结论是，最适合这项工作的人选是贝利亚。他在为纳尔根岛的大规模处决准备禁止名单方面表现得非常熟练，以至于巴库的红色领导人决定将他送往格鲁吉亚。他必须与当地的共产主义支部取得联系，为未来反对国民政府的革命铺平道路。

While Kirov, appointed by Lenin, Soviet representative in Georgia, lives in Tiflis, Mikoyan and Ordjonikidze develop new plans of action in Baku, following Stalin's directives. While reviewing possible candidates for the role of subversion agent in Georgia, they come to the conclusion that the most qualified person for the job is Beria. He showed himself to be so skilled in preparing proscription lists for the mass executions on Nargen Island, that the Red leaders of Baku decided to send him to Georgia. He must make contact with the local communist cell and pave the way for the future revolution against the national government.

贝利亚带着已成为红11军特别部部长的科曼达姆·盖赫尔（ Kommandarm Gekher ）发出的指示，登上开往祖国的火车，回到祖国，成为一个充满希望的年轻人。他是一个受过教育的人，一个对抗德国人的战争志愿者。他从未受到Okhrana官员的打扰沙皇，也不是红军、苏联民兵或布尔什维克安全部队。相反，他是一个纯洁无瑕的年轻人，作为建筑师的光明未来为他敞开了大门。他的母亲、兄弟姐妹以及他所有的朋友、邻居和亲戚都可以为他们的“拉拉”感到自豪。他作为一个十六岁的贫穷小村民离开了自己的国家，不到五年后，他作为一个成熟的年轻人回来了，成为了一名建筑工程师。

Boarded a train bound for his country of origin and armed with instructions issued by Kommandarm Gekher, who had become head of the Special Department of the 11th Red Army, Beria returned home as a young man full of promise. He is an educated man, a war volunteer against the Germans. He was never bothered by Okhrana officialstsarist, nor by the Red Army, the Soviet militia or the Bolshevik Security. On the contrary, he is a pure and immaculate young man, to whom a bright future as an architect opens wide. His mother, brothers and sister, as well as all his friends, neighbors and relations can be proud of their "Lara". He left his country as a poor little villager of sixteen and now, less than five years later, he returns as a mature young man, a construction engineer.

当火车停在他的家乡苏呼米（Sukhum）车站时，贝利亚离开车厢时发现一切都没有改变。自从格鲁吉亚宣布独立以来，苏呼米现在被称为苏呼米（Sukhumi）。总是同一位管制员在办公室忙碌，没有注意到他的到来。报亭里站着的是同一个报童，他是一个木腿残废的人。老人坐在柜台边的一张矮椅上，像往常一样打瞌睡。

When the train stops at the station of his native Sukhum, now called, since Georgia proclaimed its independence, by its Georgian name Sukhumi, and Beria leaves his compartment, he finds that nothing has changed. It's always the same controller who, busy in his office, pays no attention to his arrival. The same newsboy stands in the kiosk, a cripple with a wooden leg. The old man is sitting on a low chair near his counter, dozing as usual.

贝利亚提着行李箱穿过车站大楼，发现自己在街上，一辆棕色马拉的马车正在等候。当他走在阳光明媚的沙路上时，他看到了熟悉的风景。驾驶室车轮扬起的灰尘高高扬起，在他身后消散。黑海闪耀着银色的光泽，散发着众所周知的海藻、贻贝和鱼的气味，这种气味与里海的油腻味道截然不同。很快海岸就消失了。道路通向内陆。

Carrying her suitcase, Beria crosses the station building and finds herself in the street where a carriage drawn by a brown horse is waiting. As he walks down the sunny, sandy road, he observes the familiar landscape. The dust raised by the wheels of the cab rises high and dissipates behind him. The Black Sea shines with a silver sheen and exudes the well-known smell of seaweed, mussels and fish, a scent quite different from the oily hints of the Caspian Sea. Soon the shore disappears. The road heads inland.

自从梅尔克胡利离开那天起，他的小屋就没有改变过。它们很小，覆盖着黑色的木瓦屋顶，简陋但干净漂亮。深色衣服挂在庭院上方的电线上晾干。封闭的小花园里长着高大的金色向日葵，在五彩缤纷的花朵中占据主导地位。除了阿布哈兹之外，它可能在其他地方都找不到。它们散发出的光芒和气味与五年前甚至数百年前一样甜美，当时杰森乘坐他的阿尔戈号船来到这里寻找金羊毛。一切都和拉夫连蒂小时候一模一样。

Merkheouli's huts haven't changed since the day he left. Small, covered with black shingle roofs, they are poor but clean and pretty. Dark clothes hang to dry on wires stretched above the courtyards. In the small enclosed gardens grow tall golden sunflowers dominating multicolored flowers. It is probably found nowhere else than in Abkhazia. They radiate and smell as sweetly as they did five years ago, or indeed even hundreds of years ago, when Jason came here on his ship Argo in search of the Fleece of gold. Everything is exactly the same as it was when Lavrenti was still a child.

家里一切也都一样。穿过花园，拉夫伦蒂跨过低矮的门槛，走进厨房。炉子上放着同样的锅。右边，他与兄弟们合住的小房间仍保持着他离开时的样子。炉子的另一边是更大的卧室，里面有她父母的大床。角落里有一个圣像，上面装饰着一支在红色玻璃中燃烧的蜡烛，高耸在一堆高高的垫子上方。床边有一张桌子，上面放着一盏油灯。还有两把椅子。一切都一样。甚至窗户上的蜘蛛网也可能捕获了同一只苍蝇。

Everything is the same at home too. Crossing the garden, Lavrenti crosses the threshold of the low door and enters the kitchen. The same pots are on the stove. On the right, the small room he shared with his brothers is still as he left it. On the other side of the stove is the larger bedroom, which contains her parents' large bed. An icon in one corner, adorned with a candle burning in red glass, towers above a tall pile of cushions. Near the bed, a table supports an oil lamp. There are also two chairs. Everything is the same. Even the spider web at the window with probably the same fly caught in its nets.

然而，只有不熟悉贝利亚的人才会相信，这质朴、怀旧的景象让他感伤、心软。这种感觉对他来说是完全陌生的。贝利亚鄙视他出生的这个贫穷、简朴、偏远村庄的宁静。那里什么也没发生过。他坚信有一天他会领导这个国家。

However, only someone unfamiliar with Beria would believe that this rustic, nostalgic sight makes him sentimental and softens his heart. Such feelings are completely foreign to him. Beria despises the tranquility of this poor, simple and provincial village where he was born. Nothing ever happened there. He firmly believes that one day he will lead this country.

他一家人的生活也没有改变。塔玛拉高了一点，但仍然很胖，她负责做家务，因为她的母亲每周只从城里回家一次。他们同父异母的兄弟达蒂科从军队退役后回到了村庄。他结婚了，住在几栋房子之外。弟弟伊拉克利在苏呼米一位来自叶尔科莫什维利的好商人的店里工作，他们的母亲仍然在那里做饭。

His family's life has not changed either. Tamara, a bit taller but still plump, does the housework because her mother only comes home once a week from town. Their half-brother Datiko, released from the army, has returned to the village. He got married and lives a few houses away. The younger brother, Irakli, works in Sukhumi, in the shop of that good merchant from Ierkomoshvili, where their mother still cooks.

拉夫连季已经从他母亲的信中得知了这些细节。其他不太重要的新闻，例如这个或那个邻居的死亡、婚姻、战争中的出生或死亡，都是微不足道的。除了生活的平庸之外，什么也没有。

Lavrenti has already learned these details from his mother's letters. Other less important news, such as, for example, the death of this or that neighbor, or a marriage, or a birth or a death in the war, are insignificant. Nothing but the banalities of life.

贝利亚迫不及待地开展新活动。他首先必须拜访他的恩人斯维莫尼·耶尔科莫什维利先生和他的妻子马罗，感谢他们过去给予他的帮助，并向他们出示技术学院颁发的毕业证书，以及光荣的退伍假。这次访问是他开始格鲁吉亚使命的必要步骤。贝利亚需要这位富商的友谊和支持，他也是苏呼米的重要人物。他还必须去那里迎接他的老母亲和年轻的伊拉克利。在交换了几个吻后，拉夫伦蒂问他的母亲是否可以见房子的主人。他被要求到客厅来。

Beria does not wait to undertake its new activities. He must first visit his benefactors, Mr. Svimoni Ierkomoshvili and his wife Maro, to thank them for the help they have given him in the past and show them the diploma issued by the Technicum, as well as the honorable discharge from the army. This visit is a necessary step to begin his mission in Georgia. Beria needs the friendship and support of this wealthy merchant, who is also an important figure in Sukhumi. He must also go there to greet his old mother and the young Irakli. After exchanging a few kisses, Lavrenti asks his mother if he can see the master of the house. He is asked to come into the living room.

采访气氛热烈、亲切：茶水、蜜饯、糕点。拉夫连季的老母亲听到她亲爱的“拉拉”谈论她的学习、她的考试和她在遥远的前线的战争冒险，感到无比的喜悦、自豪和幸福。在描述巴库骚乱的可怕日子、残暴的红军对阿塞拜疆的骇人听闻的占领以及对巴库民族主义者的血腥清算时，贝利亚不免表达了深深的厌恶。他向我们保证，作为一名忠诚的格鲁吉亚人，他的心与统治他祖国的孟什维克一起跳动。他表示相信这个民主政府汇集了自由派甚至激进知识分子的代表，

The atmosphere of the interview is warm and cordial: tea, candied fruit and pastries. Lavrenti's old mother feels great joy, made of pride and happiness, to hear her dear "Lara" talk about her studies, her exams and her warlike adventures lived on a distant front. Beria does not fail to express his deep disgust when describing the horrific days of the Baku riots, the appalling occupation of Azerbaijan by the brutal Red Army and the bloody liquidation of the Baku nationalists. He assures us that, as a loyal Georgian, his heart beats alongside the Mensheviks whose party governs his native country. He expresses his conviction that this democratic government brings together representatives of the liberal and even radical intelligentsia,

叶尔科莫什维利是苏呼米最富有的商人之一，是一位有教养、开明和热心的爱国者，也是孟什维克党的积极成员。他很高兴看到他的门生分享他的信念。这位有前途的年轻人不应该试图说服他相信自己的观点是正确的。商人意识到​​，如果拉夫连季不说实话，他就不可能在巴库毕业，或者至少他会被 Okhrana 担心。。叶尔科莫什维利相信贝利亚的解释，即他是在他的朋友杜姆巴泽的帮助下才逃脱了布尔什维克特别安全部门组织的屠杀，后者将他藏在城外。否则，孟什维克中的贝利亚就会被处决。杜姆巴泽（Doumbadze）是Technicum的同志，也是贝利亚的同胞，积极参与了11日占领巴库的行动。他加入了红军。拉夫伦蒂透露，杜姆巴泽是逮捕和监禁政治犯的组织的成员。最后，贝利亚很高兴回到格鲁吉亚。他像祖国所有的好儿子一样，希望看到祖国自由、独立并由自己的人民统治。他想尽快与大学朋友重新联系，看看童年熟悉的地方，然后去他从未去过的第比利斯，在那里找到工作。

Yerkomoshvili, one of the richest businessmen in Sukhumi, a cultured, enlightened and ardent patriot, was also an active member of the Menshevik party. He is happy to see his protege share his convictions. This promising young man should not seek to convince him of the correctness of his opinions. The merchant realizes that if Lavrenty did not tell the truth, he could not have graduated in Baku or, at least, he would have been worried by the Okhrana. Yerkomoshvili believes Beria's explanation that he only escaped the massacre organized by the Bolshevik Special Security Department with the help of a friend of his, named Doumbadze, who hid him in outside of town. Otherwise, Beria, who was among the Mensheviks, would have been executed. Doumbadze, a comrade of the Technicum and a compatriot of Beria, took an active part in the occupation of Baku by the 11thred army he had joined. Lavrenti reveals that Doumbadze was part of the group that arrested and imprisoned political offenders. Finally, Beria is happy to be back in Georgia. He wishes, like all the good sons of the fatherland, to see it free, independent and governed by its own people. He would like to quickly reconnect with his college friends, see the familiar places of his childhood, and then go to Tiflis, which he has never seen, to find work there.

对叶尔科莫什维利斯的访问在亲切的气氛中结束。当他们告别年轻的客人“美妙的劳拉”时，她的主人祝愿她好运并取得成功。贝利亚再次感谢他的恩人的帮助，让他实现了成为受过教育的人的梦想。他还感谢他们为他的母亲和弟弟提供工作。然后他离开了他所憎恨的商人的家，并在他的心中将其视为愚蠢的资产阶级。贝利亚无法忍受他的恩人。在他看来，他是一个固执、顽固的孟什维克，也是一个在他豪华的三层房子里安逸的资本家，房子里有豪华的沙发和红木家具。他恨这对夫妇，就像恨两个不干活却剥削疲惫女仆的寄生虫一样，

The visit to the Yerkomoshvilis ends on a cordial note. As they say goodbye to their young guest, the "wonderful Lara", her hosts wish her good luck and much success. Beria once again thanks his benefactors for their help and for allowing him to realize his dream of becoming an educated man. He also thanks them for giving work to his mother and younger brother. Then he leaves the house of the merchant he hates and treats in his heart stupid bourgeois. Beria can't stand his benefactor. He sees him as a stubborn, stubborn Menshevik and a capitalist comfortably installed in his luxurious three-storey house, with plush sofas and mahogany furniture. He hates this couple like two parasites who don't work but exploit a weary maid,

在这次不可避免的外交访问之后，拉夫伦蒂前往波德戈尔纳亚街的学院，向其老院长和老师致意，看看他们中有多少人还在那里，了解新老师，并检查他们是否被引入了人们的头脑。民族主义、爱国主义、反共和独立的格鲁吉亚对年轻人来说是毒药。了解教职员工是否积极参与孟什维克党并了解他们的名字也很有用。然后他可以向他的朋友和以前的同学塞米恩·丹尼洛夫 (Semion Danilov) 和内斯特·拉科巴 (Nestor Lakoba) 打招呼。他们每个人都是列宁天才的虔诚崇拜者，内斯特也为他与斯大林的友谊感到自豪。

After this inevitable and diplomatic visit, Lavrenti goes to the college in Podgornaya Street to greet its old director and its teachers, to see how many of them are still there, to get to know the new ones and to check whether they introduce into the minds of young people the poison of a nationalist, patriotic, anti-communist and independent Georgia. It is also useful to find out if members of the teaching staff are active in the Menshevik party, and to know their names. Then he can say hello to his friends and former classmates, Semion Danilov and Nestor Lakoba. Each of them is a devout worshiper of Lenin's genius, and Nestor is proud of his friendship with Stalin.

拉夫伦蒂去见拉科巴。内斯特的脸色有些苍白。和丹尼洛夫一样，他也减肥了。两人都因其颠覆活动而入狱数月。他们刚刚根据格鲁吉亚政府与苏联于 1920 年 5 月 7 日签订的最新条约规定的特赦被释放。

Lavrenti goes to see Lakoba. Nestor looks a little pale. Like Danilov, he lost weight. Both spent several months behind bars because of their subversive activity. They have just been released under the amnesty provided for in the recent treaty concluded between the Georgian government and the Soviets on May 7, 1920.

拉夫连季向他们转达了巴库保护者奥尔忠尼启泽和米高扬的问候，并向他们转达了这些人的鼓励之词。他还向他们提供了这两位杰出同志签署的文件，以便他的朋友们确信他不是挑衅者，而是真正的联络官。他们告诉他，该党正计划在第比利斯创办一份格鲁吉亚语的新报纸《共产主义报》。拉夫伦蒂抵达该城市后可以与出版商进行个人联系。

Lavrenty brings them the greetings of their Baku protectors, Ordzhonikidze and Mikoyan, and conveys to them the words of encouragement from these men. He also gives them papers signed by these two eminent comrades so that his friends are sure that he is not a provocateur, but a real liaison officer. They tell him that the Party is planning the creation in Tiflis of a new newspaper, Commounisti , in the Georgian language. Lavrenti could make personal contact with the publisher upon his arrival in the city.

不久之后，贝利亚前往第比利斯。一位雄心勃勃的年轻格鲁吉亚人，拥有建筑工程学位，来到这座城市寻找工作，并没有引起怀疑。然而几天后，他返回苏呼米，向他以前的同学们转达以基洛夫为首的第比利斯共产党领导层发出的命令。

Shortly after, Beria left for Tiflis. An ambitious young Georgian, with a degree in construction engineering, who came to look for work in this city, did not arouse suspicion. A few days later, however, he returned to Sukhumi to convey to the circle of his former classmates orders sent by the communist leadership of Tiflis, led by Kirov.

1920 年 7 月中旬，从阿塞拜疆返回六周后，贝利亚被捕并被监禁在苏呼米附近的一个小镇库塔伊西（格鲁吉亚语中的库泰斯），罪名是苏联间谍。他被发现持有包含给外国情报人员的指示的机密笔记。贝利亚因为俄罗斯共产党中央委员会的利益而对格鲁吉亚孟什维克政府进行颠覆活动而面临数年监禁。

Six weeks after his return from Azerbaijan, in mid-July 1920, Beria was arrested and imprisoned in Kutaisi (Georgian name for Kutays), a town near Sukhumi, on the charge of being a Soviet spy. He was caught in possession of confidential notes containing instructions for a foreign intelligence agent. Beria faces several years in prison for subversive activities against the Menshevik government of Georgia, for the benefit of the Central Committee of the Russian Communist Party.

但他在库塔伊西监狱的铁窗里呆的时间甚至还不到一个月。拉科巴将拉夫伦蒂被捕的消息告知基洛夫几天后，他被释放。莫斯科苏维埃驻第比利斯全权代表基洛夫在 1920 年 7 月 9 日的一封信中正式请求格鲁吉亚政府立即释放贝利亚并送回阿塞拜疆。由于他强大的保护者，拉夫伦蒂很快就在看守下被护送到格鲁吉亚和阿塞拜疆边境。

But his stay behind the bars of Kutaisi prison does not even last a month. His release comes days after Lakoba informed Kirov of Lavrenti's arrest. Kirov, the plenipotentiary representative of the Moscow Soviets in Tiflis, formally requested the Georgian administration, in a letter dated July 9, 1920, that Beria be released and returned immediately to Azerbaijan. Thanks to his powerful protector, Lavrenti was quickly escorted back under guard to the border of Georgia and Azerbaijan.

8月，他获得了自由，再次走在巴库熟悉的街道上。

In August, he is free and walks the familiar streets of Baku again.

第9章

Chapter 9

尊贵的客人

A distinguished guest

贝利亚可以扮演烈士和英雄的角色。他知道他已经成为一个名人，整个格鲁吉亚政府都知道他是苏联当局的保护者，也是红色阿塞拜疆统治圈子里的一个受欢迎的人。在执行委员会办公室接受米高扬和奥尔忠尼启则采访时，贝利亚报告说，他在库塔伊西监狱绝食，因为他无法接待任何访客。他说，只有通过这一行动，他才能够向基洛夫同志传达一个信息。

Beria can play the role of martyr and hero. He knows that he has become a personality and that he is known to the whole Georgian government as a protege of the Soviet authorities as well as a popular man in the ruling circles of Red Azerbaijan. During an interview with Mikoyan and Ordzhonikidze in the office of the Executive Committee, Beria reports that he went on a hunger strike in Kutaisi prison, because he could not receive any visitors. It was only through this action, he says, that he was able to send a message to Comrade Kirov.

拒绝食物是世界各地监狱中经常使用的一种方法，因此就贝利亚的情况而言，很难验证她的故事的准确性。贝利亚在与《共产主义》杂志的编辑们以及指挥对学员学院的袭击并刚刚因特赦而出狱的塞尔戈·马哈拉泽谈论他在第比利斯的任务时表示，马哈拉泽将能够取得哪怕一点点的成功。没有红11军特务部应该增派的部队的帮助。这个分遣队的首领，指挥部格赫尔是一个身材矮小、罗圈腿的拉脱维亚人，是一个肆无忌惮的恶霸，很快就成为贝利亚的朋友。盖克尔所代表的力量令贝利亚着迷。当他第一次见到盖克尔时，正值“镇压资产阶级的一周”，这名军官手里拿着手枪，亲自射杀了阿塞拜疆国民军的军官。指挥部在模拟审判中对这些囚犯的审讯让贝利亚兴奋得超乎他的想象。这样的力量，令人着迷。

Food denial is a method often used in prisons all over the world, so it is difficult, in Beria's case, to verify the accuracy of her story. Speaking about his mission in Tiflis with the editors of Communism , and with Sergo Makharadze, who commanded the attack on the cadet academy and who has just been released from prison thanks to the amnesty, Beria reports that Makharadze will be able to achieve the slightest success without the help of additional troops which should be sent by the Special Department of the 11th Red Army. The head of this detachment, the kommandarmGekher, a short, bowlegged Latvian and unscrupulous bully, quickly becomes Beria's friend. The power that Gekher represents fascinates Beria. When he saw Gekher for the first time, during the "week of the suppression of the bourgeoisie", the officer had a pistol in his hand and himself shot down officers of the national army of Azerbaijan. The kommandarm 's interrogation of these prisoners , during mock trials, had excited Beria much more than he could have imagined. Such power was bewitching.

自从回到巴库后，贝利亚养成了与指挥部共度时光的习惯，与他一起喝酒，聆听他在十月革命期间的功绩。贝利亚很快意识到，如果盖克尔很快喝醉，他贝利亚可以喝很多酒，但仍然保持清醒的头脑。但这并不意味着他要花太多时间和这个顽固的士兵在一起。贝利亚所需要的只是强大的指挥部的友谊。

Since his return to Baku, Beria made a habit of spending his evenings and nights with the kommandarm , drinking in his company and listening to the story of his exploits during the October Revolution. Beria soon realizes that if Gekher gets drunk quickly, he, Beria, can drink a lot and still maintain a clear mind. But that doesn't mean he has to spend too much time with this stubborn soldier. All Beria needs is the friendship of the powerful kommandarm .

1920 年 9 月，一所新学院在巴库成立：一所理工大学。因此，贝利亚不再需要像他希望的那样去大城市学习建筑。他可以在城里上课，在那里他有有影响力的朋友，而且他本人在某种程度上也很有个性。贝利亚知道，尽管他取得了成功，但他仍然被认为是微不足道的。他还知道，他不能完全依赖他的朋友，他们有一天或有一天可能会被召唤到其他地方，被指派去执行其他任务或得到晋升。所以他们会忘记这件事。考虑到此类事件的发生，谨慎从事建筑师这个稳定的职业是明智之举。

In September 1920, a new institute was opened in Baku: a polytechnic university. Beria therefore no longer has to go to a big city to study architecture, as he wishes to do. He can take the courses right here, in town, where he has influential friends and where he himself is, in a way, a personality. Beria knows that, despite his successes, he is still considered a negligible quantity. He also knows that he cannot rely exclusively on his friends who, one day or another, may be called elsewhere, directed to other missions or promoted. So they would forget about it. In anticipation of such events, it would be prudent to exercise the stable profession of architect.

拉夫连季勤奋学习了两个月，只留下书本，按照指示参加党的会议。

Lavrenti studied diligently for two months, leaving his books only to attend Party meetings, as instructed.

1920年11月2日，奥尔忠尼启则在阿塞拜疆共产党中央委员会总部举行的会议上说，他收到斯大林同志的电报，宣布三天后抵达巴库。对于这位领导人来说，这显然将凯旋回到他曾经策划阴谋并被关押在拜洛夫监狱的城市。

At the meeting of November 2, 1920, held at the headquarters of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Azerbaijan, Ordzhonikidze said that he had received a telegram from Comrade Stalin, announcing his arrival in Baku in three days. It will obviously be a triumphant return for the leader to the city where he once hatched plots and where he was locked up in the Bailov prison.

这次正式访问必须具有庆祝英雄的性质，他与杰出的列宁一起发动了伟大的十月革命。庆祝活动的节目和日程必须当场决定。助手们选出了一个由三位最杰出人物组成的委员会：奥尔忠尼启则、米高扬和基洛夫，他们将从第比利斯赶来参加这次活动。第一个将主持。当选总统后，受欢迎的“亲爱的塞尔戈”邀请指挥员盖克尔加入该组织，并邀请拉夫伦蒂·帕夫洛维奇·贝利亚担任助理。贝利亚被誉为一位有前途的年轻共产主义者，他在格鲁吉亚的监狱中受尽苦难，并为布尔什维克征服阿塞拜疆发挥了巨大作用。

The official visit must take on the character of a party celebrating the hero who, with the brilliant Lenin, launched the great October revolution. The program and schedule of the festivities must be decided on the spot. The assistants elect a committee made up of three of the most eminent personalities: Ordjonikidze, Mikoyan and Kirov, who will come from Tiflis for the occasion. The first will preside. Elected president, the popular "dear Sergo" invites the kommandarm Gekher to join the group and, as assistant, Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria. Beria earned a reputation as a promising young communist, who suffered in the prisons of Georgia and was of great use to the Bolsheviks in their conquest of Azerbaijan.

奥尔忠尼启泽亲自宣布的这一新荣誉让贝利亚充满了自豪和幸福。他终于找到了会见斯大林的机会。这并不是说他对他著名的同胞感到钦佩。贝利亚对此完全不以为然。诸如钦佩或忠诚之类的情感与他冷酷而精于算计的性格格格不入。在他看来，伟大的斯大林同志只是一个患有天花的庸俗农民，一个来自第比利斯地区哥里肮脏郊区的沙文主义私生子，一个醉酒鞋匠的儿子，一个神学院的败类，一个失意的候选人。对于东正教神职人员来说，他是一个比聪明的煽动者更幸运的人，一个粗鲁的阴谋家，但冷酷无情，不择手段，足以登上顶峰。事实上，他的地位归功于列宁，他是列宁的密切合作者。相反，贝利亚这个受过教育的年轻人，对斯大林的鄙视多于钦佩。但结识斯大林同志应该标志着迈向长期政治生涯和权力的第一步。仅此一点就很重要。因为此时列宁、斯大林和托洛茨基的名字象征着权力。

This new distinction, announced by Ordzhonikidze in person, floods Beria with pride and happiness. He finally found the opportunity to meet Stalin. It's not that he feels admiration for his famous compatriot. Beria is not impressed at all. Feelings like admiration or devotion are foreign to his cold and calculating character. In his opinion, the great comrade Stalin is only a vulgar peasant, marked by smallpox, a chauvinistic bastard from the filthy suburbs of Gori, in the region of Tiflis, the son of a drunken cobbler, a scum of a seminary , a frustrated candidate for the Orthodox priesthood, a more lucky than clever agitator, a crude conspirator but ruthless and unscrupulous enough to rise to the top. In truth, he owes his position to Lenin, of whom he is a close collaborator. Beria, on the contrary, an educated young man, despises Stalin more than he admires him. But an acquaintance with Comrade Stalin should mark the first step towards a long political career and towards power. That alone counts. Because at this time power is symbolized by the names of Lenin, Stalin and Trotsky.

新成立的委员会在这三天里进行了狂热的活动。1920年11月5日清晨，红军和民兵的警戒线包围了车站。炼油厂、工厂工人代表、全体党员涌进大楼。当期待已久的火车终于停在站台前时，奥尔忠尼启则、基洛夫和米高扬登上了第一节普尔曼车厢。他们在走廊里漫步寻找他们的领导和战友。他们很快就见到了他，并陪同他前往执行委员会总部。他们乘坐一辆破旧的军用卡车而来，由一辆载有保安人员的类似汽车护送。由于路线尚未公布，因此车队并未引起人们的注意。

The newly created committee spends these three days in feverish activity. From early morning, November 5, 1920, a cordon of Red Army troops and militiamen surrounded the station. Representatives of refinery and factory workers, all Party members, crowd into the building. When the long-awaited train finally stops in front of the platform, Ordzhonikidze, Kirov and Mikoyan get into the first Pullman car. They roam the hallway in search of their leader and comrade. They soon meet him and accompany him to the headquarters of the Executive Committee. They came in a shabby military truck, escorted by a similar car carrying security men. The route has not been announced, so the caravan goes unnoticed.

在1920年11月6日这个值得纪念的日子里，巴库苏维埃将于上午十点在阿塞拜疆共产党中央委员会和阿塞拜疆苏维埃社会主义共和国委员会总部举行会议。仅允许持有11 号安全部门前一天发放的特别通行证的人员进入 红军。该文件必须在入口处出示，并由民兵仔细检查。十点一刻，大厅里挤满了人。站台上挂着红底长横幅，上面挂着镰刀和锤子，上面写着：“资产阶级去死吧！” 和“资本家去死吧！” ”。当局登场：斯大林、奥尔忠尼启则、基洛夫和米高扬。观众们跳起来，以长时间的掌声向他们致意。他们坐在铺着红地毯的桌子后面。在长时间的掌声之后，“亲爱的谢尔戈”奥尔忠尼启则站了起来。他以友好的姿态伸出双臂，脸上露出灿烂而温暖的微笑，宣布：“同志们注意，斯大林同志要讲话了。”。

On this memorable day of November 6, 1920, the Baku Soviet is to meet at ten o'clock in the morning at the headquarters of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Azerbaijan and the Council of Commissars of the Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic. Access is only allowed to people who have a special pass, issued the day before by the Security Department of the 11th Red Army. The document must be presented at the entrance, where a militiaman checks it carefully. At a quarter to ten, the great hall is full. On the platform, long banners with a red background bearing a sickle and a hammer, as well as slogans: “Death to the bourgeois! and “Death to the capitalists!” ". The authorities make their entrance: Stalin, Ordjonikidze, Kirov and Mikoyan. The audience jumps up and greets them with a long ovation. They sit behind a table covered with a red carpet. After a long round of applause, “dear Sergo” Ordzhonikidze stands up. Arms outstretched in a friendly gesture, face lit up with a broad and warm smile, announces: “Attention comrades, Comrade Stalin is going to speak. ".

斯大林站起来开始讲话。在拥挤的房间里，他那带着格鲁吉亚口音的刺耳、粗暴的声音，听起来就像荒凉寂静的森林里斧头的敲击声。他的讲话既不感伤也不怀旧。就在几年前他进行秘密活动的那个城市，他被逮捕并三度被关进监狱，斯大林并没有唤起这段过去，甚至只字不提。他演讲的主题是“无产阶级革命三年”。这是奋斗、成功和胜利的枯燥记录；一份有事实和日期支持的冷静报告。每次提到马克思、恩格斯或列宁，斯大林都会停下来鼓掌。他立即被委员会成员效仿，然后被所有协助者效仿。

Stalin stands up and begins his speech. In the crowded room, his harsh, rough voice, marked by the Georgian accent, resounds like the blows of an ax in a solitary and quiet forest. His speech is neither sentimental nor nostalgic. In the very city where, a few years earlier, he carried out his clandestine activities, where he was arrested and three times dragged behind bars, Stalin does not evoke this past, not even in a single word. The subject of his presentation is “Three years of proletarian revolution”. It is the dry record of struggles, successes and victories; a sober report, supported by facts and dates. At each mention of Marx, Engels or Lenin, Stalin stops and applauds. He is immediately imitated by the members of the committee and then by all the assistance.

贝利亚坐在观众席的前排。他的眼睛注视着说话者的脸，脸上带着虔诚的表情。每当他注意到斯大林也要鼓掌时，他就会鼓掌。

Beria took his place in the front row of the audience. His eyes fix the speaker's face with an expression of devotion. He claps whenever he notices Stalin about to clap as well.

接下来的两天是斯大林与阿塞拜疆新政权的三位领导人举行的会议，讨论征服格鲁吉亚和亚美尼亚的计划。然后，1920 年 11 月 9 日，也就是他出发的前一天，斯大林向阿塞拜疆共产党中央委员会发表了另一次主旨演讲。贝利亚再次坐到了前排。每次演讲者停顿时，他都会热烈鼓掌。

The next two days are spent in meetings during which Stalin discusses with the three leaders of the new regime of Azerbaijan, plans for the conquest of Georgia and Armenia. Then, on November 9, 1920, the day before his departure, Stalin addressed another keynote address to the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Azerbaijan. Beria once again moved into the front row. And he applauds enthusiastically at each pause of the speaker.

第10章

Chapter 10

一个预约

An appointment

苏波战争的进展喜忧参半。经过一番苦战，拿下基辅甚至越过第聂伯河的波兰人不得不放弃阵地撤退。谢苗·布登尼指挥的哥萨克骑兵主力和米哈伊尔·图哈切夫斯基指挥的步兵将波兰军队逼退到维斯瓦河附近并威胁华沙。

The Soviet-Polish war proceeds with mixed fortunes. After hard battles, the Poles, who took kyiv and even crossed the Dnieper, had to abandon their positions and retreat. The bulk of the Cossack cavalry, led by Kommandarm Semion Budenni, and the infantry, led by Kommandarm Mikhaïl Tukhachevski, push back the Polish troops almost to the Vistula and threaten Warsaw.

当列宁确信波兰的陷落只剩下几天的时间时，他决定重新审视对格鲁吉亚的友好政策，并执行斯大林和奥尔忠尼启则制定的征服高加索的计划。但在违反 1920 年 5 月 7 日的苏格条约之前，必须仔细准备行动。这必须从阿塞拜疆开始，尤其是从其首都巴库开始。

When Lenin became convinced that the fall of Poland was only a matter of days away, he decided to review his friendly policy towards Georgia and to carry out the plans set up by Stalin and Ordzhonikidze to the conquest of the Caucasus. But before breaking the Soviet-Georgian treaty of May 7, 1920, the action must be carefully prepared. This must start from Azerbaijan and, above all, from its capital Baku.

巴库共产党被赋予了新的任务。所有成员都必须保持警惕。

The Communist Party of Baku is given a new task. All its members must be on alert.

在与托洛茨基和阿列克谢·里科夫（第一位外交人民委员）和另一位内政委员列宁会面后，宣布现在是对格鲁吉亚进行打击的时候了。1921年2月9日，列宁允许斯大林亲自决定零时。

After an interview with Trotsky and Alexeï Rykov the first, People's Commissar for Foreign Affairs, the other, Commissar of the Interior, Lenin, announces that the time has come to deal a blow to Georgia. On February 9, 1921, Lenin gave Stalin permission to personally decide on zero hour.

八天后，早上六点，红十一 军从阿塞拜疆对格鲁吉亚发动突然袭击。骄傲的格鲁吉亚人无意投降，向敌人低头。在战争的第一天，他们的骑兵就英勇作战，阻止了敌人，而他们隐藏在高加索高山山坡上的机枪则迫使敌人撤退。然而，战争的结果从一开始就可以预见。数以千计的红军士兵一波又一波地涌入，放火烧毁村庄，屠杀所有居民，无辜的农民、男人、女人和儿童。

Eight days later, at six o'clock in the morning, the 11th Red  Army launched a surprise attack against Georgia from Azerbaijan. The proud Georgians have no intention of surrendering their country and bowing to the enemy. In heroic combat, their cavalry stopped the enemy on the first day of the war, while their machine guns, concealed on the slopes of the high mountains of the Caucasus, forced the enemy to retreat. However, the outcome of the war is predictable from the start. The flood of thousands of soldiers of the Red Army leaping in successive waves, set fire to the villages and massacred their entire population, innocent peasants, men, women and children.

即使在俄罗斯军队占领首都之后，格鲁吉亚人也没有放下武器。他们退回巴统（旧巴统）寻找援军。然而此时，土耳其却趁苏格战争之机向巴统挺进。当第一批土耳其军团到达黑海重要港口巴统郊区时，苏联军队停止了前进。列宁不希望与土耳其发生战争，因为这场战争可能会旷日持久且充满风险。他更愿意让土耳其人来消灭红军已经开始扫荡的格鲁吉亚军队。格鲁吉亚军队发现自己陷入了交火之中。他们设法迫使土耳其人撤退，但他们无法抵抗俄罗斯人的压力。

Even after the occupation of their capital by Russian troops, the Georgians do not lay down their arms. They fall back on Batumi (old Batum) in search of reinforcements. At this time, however, Turkey took advantage of the Soviet-Georgian war to move towards Batumi. When the first Turkish regiments reach the suburbs of Batumi, an important port on the Black Sea, the Soviet army halts its advance. Lenin does not want a war with Turkey, which risks being long and risky. He prefers to leave it to the Turks to decimate the Georgian army which the Red forces have begun to sweep away. Georgian forces find themselves caught in the crossfire. They manage to force the Turks to retreat, but they cannot resist the pressure of the Russians.

格鲁吉亚人民面临着彻底灭绝的危险。他的政府明白，进行一场绝望的战争、允许平民被屠杀、城镇和村庄被烧毁，这将是疯狂的、名副其实的自杀。这场战争几天后，格鲁吉亚人在莫斯科要求停战。他们被迫无条件投降，让这个国家受到残酷征服者的摆布。

The Georgian people risk complete extermination. His government understands that it would be madness, veritable suicide, to pursue a desperate war, and allow civilians to be massacred and towns and villages to be burned down. After a few days of this war, the Georgians ask for an armistice in Moscow. They are forced to surrender unconditionally, leaving the country at the mercy of a ruthless conqueror.

敌对行动结束后，苏联特别安全部在军事占领到位后立即抵达格鲁吉亚。

When hostilities end, the Soviet Special Security Department arrives in Georgia, immediately after the military occupation has been put in place.

在格鲁吉亚以及不久之后在亚美尼亚和波兰前线取得的胜利需要大量的粮食和装备供应。俄罗斯本土工人和农民的生活条件正变得难以忍受。在波兰前线，红军于 1920 年 8 月 14 日在华沙附近被击败，不得不撤出波兰。俄罗斯已经彻底疲惫不堪。契卡散布恐怖消灭了很大一部分自由职业人士、知识分子和专家。他们根据捷尔任斯基的命令被逮捕并消灭。许多工厂的机器在 1917 年被叛乱的工人摧毁，目前仍然关闭。饥荒和苦难随之而来。最后，喀琅施塔得的水手们，曾经是共产主义理想最热心的追随者，决定再次抗议，以支持他们的工人和农民同胞。在 1921 年 2 月 28 日组织的一次大型集会上，他们选出了代表前往彼得格勒与党的地区领导人格里戈里·季诺维也夫（Grigory Zinoviev）讨论这个问题，季诺维也夫是他们钦佩和赞扬的伟大列宁同志最好的朋友之一。十月革命前的热情。

The victories reported in Georgia and shortly afterwards in Armenia and on the Polish front demanded enormous supplies of food and equipment. The living conditions of workers and peasants in Russia itself are becoming unbearable. On the Polish front, the Red Army, defeated on August 14, 1920 near Warsaw, had to withdraw from Poland. Russia is completely exhausted. Spreading terror, the Chekaannihilates a great part of the members of the liberal professions, of the intelligentsia and of the specialists. They are arrested and exterminated in application of the orders given by Dzerzhinsky. Many factories, whose machines were destroyed by rebellious workers in 1917, remain closed. Famine and misery set in. Finally, the sailors of Kronstadt, who had been the most ardent adherents of communist ideals, decide to protest once again in favor of their fellow workers and peasants. During a large rally, organized on February 28, 1921, they elect representatives who will go to Petrograd to discuss the problem with Grigory Zinoviev, the regional leader of the Party and one of the best friends of the great comrade Lenin whom they admired and applauded with enthusiasm before the October Revolution.

1921年3月1日， 季诺维也夫在彼得格勒斯莫尔尼广场的办公室接见了由30人组成的代表团。他承诺将向莫斯科发电报。答案是直接的：列宁认为喀琅施塔得决议是反革命行为；他亲自下令监禁代表们，并将他们视为卑鄙的叛徒。该订单立即执行。第二天，水手们被捕并被枪杀。

On March 1 ,  1921, the delegation of thirty men was received by Zinoviev in his office in Smolni Square in Petrograd. He promises to send a telegram to Moscow. The answer is immediate: Lenin considers the Kronstadt resolution as a counter-revolutionary act; he personally gives the order to imprison the delegates and treat them as vulgar traitors. The order is executed immediately. The sailors are arrested and shot the next day.

苏维埃的国家是无产阶级的国家。所以如果有人抗议，他就是在抗议无产阶级，抗议他自己的祖国。在这种情况下，它不是一个爱国者，而是一个寄生虫，在每个人都喝的水源中吐口水。在人民的土地上没有这样的人的立足之地。也不存在针对代表无产阶级、始终致力于公民利益的政府的罢工、示威或任何其他形式的叛变的余地。这些背叛的细菌必须从社会的健康元素中斩断，并从根本上消灭，因为它们不配生存。

The country of the Soviets is the country of the proletariat. So if someone protests, he is protesting against the proletariat, against his own fatherland. In this case, it is not a patriot, but a parasite which spits in the source where everyone drinks. There is no place for such men in the land of the people. Nor is there room for strikes, demonstrations or any other form of mutiny against the administration which, representing the proletariat, devotes itself at all times to the good of the citizens. These germs of betrayal must be cut off from the healthy element of the community, and annihilated to the root, for they do not deserve to live.

当喀琅施塔得的水手们得知他们的代表团被处决时，他们决定奋起反抗。1917 年 2 月和 10 月全心全意支持列宁的那些人现在正在反抗这个政权。但列宁政府的反应并不像克伦斯基政府那样，克伦斯基政府宣布对与之作战的士兵和水手进行大赦。列宁行动迅速而无情。他把这个问题留给了红军总司令和组织者托洛茨基，托洛茨基已成为战争政委。托洛茨基委托米哈伊尔·尼古拉耶维奇·图哈切夫斯基处理与水手打交道的棘手任务。这个选择非常聪明。指挥部_图哈切夫斯基是前沙皇军官，在波兰战争中表现出勇敢和经验。他于 1918 年加入布尔什维克。作为一名前白俄指挥官，他一定憎恨杀害他的同事（包括他的一些最好的朋友）的喀琅施塔得水手。他将毫不犹豫地镇压叛乱。

When the sailors of Kronstadt learn of the execution of their delegation, they decide to rise up. The same men who supported Lenin with heart and devotion in February and October 1917 are now rebelling against the regime. But Lenin's government did not react like that of Kerensky, which had proclaimed an amnesty for the soldiers and sailors who had fought against it. Lenin acts swiftly and mercilessly. He left the problem to Trotsky, Commander-in-Chief and organizer of the Red Army, who had become Commissar for War. Trotsky entrusts Mikhail Nikolayevich Tukhachevsky with the delicate task of dealing with the sailors. The choice is very clever. The KommandarmTukhachevski, who showed bravery and experience during the war in Poland, is a former tsarist officer. He joined the Bolsheviks in 1918. As a former White Russian commander, he must hate the Kronstadt sailors who killed his colleagues, including some of his best friends. He will have no qualms about crushing the mutiny.

在采取这一行动之前，图哈切夫斯基指出，他唯一的问题是所使用的部队的问题。在与托洛茨基的一次会议上，他提出了一种可能性，即红军士兵不是与暴乱者作战，而是加入他们并反对政府。为了防止叛乱，托洛茨基解除了彼得格勒驻军的武装。他还承诺向图哈切夫斯基提供6万名武装人员，他们将被告知他们将进攻喀琅施塔得，因为它是白卫军反共产主义起义的基地，而且那里已经组织了一场反阴谋。资产阶级革命家。他们将获得充足的面包、更好的食物和足够的伏特加来激发他们对抗寄生虫的兴趣。还将有共产党学员单位。契卡。

Before undertaking this action, Tukhachevsky points out that his only problem is that of the troops to be used. During a conference with Trotsky, he evokes the possibility that the soldiers of the Red Army, instead of fighting the rioters, join them and turn against the government. To prevent rebellions, Trotsky had the Petrograd garrison disarmed. He also promises to provide Tukhachevsky with 60,000 armed men who will be told that they are going to attack Kronstadt, because it serves as the base for a revolt of the White Guards against communism and because a counter-plot has been organized there. petty-bourgeois revolutionary. They will be given good rations of bread, better food, and enough vodka to excite them against parasites. There will also be units of Communist cadets.Cheka .

1921 年 3 月 5 日，托洛茨基让叛变的水手们宣布，如果他们不投降，他们将被一一枪杀——用他自己的话来说——“就像湖上的鸭子一样”。

On March 5, 1921, Trotsky had the mutinous sailors proclaimed that, if they did not surrender, they would be shot one by one – in his own words – “like ducks on a lake”.

但水手们无意放弃他们的堡垒。3月7日，图哈切夫斯基的部队在强大的火炮掩护下猛攻喀琅施塔得。尽管袭击者的人数与15,000名水手的比例为四比一，但水手们还是用枪林弹雨迎接对手。战争持续十天。红色部队必须在浴血奋战中占领一个又一个堡垒。“他们像野兽一样战斗，”图哈切夫斯基在 1921 年 3 月 17 日向列宁报告攻克喀琅施塔得的情况时写道。地面上、堡垒周围和堡垒内，躺着数以千计的水手“一一”被杀。那些被俘虏的人随后将被契卡人的排处决，直到最后。按照托洛茨基的说法，他们“就像湖上的鸭子一样”被拖了。

But the sailors had no intention of surrendering their bastion. On March 7, Tukhachevsky's forces, covered by powerful artillery, stormed Kronstadt. Although the attackers outnumbered the 15,000 sailors by a ratio of four to one, the sailors greeted their opponents with a hail of bullets. The war lasts ten days. The red units must take fort after fort, in bloody battles. “They fought like wild beasts,” wrote Tukhachevsky on March 17, 1921, when he reported to Lenin on the capture of Kronstadt. On the ground, around the forts, and in the fortress, lie thousands of sailors killed "one by one". Those taken prisoner will later be executed, to the last, by platoons of Cheka men. In accordance with Trotsky's word, they were pulled “like ducks on a lake”.

列宁最忠实的崇拜者、喀琅施塔得的猎鹰、著名巡洋舰奥罗拉号的战友、被党称为“革命的骄傲和荣耀”的热心水手、以及最优秀的人，就这样结束了。工人和农民的儿子。

Thus ended the most devoted worshipers of Lenin, the falcons of Kronstadt, the brothers-in-arms of the crew of the famous cruiser Aurora, the enthusiastic sailors whom the Party had called "the pride and glory of the revolution", and the best sons of workers and peasants.

1921年3月末，格鲁吉亚战败，喀琅施塔得兵变以流血结束，与波兰签署和平条约，格鲁吉亚和亚美尼亚最终平定，镇压任何反对的迹象，任何反布尔什维克的情绪，使用巴库已经采用的方法。为了完成这项任务，洞察力强的奥尔忠尼启则已经选择了他的年轻同志，忠诚而有前途的拉夫连季·贝利亚。

Towards the end of March 1921, when Georgia was defeated, when the Kronstadt mutiny ended in blood, when a peace treaty was signed with Poland, the final pacification of Georgia and Armenia, and crush any sign of opposition, any anti-Bolshevik sentiment, using the method already applied in Baku. For this task, the penetrating Ordzhonikidze has already chosen his young comrade, the faithful and promising Lavrenty Beria.

贝利亚自1920年9月起，为了夏季考试，在理工大学用整个学年的时间刻苦学习。他只是偶尔见到奥尔忠尼启则或米高扬，只是因为他不想与这些地位高的同志失去联系。1921 年 4 月，他突然被叫到执行委员会总部。奥尔忠尼启则想见他。我们需要他。

Beria, since September 1920, devoted the whole school year to assiduous studies at the polytechnic university in view of the summer examinations. He only sees Ordzhonikidze or Mikoyan from time to time, only because he doesn't want to lose contact with these well-placed comrades. Suddenly, in April 1921, he was called to the headquarters of the Executive Committee. Ordzhonikidze wants to see him. We need him.

第11章

Chapter 11

适合这份工作的人

The man for the job

当贝利亚到达执行委员会时，他从秘书那里得知奥尔忠尼启则同志很忙。拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇必须等待。这是他第一次受到这样的欢迎。由于他约会从不迟到，所以他总是可以立即进来见任何权威人士。这次他必须等待电话。奥尔忠尼启则办公室的门终于打开，敦巴泽走了出来。他的脸上表现出决心、纪律和服从命令，即使这些命令违背了他的意愿。他看了看拉夫伦蒂，然后走开了。也许他被命令不要与他在总部可能遇到的任何人交谈，或者也许他只是没有心情说话。

When he arrives at the Executive Committee, Beria hears from the secretary that Comrade Ordzhonikidze is busy. Lavrenty Pavlovich must wait. This is the first time that he has been given such a welcome. Since he is never late for an appointment, he can always come in immediately to see any authority. This time he has to wait to be called. The door to Ordzhonikidze's office finally opens and Doumbadze comes out. His face expresses determination, discipline and submission to orders, even if they are against his will. He looks at Lavrenti and goes his way. Maybe he's been ordered not to talk to anyone he might meet at headquarters, or maybe he's just not in the mood to talk.

不久之后，“亲爱的塞尔戈”出现在门口，友好地伸出手臂，邀请贝利亚进来。他们坐在他那张漂亮、装饰华丽的桌子旁：这是一个在血腥清洗中被消灭的资本家的房子。“亲爱的塞尔戈”用格鲁吉亚语透露，尽管共产主义理想取得了胜利，阿塞拜疆建立了红色政府，但巴库仍然存在反对派，那里的反布尔什维克运动非常活跃。孟什维克、达伊纳克和穆萨瓦派等反苏政党转入地下。这些颠覆组织必须采取一切手段予以镇压。第11军特种部队指挥部保卫部Gekher 的效果非常好，但这还不够。这个任务必须由有一定监视和调查经验的人来承担，由狡猾而有技巧的人来承担，特别是由那些不仅是士兵或民兵，而且是献身于党的年轻知识分子来承担。这项任务必须始终是他们的主要职业、他们唯一的兴趣中心和唯一的活动。奥尔忠尼启则知道贝利亚目前正在学习建筑，但国家的安全是第一位的。列宁同志曾经说过：“一个好的共产党员同时也是一个好的契机。”。这意味着每个布尔什维克都应该是一名警察、一名间谍、一只“绵羊”。在这种情况下，贝利亚必须立即接受党赋予他的新职责。这意味着他必须停止上学。但他可以为党选择他执行一项特殊任务而感到自豪。同样的事情也发生在梦想成为红军高级军官的杜姆巴泽身上。然而，在这个新的共产主义政权正在建立的伟大时代，优秀的建筑师，甚至是优秀的正规军军官，并不像优秀而熟练的契卡分子那样重要。如果苏联祖国被敌人破坏了，再好的技术人员还有什么用呢？作为巴库的一名忠诚的布尔什维克，杜姆巴泽很荣幸承担同样的责任。他明白党的利益高于一切，他将放弃学业。那里契卡莫斯科是模范政府。它由列宁最亲密的朋友捷尔任斯基同志的专家领导，他完美地履行了自己的义务。但党需要新的干部，特别是格鲁吉亚人。格鲁吉亚迟早会并入苏联。从一开始就需要有充分准备的年轻人、在外面接受培训的共产主义者来承担新的责任。这些高级官员将在该国新政权建立后立即上任。奥尔忠尼启则知道，贝利亚在“镇压资产阶级的一周”的难忘日子里表现出了很多才华。现在，“亲爱的塞尔戈”渴望成为拉夫伦蒂在他的工作中的私人向导。Tcheka de Baku：镇压城市内的秘密运动。这将作为贝利亚被任命到格鲁吉亚之前的训练。没有时间可以浪费了。第二天，贝利亚必须在拜洛夫监狱办公室开始她的新工作。奥尔忠尼启则与他的年轻战友握手并祝他好运。

Shortly after, “dear Sergo” appears on the threshold and, extending his arm in a friendly way, invites Beria to enter. They sit at his handsome, richly decorated desk: it's a take from the house of a capitalist eliminated during the bloody purge. Speaking Georgian, "dear Sergo" reveals that despite the victory of the communist ideal and the establishment of a red administration in Azerbaijan, there is still opposition in Baku and that the anti-Bolshevik movement there is very active. The anti-Soviet parties the Mensheviks, the Dajnaks and the Mussavatians went underground. These subversive organizations must be crushed by all means. The special section of the 11th army , the Security Department of the kommandarmGekher, works very well, but that's not enough. This mission must be taken on by people who have some experience in surveillance and investigation, by cunning and skilful people, particularly by those who are not only soldiers or militiamen, but young intelligent people, devoted to the Party. This task must be their principal occupation, at all times, their only center of interest and their only activity. Ordzhonikidze knows that Beria is currently studying architecture, but the country's security comes first. Comrade Lenin once said: "A good Communist is at the same time a good Chekist. ". This means that every Bolshevik should be a policeman, a spy, a "sheep." Under these conditions, Beria must immediately accept the new responsibilities entrusted to him by the Party. This means that he must stop attending school. But he can be proud that the Party has chosen him for a special task. The same thing happened to Doumbadze, who dreamed of becoming a senior officer in the Red Army. However, in this great epoch when a new communist power is being created, good architects and even brilliant officers of the regular army are not as necessary as good and skilful Chekists. What use would good technicians be if the Soviet fatherland were to be undermined by the enemy? As a devoted Bolshevik of Baku, Doumbadze is honored with the same kind of responsibilities. He understood that the interests of the Party were higher than all the rest, and he will give up his studies. ThereChekaof Moscow is a model administration. It is led by the expert hands of Lenin's most intimate friend, Comrade Dzerzhinsky, who fulfills his obligations to perfection. But the Party needs new cadres, especially Georgians. Sooner or later, Georgia will be incorporated into the Soviet Union. There will be a great demand for well-prepared young men, communists trained outside, to assume the new responsibilities from the outset. These senior officials will come into operation as soon as the new regime has been established in the country. Ordzhonikidze is aware of the fact that Beria displayed a lot of talent during the memorable days of the “week of suppression of the bourgeoisie”. Now "dear Sergo" is eager to become Lavrenti's personal guide in his work at theTcheka de Baku: the crushing of the clandestine movement in the city. This will serve as training for Beria before his appointment to Georgia. There's no time to lose. The next day, Beria has to start her new job at the Bailov prison office. Ordzhonikidze shakes hands with his young comrade and wishes him good luck.

成为一名建筑师的梦想永远消失了。但一个新的梦想正在形成：解决这里、巴库以及后来他的祖国格鲁吉亚成千上万人的生死问题。这比盖房子、筑堤坝、打隧道还要令人兴奋。现在，贝利亚需要做的就是熟练、高效地完成自己的工作，忠诚、乐于助人，如果可能的话，对党来说是不可替代的。

The dream of becoming an architect vanishes forever. But a new dream takes shape: to dispose of the life and death of thousands of people here, in Baku, and, later, in his native Georgia. It is even more exhilarating than building houses, erecting dykes or drilling tunnels. For now, all Beria needs to do is do his job skillfully, efficiently, be loyal, helpful and, if possible, irreplaceable to the Party.

第二天八点，贝利亚出现在拜洛夫监狱。他的办公室已经准备好了，等待着他。这是一间狭窄的房间，墙壁上贴满了牛皮纸。云纹装饰被大片霉菌破坏，沉闷的灰色天花板多年没有重新粉刷，像麻风病皮肤一样剥落。地板上铺着一块破旧的绿色地毯。一张低矮、粗糙的桌子上铺着与地板相似的绿色地毯，桌上放着一盏电灯、一部电话和一个文具盒。有两把椅子和一个文件柜。墙上挂着一个大圆钟、一幅列宁的肖像，角落里还有一个衣帽架，使家具更加完整。当贝利亚坐在桌边时，他的右边打开了一扇小窗户，窗户上有厚厚的栅栏，上面覆盖着棕色的布。它俯瞰着庭院。

The next day, at eight o'clock, Beria showed up at the Bailov prison. His office, already prepared, awaits him. It is a narrow room, the walls covered with brown paper. The moire decor is ravaged by large patches of mold, and the dreary gray ceiling, which hasn't been repainted for years, is peeling off like leprous skin. A green, worn rug covers the floor. A low, coarse table, covered with a green carpet similar to that on the floor, supports an electric lamp, a telephone and a writing case. There are two chairs and a filing cabinet. A large round clock on the wall, a portrait of Lenin and a coat rack in one corner complete the furnishings. To Beria's right, when he is seated at his table, opens a small window with thick bars covered with brown cloth. It overlooks the courtyard.

奥尔忠尼启则的个人监视意味着——贝利亚从他与奥尔忠尼启则的第一次电话交谈中得知——拉夫连季几乎可以自由支配。“亲爱的塞尔戈”将他的全部权力委托给了他年轻的门徒。如果贝利亚需要特别建议，可以随时给奥尔忠尼启泽打电话。就这些。这样的力量非常符合贝利亚的野心。他知道，托付给他的任务，即镇压秘密运动，只是他的入学考试。如果他成功了，伟大事业的大门就会在他面前打开。赌注很高。他必须赢。他的工作需要有方法，不急不躁。

Ordzhonikidze's personal surveillance means – Beria learns from the first telephone conversation he has with him – that Lavrenty has practically a free hand. The "dear Sergo" delegates his full powers to his young protege. Beria can phone Ordzhonikidze anytime if he needs special advice. That is all. Such power meets Beria's ambitions very well. He is aware that the task entrusted to him, the crushing of the clandestine movement, constitutes only his entrance examination. If he succeeds, the doors of a great career will open before him. The stakes are high. He must win. His work requires method, without haste.

首先，贝利亚宣读了囚犯名单。在拜洛夫监狱，这份统计材料按字母顺序列出了囚犯的姓名，以及关押每个囚犯的牢房编号。贝利亚翻阅这份名单，发现了几个他认识并谴责过的人的名字。看到他们中的一些人并向他们提问会很有趣。这将是他以新角色与被拘留者的第一次会面，也是他作为一名契卡员的第一次审讯。

To begin, Beria reads the list of prisoners. At the Bailov prison, this statistical material presents the names in alphabetical order, with the number of the cell where each prisoner is incarcerated. Going through the list, Beria discovers the names of several people he knows personally and has denounced. It would be interesting to see some of them and question them. It will be his first meeting, in his new role, with the detainees and his first interrogation as a Chekist.

贝利亚按下桌子上的金属按钮。出现的狱卒接到命令，将马拉特·博萨乔利带过来。警卫消失了，但很快又回来了：所示的牢房里没有那个名字的人。贝利亚打电话给监狱长，请他来办公室。作为一名化学家，有着秘密行动科副科长的级别，贝利亚比一个简单的监狱看守要优越。后者告诉拉夫伦蒂，可能有几个原因可以解释囚犯马拉特·博萨乔利的缺席：（1）他可能是在“镇压资产阶级的一周”期间被枪杀的，当时正在进行大规模处决，没有核实身份；(2) 该男子可能已死在监狱中，几乎每天每夜都会发生这种情况，他将被带到太平间，然后埋在万人坑中；(3) 该男子可能使用假名；他可能会在夜间被从床上抓走，与其他被捕者一起装上一辆卡车，而他的证件却留在家里；所以现在，当我们打电话给他时，他对博萨乔利的名字没有任何反应；(4) 它可能被错误地转移到登记簿中未提及的另一个牢房。

Beria presses a metal button on his table. The jailer who appears receives the order to bring Marat Bossadjogli. The guard disappears, but returns promptly: there is no man of that name in the cell indicated. Beria telephones the director of the prison and asks him to come to his office. As a Chekist, with the rank of Vice-Director of the Covert Operations Section, Beria is superior to a simple head guard of a prison. The latter informs Lavrenti that there may be several reasons to explain the absence of the prisoner Marat Bossadjogli: (1) he may have been shot during the "week of suppression of the bourgeoisie", when mass executions were taking place without checking identities; (2) the man may have died in prison, as happens almost every day and night, he will have been taken to the morgue and then buried in a mass grave; (3) the man may have given a false name; he will have been snatched from his bed at night and loaded into a truck with a crowd of other arrested people, leaving his papers at home; so now, when we call him, he doesn't respond to the name of Bossadjogli; (4) it may have been transferred to another cell which, by mistake, was not mentioned in the register.

这些解释并不能令贝利亚满意。他询问这四种假设是否穷尽了所有可能性，以及导演是否确定不存在第五种假设。换句话说：犯人没有逃跑吗？听到这种可能性几乎不可能发生，贝利亚反驳道，“几乎”这个词在苏联监狱里没有立足之地，应该一劳永逸地划掉。采访结束后，贝利亚决定他的首要任务是对监狱进行彻底重组。这项工作将向“亲爱的塞尔戈”表明，拉夫伦蒂非常高效，而且无疑是这项工作的合适人选。

These explanations do not satisfy Beria. He asks if the four hypotheses exhaust the possibilities and if the director is sure that there is not a fifth one. In other words: didn't the prisoner escape? Hearing that such an eventuality is almost impossible, Beria retorts that "almost" is a word that has no place in a Soviet prison and should be crossed out once and for all. After the interview, Beria decides that his first task will be the complete reorganization of the prison. This undertaking will show "dear Sergo" that Lavrenti is particularly efficient and, certainly, the right man for the job.

贝利亚毫不费力地实现他的野心。他在技术学院的经历让他学到了很多关于他的同志如何代表布尔什维克进行颠覆活动的知识。他的经历教会了他两条规则。首先，如果那些对这些活动怀有敌意的教师还活着并且仍然享有自由，那么他们就属于反对派。必须阻止他们。对他们的审讯肯定会揭露大量有关反布尔什维克运动的信息。贝利亚将他们的名字列入逮捕令，以便将他们逮捕并带到他的办公室接受讯问。在教育机构、研究所和学院中可能有，

Beria has no difficulty in satisfying his ambition. His presence at the Technicum taught him a great deal about how his comrades carried out subversive activities on behalf of the Bolsheviks. His experience taught him two rules. First of all, if the teachers who were hostile to these activities are still alive and still enjoying their freedom, they belong to the opposition. They must be stopped. Their interrogation will surely reveal a great deal of information about the anti-Bolshevik movement. Beria places the list of their names on an arrest warrant so that they can be seized and taken to his office for questioning. There are probably, in educational institutions, institutes and colleges,

贝利亚向巴库教育机构的董事、院长和校长发送了一份备忘录，要求提供所有学生的确切名单及其关系细节。它还提醒当局，除由国家特别资助并由经过专业培训和官方任命的教员指导和控制的学生组织外，不允许任何学生组织。它就是共青团、共青团。

Beria sends a memorandum to directors, deans and presidents of educational institutions in Baku, asking for the exact list of all students and details of their relationships. It also reminds the authorities that no student organizations are permitted except those specifically sponsored by the State and directed and controlled by professionally trained and officially appointed instructors. It is the Communist Youth League, the Komsomol .

获得学生名单后，贝利亚指出了孩子们的名字，或者他所知道的重要穆萨瓦主义者、孟什维克或达伊纳克人的近亲的名字。以这种方式被区分意味着一个人的名字已经被作为对手而被监禁或清算。贝利亚非常清楚，这些刚满十四岁的年轻人可能对国家安全构成威胁。即使是十二岁的孩子也可以充当信使、信使或帮助隐藏进城的使者。这些孩子必须受到无情的惩罚。贝利亚指着所有他觉得熟悉或可疑的十二岁以上学生的名字。每天，一到两名学生（从年龄最大的开始）被叫去见院长或主任。

Having obtained the list of students, Beria points to the names of the children, or of the close relatives of people known to him as being important Musavatists, Mensheviks or Dajnaks. To be distinguished in this way means that one bears the name of someone who has already been imprisoned or liquidated as an opponent. Beria knows perfectly well that these young people, who are barely over fourteen, can pose a threat to state security. Even twelve-year-old children can serve as couriers, messengers or help hide emissaries who have come to town. These kids need to be punished mercilessly. Beria points to the names of all the students over the age of twelve who seem familiar or suspicious to him. Each day, one or two students, starting with the oldest, are called to see the dean or the director.

由贝利亚亲自主持的审讯最终让他感到无聊。如果一个男孩流着泪说出名字或承认自己被指控的罪名，他就会被要求签署声明，然后被送回牢房，几天后或更确切地说是几个晚上后被释放。但如果他什么都不知道，或者固执地拒绝回答问题，他就会被命令伸出双臂，并用芦苇打他的手。如果这不起作用，贝利亚就会打他的脸。起初，他就像一个兴奋的乡村教师惩罚一个坏学生，或者像一个工匠，他的笨拙学徒损坏了工具，或者像一个残酷的中士对新兵发号施令。但男孩越顽固，贝利亚就越加倍打击。审讯者用右手击打年轻人的左脸，用左手击打年轻人的右脸。起初，贝利亚认为这是获取信息的最简单方法。然后他发现这给了他特别的乐趣。由于他很聪明，他很快就明白，他所感受到的快乐并不是来自击打或看到受害者流血和痛苦尖叫。贝利亚并不是虐待狂。他的快乐源于他意识到受折磨的人是毫无防御能力的，并且他确信他的受害者即使在绝望中也不会敢攻击他。了解到进入他办公室的囚犯毫无防御能力，拉夫伦蒂比殴打本身更高兴。

The interrogation sessions, conducted personally by Beria, end up boring him. If a boy in tears names names or recognizes what he is accused of, he is made to sign his statement and sent back to his cell to be released a few days, or rather a few nights later. But if he knows nothing, or if he stubbornly refuses to answer the questions, he is ordered to stretch out his arms and his hands are struck with a reed. If that doesn't work, Beria slaps his face. At first he did it like an excited village schoolteacher punishing a bad student, or like a craftsman whose clumsy apprentice deteriorates the tools, or like a brutal sergeant giving orders to a recruit. But the more stubborn the boy is, the more Beria redoubles his blows. The interrogator hits the young man's left cheek with his right hand and his right cheek with his left hand. At first, Beria did it thinking it was the easiest way to get information. Then he discovered that it gave him special pleasure. As he is intelligent, he quickly understood that the pleasure he felt did not come from hitting or seeing the victim bleeding and screaming in pain. Beria is not sadistic. His pleasure is rooted in his awareness that the tortured person is defenseless, and in his certainty that none of his victims, even in despair, will dare to attack him. Understanding that the prisoner who enters his office is defenseless gives Lavrenti more pleasure than the beatings themselves.

年轻女孩在接受审讯时不会被打手。他们不必特别顽固就会被打败。但他们却被迫忍受各种折磨，以诱骗他们说出自己所知道的事情。他们被命令脱掉鞋子，躺在地板上，脸贴着地毯，掀起裙子，脱掉内衣。然后贝利亚将脚放在受害者的脖子上并开始鞭打他。不幸的孩子可能会哭泣，但她被警告，如果她试图尖叫，惩罚将不会停止。

Young girls, when interrogated, are not hit on the hands. They don't have to be particularly stubborn to be beaten. But they are forced to endure various tortures to trick them into revealing what they know. They are ordered to take off their shoes and lie on the floor with their faces against the carpet, lift their skirts and take off their underwear. Then Beria puts his foot on the victim's neck and begins to whip him. The unfortunate kid may cry, but she is warned that if she tries to scream, the punishment will not stop .

殴打女孩会让贝利亚产生性兴奋。不仅仅是因为他们半裸地躺在他面前。当然，对于像拉夫伦蒂这样的二十二岁男人来说，一个半裸的年轻女孩是令人兴奋的。但这并不是贝利亚兴奋的主要原因，因为在马鞭的第一次打击之后，受害者的身体会变成紫色，开始流血，最后，当疼痛变得无法忍受时，自然的需求就必须得到满足。事情的这一面令人不愉快，而且气味令人厌恶。快乐的真正原因是女孩的青春。孩子越天真无助，她就越令人兴奋、越令人向往，快乐也越大。

Thrashing girls sexually excites Beria. And not just because they're lying half-naked in front of him. Of course, a partially undressed young girl is exciting for a twenty-two-year-old man like Lavrenti. But this is not the main reason for Beria's excitement, because after the first blows of the riding crop, the victim's body turns purple, begins to bleed, and finally, when the pain becomes intolerable, the natural needs must be satisfied. . This aspect of things is unpleasant and the smell is repugnant. The real cause of pleasure is the girl's youth. The more innocent and defenseless the kid is, the more exciting and desirable she becomes, and the greater the pleasure.

尽管贝利亚成熟、精力充沛、健康并具有动物般的快感，但迄今为止他一直过着斯巴达式的生活。他的性经历是有限的。他知道他那圆圆的西瓜头、短扁的鼻子、厚厚的嘴唇、永远出汗的手和稀少的头发让他很难看。他的丑陋使他变得复杂。他记得当他去学校时，女孩们如何嘲笑他，以及当他试图在茶室或公园里接近她们时，她们如何咯咯地笑。在舞厅里，他们拒绝与他跳舞。贝利亚意识到自己丑陋，因此鄙视女性。他要报复他们，惩罚他们。与此同时，他努力让自己看起来即使不漂亮，至少也很有趣。他羡慕又讨厌他碰巧遇到的英俊男孩。他想要成为一个伟大人物、一个拥有巨大权力的权贵的野心，也源于他因丑陋而产生的这种情结。贝利亚觉得，凭借他的处境，并且凭借他的权力，他可以对人们产生影响，至少就像他很英俊一样。生活让他遇到的女孩们都拒绝了贝利亚，他只能求助于那些铺路的人。然而，由于他经常缺钱，所以他不能花太多钱。年轻漂亮的妓女对于拉夫伦蒂来说太昂贵了。他必须满足于那些令他厌恶的旧便士。后来当他成为了朋友后 由于他的力量，他可以对人们产生影响，至少就像他很英俊一样。生活让他遇到的女孩们都拒绝了贝利亚，他只能求助于那些铺路的人。然而，由于他经常缺钱，所以他不能花太多钱。年轻漂亮的妓女对于拉夫伦蒂来说太昂贵了。他必须满足于那些令他厌恶的旧便士。后来当他成为了朋友后 由于他的力量，他可以对人们产生影响，至少就像他很英俊一样。生活让他遇到的女孩们都拒绝了贝利亚，他只能求助于那些铺路的人。然而，由于他经常缺钱，所以他不能花太多钱。年轻漂亮的妓女对于拉夫伦蒂来说太昂贵了。他必须满足于那些令他厌恶的旧便士。后来当他成为了朋友后 这让他感到厌恶。后来当他成为了朋友后 这让他感到厌恶。后来当他成为了朋友后kommandarm Gekher，他将参加该男子将在他的一间房间的公寓，在军营营房组织的狂欢。在那里，他必须接受朋友花钱给他带来的女孩，她们是中年女性，粗俗，胸重，臀部肥大。他们的陪伴下的欢乐聚会与与天真无邪的年轻女孩的面对面交谈非常不同。现在贝利亚已经成为一名Chekist，他有机会报仇。他可以为那些过去拒绝过他、违背对他的承诺、取笑他的人惩罚这些年轻女孩。

Although he is mature, vigorous, healthy and endowed with an animal pleasure, Beria has led a Spartan life so far. His sexual experiences are limited. He knows that his watermelon-round head, short, flat nose, thick lips, perpetually sweaty palms, and scanty hair make him ugly. His ugliness made him complex. He remembers how, when he went to school, the girls laughed at him, and how they giggled when he tried to approach them in a tea room or in a public park. In the ballrooms, they refused to dance with him. Aware of being ugly, Beria despises women. He wants to take revenge on them and punish them. At the same time, he tries to look, if not beautiful, at least interesting. He envies and he hates the handsome boys he happens to meet. His ambition to become a great personality, a dignitary invested with enormous powers, also finds its source in this complex caused by his ugliness. Beria feels that, by his situation, and thanks to his power, he can impose on people, at least as much as if he were handsome. Rejected by the girls that life makes him meet, Beria falls back on those who make the pavement. However, since he is often short of money, he cannot spend much with them. Young and pretty prostitutes are too expensive for Lavrenti. He has to content himself with old pennies who disgust him. Later, when he has become the friend of the and thanks to his power, he can impose on people, at least as much as if he were handsome. Rejected by the girls that life makes him meet, Beria falls back on those who make the pavement. However, since he is often short of money, he cannot spend much with them. Young and pretty prostitutes are too expensive for Lavrenti. He has to content himself with old pennies who disgust him. Later, when he has become the friend of the and thanks to his power, he can impose on people, at least as much as if he were handsome. Rejected by the girls that life makes him meet, Beria falls back on those who make the pavement. However, since he is often short of money, he cannot spend much with them. Young and pretty prostitutes are too expensive for Lavrenti. He has to content himself with old pennies who disgust him. Later, when he has become the friend of the which disgust him. Later, when he has become the friend of the which disgust him. Later, when he has become the friend of thekommandarm Gekher, he will participate in orgies that the man will organize in his one-room apartment, in the barracks barracks. There, he will have to accept the girls brought to him by his friend at his expense, middle-aged females, vulgar, with heavy breasts and fat buttocks. The parties of pleasure in their company are very different from a tete-a-tete with an innocent young girl. Now that Beria has become a Chekist, he has a chance to take his revenge. He can punish these young girls for all those who have rejected him in the past, or who have broken their promises to him and who have made fun of him.

在执行歼灭敌人的任务时，贝利亚的袖子里藏着一张假牌，可以给他的强大朋友奥尔忠尼启泽、米高扬、盖赫尔留下深刻的印象。在“镇压资产阶级周”之前，他在准备取缔名单时，没有透露几位隐藏得很好的重要阴谋家的名字。他对他们的名字保密有两个原因：第一，如果巴库革命失败，这些人可能会重新出现并帮助他；第二，如果巴库革命失败，这些人可能会重新出现并帮助他。然后，在适当的时候，他可以将他的信息作为贵重物品出售。现在那一刻已经到来。但拉夫伦蒂知道他不能着急。相反。这一启示必须表现为一项需要耐心研究的艰巨工作的典范。在担任Chekist活动的头几个月里，贝利亚开始签署针对这些人的第一批逮捕令。如果反对派仍然存在，这将是一个巨大的打击。以这种方式被捕的人应该被共产党视为敌人，但到目前为止，他们仍然逍遥法外，受到虚假证件的保护，并且居住在与过去不同的地址。认识他们的贝利亚发明了一种特殊的方法。由于他总是穿着便服，而且职务不明确，所以他不应该担心被认定为特工。以这种方式被捕的人应该被共产党视为敌人，但到目前为止，他们仍然逍遥法外，受到虚假证件的保护，并且居住在与过去不同的地址。认识他们的贝利亚发明了一种特殊的方法。由于他总是穿着便服，而且职务不明确，所以他不应该担心被认定为特工。以这种方式被捕的人应该被共产党视为敌人，但到目前为止，他们仍然逍遥法外，受到虚假证件的保护，并且居住在与过去不同的地址。认识他们的贝利亚发明了一种特殊的方法。由于他总是穿着便服，而且职务不明确，所以他不应该担心被认定为特工。契卡。他养成了在两个助手的陪同下走在街上的习惯。他们是巴库人、纳尔根岛前刽子手里扎-扎德，以及亚美尼亚特工和间谍奥贝利亚尼。当贝利亚在路人中发现一名受害者，或者注意到她在商店或办公室工作时，他会用亲切的微笑和友好的“你好”向她打招呼。第二天，贝利亚的一位同伴跟踪此人到了他的秘密住所。我们在夜间停止它。

In his mission to annihilate the enemy, Beria has a false card hidden up his sleeve, which can impress his powerful friends, Ordzhonikidze, and Mikoian, and Gekher. Before the “week of the suppression of the bourgeoisie”, while preparing proscription lists, he did not reveal the names of several important conspirators who were well hidden. He had two reasons for keeping their names secret: first, if the Baku revolution failed, these people might resurface and help him; then, in due course, he could sell his information as valuables. Now that moment has arrived. But Lavrenti knows he must not rush. On the contrary. This revelation must appear as the apotheosis of a difficult work requiring patient research. During the first months of his activity as a Chekist, Beria began to sign the first arrest warrants against these people. It will be a mighty blow to the opposition, if it still exists. Men caught in this way should be known to the Communist Party as its enemies, but so far they have remained at large, protected by false papers and living at different addresses than in the past. Beria, who knows them personally, invents a special method. As he always wears civilian clothes and as his function is obscure, he should not fear being identified as an agent of the Men caught in this way should be known to the Communist Party as its enemies, but so far they have remained at large, protected by false papers and living at different addresses than in the past. Beria, who knows them personally, invents a special method. As he always wears civilian clothes and as his function is obscure, he should not fear being identified as an agent of the Men caught in this way should be known to the Communist Party as its enemies, but so far they have remained at large, protected by false papers and living at different addresses than in the past. Beria, who knows them personally, invents a special method. As he always wears civilian clothes and as his function is obscure, he should not fear being identified as an agent of theCheka . He got into the habit of walking the streets, followed by two assistants. They are Riza-Zade, a native of Baku and a former executioner on the island of Nargen, and Orbeliani, an Armenian agent and spy. When Beria spots one of his victims in the crowd of passers-by, or notices her working in a shop or office, he greets her with a cordial smile and a friendly "hello". The next day, the person is tailed to his secret lodgings by one of Beria's companions. We stop it during the night.

有一次散步时，贝利亚注意到一个穿着破烂夹克和裤子的可疑人物，一顶破旧的帽子拉低到额头上。她偷偷地溜进一条狭窄的小巷，避开了视线。贝利亚命令他的侦探追踪该男子并将他带回监狱。这就是拉夫伦蒂在港口遇到的那个人。他也是 Mir Djaffar Bagirov 的熟人。他向拉夫伦蒂和巴吉洛夫支付报酬，以获取他们的信息。该男子被捕的当晚就在监狱的地窖中被处决。拉夫伦蒂现在可以安心睡觉了。通过下令处决此人，他除掉了一名代表 Okhrana 目睹其活动的目击者。

During one of his walks, Beria notices a suspicious figure in a ragged jacket and trousers, a worn cap pulled down over his forehead. She slips furtively down a narrow alley, avoiding sight. Beria orders his sleuths to follow the man and bring him back to prison. This is the man Lavrenti met at the port. He is also an acquaintance of Mir Djaffar Bagirov. He was paying Lavrenti and Bagirov for their information. The very night of his arrest, the man was executed in the cellars of the prison. Lavrenti can now sleep in peace. By ordering the execution of this person, he got rid of a witness to his activities on behalf of the Okhrana .

拉夫连季显然没有想到，他的名字和他的朋友巴吉洛夫一样，仍然出现在沙皇秘密警察档案的工资单上，而且这些文件在革命期间并没有全部被烧毁或毁坏。

Lavrenti obviously does not envisage that his name, like that of his friend Bagirov, still appears on the payroll of the archives of the tsarist secret police, and that these documents were not all burned or destroyed during the revolution.

贝利亚记得他曾经照顾过的上流社会学生父母的名字。他们必须因只付给他几卢布并剥削他而羞辱他而受到惩罚。

Beria remembers the names of the parents of the high society students, whom he once cared for. They must be punished for humiliating him by paying him only a few rubles and exploiting him.

几周后，由于贝利亚精明地隐瞒了他所掌握的信息，贝利亚实际上成功地完成了任务，并得到了奥尔忠尼启则的充分奖励。善良的“亲爱的塞尔戈”提拔了拉夫伦蒂，并任命他为秘密行动部部长和阿塞拜疆契卡副主席。

A few weeks later, the success of the mission effectively assumed by Beria, thanks to the shrewd concealment of the information he possessed, was fully rewarded by Ordjonikidze. The good "dear Sergo" promotes Lavrenti and appoints him head of the Secret Operations Department and vice-president of the Cheka of Azerbaijan.

评级

Ratings

8 . V. I. 列宁在 1920 年 4 月 3 日第九次党代表大会上发表的讲话 。

8 . V. I. Lenin, in a speech delivered during the IX Party  Congress, April 3, 1920.

9 . 根据提交人 1941 年至 1942 年被拘留在科米苏维埃社会主义自治共和国劳改营期间所抓获的一名囚犯的证词。

9 . According to the testimony of a prisoner taken by the author while he was detained, in 1941-1942, in a labor camp of the Komi Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic.

第12章

Chapter 12

第比利斯宴会

Tiflis banquet

1921年的夏天，高加索地区炎热、干燥、阳光明媚。格鲁吉亚和共产主义俄罗斯之间的战争结束已经过去了三个月，但新政权仅靠第十一个国家的存在才得以维持。红军。高加索共产党委员会由几位老布尔什维克组成：布杜·姆迪瓦尼，苏联入侵后担任格鲁吉亚人民委员会主席；马米亚·奥拉赫拉什维利，格鲁吉亚革命委员会主席；菲利普·马哈拉泽；阿列克谢·斯瓦尼泽 (Alexei Svanidze)，斯大林第一任妻子叶卡捷琳娜 (Ekaterina) 的妹夫；谢尔戈·阿利卢耶夫 (Sergo Alliluyev)，斯大林第二任妻子娜杰日达 (Nadezhda) 的妹夫；内斯特·拉科巴和其他一些人。这个委员会太小，无法成立一个政党。一小群因承诺提供更好工作而皈依马克思主义的工人不能自称为“群众”。斯瓦尼泽在给斯大林的信中请求“索索”亲自访问并向他的同胞展示自己，以鼓励他们并提高他们的士气。

The summer of 1921 was hot, dry and sunny in the Caucasus. Three months have passed since the end of the war between Georgia and communist Russia, but the new regime is only holding on thanks to the presence in the country of the 11thRed Army. The Committee of the Communist Party of the Caucasus is made up of a handful of old Bolsheviks: Boudou Mdivani, who became, after the Soviet invasion, president of the Council of People's Commissars of Georgia; Mamia Orakhelashvili, Chairman of the Georgian Revolutionary Committee; Philippe Makharadze; Alexei Svanidze, brother-in-law of Ekaterina, Stalin's first wife; Sergo Alliluyev, brother-in-law of Nadezhda, Stalin's second wife; Nestor Lakoba and a few others. This committee is too small to be able to found a party. A small group of workers, won over to Marxism by the promise of better work, cannot claim to be called the “mass”. Svanidze asks, in a letter to Stalin, that "Soso" make a personal visit and show himself to his compatriots to encourage them and raise their morale.

六月底，斯大林抵达第比利斯。他的同志们相信，约瑟夫·维萨里奥诺维奇·朱加奇维利（Iosif Vissarionovitch Djougachvili），一位贫穷的格鲁吉亚鞋匠的儿子，已经达到了权力的顶峰，会给全国留下深刻的印象。

At the end of June, Stalin arrives in Tiflis. His comrades are convinced that Iosif Vissarionovitch Djougachvili, son of a poor Georgian cobbler, who has reached the pinnacle of power, will impress the nation.

回国几天后，斯大林走进第比利斯铁路工厂的大厅，那里定于上午十点举行一次大型会议。三千多名工人聚集在一起等待演讲者的到来。斯大林在斯瓦尼泽、阿利卢耶夫、姆迪瓦尼和马哈拉泽的陪同下登上挂满红旗的讲台。我们对它的欢迎更多的是好奇而不是钦佩。对于这群人来说，斯大林只是苏联政治局委员和布尔什维克政委之一，但绝不是英雄。当马哈拉泽介绍这位尊贵的访客、该国的孙子约瑟夫·维萨里奥诺维奇·朱加什维利时，响起了一些罕见的、不冷不热的掌声。

A few days after his return to the country, Stalin entered the main hall of the Tiflis railway factory, where a big meeting was scheduled for ten o'clock in the morning. More than three thousand workers assembled in expectation of the speaker. Accompanied by Svanidze, Alliluyev, Mdivani and Makharadze, Stalin climbs onto the platform decorated with red flags. We welcome it with more curiosity than admiration. For this crowd, Stalin is only a member of the Soviet Politburo (short for Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party) and one of the Bolshevik commissars, but in no way a hero. A few rare and lukewarm applause ring out when Makharadze introduces the distinguished visitor, Iosif Vissarionovitch Djougashvili, the country's grandson.

“同志们！兄弟们！斯大林用俄语开始。

“Comrades! Brothers ! begins Stalin in Russian.

– 你为什么不说格鲁吉亚语？观众中有人喊道。你忘记了你的母语吗？你太无耻了 ！

– Why don't you speak Georgian? shouts someone in the audience. Have you forgotten your mother tongue? Shame on you !

——我没有忘记我的母语，斯大林回答道，但我正在使用伟大的十月革命的语言。»

– I have not forgotten my mother tongue, replies Stalin, but I am using the language of the great October revolution. »

这句话引起一阵笑声。演讲无法发表。 工人们开始提问。为什么他们从独立和自由中“解放”出来？为什么非当局组织的会议被禁止？我们为什么要审查媒体？为什么小麦、水果等产品要从格鲁吉亚运往俄罗斯？俄罗斯军队为何继续占领该国？

A wave of laughter responds to this statement. The speech cannot be delivered . The workers start asking questions. Why are they "liberated" from their independence and freedom? Why is any meeting that is not organized by the authorities banned? Why do we censor the press? Why are wheat, fruits and other products from Georgia transported to Russia? Why does the Russian army continue to occupy the country?

斯大林对每个问题都进行了简短、冷静的回答。他沙哑的声音一如既往地平静而单调，但很明显说话者很难保持冷静。这些问题可能会无限地融合在一起。马哈拉泽最后宣布斯大林同志将再回答三个问题，然后会议结束。然后，工人们回到他们的机器和工具前，感到失望和沮丧，因为他们发现与为压迫他们和损害他们利益而建立的新政权没有共同点。

Stalin answers briefly, soberly to each question. His raspy voice is as calm and monotonous as ever, but it's clear the speaker is having trouble keeping his composure. The questions could fuse ad infinitum. Makharadze ends it by announcing that Comrade Stalin will answer three more questions and then the meeting will end. The workers then return to their machines and tools, disappointed and depressed because they find no common point with the new regime established to oppress them and harm their interests.

斯大林和他的副手决定保持沉默，等待大约一周。这样，在组织新的会议之前，人们就有可能平静下来并忘记会议的失败。

Stalin and his deputies decide to remain quiet and wait about a week. The people will thus have the possibility of calming down and forgetting the failure of the meeting before a new meeting is organised.

1921年7月6日，位于第比利斯的格鲁吉亚共产党中央委员会于第二天上午11点召开新的会议。这次总统职位被委托给了杰出的内斯特·拉科巴，他比菲利普·马哈拉泽的这位秃头大胡子有更高的精神和更令人愉快的外表。拉科巴带着友好而令人解除戒心的微笑宣布，斯大林同志将发表一个非常有趣的演讲，他已经为此准备了好几天了。所以请亲爱的同志们不要打断发言。在深深的沉默中，斯大林站了起来，他满脸天花的表情表现出最彻底的冷漠，发表了，或者更确切地说，背诵了题为“共产党人在格鲁吉亚和外高加索的当前任务”的演讲。斯大林坚持三个高加索国家本土爱国主义的狭隘视野。这是一种过时的现象，对于国际共产主义这一伟大共同目标的成功来说是危险的。他强调需要采取一切手段镇压任何民族主义起义并铲除其根源。

On July 6, 1921, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Georgia in Tiflis called a new meeting for the next day at eleven o'clock in the morning. The presidency is entrusted this time to the distinguished Nestor Lakoba, who has a higher spirit and a more pleasant appearance than this bald bearded man of Philippe Makharadzé. With a smile as friendly as it is disarming, Lakoba announces that Comrade Stalin is going to deliver a very interesting speech on which he has been working for several days. So dear comrades are asked not to interrupt the speaker. In profound silence, Stalin rose and, his face marked by smallpox expressing the most complete coldness, delivered, or rather recited his speech entitled "The immediate tasks of the Communists in Georgia and Transcaucasia." Stalin insists on the narrowness of sight of the local patriotism of the three Caucasian countries. It is an obsolete phenomenon, dangerous for the success of the great common objective: international communism. He stresses the need to crush any nationalist uprising and to root out its roots by all means.

演讲者讲了将近一个小时。当他完成时，工厂的警报声响起，宣布中午，午餐时间。每个人都走向出口，拿走他们从家里带来的零食和一瓶茶或咖啡。没有人愿意问问题。这次会议的安排和时间安排得非常巧妙。

The speaker speaks for almost an hour. When he finished, the factory siren sounded announcing noon, lunchtime. Everyone heads for the exit to take their snack and the bottle of tea or coffee they brought from home. Nobody cares to ask questions. The meeting was skilfully set up and timed.
