Beria lights a cigarette, removes her pince-nez, blows on the glasses and wipes them with her handkerchief. He rings the orderly and asks him for tea. Naturally, he must prepare the request immediately and send it by express first thing in the morning the next day. But Lavrenti always prefers to think several times and consider the motives that justify the events. He tries to find out where the wind comes from: “  Kouda veter douïet  ”.

叶努基泽是斯大林最亲密的朋友之一，甚至希望他在1926年进入政治局。与“索索”结婚。叶努基泽也是老布尔什维克谢尔戈·阿利卢耶夫的密友。叶努基泽是斯大林心爱的孙女斯维特兰娜的偶像。他对她来说比她自己的父亲更亲爱，而她的父亲常常让她害怕。她称叶努基泽为“阿维尔叔叔”，并一直恳求他讲述生活在高加索山脉的巨人的精彩传说。每当斯大林带着妻儿来索契度假时，几乎已经是一家人的“阿维尔叔叔”就陪伴在身边。

Yenukidze is one of Stalin's dearest friends who even wanted him to enter the Politburo in 1926. married “Soso”. Yenukidze is also the close friend of the old Bolshevik Sergo Allilouïev. Yenukidze is the idol of Svetlana, Stalin's beloved granddaughter. He is dearer to her than her own father who, too often, frightens her. She calls Yenukidze "Uncle Avel" and begs him all the time to tell the wonderful legends of the giants who lived in the Caucasus mountains. Whenever Stalin comes to vacation in Sochi with his wife and children, "Uncle Avel", who is almost part of the family, accompanies them.

叶努基泽现居莫斯科，与斯大林和“亲爱的谢尔戈”奥尔忠尼启则组成了克里姆林宫的格鲁吉亚三人组。

Yenukidze lives in Moscow, forming with Stalin and the "dear Sergo" Ordzhonikidze the Georgian trio of the Kremlin.

现在，叶努基泽正准备以外高加索共和国的强大总统的身份来到第比利斯。斯大林最好的朋友似乎即将成为他在外高加索的全权代表。这可能会导致贝利亚被边缘化，叶努基泽、已故的纳德日达和她的女儿斯维特兰娜都不欣赏贝利亚。如果叶努基泽返回祖国高加索，他肯定会击退迄今为止被视为斯大林二号人物的贝利亚。乍一看，情况似乎很危险。这需要反思。斯大林驱逐贝利亚能得到什么好处？拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇（Lavrenty Pavlovich）是斯大林政策的一个很好的工具，以至于很难相信，至少在目前，有可能找到一个更有用的人。除了，阿维尔·索夫罗诺维奇 (Avel Sofronovitch) 被誉为艺术的保护者和敏感的人，对他所认识的人充满理解。他喜欢帮助他的朋友。对于布尔什维克来说，他有一颗柔软的心。大家都知道，他帮助著名共产党员的亲属被捕并被驱逐到西伯利亚。然而，斯大林从不相信基于温柔和理解的权威。恰恰相反，他实行铁腕统治，并不太希望把在民族感情仍然占主导地位的外高加索的责任交给叶努基泽。另一方面，阿维尔不仅是“索索”的亲密朋友，也是斯大林从革命前就开始的合作者和青年同志。对他个人认识的人充满理解。他喜欢帮助他的朋友。对于布尔什维克来说，他有一颗柔软的心。大家都知道，他帮助著名共产党员的亲属被捕并被驱逐到西伯利亚。然而，斯大林从不相信基于温柔和理解的权威。恰恰相反，他实行铁腕统治，并不太希望把在民族感情仍然占主导地位的外高加索的责任交给叶努基泽。另一方面，阿维尔不仅是“索索”的亲密朋友，也是斯大林从革命前就开始的合作者和青年同志。对他个人认识的人充满理解。他喜欢帮助他的朋友。对于布尔什维克来说，他有一颗柔软的心。大家都知道，他帮助著名共产党员的亲属被捕并被驱逐到西伯利亚。然而，斯大林从不相信基于温柔和理解的权威。恰恰相反，他实行铁腕统治，并不太希望把在民族感情仍然占主导地位的外高加索的责任交给叶努基泽。另一方面，阿维尔不仅是“索索”的亲密朋友，也是斯大林从革命前就开始的合作者和青年同志。大家都知道，他帮助著名共产党员的亲属被捕并被驱逐到西伯利亚。然而，斯大林从不相信基于温柔和理解的权威。恰恰相反，他实行铁腕统治，并不太希望把在民族感情仍然占主导地位的外高加索的责任交给叶努基泽。另一方面，阿维尔不仅是“索索”的亲密朋友，也是斯大林从革命前就开始的合作者和青年同志。大家都知道，他帮助著名共产党员的亲属被捕并被驱逐到西伯利亚。然而，斯大林从不相信基于温柔和理解的权威。恰恰相反，他实行铁腕统治，并不太希望把在民族感情仍然占主导地位的外高加索的责任交给叶努基泽。另一方面，阿维尔不仅是“索索”的亲密朋友，也是斯大林从革命前就开始的合作者和青年同志。他实行铁腕统治，并不太愿意让叶努基泽在民族感情仍然占主导地位的外高加索地区担任职务。另一方面，阿维尔不仅是“索索”的亲密朋友，也是斯大林从革命前就开始的合作者和青年同志。他实行铁腕统治，并不太愿意让叶努基泽在民族感情仍然占主导地位的外高加索地区担任职务。另一方面，阿维尔不仅是“索索”的亲密朋友，也是斯大林从革命前就开始的合作者和青年同志。

And now Yenukidze is preparing to come to Tiflis as a powerful president of the republics of Transcaucasia. It seems that Stalin's best friend is on the way to becoming his plenipotentiary delegate in Transcaucasia. This runs the risk of causing Beria to be sidelined, whom neither Yenukidze, nor the late Nadezhda, nor her daughter Svetlana appreciate. If Yenukidze returns to his native Caucasus, he will certainly repel Beria who, up to now, was considered Stalin's second in command. At first glance, the situation seems dangerous. It requires reflection. What would Stalin gain by dislodging Beria? Lavrenty Pavlovich is such a good instrument of Stalin's policy that it is hard to believe, at least for the moment, that it is possible to find someone more useful. Besides, Avel Sofronovitch is known to be a protector of the arts and a sensitive man, full of understanding for the people he knows personally. He likes to help his friends. He has a soft heart, as far as that is possible for a Bolshevik. Everyone knows that he helped the relatives of prominent Communists arrested and deported to Siberia. Stalin, however, never believed in an authority based on gentleness and understanding. Quite the contrary, he governed with an iron fist and could not really wish to entrust Yenukidze with a post of responsibility in Transcaucasia where national feelings still dominated. On the other hand, Avel is not only the close friend of “Soso”, he is also the collaborator and the comrade of youth of Stalin, since before the revolution. full of understanding for the people he knows personally. He likes to help his friends. He has a soft heart, as far as that is possible for a Bolshevik. Everyone knows that he helped the relatives of prominent Communists arrested and deported to Siberia. Stalin, however, never believed in an authority based on gentleness and understanding. Quite the contrary, he governed with an iron fist and could not really wish to entrust Yenukidze with a post of responsibility in Transcaucasia where national feelings still dominated. On the other hand, Avel is not only the close friend of “Soso”, he is also the collaborator and the comrade of youth of Stalin, since before the revolution. full of understanding for the people he knows personally. He likes to help his friends. He has a soft heart, as far as that is possible for a Bolshevik. Everyone knows that he helped the relatives of prominent Communists arrested and deported to Siberia. Stalin, however, never believed in an authority based on gentleness and understanding. Quite the contrary, he governed with an iron fist and could not really wish to entrust Yenukidze with a post of responsibility in Transcaucasia where national feelings still dominated. On the other hand, Avel is not only the close friend of “Soso”, he is also the collaborator and the comrade of youth of Stalin, since before the revolution. Everyone knows that he helped the relatives of prominent Communists arrested and deported to Siberia. Stalin, however, never believed in an authority based on gentleness and understanding. Quite the contrary, he governed with an iron fist and could not really wish to entrust Yenukidze with a post of responsibility in Transcaucasia where national feelings still dominated. On the other hand, Avel is not only the close friend of “Soso”, he is also the collaborator and the comrade of youth of Stalin, since before the revolution. Everyone knows that he helped the relatives of prominent Communists arrested and deported to Siberia. Stalin, however, never believed in an authority based on gentleness and understanding. Quite the contrary, he governed with an iron fist and could not really wish to entrust Yenukidze with a post of responsibility in Transcaucasia where national feelings still dominated. On the other hand, Avel is not only the close friend of “Soso”, he is also the collaborator and the comrade of youth of Stalin, since before the revolution. he governed with an iron fist and could not really wish to entrust Yenukidze with a post of responsibility in Transcaucasia where national feelings still dominated. On the other hand, Avel is not only the close friend of “Soso”, he is also the collaborator and the comrade of youth of Stalin, since before the revolution. he governed with an iron fist and could not really wish to entrust Yenukidze with a post of responsibility in Transcaucasia where national feelings still dominated. On the other hand, Avel is not only the close friend of “Soso”, he is also the collaborator and the comrade of youth of Stalin, since before the revolution.

Minoutochkou “分钟！俄罗斯有句谚语说。基洛夫的神秘刺杀应该向斯大林的老同志和合作者表明，他们不再完全受到欢迎。此外，即使是像外高加索共和国总统这样高的职位，也可能与晋升有很大不同，因为它将叶努基泽从克里姆林宫中除名，叶努基泽在中央执行委员会中实际上坐在独裁者的右边。

Minoutochkou “minute! says the Russian proverb. The more than mysterious assassination of Kirov should indicate to Stalin's old comrades and collaborators that they are no longer entirely welcome. Moreover, even a position as high as that of president of the republics of Transcaucasia could be something quite different from a promotion insofar as it removes from the Kremlin a Yenukidze who, in the Central Executive Committee, sits practically to the right of the dictator.

在莫斯科打来电话之前，贝利亚完成了关于他正在采访的人的报告，并将其收进抽屉里。然后他站起来，走到保险箱前，拿出叶努基泽的文件。格鲁吉亚安全部门负责人已将其设置为个人使用，并保留以备不时之需。

Beria finishes the report on the man he was interviewing before the phone call from Moscow and puts it away in a drawer. Then he gets up, walks to the safe and pulls out Yenukidze's file. The head of the Georgian Security has set it up for his personal use and keeps it in reserve for any eventuality.

贝利亚在这里有非常详细的传记：叶努基泽，阿维尔·索夫罗诺维奇，1877 年 5 月 7 日出生于佐治亚州库塔伊西附近的查基迪西地区拉斯特查村；1898年加入共产党。笔名：Avel、Abdoul、Zolotaïa Rebka（“金鱼”）；1897年至1900年，外高加索铁路机械工，后任助理机车工程师；在巴库，组织地下运动和党支部；创立了SD（社会民主党组织）；还在巴库创建了非法的尼娜印刷厂并管理至 1906 年；直到 1914 年，他一直是外高加索地区最活跃的布尔什维克之一，随后他前往顿河，在那里继续他的政治活动，然后前往莫斯科和彼得格勒；被奥克拉纳逮捕1914年10月被流放到西伯利亚；1916年应征入伍。

Beria has a very detailed biography here: Yenukidze, Avel Sofronovitch, born May 7, 1877 in the village of Raststcha, Tsakidisi region near Kutaisi, Georgia; joined the Communist Party in 1898; pseudonyms: Avel, Abdoul, Zolotaïa Rebka (“golden fish”); from 1897 to 1900, mechanic worker on the Transcaucasian railways, then assistant locomotive engineer; in Baku, organizes the underground movement and Party cells; founded the SD, Social Democratic Organization; also creates the illegal Nina printing press in Baku and manages it until 1906; one of the most active Bolsheviks in Transcaucasia until 1914, when he left for the Don, where he continued his political activities, then for Moscow and Petrograd; arrested by the Okhranain October 1914 and exiled to Siberia; drafted into the army in 1916.

1917 年 2 月彼得格勒革命期间，阿维尔·叶努基泽参加了士兵起义，并与共产党人并肩作战。在第一次苏维埃代表大会上，他当选为中央委员。1917年，他成为彼得格勒苏维埃党执行委员会委员。他在党内积极参战，在伟大的十月革命中进行斗争。革命后，叶努基泽任全俄苏维埃中央执行委员会书记、中央党委委员。

During the February 1917 revolution in Petrograd, Avel Yenukidze took part in the soldiers' uprising and fought in the streets alongside the Communists. At the first congress of the soviets, he was elected to the central committee. In 1917, he became a member of the Petrograd Soviet for the Party's Executive Committee. He actively militates in the Party and fights during the great October revolution. After the revolution, Yenukidze became secretary of the All-Russian Central Executive Committee of Soviets and a member of the Central Party Committee.

贝利亚翻阅了文件，在按时间顺序提交的其他文件中发现了一份最近的新闻剪报。这是一封致编辑的公开信，于1935年1月16日发表在政府报纸《真理报》上。叶努基泽在这篇文章中批评并纠正了一些老布尔什维克，他们在回忆录中重述了外高加索非法亲共活动的历史，犯了一些错误或扭曲。对此必须坚决予以谴责。这次，叶努基泽承认自己也犯了一些错误，特别是他允许在《伟大的苏联百科全书》专门为他写的告示中发表这一错误。断言他，阿维尔·索夫罗诺维奇·叶努基泽，领导了巴库的地下行动。事实是，或者至少应该是大家都知道，当时这场运动的领导人是斯大林同志。

Leafing through the file, Beria discovers, among other documents filed in chronological order, a recent press clipping. It is an open letter to the editor, published in the government newspaper Pravda on January 16, 1935. In this article Yenukidze criticizes and corrects some old Bolsheviks who, by recounting in their memoirs the history of illegal pro-Communist activities of Transcaucasia, have made several errors or distortions. This must be denounced without detour. On this occasion, Yenukidze recognizes that he too made some errors, particularly when he allowed publication in the notice devoted to him by the Great Soviet Encyclopediathe assertion that he, Avel Sofronovitch Yenukidze, had led the underground action in Baku. It is, or at least it should be known to everyone, that the leader of the movement at the time was Comrade Stalin.

这句话安抚了贝利亚。现在，他清楚地知道如何看待分配给他未来的上司、外高加索共和国指定总统的新职能。老派布尔什维克很清楚，斯大林参加革命运动与秘密工人和列宁的其他同伙相比毫无意义。在格鲁吉亚和阿塞拜疆，它的意义就更小了，那里的奥尔忠尼启则、米高扬、叶努启则和已故的基洛夫比科巴同志更活跃。现在最重要的证人之一基洛夫已经去世。叶努基泽最近的任命似乎是他终结的前奏。

This statement soothes Beria. Now he knows exactly what to think of the new functions assigned to his future superior, the designated president of the republics of Transcaucasia. The Bolsheviks of the old guard know well that Stalin's participation in the revolutionary movement means nothing in comparison with that of the clandestine workers and other associates of Lenin. It has even less significance in Georgia and Azerbaijan where Ordzhonikidze, Mikoyan, Yenukidze and the late Kirov were more active than comrade Koba. Now Kirov, one of the most important witnesses, is dead. Yenukidze's recent appointment seems to be a prelude to his end.

贝利亚用他最好的笔向苏联中央执行委员会写了一份谦卑的请求，请求允许格鲁吉亚亲爱的儿子阿维尔·索夫罗诺维奇·叶努基泽同志当选外高加索联邦共和国总统。

With his finest pen, Beria wrote a humble request to the Central Executive Committee of the USSR, asking that comrade Avel Sofronovitch Yenukidze, that dear son of Georgia, be allowed to be elected President of the Federative Republics of Transcaucasia.

这封信太重要了，不能由秘书打印。拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇命令勤务兵把打字机带到他的办公室，他自己复印了文件。他将副本放入叶努基泽的档案中，并将其全部锁在保险箱中。他将复写纸揉皱，扔进灰烬中，并用余烬覆盖。他用打火机里的汽油清洁了机器的滚筒，然后命令士兵把仪器带回来。

The letter is too important to be typed by a secretary. Lavrenti Pavlovich orders the orderly to bring the typewriter to his office and he copies the document himself. He places the copy in Yenukidze's file and locks it all in the safe. He crumples the carbon paper, throws it in the ashes and covers it with embers. He cleans the roller of the machine with the gasoline he uses in his lighter, then he orders the soldier to bring the instrument back.

共产党外高加索地区委员会第一书记的愿望得到了实现。三月初一个寒冷的早晨，阿维尔·叶努基泽（Avel Yenukidze），一个身材高大的金发男子，在第比利斯车站从普尔曼汽车上下来。贝利亚和几位委员以格鲁吉亚典型的热情欢迎他，同时也表达了对这位未来的国家总统的尊重。拉夫伦蒂特别热情、热切，同时又很有仪式感，这很适合下属。如果这位可敬的人物最终成为一位卓有成效的总统，贝利亚将能够解释甚至证明这个想法是他的，是他自己建议的结果。

The wish expressed by the first secretary of the Territorial Committee of Transcaucasia of the Communist Party is granted. On a cold morning in early March, Avel Yenukidze, a tall blond man, gets out of a Pullman car at Tiflis station. Beria and several commissioners welcomed him warmly, with the cordiality so typically Georgian, but also with all the respect due to the future president of their country. Lavrenti is particularly cordial and eager, at the same time ceremonial, as befits a subordinate. If this honorable personality turned out to be an effective president, Beria would be able to explain and even prove that the idea was his, that it was the consequence of his own suggestion.

在等待任命期间，叶努基泽利用他在格鲁吉亚首都的机会发出邀请或回应最有影响力的公民的邀请，或者前往贝利亚为他预订的旅馆的剧院和歌剧院。但拉夫伦蒂推迟了选举日期，等待大老板的新指示。终于，在五月的最后几天，经过几周的等待，克里姆林宫传来了消息。斯大林同志任命他的朋友阿维尔担任格鲁吉亚医院院长。受到蔑视和嘲笑，叶努基泽于同一天离开第比利斯前往莫斯科。

While waiting for his appointment, Yenukidze takes advantage of his presence in the capital of Georgia to extend invitations or to respond to invitations from the most influential citizens, or to go to the theater and the opera where Beria has booked him a lodge. But Lavrenti delays the date of the election, awaiting new instructions from the big boss. Finally, in the last days of May, after a few weeks of waiting, a message arrived from the Kremlin. Comrade Stalin appoints his friend Avel director of hospitals in Georgia. Scorned and ridiculed, Yenukidze left Tiflis for Moscow the same day.

拉夫连季明白，这一任命意味着老布尔什维克的最终垮台。

Lavrenti understands that this appointment spells the final downfall of the old Bolshevik.

贝利亚的结论是，现在是时候向这位著名的格鲁吉亚共产党人发起攻击，他是“索索”的前密友，现在却背弃了他。拉夫连季越早攻击叶诺基泽，越早证明他是第一个批评他的人，就越好。这将确保斯大林对他的青睐。然而，在他斥责叶努基泽给其他作家的错误和扭曲打上烙印的同时，对这些人进行污名化也是有道理的。贝利亚决定按照他的意图，沉没一些回忆录和文章的作者，如马米亚·奥拉赫拉什维利和菲利普·马哈拉泽，但暂时不用让塞尔戈·奥尔琼尼启则担心。奥拉赫拉什维利曾任外高加索委员会主席。他比斯大林年长，是最早的革命先驱之一。他在与斯大林共同活动之初就结识了，并写下了《外高加索共产主义运动史。因此，他与前人民委员会主席菲利普·马哈拉泽（Philippe Makharadzé）一样，都是研究高加索革命的历史学家之一，也是《外高加索的1905年》一书的作者。和其他作品。叶努基泽、奥拉赫拉什维利和马哈拉泽这三人在回忆录中回顾高加索地区共产主义斗争、非法印刷机和地下报刊的历史时，只把斯大林描绘成一个二流的活动家，没有特别的影响力。显然，这些人与斯大林合作了足够长的时间来了解此事的真相。这当然是犯罪。贝利亚决定为斯大林过去​​三十五年在高加索的成就写一个完全不同的新版本。他需要一点自由来创建自己的版本，以取悦大同志。不应该留下任何有争议的作品，也不应该留下斯大林真实活动的证据。

Beria concludes that the time has come to strike and throw the first stone at the prominent Georgian communist, a former close friend of “Soso” who now turns his back on him. The sooner Lavrenty attacks Yenokidze and the sooner he can establish that he was the first to criticize him, the better. This will ensure Stalin's favor for him. However, at the same time as he anathematizes Yenukidze for branding other writers for their errors and distortions, it would make sense to stigmatize these as well. Beria decides to sink a few authors of memoirs and articles like Mamia Orakhelashvili and Philippe Makharadze, as he had intended, but not to worry Sergo Ordjonikidze for the moment. Orakhelashvili had been chairman of the Council of Commissars of Transcaucasia. He is older than Stalin and one of the first pioneers of the revolution. He got acquainted with Stalin at the very beginning of their joint activities and wrote theHistory of the Communist Movement in Transcaucasia . He is therefore, with Philippe Makharadzé, former president of the Council of People's Commissars, one of the historians of the revolution in the Caucasus, author of The Year 1905 in Transcaucasiaand other works. All three, Yenukidze, Orakhelashvili and Makharadze, when they retraced in their memoirs the history of the communist struggles in the Caucasus, of the illegal printing presses and of the underground press, presented Stalin only as a second-rate activist, without particular influence. It is obvious that these men collaborated long enough with Stalin to know the truth on the matter. It's a crime, of course. Beria decides to write a new and entirely different version of Stalin's achievements in the Caucasus over the past thirty-five years. He needs a bit of free reign to create his own version intended to please the big comrade. There should be no controversial works left, no evidence of Stalin's real activity.

显然，叶努基泽和斯大林的这两位老同志已经不再受“索索”的青睐了。拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇必须扮演这个角色。在他正在写的书的草稿中，贝利亚添加了这样一段话：

It is clear that Yenukidze and these two old comrades of Stalin are falling out of favor with “Soso”. Lavrenty Pavlovich must play this asset. In the draft of the book he is writing, Beria adds this paragraph:

对于阿维尔·叶努基泽、马米亚·奥拉赫拉什维利和菲利普·马哈拉泽所描述的外高加索布尔什维克的斗争，应该指出的是，他们犯了一些历史上重大的错误和歪曲。这种有意识地、蓄意地篡改事实和事件，对党的真相和历史造成了严重损害。

With regard to the struggle of the Transcaucasian Bolsheviks as described by Avel Yenukidze, Mamia Orakhelashvili and Philip Makharadze, it should be noted that they committed certain historically significant errors and distortions. This conscious and deliberate alteration of facts and events causes serious harm to the truth and history of the Party.

评级

Ratings

17 . 亚历山大·奥尔洛夫，《斯大林罪行秘史》，纽约，1953 年。

17 . Alexander Orlov, The Secret History of Stalin's Crimes , New York, 1953.

第22章

Chapter 22

让我们弥补过去

Let's make up the past

1935 年 7 月 21 日至 22 日，贝利亚在第比利斯召开了一次党的工作人员大型会议。一个炎热而沉重的早晨，在铁路修理厂里，外高加索领土委员会第一书记走上讲台，开始以讲座的形式宣读他的文章：

On July 21 and 22, 1935, Beria called a massive meeting of Party functionaries in Tiflis. One hot, heavy morning in the railway repair shop, the first secretary of the Territorial Committee of Transcaucasia ascends the rostrum and begins to read his essay in the form of a lecture:

同志们！

Comrades!

学习和了解我们党的历史，是对我们党员和共青团员进行马克思列宁主义教育的重要手段。

The study and understanding of the history of our Party constitute essential means for the Marxist-Leninist education of the members of our Party and of the Young Communist League.

斯大林同志在他的历史文章《关于布尔什维主义历史的一些问题》中，提请党组织注意“……把布尔什维主义历史问题提高到适当的高度，指导历史研究”。以科学的、布尔什维克的方式来认识我们党，并通过系统地撕掉他们的面具，将注意力转向托洛茨基主义者和其他篡改我们党历史的人。»

Comrade Stalin, in his historical article About Some Problems of the History of Bolshevism , drew the attention of Party organizations to the need "...to raise the problems of the history of Bolshevism to the proper height, to direct the study of the history of our Party in a scientific, Bolshevik way, and to direct the attention against the Trotskyist and other falsifiers of the history of our Party, by systematically tearing off their masks. »

这个任务要求把党史教学、党史反党集团及其反对党路线的方法的研究提高到适当的高度。

This task demands that the teaching of Party history, the study of anti-Party groups in our Party's history and their methods of fighting the Party line, be raised to the proper height.

这项任务要求党员不仅要知道党如何与立宪民主党（立宪民主党）、社会革命党、孟什维克和无政府主义者作斗争并取而代之，而且要知道党如何与托洛茨基主义者、“民主集中派”、“民主集中派”、“民主集中派”等作斗争并取缔。工人阶级反对派”、季诺维也夫主义者、右派、右倾和左倾等。

This task requires that Party members know not only how the Party fought and supplanted the Constitutional-Democrats (Cadets), Socialist-Revolutionaries, Mensheviks and Anarchists, but also how the Party fought and supplanted the Trotskyists, the “democratic centralists”, the “working class opposition”, the Zinovievists, the rightists, the right and left deviationists, etc.

为了将布尔什维克的警惕性提高到理想的高度，并武装共产党人来对抗我们党的一切敌人，每个党员都必须了解列宁和斯大林的政党创建的英雄经历，并且知道如何这个党战斗了。他不仅需要了解和理解党的成功和胜利，而且还需要了解党在与列宁主义敌人的斗争中如何赢得这些成功和胜利。

To raise Bolshevik vigilance to the desired height and to arm the Communists against all the enemies of our Party, it is necessary that each member of the Party know the heroic experience by which the party of Lenin and Stalin was created and that he know how this Party fought. He needs to know and understand not only the successes and victories of the Party, but also how they were won by the Party in the struggle against the enemies of Leninism.

今天，随着社会主义的胜利，随着最广大劳动人民文化和政治的伟大进步，随着敌人和被征服阶级的幸存者的反抗的加剧，必须提高马克思主义的理论水平。列宁主义训练无论如何，首先是我们党的布尔什维克历史的知识水平。

Today, with the victory of socialism, with the great cultural and political progress of the broadest masses of the working people and with the intensification of the resistance of the survivors of the enemy and vanquished classes, it is essential to raise the level of Marxist-Leninist training by all means, and first and foremost the level of knowledge of the Bolshevik history of our Party.

研究党的历史不应局限于干巴巴地描述布尔什维主义英雄历史的事件和事实，而应解释国家的经济和社会状况，全面了解其多样性和复杂性。革命前俄罗斯的阶级斗争，以及被压迫民族在工人阶级及其布尔什维克党领导下争取民族解放的斗争。

The study of the history of the Party should not be limited to a dry description of the events and facts of the heroic history of Bolshevism, but should explain the economic and social situation of the country, give a full picture of the multiplicity and the complexity of the class struggle in pre-revolutionary Russia, as well as the struggle of the oppressed nations for their national emancipation under the leadership of the working class and its Bolshevik party.

党的历史必须以马克思主义的方式来解释我们党与党内和工人阶级中的反布尔什维克倾向和派系的斗争历史，并表明这一斗争的资本和原则的重要性。为列宁主义而战。

The history of the Party must be exposed in such a way as to provide a Marxist explanation of the history of our Party's struggle against anti-Bolshevik tendencies and factions within the Party and the working class, and to demonstrate the importance capital and principle of this fight for Leninism.

今天，我们需要党员和共青团员更加认真地学习，更加深入地了解布尔什维主义的历史，党与一切偏颇和一切反列宁主义倾向的斗争的历史，关于布尔什维主义的具体历史。列宁和斯大林的政党的运作情况。

What we need today is for the members of the Party and the Young Communist League to study more seriously and acquire a deeper knowledge of the history of Bolshevism, the history of the Party's struggle against all deviations and all anti-Leninist tendencies, of the concrete situation in which the party of Lenin and Stalin operates.

我们需要研究党的历史，以确保吸收布尔什维克反对列宁主义的许多敌人的斗争的英雄经验，并使党员和共产主义青年团的成员能够与党的敌人作战，与列宁主义的敌人进行斗争。一切被击败的反革命分子、一切反党团体的思想和观点的最后追随者。

We need a study of Party history which ensures the assimilation of the heroic experience of the struggle of the Bolsheviks against the many enemies of Leninism and which equips the members of the Party and of the Young Communist League to fight the enemies of Party, to fight the last followers of the ideas and views of all defeated counter-revolutionaries, of all anti-Party groups.

近年来，外高加索党组织在宣传学习党史方面做了大量工作。但我们在这方面的成就显然还不够。我们在对待布尔什维克、研究外高加索和格鲁吉亚布尔什维克组织、研究外高加索布尔什维克为列宁和斯大林事业而进行的斗争方面尤其落后。

In recent years, the Party organizations of Transcaucasia have done considerable work in disseminating and studying the Party's history. But our achievements in this area are clearly inadequate. We are particularly behind in the Bolshevik treatment and in the study of the Bolshevik organizations of Transcaucasia and Georgia, in the study of the struggle of the Transcaucasian Bolsheviks for the cause of Lenin and Stalin .

外高加索的布尔什维克在我们党的领导人斯大林同志的直接领导下进行了几十年的建设列宁主义政党的斗争中，获得了丰富的历史经验。

The Bolsheviks of Transcaucasia have acquired enormous historical experience in the struggle to build the Leninist Party, a struggle which has been going on for decades under the direct leadership of the leader of our Party, Comrade Stalin.

外高加索布尔什维克组织的整个历史，以及外高加索和格鲁吉亚整个革命运动的整个历史，从一开始就与斯大林同志的工作和名字密不可分。

The whole history of the Bolshevik organizations in Transcaucasia and the whole revolutionary movement in Transcaucasia and Georgia is inseparable from the very beginning from the work and name of Comrade Stalin.

这些话引起了分散在人群中的许多贝利亚特工的长时间掌声。

These words are greeted with long applause aroused and organized by the many Beria agents dispersed in the crowd.

当“自发”的掌声平息后，演讲者继续讲话，但这一次他对布尔什维克老兵发起了精心准备的攻击：

When the "spontaneous" ovation dies down, the speaker resumes, but this time he launches the carefully prepared attack on the Bolshevik veterans:

格鲁吉亚共产党第九次代表大会和外高加索共产主义组织第七次代表大会特别关注处理和研究外高加索和格鲁吉亚共产主义组织历史的问题。

The Ninth Congress of the Communist Party of Georgia and the Seventh Congress of Communist Organizations of Transcaucasia paid special attention to the problems of treatment and study of the history of communist organizations of Transcaucasia and Georgia.

某些共产主义历史学家的著作中出现的错误和歪曲在这些代表大会上受到了严厉的批评。

The errors and distortions which appear in the works of certain communist historians have been severely criticized during these congresses.

格鲁吉亚共产党第九次代表大会在其决议中作出如下指示：

In its resolutions, the Ninth Congress of the Communist Party of Georgia gave the following instructions:

“注意到一些共产主义历史学家的著作中出现的对党的历史以及格鲁吉亚和外高加索革命运动的歪曲，大会认为格鲁吉亚所有党组织有必要不断努力伪造布尔什维克主义的历史。»

"Noting the distortions of the history of the Party and of the revolutionary movement in Georgia and Transcaucasia which appear in the works of a number of Communist historians, the Congress considers it necessary for all Party organizations in Georgia to pay ever-increasing to attempts to falsify the history of Bolshevism. »

大会后，我们的组织改进了收集和阐述与布尔什维克组织和外高加索革命运动历史有关的材料的方法。

After the Congress, our organizations improved their method of collecting and elaborating materials relating to the history of Bolshevik organizations and the revolutionary movement in Transcaucasia.

然而，所做的仍然很少。仍有大量数据和文件有待收集。

However, what has been done is still very little . There is still a large amount of data and documents to be collected.

苏共中央马克思恩格斯列宁研究所第比利斯分部18 ( B) 19尚未发现自己能够收集有关党组织和革命运动历史的文件和数据在外高加索地区；他也没有发表任何关于这个主题的原创作品。

The Tbilisi branch 18 of the Marx-Engels-Lenin Institute of the Central Committee of the CPSU (B) 19 has not yet found itself in a position to produce a collection of documents and data relating to the history of Party organizations and the revolutionary movement in Transcaucasia; nor did he publish a single original work on the subject.

贝利亚用一段令人印象深刻、戏剧性的长停顿打断了他的阅读。然后，他拿起手稿，猛烈抨击高加索的三位老布尔什维克，叶努基泽、奥拉赫拉什维利和马哈拉泽，因为他们在著作中犯下了对历史特别重要的歪曲和错误，以及他们忽视了修改和修改。纠正他们的工作。他追求：

Beria interrupts his reading with a long, impressive, dramatic pause. He then takes up his manuscript and thunders against the three old Bolsheviks of the Caucasus, Yenukidze, Orakhelashvili and Makharadze, because of distortions and errors, particularly important for history, which they committed in their writings, as well as for their neglect to revise and rectify their work. He pursues :

党员、劳动委员会委员、 20名党外工人和集体农庄农民对布尔什维克组织和外高加索革命运动的研究表现出了浓厚的兴趣。党组织敦促我们获取正确反映党组织历史的文献。

Members of the Party and the LJC , 20 non-Party workers and collective farm farmers showed considerable interest in the study of Bolshevik organizations and the revolutionary movement in Transcaucasia. Party organizations urge us to obtain documentation that correctly presents the history of our Party organizations.

自外高加索共产党组织第七次代表大会和格鲁吉亚共产党第九次代表大会以来，我们已经收集了一些有关我们党的组织历史的资料和文件。

Since the Seventh Congress of Communist Organizations of Transcaucasia and since the Ninth Congress of the Communist Party of Georgia, we have already collected some data and documents relating to the history of the organizations of our Party.

苏共（布）外高加索地区委员会和格鲁吉亚共产党中央委员会指示我根据这些数据和这些文件澄清有关外高加索和格鲁吉亚布尔什维克组织历史的事实和事件的某些问题。

The Territorial Committee of Transcaucasia of the CPSU (B) and the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Georgia instructed me to clarify certain questions of facts and events concerning the history of Bolshevik organizations in Transcaucasia and Georgia on the basis of these data and these documents.

由于该党外高加索领土委员会主席以及格鲁吉亚共产党中央委员会主席都是发言者本人，因此贝利亚发言的澄清任务也就由他本人承担。甚至拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚。

Since the head of the Transcaucasian Territorial Committee of the Party, as well as that of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Georgia are none other than the speaker himself, the mission of clarification of which Beria speaks is therefore addressed to himself by himself. even Lavrenti Pavlovich Beria.

简介已完成。演讲者可以触及问题的核心：精心捏造和阐述的事实，以创造对伟大领袖的崇拜。

The intro is complete. The speaker can get to the heart of the matter: the facts meticulously invented and elaborated to create the cult of the great leader.

第一章的标题是“1897-1904年外高加索布尔什维克组织的诞生和形成的历史”。在这里，当贝利亚提到臭名昭著的共产主义先驱维克托·库尔纳托夫斯基（Viktor Kournatovsky），“一位有成就且受过教育的马克思主义者”时，贝利亚称他为“无产阶级革命者，列宁至死不渝的追随者”。由于这个人是“列宁的支持者”，贝利亚说道：

The first chapter is entitled “History of the birth and formation of Bolshevik organizations in Transcaucasia, 1897-1904”. Here, when he mentions a notorious pioneer of communism, Viktor Kournatovsky, "accomplished and educated Marxist", Beria calls him "proletarian revolutionary, persevering follower of Lenin until the end of his life". Since this man is a "supporter of Lenin", Beria states:

1900年夏天，流亡结束后，党将库尔纳托夫斯基转移到第比利斯继续那里的革命工作。他一到第比利斯，就与斯大林同志建立了密切的联系，成为他的亲密朋友和合作者。

In the summer of 1900, at the end of its time in exile, the Party transferred Kournatovsky to Tiflis to continue its revolutionary work there. As soon as he arrived in Tiflis, he established close contact with Comrade Stalin and became his close friend and collaborator.

1900年，斯大林仍然是一位默默无闻的活动家，是秘密运动中的一个小齿轮。但既然库尔纳托夫斯基已经去世二十三年了，他已经无法再否认他与斯大林的合作，那么为了塑造现任独裁者的形象而公布这种联系是没有危险的。然后，贝利亚在描述 1904 年末和 1905 年初发生的事件时断言：

In 1900, Stalin was still an obscure activist, a small cog in the clandestine movement. But since Kournatovsky, who has been dead for twenty-three years now, can no longer deny his collaboration with Stalin, there is no danger in publishing this association in order to develop the image of the current dictator. Then, describing the events of late 1904 and early 1905, Beria asserts:

 ……在反对格鲁吉亚“合法马克思主义”、反对诺亚·乔丹尼亚（Noah Jordania）领导的大多数“messameh dassi 21 ”的坚决和不妥协的斗争中，革命的布尔什维克社会民主党组织支持列宁的22 《火星报》它是在斯大林同志的领导下在外高加索形成和发展的。

…in a resolute and uncompromising struggle against Georgian “legal Marxism”, against the majority of “messameh dassi 21  ”, led by Noah Jordania, a revolutionary, Bolshevik social-democratic organization, stands in support of Lenin's Iskra 22 . It takes shape and grows in Transcaucasia under the leadership of Comrade Stalin .

这句话引起了经久不息的掌声。当观众安静下来时，贝利亚继续说道。他现在指责菲利普·马哈拉泽“在他的某些作品中，对‘messameh dassi’的历史进行了错误的描述，并对他的角色和意义做出了错误的估计”。但是，由于马哈拉泽尚未受到斯大林的正式谴责，而且他还可以继续掌权一段时间，拉夫连季总是给他一些“同志”。

Prolonged applause greets these words. When the audience falls silent, Beria resumes. He now accuses Philippe Makharadze of giving, "in a certain number of his works, an incorrect account of the history of 'messameh dassi' and a false estimate of his role and his significance". But, since Makharadze was not yet officially condemned by Stalin and he could remain in power for some time, Lavrenty always gave him some "comrade".

贝利亚翻过一页继续说道：

Beria turns the page and continues:

1900年，在斯大林同志的领导下，第比利斯的四五百名工人庆祝了五一劳动节。他们聚集在盐湖地区城外，手持马克思和恩格斯的肖像，挥舞着革命口号。斯大林同志发表了充满活力的讲话，号召工人阶级反对沙皇和资本家。1900 年 5 月至 7 月，第比利斯的工厂爆发了罢工浪潮。1900年8月，在斯大林同志的领导下，铁路商店和车辆段工人爆发了大罢工……大约有四千人放下了工具。1901 年，第比利斯的工人走上街头进行第一次五一节示威。在斯大林同志和库尔纳托夫斯基同志的领导下，第比利斯社会民主党领导班子针对这次游行，进行了伟大的鼓动，完成了伟大的组织工作……斯大林同志为第比利斯无产阶级的这次五一游行做了巨大的准备工作。在他的倡议下，党的领导小组散发了许多传单。

In 1900, under the leadership of Comrade Stalin, four to five hundred Tiflis workers celebrated May Day. They gather outside the city in the Salt Lake region, carrying portraits of Marx and Engels and brandishing revolutionary slogans. Comrade Stalin delivers a vibrant speech and urges the workers to fight the Tsar and the capitalists. From May to July 1900, a wave of strikes spread through the factories of Tiflis. In August 1900, a major strike by railway stores and depot workers broke out under the leadership of Comrade Stalin… About four thousand men laid down the tool. In 1901, Tiflis workers marched through the streets for their first May Day demonstration. Under the leadership of Comrade Stalin and Kurnatovsky, the leading group of the Tiflis Social-Democrats carried out a great agitation and accomplished a great work of organization in view of this parade… Comrade Stalin did an enormous work of preparation for this May Day demonstration of the Tiflis proletariat. On his initiative, the Party's leading group issued a number of leaflets.

整章就是这样写的。它表明，外高加索的共产主义运动是在斯大林同志几乎完全的领导下发展起来的。

The whole chapter is written in this way. It demonstrates that the communist movement in Transcaucasia is evolving under the almost exclusive leadership of Comrade Stalin.

演说家累了，想休息一下。宣布休息约十分钟。

The orator, tired, wishes to rest. A break of about ten minutes is announced.

休息后，贝利亚继续阐述他刚刚创造的过去。第二章按时间顺序排列，标题为“1905-1907年第一次俄国革命期间外高加索布尔什维克组织的历史”。它是从这一段开始的：

After the break, Beria resumes the exposition of the past that he has just created. The second chapter, in chronological order, is entitled “History of the Bolshevik organizations in Transcaucasia during the period of the first Russian revolution, 1905-1907”. It begins with this paragraph:

1904 年 2 月，斯大林同志逃离西伯利亚回到第比利斯。他重新担任外高加索布尔什维克组织的领导人，组织和指导反对孟什维克的斗争，自他缺席期间举行的第二次党代表大会以来，孟什维克变得特别活跃。

Comrade Stalin returns to Tiflis in February 1904, having escaped from Siberia. He resumed his place at the head of the Bolshevik organizations in Transcaucasia, organizing and directing the struggle against the Mensheviks, who had become particularly active since the second Party Congress which was held during his absence.

紧接着，演讲者透露了这一点：

Immediately afterwards, the speaker reveals this:

在基阿图里，斯大林组织了布尔什维克党农村委员会，从主要积极分子中选出了一批宣传员，并组建了一个特殊的积极分子小组，在基阿图里地区的农民中开展活动……在斯大林同志的倡议下，成立了库泰斯是布尔什维克伊梅雷蒂诺-明格勒利安委员会，领导前库泰斯省的党组织。

In Chiaturi, Stalin organizes a Rural Committee of the Bolshevik Party, chooses a group of propagandists from among the main activist workers and forms a special group of activists to act among the peasants of the Chiaturi region… On the initiative of Comrade Stalin is formed in Kutays a Bolshevik Imeretino-Mingrelian Committee to lead the Party organizations in the former province of Kutays.

斯大林同志组织了一批为库泰斯委员会服务的宣传人员，并为其成员做好党的鼓动工作的准备。

Comrade Stalin organizes a group of propagandists in the service of the Kutays Committee and prepares its members for Party agitation work.

观众可以从这些句子中推断出，如果斯大林没有组织这些团体并为党的鼓动工作做好准备，那么外高加索的布尔什维克组织就永远不会存在。然后，贝利亚宣称：

As the audience can deduce from these sentences, if Stalin had not organized these groups and prepared people for Party agitation work, the Bolshevik organizations in Transcaucasia would never have come into existence. Then Beria proclaims:

1904年11月，斯大林同志前往巴库，加强了召开第三次代表大会的运动，并开展了反对孟什维克的斗争，特别是反对孟什维克中央委员会代表格列博夫（诺斯科夫）的斗争。巴库。

In November 1904, Comrade Stalin went to Baku to intensify the campaign for the meeting of the Third Party Congress and to develop the struggle against the Mensheviks, in particular against the representative of the Menshevik Central Committee, Glebov (Noskov), who then found in Baku.

斯大林同志和高加索布尔什维克猛烈攻击民族主义政党：达吉纳克、联邦主义者、无政府主义者和其他政党。

Comrade Stalin and the Caucasian Bolsheviks ferociously attack the nationalist parties: dajnaks, federalists, anarchists and others.

当然，当贝利亚肯定“斯大林同志猛烈攻击民族主义政党”时，他绝没有批评这位伟大的天才。相反。这里的“猛烈”一词是褒义词，应理解为“有逻辑地、有条理地、有系统地、用铁拳”。听众应该从这个意义上理解它。

Certainly, when he affirms that "comrade Stalin ferociously attacks the nationalist parties", Beria in no way criticizes the great genius. On the contrary. The word “fiercely” is here a compliment that should be understood as “logically, methodically, systematically, with an iron fist”. Listeners are supposed to understand it in that sense.

“……在所有这些运动中，斯大林都发挥着主导作用，”发言人总结道。然后，贝利亚说了几句话之后宣布：

“…in all these campaigns, Stalin plays a leading role,” concludes the speaker. Then, after a few words, Beria declares:

在1905年至1907年第一次革命期间，斯大林同志坚定地遵循列宁的路线。他是布尔什维克和外高加索革命工农的向导和领袖。

During the first revolution of 1905-1907, Comrade Stalin firmly followed Lenin's line. He is the guide and leader of the Bolsheviks and the revolutionary workers and peasants of Transcaucasia .

显然，这些特别强调的词必须受到热烈欢迎。讲师用左手擦了擦额头。这是掌声的信号。分散在人群中的几名特工开始“自发地”拍手。所有的援助都效仿他们的热烈掌声。紧接着，贝利亚透露：

It is obvious that these words, pronounced with particular emphasis, must be welcomed with enthusiasm. The lecturer wipes his forehead with his left hand. This is the signal for applause. Several agents scattered in the crowd began to clap their hands “spontaneously”. All the assistance imitates them in long and sonorous applause. Immediately afterwards, Beria reveals:

外高加索工农革命运动的指导力量、推动力量，是以列宁最忠实的战友斯大林同志为首的布尔什维克组织……

The guiding force, the driving force of the revolutionary movement of the workers and peasants of Transcaucasia is the Bolshevik organization headed by Comrade Stalin, the most faithful and loyal brother in arms of Lenin...

……在1904年至1907年期间，斯大林同志作为外高加索布尔什维克的领袖，作为理论家和组织者完成了大量的工作。他领导并指导了整个布尔什维克报刊的斗争。目前，外高加索地区出版了以下报纸……

… During the period 1904-1907, Comrade Stalin, at the head of the Transcaucasian Bolsheviks, accomplished an enormous amount of work as a theoretician and organizer. He leads and directs the struggle of the entire Bolshevik press. At this time, the following newspapers are published in Transcaucasia…

发言者列出了第比利斯用格鲁吉亚语、俄语和亚美尼亚语出版的七份报纸，以及巴库用相同语言出版的八份报纸，再加上一份土耳其语报纸。根据贝利亚的说法，所有这些都是由斯大林一人同时创立和指导的，而1903年至1905年以这三种语言出版的全高加索党委员会出版物的十二期是在斯大林的帮助下指导的两个同志的。然后，贝利亚继续他的论证，断言：

The speaker listed seven newspapers from Tiflis published in Georgian, Russian and Armenian, and eight newspapers from Baku published in the same languages, plus one newspaper in Turkish. All, according to Beria, were simultaneously founded and directed by Stalin alone, while twelve issues of a publication of the All-Caucasian Committee of the Party, published in these three languages ​​from 1903 to 1905, were directed by Stalin with the help of two comrades. Then, Beria continues his demonstration by asserting:

……斯大林同志不断地提倡和解释党必须做什么来准备武装起义并取得胜利。

… Comrade Stalin constantly advocates and explains what the Party must do to prepare an armed uprising and give it victory.

……斯大林同志坚持必要性，并传播了工人阶级普遍起义的思想。他谴责并污蔑孟什维克领导人。

… Comrade Stalin insists on the necessity and spreads the idea of ​​a general insurrection of the working class. He denounces and stigmatizes the Menshevik leaders.

……斯大林同志论证了无产阶级进行武装革命斗争的必要性，并强调无产阶级在这场斗争中的主要盟友是农民。斯大林同志号召农民在无产阶级的领导下，全力反对沙皇制度。

… Comrade Stalin demonstrates the necessity for the proletariat of an armed revolutionary struggle and underlines that its main ally in this struggle is the peasantry. Comrade Stalin urges the peasants to fight tooth and nail against tsarism under the leadership of the proletariat.

外高加索布尔什维克在斯大林同志的领导下，以列宁主义的精神解决了团结问题。

Under the leadership of Comrade Stalin, the Bolsheviks of Transcaucasia solve the problem of unity in a Leninist spirit.

……斯大林同志证明了布尔什维克关于土地问题的纲领的有效性。

… Comrade Stalin demonstrates the validity of the Bolshevik program for agrarian questions.

……斯大林同志以非凡的逻辑和对原则的非凡忠诚来开展整个理论工作，支持与俄罗斯和国际运动中的机会主义进行不断的斗争……

… Comrade Stalin carries out the entire theoretical work with exceptional logic and remarkable fidelity to principles, supporting an unceasing struggle against opportunism in the Russian and international movement…

贝利亚以一种特别可悲的语气结束了关于“第一次俄国革命期间外高加索布尔什维克组织的历史”的这一长章：

Beria concludes this long chapter on the "History of the Bolshevik organizations in Transcaucasia during the period of the first Russian revolution" with these words, spoken in a particularly pathetic tone:

在第一次革命期间，外高加索的布尔什维克由列宁最好的战友领导，他在外高加索奠定了革命马克思列宁主义的基础，并在那里建立了第一个支持列宁《火星报》的社会组织——民主派：斯大林同志。

During the years of the first revolution, the Bolsheviks of Transcaucasia were led by Lenin's best comrade in arms, the man who laid the foundations of revolutionary Marxism-Leninism in Transcaucasia and founded the first social organizations there- democrats to support Lenin's Iskra : Comrade Stalin.

这句话引起了长时间的掌声。这一次，经纪人不再需要刺激观众。房间里的每个人都高兴地拍手。会议第一部分到此结束，也是会议的第一天。人们可以回家休息了。没有问题或评论。

Long applause greets these words. This time, agents no longer need to stimulate the audience. Everyone in the room claps their hands happily. This is the end of the first part of the conference, as well as the first day of the meeting. People can go home to rest. There are no questions or comments.

第二天，距离预定的九点钟会议还有半小时，第比利斯铁路商店的大厅开始挤满了人。人们各就各位，但和前一天一样，更加随意。他们成对坐着，或者和朋友、邻居、熟人一起坐着。会议第二天，他们认出了分散在人群中的贝利亚特工，并尽量不与他们靠得太近。

The next day, half an hour before the meeting scheduled for nine o'clock, the large hall of the Tbilisi railway store begins to fill up. People take their places, but more haphazardly like the day before. They sit in pairs or in groups of friends, neighbours, acquaintances. On the second day of the meeting, they are able to recognize Beria's agents scattered in the crowd and they try not to get too close to them.

九点整，拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇走上讲台。迎接他的是礼貌的掌声，掌声足够响亮，以至于观众不能被指责对演讲者有敌意。后者从公文包中取出手稿，在右侧页面打开并继续前一天开始的演示。

At nine o'clock sharp, Lavrenti Pavlovich ascends the rostrum. Polite applause greets him, loud enough that the audience cannot be accused of hostility towards the speaker. The latter extracts his manuscript from a briefcase, opens it at the right page and resumes the presentation begun the day before.

第三章。“工人运动反动和复兴时期外高加索布尔什维克组织的历史，1907-1913”。

Chapter three. "History of the Bolshevik organizations in Transcaucasia during the period of reaction and revival of the labor movement, 1907-1913".

现在，贝利亚以干巴巴的声音朗读，面无表情，就像检察官宣读起诉书一样。

Now Beria reads in a dry, dull voice and with the expressionless face of a prosecutor reading an indictment.

斯大林同志大力反对孟什维克与立宪民主党人妥协的选举策略，立宪民主党人想与沙皇和地主分享权力，他们害怕革命胜过反动。

Comrade Stalin vigorously fights the Menshevik electoral tactic of compromise with the Cadets who want to share power with the Tsar and the landlords, and who fear revolution more than reaction.

斯大林同志多次强调反革命自由派资产阶级和孟什维克使工人阶级服从资产阶级政治利益的策略所构成的巨大危险。

On several occasions Comrade Stalin insists on the enormous danger posed by the counter-revolutionary liberal bourgeoisie and the Menshevik tactics of subordinating the working class to the political interests of the bourgeoisie.

……从1907年到1912年期间，巴库布尔什维克党组织在斯大林同志的领导下，在反对孟什维克的斗争中不断壮大，赢得了绝大多数社会民主党工人的支持。

… During the period from 1907 to 1912, the Bolshevik Party organization in Baku, under the leadership of Comrade Stalin, grew in number, strength and vigor in the struggle against the Mensheviks, winning to its cause the vast majority of social democratic workers .

……以斯大林同志为首的巴库布尔什维克委员会包围并占领了孟什维克的每一个阵地。斯大林同志除了在实际组织方面作出了伟大的工作外，在理论和宣传方面也表现出了巨大的活动。

… The Baku Bolshevik Committee, headed by Comrade Stalin, besieges and takes each of the Menshevik positions. Besides a great work of practical organization, Comrade Stalin displays great activity in the field of theory and propaganda.

……斯大林同志揭开了孟什维克中央委员会的面纱，揭露了它的破产。

… Comrade Stalin unmasks the Menshevik Central Committee, revealing its bankruptcy.

……此外，斯大林同志揭示了一个不可避免的规律：所有机会主义集团和集团，从右翼孟什维克取消派到托洛茨基主义者，都不断寻求联合。他将托洛茨基主义描述为一种中间派形式。

… Furthermore, Comrade Stalin reveals the inescapable law that all opportunist groups and groupings, from right-wing Menshevik liquidators to Trotskyists, constantly seek to unite. And he describes Trotskyism as a form of centrism.

……斯大林同志谴责孟什维克主义的社会基础，并将孟什维克的策略描述为无产阶级中半资产阶级分子的策略……

… Comrade Stalin denounces the social foundations of Menshevism and describes the tactics of the Mensheviks as the tactics of the semi-bourgeois elements of the proletariat…

……斯大林同志强调了孟什维克的取消主义和孟什维克在党外召开工人代表大会的想法。

… Comrade Stalin highlights the liquidationism of the Mensheviks and the Menshevik idea of ​​a workers' congress outside the Party .

……斯大林同志表明，召开工人代表大会的想法是孟什维克对工人阶级的直接背叛，他们按照自由资产阶级的“命令”，试图瓦解工人阶级的革命政党，同时，在工人运动中发挥带头作用。

… Comrade Stalin demonstrates that the idea of ​​calling a workers' congress is a direct betrayal of the working class by the Mensheviks who, “on the orders” of the liberal bourgeoisie, are trying to dismantle the revolutionary party of the working class and, at the same time, to take the lead in the labor movement.

……在反动年代，斯大林同志领导的巴库布尔什维克领导了巴库无产阶级的阶级斗争，并在1907年底的石油巨头会议上成功地组织了一场伟大的运动。

… During the years of reaction, the Baku Bolsheviks, led by Comrade Stalin, led the class struggles of the Baku proletariat and successfully organized a great campaign at the conference of oil magnates at the end of 1907.

…… 1908年1月和2月，斯大林同志领导的巴库委员会组织了一系列大罢工，其引人注目之处在于工人从小资产阶级的要求（增加等）转向了无产阶级的要求。

… In January and February 1908, the Baku Committee, led by Comrade Stalin, organized a series of big strikes remarkable for the fact that the workers changed from petty-bourgeois demands (increases, etc.) to proletarian demands .

……斯大林同志在巴库活动期间多次被捕并被判处流放。沙皇的秘密警察顽强地追捕他。

… During his activities in Baku, Comrade Stalin was repeatedly arrested and sentenced to exile. The Tsar's secret police doggedly track him down.

……从 3 月 25 日到 1908 年 9 月底，斯大林同志被关押在巴库监狱。他设法在监狱中与巴库委员会建立联系并指导其行动。他还在监狱里经营《巴金斯基工人报》 。

… Comrade Stalin was imprisoned in the Baku prison from March 25 to the end of September 1908. He managed to establish contact, from his prison, with the Baku Committee and to guide its action. He also runs the Bakinski rabotchi newspaper from his prison .

……斯大林同志定期在地区和地区间党的会议上发表讲话。它负责罢工的准备和进行。它进一步发展了旨在揭露和击败孟什维克、社会革命党、达伊纳克和其他小资产阶级政党的不断斗争。

… Comrade Stalin regularly speaks at regional and inter-regional Party meetings. It is responsible for the preparation and conduct of strikes. It further develops the incessant struggle aimed at exposing and defeating the Mensheviks, Social Revolutionaries, Dajnaks and other petty-bourgeois parties.

1909年10月，斯大林同志抵达第比利斯，在那里组织和领导了布尔什维克组织反对孟什维克取消派的斗争。

In October 1909 Comrade Stalin arrived in Tiflis where he organized and led the struggle of the Bolshevik organizations against the Menshevik liquidators.

斯大林同志为在第比利斯召开布尔什维克党代表大会和布尔什维克报纸《Tifliski proletari 23》的出版做好了准备。

Comrade Stalin prepares the ground for the meeting of the Bolshevik Party Conference in Tiflis and for the publication of the Bolshevik newspaper Tifliski proletari 23 .

1909年11月，布尔什维克在第比利斯召开了会议，会议按照斯大林同志的建议进行了工作：在两条战线上进行斗争。

The Bolshevik conference in Tiflis took place in November 1909 and worked along the lines of Comrade Stalin's recommendations: to wage the struggle on two fronts.

……在斯大林同志的领导下，外高加索和格鲁吉亚的布尔什维克在历史上一直与工人运动的主要敌人孟什维克进行着激烈的斗争。在外高加索布尔什维克历史的各个阶段，斯大林同志都以真正列宁主义的方式攻击并击败了“合法马克思主义者”、孟什维克经济学家和取消派。在反动最黑暗的时期以及革命复兴期间，它在与孟什维克和社会革命党的残酷斗争中建立和巩固了布尔什维克党的组织。

… Under the leadership of Comrade Stalin, the Bolsheviks of Transcaucasia and Georgia throughout their history wage a fierce struggle against the Mensheviks, the main enemies of the labor movement. At all stages of the history of the Transcaucasian Bolsheviks, Comrade Stalin attacks and defeats the "legal Marxists", the Menshevik economists and liquidators, in a truly Leninist manner. During the darkest period of reaction, as well as during the revolutionary revival, it builds and consolidates the organizations of the Bolshevik party in a ruthless struggle against the Mensheviks and the Socialist-Revolutionaries.

斯大林同志在反动时期在巴库的行动中，使巴库成为布尔什维主义的根据地。

During his action in Baku during the period of reaction, Comrade Stalin made Baku a stronghold of Bolshevism.

斯大林同志领导的党组织“度过了反革命时期，没有被削弱”，尽管受到镇压，反动势力并没有成功地将其打倒。在斯大林同志的领导下，巴库组织“极其积极地参与了工人运动的一切进展。在巴库，该党是一个真正意义上的群众政党”。

The Party organization, led by comrade Stalin, “crossed the counter-revolutionary period without weakening” and, in spite of the repression, the reaction did not succeed in bringing it down. Under the leadership of Comrade Stalin, the Baku organization “takes an extraordinarily active part in all that progresses in the labor movement. In Baku, the Party is a mass party in the full sense of the word”.

……在斯大林同志的领导下，外高加索布尔什维克把布拉格会议的准备工作组织成反对取消派​​的决定性斗争。

… Under the leadership of Comrade Stalin, the Transcaucasian Bolsheviks are organizing the preparations for the Prague Conference into a decisive struggle against the liquidators.

这时，谢尔戈·奥尔忠尼启则奉列宁指示来到外高加索，参加布拉格党代表会议的筹备工作。

At this time, acting on Lenin's instructions, Sergo Ordzhonikidze came to Transcaucasia to attend the preparations for the Party conference in Prague.

在斯大林同志的帮助和领导下，奥尔忠尼启泽成功地在巴库成立了全俄党代表会议组织委员会。

With the help and under the leadership of Comrade Stalin, Ordzhonikidze succeeded in setting up in Baku an organizing committee for the All-Russian Party Conference.

然而，斯大林的声望不足以成为布拉格布尔什维克代表大会的代表，因此没有被列宁召唤去代表那里的党。由于所有代表的名字都已知晓，贝利亚决定必须对斯大林同志的缺席做出解释。他宣称：

However, Stalin, who was not a sufficiently eminent personality to be a delegate to the Prague Congress of the Bolsheviks, was not summoned by Lenin to represent the Party there. As the names of all the delegates are known, Beria decides that Comrade Stalin's absence must be explained. He proclaims:

布拉格代表大会选举了一个中央委员会，并以列宁为主席。斯大林同志也当选，尽管他没有出席。

The Prague Congress elects a central committee and puts Lenin at its head. Comrade Stalin is also elected, although he is not present.

布拉格党代表大会召开时，斯大林正在流亡。1911年9月9日，斯大林同志在圣彼得堡被捕，并被流放到沃洛格达省的索尔维切戈茨克。但他于 1912 年 2 月 29 日成功逃脱。

At the time of the Prague Party Congress, Stalin was in exile. Comrade Stalin was arrested in St. Petersburg on September 9, 1911 and exiled to Solvychegodsk in the Vologda Province. But he managed to escape on February 29, 1912.

……布拉格代表大会结束后，斯大林同志返回外高加索（巴库和第比利斯）。他组织和指导外高加索布尔什维克为执行布拉格代表大会的决议而进行的斗争。

…After the Congress of Prague, comrade Stalin returns to Transcaucasia (Baku and Tiflis). He organizes and directs the struggle of the Transcaucasian Bolsheviks for the application of the resolutions of the Congress of Prague.

接下来，贝利亚说道：

Next, Beria states:

……斯大林同志对马克思主义工人运动团结观给出了出色的定义。

…Comrade Stalin gives an excellent definition of the Marxist conception of the unity of the labor movement.

偌大的大厅里，在七月酷暑的作用下，千余人汗流浃背，散发着浓浓的臭味，斯大林……斯大林……斯大林的名字，像磨盘运转的回声一样，回响不息。 。有一种疲倦和无聊的气氛。听众知道，从今天起，一本新的政治圣经开始生效，任何敢于公开反对教条的人很快就会发现自己身陷囹圄。

In the enormous hall where, under the effect of the July heat, the sweat of more than a thousand sweating bodies spreads a strong odor, the name of Stalin... Stalin... Stalin resounds endlessly like the echo of a millstone in operation. There is an atmosphere of weariness and boredom. Listeners know that from today a new political Bible comes into force and that anyone who dares to speak out against dogma will quickly find themselves behind bars.

贝利亚用以下一段话结束了这一章：

Beria concludes the chapter with this paragraph:

在斯大林同志的领导下，外高加索的布尔什维克在革命运动的各个阶段，领导了一场与工人阶级的敌人，首先是孟什维克、资产阶级民族主义者、“调和派”的不妥协的斗争。 “妥协者”。历史上斯大林同志撕下斯托雷平“工人党”理论家和建设者面具的《高加索来信》，对于揭露和击溃孟什维克起了极其重要的作用。

With Comrade Stalin at the helm, the Bolsheviks of Transcaucasia led, at all stages of the revolutionary movement, an uncompromising struggle against the enemies of the working class, in the first place against the Mensheviks, the bourgeois nationalists, the "conciliators". and the “compromise makers”. The historical "Letters from the Caucasus", in which Comrade Stalin tears off the mask of the ideologues and builders of Stolypin's "workers' party", play an extremely important role in exposing and routing the Mensheviks.

这些话引起全场热烈而经久不息的掌声。观众庆幸半天过去了，可以锻炼一下鼓掌了。否则，他就会昏昏欲睡，而这种态度如果被在场的特工注意到，可能会产生非常不幸的后果。

These words elicit loud and prolonged applause. The audience rejoices that half the day is up and that it can take some exercise in clapping. Otherwise, drowsiness awaits him and such an attitude, if noticed by one of the agents present, could have very unfortunate consequences.

贝利亚喝了一大口水，离开了舞台。休息十五分钟。

Beria takes a big sip of water and leaves the stage. Fifteen minute break.

人们涌向厕所或院子，或到街上从街角的售货亭购买柠檬水或格瓦斯。

People rush to the toilets or to the yard, or to the street to buy lemonade or kvass from the corner kiosk.

中午，贝利亚回来阅读他作品的最后一章。它的标题是“反对民族主义偏差主义的斗争史，1913-1924年”。本章的基调与前面的没有什么不同。拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇进一步揭示了这一点：

At noon, Beria returns to read the last chapter of his work. It is entitled “History of the struggle against nationalist deviationism, 1913-1924”. The tone of this chapter does not differ from the preceding ones. Lavrenty Pavlovich further reveals this:

列宁最先认识到斯大林同志关于民族问题的理论著作的重要性。

Lenin was the first to appreciate the great importance of Comrade Stalin's theoretical works on the national problem.

……斯大林同志在《马克思主义与民族和殖民地问题》（1913）一书中丰富了布尔什维克的民族问题理论，粉碎了孟什维克的民族文化自治纲领。

… In his book Marxism and National and Colonial Problems (1913), Comrade Stalin enriched the Bolshevik theory of the national problem and shattered the Menshevik program for the cultural autonomy of nations.

……斯大林同志在1921年7月6日第比利斯党组织会议上提交的《关于格鲁吉亚和外高加索共产主义的当前任务》的报告中指出，不断反对民族主义的斗争是共产党人的主要政治任务。外高加索地区。

… Comrade Stalin, in his report “On the immediate tasks of communism in Georgia and Transcaucasia”, presented at the July 6, 1921 meeting of the Party organization in Tiflis, says that an unceasing struggle against nationalism constitutes the main political task of the Communists of Transcaucasia.

这句话终于结束了阅读。爆发出热烈的掌声。所有的帮助都站起来，给演讲者长时间的鼓掌。然而，掌声不是针对他个人的，而是通过他，献给斯大林同志的，斯大林同志几乎是独自为布尔什维主义事业赢得了外高加索。偌大的大厅里，回荡着秘密警察的呼喊声：“外高加索联邦万岁！” “伟大的斯大林万岁！” “斯大林同志万岁！” »

These words finally end the reading. Turbulent applause erupts. All the assistance rises and gives the speaker a long ovation. However, the applause is not addressed to him personally, but, through him, to Comrade Stalin who won, almost alone, Transcaucasia for the cause of Bolshevism. The huge hall resounded with cries elicited by the secret police: "Long live the Transcaucasian Federation!" "Long live the great Stalin!" "Hurrah for Comrade Stalin!" »

“欢呼！万岁！万岁！回答一千个声音。

“Hurrah! Hooray! Hooray! answer a thousand voices.

1935 年 7 月 22 日，第比利斯，阳光明媚的下午三点钟，外面气温在 40 度左右，党的工作人员会议结束了。贝利亚把打印整齐的文件整理好，塞进公文包里。听课时喝了很多杯水，他的喉咙还是干燥，声音也沙哑。他已经筋疲力尽了，因为要让这些明智的人相信，在所描述的时期内，由一个当时绝不是领导者的人所扮演的主角并不容易。他只是数百人中的一员。他也是贝利亚又恨又恨的人，很乐意罢免他的职务，夺取权力。他想消灭他，就像他消灭许多其他格鲁吉亚共产党人一样，

It was around 40° outside on July 22, 1935 in Tbilisi when, at three o'clock on a sunny afternoon, the meeting of Party workers ended. Beria puts her neatly typed papers in order and slips them into a briefcase. His throat is dry despite the many glasses of water he's had during his lecture, and his voice is hoarse. He is completely exhausted, because convincing these sensible people of the leading role played, during the period described, by someone who was by no means a leader at that time is not easy. He was just one man among hundreds of others. He is also a man that Beria hates and hates, and would be happy to oust from his post to seize his power. He would like to annihilate him as he annihilated many other Georgian communists,

当天晚上，贝利亚将手稿副本寄给克里姆林宫，请亲爱的斯大林同志审阅，如果批准，请转交给党中央委员会的官方机关报《真理报》。。

That same evening, Beria sends a copy of the manuscript to the Kremlin, asking dear comrade Stalin to examine it and, if he approves, to kindly pass it on to Pravda, the official organ of the party's Central Committee . Communist of the Soviet Union.

拉夫伦蒂相信，通过这一程序，他的文章将被他的顶头上司宣读，而大老板也会欣赏外高加索领土委员会第一书记的努力。贝利亚不是斯大林这一代人，没有理由害怕受到独裁者灭绝计划的打击。另一方面，如果其详细阐述没有得到完全批准，贝利亚还不会定期清洗可疑分子，特别是某些老格鲁吉亚布尔什维克。无论哪种方式，贝利亚组织的为期两天的会议以及整个会议都将证明是有益的。

Lavrenti is confident that, thanks to this procedure, his essay will be read by his immediate superior and that the big boss will appreciate the efforts of the first secretary of the Territorial Committee of Transcaucasia. Beria, who does not belong to Stalin's generation, has no reason to fear being hit by the dictator's program of extermination. On the other hand, if its elaboration is not fully approved, Beria will not yet undertake a regular purge among the dubious elements, particularly certain old Georgian Bolsheviks. Either way, the two-day meeting that Beria organized and the conference as a whole will prove beneficial.

评级

Ratings

18 . 请注意，当时很少使用格鲁吉亚名称“第比利斯”而不是俄罗斯名称“第比利斯”。

18 . Note the use, rare at the time, of the Georgian name Tbilisi instead of the Russian Tiflis.

19 . 苏联共产党（布尔什维克）。

19 . Communist Party of the Soviet Union (Bolsheviks).

20 . 共产主义青年团（共青团）。

20 . Communist Youth League ( Komsomol ).

21 . “第三组”。

21 . “Third group”.

22 . 《火花》，俄罗斯社会主义报纸，由列宁于 1900 年创办。

22 . The Spark , Russian socialist newspaper founded by Lenin in 1900.

23 . 第比利斯的无产者。

23 . The Proletarian of Tiflis .

第23章

Chapter 23

在赛马比赛中

At the horse races

夏天太热，不适合留在第比利斯。贝利亚决定稍微休息一下，并与妻子尼娜在阿布哈兹的索契别墅里度过七月底和八月的部分时间，距离苏呼米不远。

Summer is too hot to stay in Tbilisi. Beria decides to take a little rest and spend the end of July and part of August with his wife Nina in Abkhazia, in their villa in Sochi, not far from Sukhumi.

回到家乡苏呼米后，拉夫伦蒂拜访了内斯特·拉科巴。阿布哈兹中央执行委员会秘书很高兴见到他有权有势的朋友，邀请他到他位于苏呼米附近黑海岸边度假胜地古达乌提的乡间别墅共进晚餐。车程不到半小时。

Returning to his native Sukhumi, Lavrenti visits Nestor Lakoba. The secretary of the Central Executive Committee of Abkhazia, happy to see his powerful friend, invited him to dinner at his country house in Goudaouti, a resort on the shores of the Black Sea, near Sukhumi. It's less than half an hour by car.

亲爱的很好，卡赫蒂的高加索葡萄酒具有很好的年份。晚餐后，拉科巴向贝利亚吐露，他已经写了一本小册子，想出版。内斯特想把它读给他的朋友拉拉听，并听听他的评论。贝利亚不能拒绝他这个小恩小惠。又喝了一瓶酒，然后拉科巴请客人到他的书房来。拉夫伦蒂坐在柔软舒适的格鲁吉亚沙发上，可以听到主人朗读手稿的悠扬声音。这本小册子是对亲爱的格鲁吉亚同胞和大酋长的荣耀的赞歌。

The dear is fine and the Caucasian wine of Kakheti carries a good vintage. After dinner, Lakoba confides in Beria that he has written a pamphlet that he would like to publish. Nestor would like to read it to his friend Lara and hear his comments. Beria cannot refuse him this small service. Another bottle of wine, then Lakoba asks his guest to come into his study. There, seated on the takhta , a soft and comfortable Georgian divan, Lavrenti can hear the melodious voice of his host reading the manuscript. The brochure is a hymn to the glory of the dear Georgian compatriot and the Grand Chief.

它的标题是斯大林和哈奇梅。拉科巴将约瑟夫·维萨里奥诺维奇·朱加什维利介绍为“他那个时代最伟大的人，像历史一样的人只为人类贡献了一百或两百年的时间”，“才华横溢、孜孜不倦、刻在钢铁上的我们亲爱的斯大林24  ” 。

It is titled Stalin and Khachime . Lakoba presents Iosif Vissarionovitch Djougashvili there as "the greatest man of his time, a man like history only gives one every hundred or two hundred years to humanity", as "the brilliant, tireless and carved in steel, our dear and beloved Stalin 24  ”.

拉夫连季全心全意地认可了这部作品，并建议拉科巴将手稿寄往莫斯科。然而，在他的心中，出现了一种怀疑：这个人可能会成为一个竞争对手，并且正如一些反对者已经称拉科巴为“阿布哈兹民主绿洲的创造者”一样，拉夫连季开始认为他的同志，在他鲁莽地阅读他的长篇悼词，自掘坟墓。

Lavrenti approves the work wholeheartedly and advises Lakoba to send the manuscript to Moscow. In his mind, however, a suspicion arises: this man could become a rival and, as some opponents already call Lakoba "the creator of the democratic oasis of Abkhazia", ​​Lavrenty comes to think that his comrade, in him recklessly reading his long eulogy, digs his own grave.

两天后，拉科巴在苏呼米的办公室给贝利亚在索契的避暑别墅打电话。接下来的周日，古道提站将有一大看点：赛马。内斯特·拉科巴邀请他的朋友拉夫伦蒂·帕夫洛维奇陪同他参加这次活动。

Two days later, from his office in Sukhumi, Lakoba telephoned Beria at his summer house in Sochi. The following Sunday, there will be a great attraction at Gudaouti station: horse racing. Nestor Lakoba invites his friend Lavrenti Pavlovich to accompany him to this event.

赛马场挤满了数千名观众。每个格鲁吉亚人都是天生的骑手，赛车是高加索地区最激动人心的运动。天气炎热，但微风徐徐，空气清新。

The racetrack is teeming with thousands of spectators. Every Georgian is born a rider, and racing is the most exciting game in the Caucasus. The day is hot, but a light sea breeze refreshes the atmosphere.

围场里，世界上最美丽的切尔克斯马、栗色马和黑马的游行，构成了令人印象深刻的壮丽奇观。看着他们，平时开朗、大声、健谈的格鲁吉亚人变得比平时更加​​兴奋。

In the paddock, the parade of Circassian, chestnut and black horses, the most beautiful in the world, constitutes an impressive and magnificent spectacle. Looking at them, Georgians, usually cheerful, loud and talkative, get even more excited than usual.

为阿布哈兹中央执行委员会主席保留的大看台上挤满了知名人士。主人内斯特·拉科巴 (Nestor Lakoba) 是一位富有同情心、留着漂亮的铅笔胡子、举止不做作的人，旁边站着他的母亲、一位杰出人士和他的妻子。我们还看到了他的表弟巴塞尔和迈克尔，都是二十多岁的男人，身材高大，表现得很好。这些男孩如此快乐、如此开放，很难相信，在他们的日常工作中，他们是商人和无情的刽子手。目前，他们为尊贵的客人提供葡萄酒和卷有最好的高加索烟草的普希金香烟。嘉宾中有共产党外高加索委员会第一书记、亲爱的拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚同志和对外贸易人民委员、前苏联空军总司令阿尔卡季·罗森戈尔茨同志，他是老一代先锋人物，面容坚毅，体格魁梧。罗森戈尔茨和他的女儿叶莲娜来索契度过暑假。她坐在前排，一边啃着迈克尔提供的巧克力，一边通过巴塞尔借来的双筒望远镜观察。伊莱娜是一个美丽开朗的年轻女孩，有着黑色的大眼睛和自然的金色头发。它们通过她大理石白色的脖子上的一个大结连在一起，脖子上点缀着一些雀斑。当她笑的时候，这经常发生在她身上，她皱起了漂亮的小鼻子，鲜红的嘴唇间露出闪闪发光的牙齿，就像高加索樱桃一样新鲜。她很胖，但并不胖，还有十几岁的小乳房。她还不到十八岁，但看起来比大多数同龄女孩都要成熟。埃琳娜已经是一位非常有吸引力的年轻女子，可能还是处女，就像那些母亲在严格的宗教传统中长大的优秀犹太家庭的年轻女孩一样。他的父亲是一位意志坚强的专员，以行政能力着称。他是革命时期在莫斯科作战的老布尔什维克。几年来，他坚定地统治着乌克兰顿涅茨河的煤炭盆地顿巴斯。作为最著名的共产主义者之一，作为中央委员会成员，罗森戈尔茨后来被任命为驻伦敦大使。他在那里一直待到 1928 年，之后他返回俄罗斯为政府工作。他是三个孩子的父亲。最小的叶莲娜是他的宝贝女儿。他为她感到骄傲，目不转睛地盯着她。他也不是唯一的一个。巴兹尔和迈克尔这两位年轻军官始终站在叶莲娜身边。无需猜测贝利亚对年轻女孩的不正常倾向，因为其特殊品味的噪音在其随从中自由传播。我们可以肯定，拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇目前正在尽最大努力让自己变得有趣和渴望，他会不惜一切代价与她做爱。他在那里一直待到 1928 年，之后他返回俄罗斯为政府工作。他是三个孩子的父亲。最小的叶莲娜是他的宝贝女儿。他为她感到骄傲，目不转睛地盯着她。他也不是唯一的一个。巴兹尔和迈克尔这两位年轻军官始终站在叶莲娜身边。无需猜测贝利亚对年轻女孩的不正常倾向，因为其特殊品味的噪音在其随从中自由传播。我们可以肯定，拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇目前正在尽最大努力让自己变得有趣和渴望，他会不惜一切代价与她做爱。他在那里一直待到 1928 年，之后他返回俄罗斯为政府工作。他是三个孩子的父亲。最小的叶莲娜是他的宝贝女儿。他为她感到骄傲，目不转睛地盯着她。他也不是唯一的一个。巴兹尔和迈克尔这两位年轻军官始终站在叶莲娜身边。无需猜测贝利亚对年轻女孩的不正常倾向，因为其特殊品味的噪音在其随从中自由传播。我们可以肯定，拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇目前正在尽最大努力让自己变得有趣和渴望，他会不惜一切代价与她做爱。他为她感到骄傲，目不转睛地盯着她。他也不是唯一的一个。巴兹尔和迈克尔这两位年轻军官始终站在叶莲娜身边。无需猜测贝利亚对年轻女孩的不正常倾向，因为其特殊品味的噪音在其随从中自由传播。我们可以肯定，拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇目前正在尽最大努力让自己变得有趣和渴望，他会不惜一切代价与她做爱。他为她感到骄傲，目不转睛地盯着她。他也不是唯一的一个。巴兹尔和迈克尔这两位年轻军官始终站在叶莲娜身边。无需猜测贝利亚对年轻女孩的不正常倾向，因为其特殊品味的噪音在其随从中自由传播。我们可以肯定，拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇目前正在尽最大努力让自己变得有趣和渴望，他会不惜一切代价与她做爱。当他的特殊品味的噪音在他周围的人中自由传播时。我们可以肯定，拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇目前正在尽最大努力让自己变得有趣和渴望，他会不惜一切代价与她做爱。当他的特殊品味的噪音在他周围的人中自由传播时。我们可以肯定，拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇目前正在尽最大努力让自己变得有趣和渴望，他会不惜一切代价与她做爱。

The grand grandstand, reserved for the Chairman of the Central Executive Committee of Abkhazia, is occupied by eminent personalities. Beside the host, Nestor Lakoba, a sympathetic man with a fine pencil mustache and unaffected manners, stand his mother, a distinguished person, and his wife. We also see his cousins ​​Basile and Michael, men in their twenties, tall, presenting well. These boys are so jovial and so open that it is hard to believe that in their daily work they are chekists and ruthless executioners. At the moment they serve honorable guests wine and Pushkin cigarettes rolled with the best Caucasian tobacco. Among the guests are the first secretary of the Transcaucasian Committee of the Communist Party, dear comrade Lavrentiy Pavlovich Beria and the People's Commissar for Foreign Trade and former Commander-in-Chief of the Soviet Air Force, Arkady Rosengoltz, a pioneer of the old generation, a man with a strong face and a broad build. Rosengoltz came to spend his summer vacation in Sochi with his daughter, Yelena. Seated in the front row, she looks through binoculars lent by Basile, while nibbling chocolate offered by Michael. Ielena is a beautiful and cheerful young girl with big black eyes and naturally golden hair. They are held together by a big knot on her marble-white neck, dotted with a few freckles. When she laughs, which often happens to her, she wrinkles her pretty little nose and bares gleaming teeth between scarlet lips as fresh as Caucasian cherries. She's chubby, but not fat, with small teenage tits. She is not eighteen, but seems more mature than most girls her age. Elena is already a very attractive young woman, probably still a virgin, as are generally the young girls of good Jewish families whose mothers have been brought up in strict religious traditions. His father is a strong-minded commissioner, known for his administrative skills. He is an old Bolshevik who fought in Moscow during the revolution. For a few years, he ruled with a firm hand the Donbas, the coal basin of the Donets in Ukraine. Being one of the most prominent communists, a member of the Central Committee, Rosengoltz was later appointed ambassador to London. He remained there until 1928, when he returned to Russia to work for the government. He is the father of three children. Yelena, the youngest is his darling daughter. He is proud of her and does not take his eyes off her. He's not the only one either. The two young officers, Basil and Michael, constantly stand by Yelena's side. It is not necessary to guess the abnormal tendencies which push Beria towards the very young girls, since the noise of its particular tastes circulates freely among its entourage. We can be sure that Lavrenty Pavlovich, who, for now, is doing his best to make himself interesting and eager, will stop at nothing to make love with her. He remained there until 1928, when he returned to Russia to work for the government. He is the father of three children. Yelena, the youngest is his darling daughter. He is proud of her and does not take his eyes off her. He's not the only one either. The two young officers, Basil and Michael, constantly stand by Yelena's side. It is not necessary to guess the abnormal tendencies which push Beria towards the very young girls, since the noise of its particular tastes circulates freely among its entourage. We can be sure that Lavrenty Pavlovich, who, for now, is doing his best to make himself interesting and eager, will stop at nothing to make love with her. He remained there until 1928, when he returned to Russia to work for the government. He is the father of three children. Yelena, the youngest is his darling daughter. He is proud of her and does not take his eyes off her. He's not the only one either. The two young officers, Basil and Michael, constantly stand by Yelena's side. It is not necessary to guess the abnormal tendencies which push Beria towards the very young girls, since the noise of its particular tastes circulates freely among its entourage. We can be sure that Lavrenty Pavlovich, who, for now, is doing his best to make himself interesting and eager, will stop at nothing to make love with her. He is proud of her and does not take his eyes off her. He's not the only one either. The two young officers, Basil and Michael, constantly stand by Yelena's side. It is not necessary to guess the abnormal tendencies which push Beria towards the very young girls, since the noise of its particular tastes circulates freely among its entourage. We can be sure that Lavrenty Pavlovich, who, for now, is doing his best to make himself interesting and eager, will stop at nothing to make love with her. He is proud of her and does not take his eyes off her. He's not the only one either. The two young officers, Basil and Michael, constantly stand by Yelena's side. It is not necessary to guess the abnormal tendencies which push Beria towards the very young girls, since the noise of its particular tastes circulates freely among its entourage. We can be sure that Lavrenty Pavlovich, who, for now, is doing his best to make himself interesting and eager, will stop at nothing to make love with her. as the noise of his particular tastes circulates freely among those around him. We can be sure that Lavrenty Pavlovich, who, for now, is doing his best to make himself interesting and eager, will stop at nothing to make love with her. as the noise of his particular tastes circulates freely among those around him. We can be sure that Lavrenty Pavlovich, who, for now, is doing his best to make himself interesting and eager, will stop at nothing to make love with her.

几天后，内斯特·拉科巴邀请贝利亚下午去他的乡间别墅喝茶，暗示这将是一次男孩们的聚会。拉科巴的两个表兄弟巴塞尔和迈克尔出席了会议。唯一的女嘉宾是迷人的伊莱娜。贝利亚没有问她的主人她对于重聚的初衷是什么，也没有问为什么这个年轻的女孩没有由她的父亲陪伴。不管怎样，接待成功了。留声机旋转，年轻女士和两个年轻人一起跳华尔兹、探戈、狐步，轮流扮演骑手。自助餐也非常成功：糕点、茶、土耳其美食、糖果和葡萄酒。但当小女孩借口原谅并出去“给她的小鼻子搽粉”时，一名年轻的厨师向其他人眨了眨眼，然后将纯酒精倒入叶莲娜的杯子里。当她回来时，这位绅士像选美皇后一样向她敬酒，并鼓励她一口气喝掉杯子。少女立即感到头晕目眩，浑身发热。她要求出去呼吸新鲜空气。贝利亚和两个年轻人主动提出陪他一起去花园散步。两位先生挽着她的手臂走出去，第三位先生在前。在一条阴暗的小巷里，少女晕倒了。她的护送人员扶着她，让她坐在长凳上。然而，她病得太重，坐不住了。我们把她放在草地上。一位绅士开始为她脱衣服。起初，女孩不明白自己发生了什么事。她可能认为他们想松开她的衣服，让她呼吸更自由。当她明白他们的意图后，她尝试寻求帮助。但已经太晚了。一个男人用尽全力压垮她。她试图把他推开，但无济于事。她被在场的所有男人一个接一个地强奸。

A few days later, Nestor Lakoba invites Beria to come for tea one afternoon at his country house, implying that it will be a meeting of boys. Lakoba's two cousins, Basile and Michael, attend. The only female guest is the charming Ielena. Beria does not ask her host what has become of her first intentions regarding the reunion, nor why the young girl is not accompanied by her father. Anyway, the reception is successful. The gramophone spins, the young lady dances waltzes, tangos, fox-trots with the two young people who take it in turns to act as riders. The buffet is also very successful: pastries, tea, Turkish delicacies, sweets and wines. But when the young girl excuses herself and goes out for a moment to "powder her little nose", one of the young chekists winks at the other men and pours pure alcohol into Yelena's glass. When she returns, the gentleman toasts her like a beauty queen and encourages her to drink her glass in one gulp. Immediately the young girl feels dizzy and feels hot; she asks to go out for some fresh air. Beria and the two young people offer to accompany him, suggesting a walk in the gardens. Two gentlemen take her arms and go out, preceded by the third. In one of the shaded alleys, the young girl fainted. Her escort supports her and seats her on a bench. She is too sick, however, to sit still. We lay her on the grass. One of the gentlemen begins to undress her. At first, the girl does not understand what is happening to her. She probably thinks they want to loosen her clothes to allow her to breathe more freely. When she understands their intentions, she tries to call for help. But it's too late. A man crushes her with all his weight. She tries to push him away, but to no avail. She is raped by all the men present, one after the other.

女孩不知所措，心碎了。但当她回到家并告诉父亲真相时会发生什么呢？一名年轻的契卡分子将双手按在喉咙上并挤压。强，越来越强。

The girl is overwhelmed and broken. But what will happen when she returns home and tells her father the truth? One of the young Chekists presses his hands to his throat and squeezes. Strong, getting stronger.

回到家后，拉夫伦蒂来到拉科巴的书房，用中立且客观的声音给预审法官打电话，命令值班人员立即带着代表前来。很快，检查人员就到了。佐治亚州秘密警察局长贝利亚告诉他们，喝了几杯酒后，女孩变得歇斯底里，跑进了花园。他们跟着她，喊着让她回来。但她没有听他们的。现在他们发现她死了。那个歇斯底里的女孩自杀了。无需尸检。经阿布哈兹执行委员会秘书内斯特·拉科巴证实的外高加索共产党第一书记的证词就足够了。预审法官剩下的就是

Returning to the house, Lavrenti went to Lakoba's study, from where he telephoned in a neutral and impersonal voice to the investigating magistrate, ordering whoever was on duty to come immediately with deputies. Quickly, the inspectors arrive. Georgia secret police chief Beria informs them that after a few glasses of wine, the girl became hysterical and ran into the garden. They followed her, shouting at her to come back. But she didn't listen to them. And now they found her dead. The hysterical girl committed suicide. No autopsy is necessary. The testimony of the first secretary of the Transcaucasian Committee of the Communist Party, confirmed by that of the secretary of the Executive Committee of Abkhazia, Nestor Lakoba, is sufficient. All that remains for the examining magistrate is

第二天，贝利亚离开苏呼米返回他在格鲁吉亚首都的办公室。

The next day, Beria leaves Sukhumi to return to his office in the capital of Georgia.

24 . 鲍里斯·苏瓦林 (Boris Souvarine)，斯大林，纽约，1939 年。

24 . Boris Souvarine, Stalin , New York, 1939.

第24章

Chapter 24

一群朋友组成的合唱团

A choir of friends

内斯特·拉科巴即将发表他对斯大林的悼词。他确信，将其展示给拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇（Lavrenti Pavlovich）是一件好事，而拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇（Lavrenti Pavlovich）作为他的忠实朋友，建议他将手稿提交给莫斯科，以便获得批准和印刷。然而，拉科巴并不怀疑他的前门生贝利亚在他的政府中有特工，并且他们向第比利斯的内务人民委员部通报了他的一举一动。贝利亚建立了一份特别档案，其中包含针对他的前恩人的各种证据和指控。诚然，秘密警察局长将罗森戈尔茨专员女儿的强奸和谋杀案列入档案，但没有提及他自己的参与，这并不能产生后果。更重要的是，拉科巴虽然是一名共产主义者，但也是一名白人爱国者，或者更准确地说，阿布哈兹人很高兴看到自己成为这个以苏呼米为首都的国家的主人。贝利亚已经掌握了不止一项证据来支持阿布哈兹是“格鲁吉亚的民主绿洲”这一流行谣言，并表明在拉科巴的统治下，许多孟什维克和达伊纳克仍然享有自由。此外，拉科巴是斯大林的亲密朋友。事情的这一方面非常适合拉夫伦蒂。贝利亚耐心地收集了消灭拉科巴所需的材料，就像他为斯大林的其他白人朋友所做的那样，以帮助独裁者除掉他们：姆迪瓦尼、马哈拉泽和最亲爱的叶努基泽，以及奥尔忠尼启则和斯大林的兄弟姻亲，帕维尔·阿利卢耶夫。贝利亚收集有关他们的信息。

Nestor Lakoba is about to publish his eulogy of Stalin. He is convinced that he has done well by showing it to Lavrenti Pavlovich who, as a devoted friend, advised him to submit the manuscript to Moscow to have it approved and printed. Lakoba, however, does not suspect that Beria, his former protege, has agents in his administration and that they inform the NKVD in Tbilisi about all his movements. Beria has established a special file, with evidence and accusations of all kinds against his ex-benefactor. Admittedly, the rape and murder of Commissioner Rosengoltz's daughter, which the chief of the secret police adds to the file without, however, mentioning his own participation, does not lend itself to consequence. Much more important is the fact that Lakoba, although a communist, is also a Caucasian patriot or, more precisely, Abkhazian who would gladly see himself becoming master of this country with Sukhumi as its capital. Beria already has more than one piece of evidence to back up the popular rumor that Abkhazia is "an oasis of democracy in Georgia," and to show that under Lakoba's government many Mensheviks and Dajnaks still enjoy their freedom. Furthermore, Lakoba is a close friend of Stalin. And this aspect of things suits Lavrenti very badly. Beria patiently gathers the materials necessary for the liquidation of Lakoba, as he does for other Caucasian friends of Stalin in order to help the dictator get rid of them: Mdivani, Makharadze and the dearest of all, Yenukidze, as well as Ordzhonikidze and Stalin's brother-in-law, Pavel Alliluyev. Beria collects information about them.

拉夫连季·贝利亚认为，通过践踏他最好的朋友、他的教父和保护者以及老高加索布尔什维克的尸体，他的事业可以迅速发展，他们记得亲爱的“索索”斯大林同志并不是唯一一个将高加索地区从资本主义压迫中拯救出来或做出牺牲的人。为了共产主义事业。通过消灭这些人，贝利亚正在铺平最可靠的道路，使他能够通往莫斯科的内务人民委员部主任办公室，并使他成为斯大林的得力助手。在捷尔任斯基和门任斯基之后，许多人试图获得这个职位。亚戈达接替门任斯基一年后，亚戈达的副手米哈伊尔·特里利瑟(Mikhail Trilisser)在代表老板进行个人调查时发现他提供了有关自己的虚假信息，假装他早在革命之前就是一名积极的共产主义者。特里利瑟向斯大林展示了他的发现，希望雅戈达能够被清算，而他特里利瑟将获得接任上级职位的奖励。斯大林接受了这份报告，但没有奖励特里利塞尔，而是将他送往西伯利亚的劳改营，以惩罚他对老板不忠。米哈伊尔·特里利瑟因此去世。此时，仍然需要雅戈达来准备刺杀基洛夫。他把他送到西伯利亚的劳改营，以惩罚他对老板不忠。米哈伊尔·特里利瑟因此去世。此时，仍然需要雅戈达来准备刺杀基洛夫。他把他送到西伯利亚的劳改营，以惩罚他对老板不忠。米哈伊尔·特里利瑟因此去世。此时，仍然需要雅戈达来准备刺杀基洛夫。

Lavrenty Beria feels that his career could advance rapidly by trampling the corpses of his best friends, his godfathers and protectors and the old Caucasian Bolsheviks who remember that dear comrade "Soso" Stalin was not alone in saving the Caucasus from capitalist oppression or having made sacrifices for the cause of communism. By eliminating these men, Beria is paving the surest road that can lead him to the NKVD director's office in Moscow and make him Stalin's right-hand man. Many people tried to get this post after Dzerzhinsky and Menzhinsky. A year after Yagoda succeeded Menzhinsky, Yagoda's deputy, Mikhail Trilisser, discovered while conducting a personal investigation on behalf of his boss that he had given false information about himself, pretending he had been an active communist long before the revolution. Trilisser showed his findings to Stalin in hopes that Yagoda would be liquidated and he, Trilisser, would be rewarded by taking his superior's chair. Stalin accepted the report, but instead of rewarding Trilisser, sent him to a labor camp in Siberia to punish him for being disloyal to his boss. Mikhail Trilisser died of it. Yagoda was still needed, at this time, to prepare Kirov's assassination. he sends him to a labor camp in Siberia to punish him for having been disloyal to his boss. Mikhail Trilisser died of it. Yagoda was still needed, at this time, to prepare Kirov's assassination. he sends him to a labor camp in Siberia to punish him for having been disloyal to his boss. Mikhail Trilisser died of it. Yagoda was still needed, at this time, to prepare Kirov's assassination.

贝利亚太聪明了，他不会看不到任何一个失误都会给他带来和特里利瑟一样的命运。另一方面，像绵羊一样坐着，无所事事，对他的事业也没有帮助。他决定对一个时日无多的人采取行动。但拉夫伦蒂不想着急。它将一步一步取得进展，就像叶努基泽、奥拉赫拉什维利和马哈拉泽的情况一样。

Beria is too smart not to see that a single misstep would bring him the same fate as Trilisser. On the other hand, sitting like a sheep, doing nothing, wouldn't help his career either. He decides to act against a personality whose days are already numbered. But Lavrenti does not want to hurry. It will progress step by step, as it does for Yenukidze, Orakhelashvili and Makharadze.

贝利亚的攻击重点是格里戈里·“谢尔戈”·奥尔忠尼启则。这个人离基洛夫太近了，根本不可能自救。他是一位老布尔什维克，是阿塞拜疆、格鲁吉亚和亚美尼亚的征服者之一，在基洛夫被暗杀之后，人们可以认为他不再受到斯大林的青睐。

Beria focuses his attack on Grigori "Sergo" Ordzhonikidze. This man was too close to Kirov to hope to save himself. He is an old Bolshevik, one of the conquerors of Azerbaijan, Georgia and Armenia and, after the assassination of Kirov, one can suppose that he is no longer in Stalin's graces.

和叶努启则一样，受托为斯大林撰写传记的奥尔忠尼启则仍然是斯大林的亲密朋友，目前担任莫斯科重工业人民委员。但阿维尔·叶努基泽 (Avel Yenukidze) 也是如此，1934 年基洛夫遇刺后，他接到了更重要的任务。1934年12月1日， 在斯大林个人倡议下，未经政治局同意，阿维尔·索夫罗诺维奇·叶努基泽签署了一项关于逮捕、驱逐和处决数十万人的最重要的指令。他的命令成为无数违法行为的基础：

Ordzhonikidze, who was entrusted with the task of writing Stalin's biography, like Yenukidze, is still a close friend of Stalin and, at present, he is People's Commissar for Heavy Industry in Moscow. But the same was true for Avel Yenukidze who, after the assassination of Kirov in 1934, received a more important mission. On December 1 ,  1934, on Stalin's personal initiative and without the agreement of the Politburo, Avel Sofronovitch Yenukidze had signed a most important directive concerning the arrest, deportation and execution of hundreds of thousands of people. His orders served as the basis for countless violations of legality:

一、命令调查机构加快研究对被控准备或实施恐怖行为的人的审判。

I. Order is given to the investigating bodies to expedite the study of the trials of those accused of preparing or carrying out terrorist acts.

二. 命令司法机构不得暂停执行与此类犯罪有关的死刑，以研究赦免的可能性，因为苏联中央执行委员会主席团认为不可能收到此类性质的请愿书。

II. Judicial bodies are ordered not to suspend the execution of death sentences relating to crimes of this category in order to study the possibilities of pardon, since the Praesidium of the Central Executive Committee of the USSR does not consider it possible to receive petitions of this nature.

三．宣判后立即下令内务人民委员部机构对上述类别的罪犯执行死刑25。

III. Orders are given to the bodies of the Commissariat of Internal Affairs to carry out death sentences against criminals of the above category immediately after the pronouncement of these sentences 25 .

然而一年后，叶努基泽的地位如此低落，以至于贝利亚能够在第比利斯的演讲中谴责他，而丝毫不用担心自己的安全。

Yet a year later, Yenukidze has sunk so low that Beria was able to denounce him in his Tbilisi speech without the slightest fear for his own safety.

1936年6月18日，整个苏联陷入了苦难之中：其最亲爱的作家马克西姆·高尔基刚刚去世。他是已故的纳德日达·阿利卢耶娃和斯大林的朋友。斯大林去看望了生病的高尔基。高尔基去世的前一天，斯大林站在他的床边。这位作家的葬礼呈现出全国示威的规模。全国人民向这位作家和这位忠诚的共产党人致敬。

On June 18, 1936, the whole of the Soviet Union was plunged into affliction: its dearest writer, Maxime Gorky, had just died. He was a friend of the late Nadezhda Alliluyeva and of Stalin. Stalin had visited a sick Gorky. The day before Gorky died, Stalin stood at his bedside. The writer's funeral took on the dimensions of a national demonstration. The whole country pays homage to the writer and the devoted communist.

贝利亚前往莫斯科参加向这位小说家和剧作家的终极致敬活动。在接下来的几天里，拉夫连季根据独裁者最近关于高加索的指示，向斯大林提交了一份严格的计划草案。外高加索联邦将被废除，而阿塞拜疆、格鲁吉亚和亚美尼亚将作为微型苏维埃共和国单独并入苏联。如果不对老高加索布尔什维克和几位现任领导人进行清洗，就不可能实现这种规模的变化。这项任务交给了拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚。贝利亚还向斯大林指出了某些格鲁吉亚革命者的名字，独裁者多年前在第比利斯的一次演讲中介绍了他们作为他的导师和老师。现在，外高加索委员会第一书记建议清算这些人，因为他们的名字印在演讲文本中，不容忽视。斯大林同意并给予全权委托。

Beria travels to Moscow to take part in the ultimate tribute to the novelist and playwright. During the following days, Lavrenti submits to Stalin the draft of a severe plan in accordance with the recent directives of the dictator concerning the Caucasus. The Transcaucasian Federation will be abolished, while Azerbaijan, Georgia and Armenia will be individually incorporated into the USSR as miniature Soviet republics. A change of this magnitude cannot be achieved without a purge carried out among the old Caucasian Bolsheviks and among several current leaders. This task is entrusted to Lavrenti Pavlovich Beria. Beria also pointed out to Stalin the names of certain Georgian revolutionaries whom the dictator had introduced years earlier as his mentors and teachers in one of his speeches in Tiflis. Now the first secretary of the Transcaucasian Committee suggests the liquidation of these men since their names, printed in the text of the speech, cannot be ignored. Stalin agrees and gives carte blanche.
