Not a word about the slogan "Long live the Transcaucasian Federation!" because the Transcaucasian Federation is now dead. But this corrected report tells its readers that the whole audience stood up and applauded Stalin's great constitution a year and a half before it was written.

改变几年前的演讲对贝利亚来说只是小事一桩。

Altering a speech made a few years earlier is just a trifle for Beria.

最终，在上级约瑟夫·斯大林的要求下，也为了个人利益，拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚改变了整个苏联共产党的历史。

Ultimately, at the behest of his superior Joseph Stalin as well as for his personal gain, Lavrentiy Pavlovich Beria altered the history of the entire Communist Party of the Soviet Union.

评级

Ratings

34 . LP Beria，论外高加索布尔什维克组织的历史（第 4版 ，外语版，莫斯科，1939 年）。

34 . LP Beria, On the History of Bolshevik Organizations in Transcaucasia (4th edition  , Foreign Language Editions, Moscow, 1939).

第二部分

Second part

莫斯科

Moscow

第29章

Chapter 29

一个惊喜

A suprise

贝利亚乘坐普尔曼马车的头等舱，前排一名保镖，后排一名保镖，贝利亚前往莫斯科。前一天晚上，即 1938 年 7 月 28 日，在梅泰克希城堡进行一次长时间的单独工作期间，他被命令前往首都。斯大林亲自通过电话召见他，向莫斯科汇报。就这样。暂无评论。

In the first-class compartment of his Pullman carriage, one bodyguard posted in the front and another in the back, Beria made his way to Moscow. The previous night, July 28, 1938, during one of his long solitary work sessions at Metekhi Castle, he was ordered to the capital. Stalin summoned him personally, by telephone, to report to Moscow. And that's all. No comments.

离开前，贝利亚告诉妻子，他将像往常一样进行一次例行旅行，但没有透露要去哪里或持续多长时间。它的任务始终是保密的。他像往常一样以冷漠的神情宣布了这次新的旅行。然而，拉夫连季在莫斯科被捕后，他向他最亲密的合作者之一博格丹·科布洛夫发出命令，要求立即销毁他精心编制的绝密档案，其中包含从假证人那里勒索的证词、捏造的文件和其他证物。针对的是某些仍在党内担任高级职务的人。

Before leaving, Beria tells his wife that he is leaving for a routine trip as he often undertakes, he does not say where he is going or for how long. Its missions are always confidential. He announces this new trip with an air of indifference as usual. However, in the event that Lavrenti were arrested in Moscow, he gave one of his closest collaborators, Bogdan Kobulov, the order to immediately destroy the ultra-secret files meticulously compiled by him and containing testimonies extorted from false witnesses, fabricated documents and other exhibits directed against certain people who still hold high positions in the Party.

上了火车后，拉夫伦蒂的矛盾情绪开始沸腾。他几乎不必期待克里姆林宫会受到愉快的欢迎。斯大林不是那种喜欢讨好人的人，尤其是当他命令下属当场出现，不给他任何解释的时候。

Once on the train, Lavrenti begins to boil with contradictory feelings. He hardly had to expect a pleasant welcome at the Kremlin. Stalin is not the kind of man who likes to please people, especially when he orders a subordinate to show up on the spot without giving him a word of explanation.

火车的轮子有节奏地撞击着铁轨，一次又一次地发出无休止的震动，发出干燥、单调的声音。同样，贝利亚的脑海中不断浮现同样的想法，一遍又一遍地问同样的问题，这问题在他的太阳穴中嗡嗡作响。这次传票的理由是什么？

The wheels of the train hit the rails rhythmically, producing the endless jerks of a dry, monotonous sound, again and again. In the same way, Beria's mind rolls over the same thought, asks again and again the same question that buzzes in his temples. What is the reason for this summons?

贝利亚试图扪心自问。他没有发现任何罪恶、罪行或过失可以让他受到惩罚。但你不一定非得犯罪才能被逮捕和清算。贝利亚非常清楚这一点，不仅从他自己的活动中，而且从所有针对老布尔什维克的重大诉讼中。拉夫连季充分意识到，叶若夫本人憎恨统治高加索地区的强大对手。几个月前，贝利亚得知他的名字出现在叶若夫的禁止名单上。后者命令拉夫伦蒂的一名助手谢尔盖·戈利泽逮捕贝利亚。在这份机密的个人备忘录中，叶若夫向戈格利泽明确表示，当他逮捕了他的上级时，他将接替他的位置。然而在他原始的心态下，叶乔夫没有意识到，贝利亚和他的同伴是一个如此紧密的集团，他们每个人都陷入困境似乎比互相图谋阴谋要好。戈利泽相信，作为贝利亚的副手，与担任高层相比，他将拥有更多的权力和财富，而且生命风险更小。

Beria tries to examine her conscience. He finds no sin, no crime, no fault for which he can be punished. But you don't necessarily have to commit a crime to be arrested and liquidated. Beria knows this perfectly well, not only from his own activities, but also from all the great lawsuits against the old Bolsheviks. Lavrenti is fully aware that Yezhov hates, in his person, the powerful rival who reigns over the Caucasus. A few months earlier, Beria learned that his name was on Yezhov's proscription lists. The latter had ordered one of Lavrenti's assistants, Sergei Goglidze, to arrest Beria. In this confidential and personal memorandum, Yezhov made it clear to Goglidze that, when he had arrested his superior, he would take his place. In his primitive mentality, however, Yejov hadn't realized that Beria and his companions were such a tight-knit clique that it seemed better for each of them to get bogged down together than to plot intrigues against each other. Goglidze believed that as Beria's deputy he would have more power and wealth, with less risk to his life, than if he were at the top.

正是本着这种精神，戈格利泽没有逮捕他的老板，而是向他出示了逮捕令。拉夫连季立即以米尔·贾法尔·巴吉罗夫领导的当地内务人民委员部正式视察为借口赶往巴库，而戈利泽则发电报耶约夫称，由于贝利亚不在格鲁吉亚，他无法执行命令。

It was in this spirit that Goglidze, instead of arresting his boss, had shown him the arrest warrant. Lavrenti immediately rushed to Baku under the pretext of an official inspection by the local NKVD led by Mir Djaffar Bagirov, while Goglidze telegraphed Yejov that he could not carry out the orders because Beria was not in Georgia.

拉夫连季从阿塞拜疆给身在莫斯科的米高扬和莫洛托夫打电话，与斯大林进行交涉，并说服他贝利亚正在准备一些文章，以纳入正在编写的《斯大林全集》 。在这种情况下，消灭贝利亚就会伤害伟大的斯大林同志。

From Azerbaijan, Lavrenti had telephoned Mikoyan and Molotov, both in Moscow, to intervene with Stalin and persuade him that Beria was preparing some articles for inclusion in the Complete Works of Stalin being prepared. Under these conditions, the liquidation of Beria would harm the great comrade Stalin.

就在他收到米高扬的消息称独裁者饶了贝利亚的性命并且拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇仍然受到支持的第二天，贝利亚前往莫斯科，向这位伟大领袖提出了出版斯大林全集的计划。逮捕的威胁得以避免，贝利亚可以像以前一样强大地返回第比利斯。

The day after he received word from Mikoyan that the dictator was sparing Beria's life and that Lavrentiy Pavlovich remained in favor, Beria went to Moscow and presented to the great leader a plan to publish Stalin's Complete Works . The threat of arrest was averted and Beria could return to Tbilisi as powerful as before.

贝利亚必须忍受的唯一不便是接受来自莫斯科的新代表。负责监视的看门狗是斯坦尼斯拉夫·雷登斯（Stanislav Redens），他是内务人民委员部最残忍、最残暴的领导人之一，经常在毫无意义的愤怒中盲目处决人。这种方法，或者更确切地说，这种方法的缺乏，是贝利亚巧妙而系统的政策所不知道的，贝利亚只清除那些可能对斯大林、政权或他本人构成真正危险的人。贝利亚明白，雷登斯被指派到他的政府，并不是因为克里姆林宫和叶约夫怀疑拉夫连季的专制和顽固，而是因为他们想任命一名间谍。

The only inconvenience Beria had to endure was accepting a new deputy from Moscow. The watchdog assigned to surveillance was Stanislav Redens, one of the most cruel and brutal leaders of the NKVD, who often executed people in the blindness of senseless anger. This method, or rather this lack of method, was unknown to the skilful and systematic policy of Beria, who only liquidated people who were likely to become truly dangerous for Stalin, for the regime or for himself. Beria understood that Redens had been assigned to his administration not because the Kremlin and Yejov doubted that Lavrenti was authoritarian and inflexible enough, but because they wanted to have a spy in place.

因此，贝利亚必须对雷登斯和他的妻子非常外交。为了向他们表达对伟大同志斯大林父母的尊重，拉夫连季为他们在第比利斯郊区找到了一座带花园的舒适房子和索契最豪华的别墅。他还经常向他们发出去歌剧院包厢的邀请。贝利亚知道每个男人都有自己的弱点，并发现斯坦尼斯拉夫·雷登斯喜欢女孩和伏特加。拉夫伦蒂立即把他介绍给了他的一些朋友，这些朋友都是有着相同品味的单身汉。不用说，这些快乐的伙伴都是贝利亚的特工。他们在特别资金的帮助下，在雷登斯的陪伴下，在歌舞厅里花钱，贝利亚的新副手在妓女的簇拥下，像水手一样喝酒、争吵、打碎镜子、拆毁家具、侮辱房屋。所有这些丑闻都是为了败坏雷登斯的声誉，并让他尽快被召回莫斯科接受审判和清洗。

Therefore, Beria had to be very diplomatic with Redens and his wife. Showing them the respect due to the parents of great comrade Stalin, Lavrenti had found them a comfortable house with a garden, in the suburbs of Tbilisi and the most luxurious villa in Sochi. He also frequently sent them invitations to the opera box. Knowing that every man has his weaknesses, Beria had discovered that Stanislav Redens liked girls and vodka. Lavrenti immediately introduced him to some of his friends, bachelors sharing the same tastes. Needless to say, these merry companions were agents of Beria; supplied by special funds, they spent their money in the company of Redens in the cabarets where Beria's new deputy, surrounded by prostitutes, drank like a sailor and quarreled, smashing mirrors, demolishing furniture and degrading the premises. All these scandals were organized to discredit Redens and to have him recalled as quickly as possible to Moscow to be tried and purged.

雷登斯的任命并不是贝利亚逃脱的第一个陷阱。一年半前，卫生部政委格里戈里·米哈伊洛维奇·卡明斯基博士在莫斯科举行的中央委员会会议上谴责贝利亚是为阿塞拜疆穆萨瓦蒂民族主义团体服务的前特工。但卡明斯基是一位学者，斯大林不喜欢受过高等教育的人。他称它们为“oumniyé douraky”、“疯狂科学家”。在发表反对贝利亚的演讲的同一天，卡明斯基被捕并被处决。作为一名老而忠诚的布尔什维克，卡明斯基坦率地说，他并不怀疑斯大林知道贝利亚是阿塞拜疆民族主义党以及孟什维克的成员，但拉夫连季却以间谍和煽动者的身份加入了他们。奥尔忠尼启泽、基洛夫和米高扬的充分和完全批准。此外，斯大林年轻时曾偶尔在国家安全局服役。所以当他得知还有人在敌营当过特工时，他并不感到震惊。卡明斯基攻击贝利亚表现出了勇气，但他也为自己的天真付出了沉重的代价。卡明斯基的悲痛还有另一个原因：作为卫生委员，他主持的医师学院签署了奥尔忠尼启则的死亡证明，宣布死因是心脏麻痹，尽管事实可能是“亲爱的塞尔戈”的死因截然不同。为了防止卡明斯基随后发表其他意见，他必须永远保持沉默。

The appointment of Redens was not the first trap Beria escaped. A year and a half earlier, the Commissar of Health, Dr. Grigory Mikhailovich Kaminsky, had denounced Beria, during a meeting of the Central Committee in Moscow, as a former secret agent in the service of the Azerbaijani nationalist group of Musavatists. But Kaminski was a scholar, and Stalin didn't like highly educated people. He called them oumniyé douraky, “mad scientists”. The same day he delivered his speech against Beria, Kaminski was arrested and executed. In his frankness as an old and loyal Bolshevik, Kaminski had not suspected that Stalin knew of Beria's membership of the nationalist party of Azerbaijan, as well as that of the Mensheviks, but that Lavrenty had joined them in as a spy and a provocateur with the full and complete approval of Ordzhonikidze, Kirov and Mikoyan. Also, in his youth, Stalin had himself occasionally served in the Okhranaso he was not shocked to learn that someone else had worked as an agent in the enemy camp. Kaminski had shown courage by attacking Beria, but he had paid dearly for his naivety. Kaminski was to be devastated for yet another reason: as Commissar of Health, he had presided over the college of physicians who had signed Ordzhonikidze's death certificate, declaring the cause of death to be paralysis of the heart, in despite the fact that there could be very different causes for the death of "dear Sergo". To prevent Kaminski from expressing another opinion later, he had to be silenced forever.

但目前看来，贝利亚没有前两起案件那么幸运。也许叶乔夫这次会成功。谁知道 ？贝利亚将根据斯大林的命令被处决，因为他进行了虚假的谴责，或者将他的位置让给了另一个人，例如马林科夫或赫鲁晓夫。

But, as it seems at the moment, Beria is less fortunate than in the two previous cases. Maybe Yejov will succeed this time. Who knows ? Beria will be executed on Stalin's order because of a false denunciation or to give his place to another, for example Malenkov or Khrushchev.

贝利亚距离莫斯科每前进一公里，他就会觉得自己正在接近莫斯科监狱之一的死囚牢房：卢比扬卡监狱、莱福托沃监狱或布特尔基监狱。拉夫伦蒂决定不再被动屈服。

Every kilometer that brings Beria closer to Moscow makes him think that he is approaching the death cell of one of the Moscow prisons: Lubyanka, Lefortovo or Boutyrki. Lavrenti decides not to submit passively.

他一直厌恶斯大林，这个没有礼貌、没有文化、没有受过训练或教育、被神学院拒之门外的粗人，那个死不悔改的混蛋，他的呼吸里充满着廉价黑烟、大蒜和消化不良的臭味。当你和他说话或听他说话时，不再看他长满天花的黑脸，或者他邪恶的小眼睛，就足以被怀疑有阴谋，并被这个看到针对自己的阴谋的疯子判处死刑。

He always loathed Stalin, that boor without manners, without culture, without training or education, that reject from theological school, that unrepentant bastard whose breath stinks of cheap black tobacco, garlic and the whiff of indigestion. . It is enough to stop looking at his dark face, marked by smallpox, or his wicked little eyes, while talking to him or listening to him, to be suspected of conspiracy and condemned to death by this maniac who sees plots against himself.

从第一次听说斯大林的那一刻起，贝利亚就恨他。他嫉妒他的地位、他的荣耀和他的权力。但他鄙视伟大的斯大林同志，因为他在《外高加索布尔什维克组织史》中赞扬独裁者时不得不舔靴子。现在他很可能会被监禁并被处决。当他思考这一命运时，他感觉到膝盖上戴着一条宽大的毛巾。在这个过时的黑色皮革公文包中，贝利亚在许多文件和文件中保留了纳甘（Nagan），即军用左轮手枪。格鲁吉亚安全负责人携带武器并没有什么异常，即使他穿着拉夫伦蒂喜欢穿的便装。如果与上级的谈话采取审讯的形式，这只能是他被捕和处决的前奏，贝利亚决心假装他想出示一些文件，并从公文包中取出手枪进行射击。审讯者。

From the first moment he heard of Stalin, Beria hated him. He envies his position, his glory and his power. But he despises great comrade Stalin because he had to lick the dictator's boots while praising him in History of the Bolshevik Organizations of Transcaucasia. And now he will probably be imprisoned and executed. As he contemplates this fate, he feels the voluminous towel he wears on his knees. In this obsolete black leather briefcase, Beria keeps, among many papers and documents, the Nagan, the service revolver. There is nothing abnormal in the head of Georgian security carrying a weapon, even when he is in civilian clothes, the outfit that Lavrenti prefers to wear. In the event that the conversation with his superior takes the form of an interrogation, which could only be the prelude to his arrest and execution, Beria is determined to pretend that he wants to show some papers and to extract the pistol from his briefcase to fire the interrogator.

至少，在被送去行刑队之前，他会因为杀了这个肮脏的宗宪太郎这个王八蛋而感到满足。然后我们会处决他吗？有什么关系！无论如何，如果一个愚蠢的枪声响起，一个人的生活还算什么！足以改变他的整个宇宙吗？不再有恐惧，不再有担忧！所有问题都立即解决，一劳永逸。贝利亚恢复了往常的镇静。

At least, before being sent to the firing squad, he would have had the satisfaction of having killed this filthy souken syn , this son of a bitch. We would then execute him? What does it matter! Anyway, what's a man's life if a stupid gunshot puff! enough to change his whole universe? No more fears, no more worries! All problems are solved at once, once and for all. Beria regains her usual poise and composure.

这是一段漫长的旅程。经过三天的旅途，火车终于进入了苏联首都喀山的广阔车站。贝利亚和他的两个同伴从舒适的铂尔曼酒店下来。灰色的黎明在莫斯科的寒冷中迎接他们。这三名旅客来自炎热的高加索地区，匆匆穿过车站，但立即一名内务人民委员部官员走近他们。他热情地行礼，自我介绍为博布罗夫上校，并请贝利亚同志跟随他上车。拉夫伦蒂解散了警卫，命令他们下午到贝利亚通常下榻的精选酒店报到。然后他和他的向导一起离开。

It's a long trip. After three days on the road, the train finally enters the vast station of Kazan, in the Soviet capital. Beria and his two companions descend from their cozy Pullman. The gray dawn greets them in the Moscow cold. The three travellers, come from the heat of the Caucasus, hurry through the station, but immediately an officer of the NKVD approaches them. Saluting warmly, he introduces himself as Colonel Bobrov and asks Comrade Beria to follow him to the car. Lavrenti dismisses his guards, ordering them to report in the afternoon at the Select hotel where Beria usually stays. Then he leaves with his guide.

他们从巨大的车站出来，穿过马路。再往前走，一辆黑色豪华轿车正在等候。博布罗夫上校打开门，带贝利亚上楼。然后，他穿着平民制服，坐在司机旁边。汽车启动了。

They come out of the huge station and cross the street. Further on, a black limousine is waiting. Colonel Bobrov opens the door and brings Beria upstairs. He then takes his place next to the driver dressed in civilian livery. The car starts.

宽敞的汽车里，一个矮胖的男人正在等待贝利亚。他的黑色夹克搭配白色束腰外衣、黑色罩衫和高筒靴让他看起来像一只企鹅。圆圆的脸上满是肃穆，男人伸出手来迎接新人。

A short, fat man was waiting for Beria in the spacious automobile. His black jacket over his white tunic, his black kepi and his high boots make him look like a penguin. His round face full of solemnity, the man holds out his hand to greet the newcomer.

他们像两个熟人一样握手。贝利亚很了解这个角色。据官方新闻稿称，正是斯大林著名的机要秘书亚历山大·波斯克列比切夫将军，他赶到了斯大林的妻子娜杰日达刚刚被发现的地方，娜杰日达是急性阑尾炎的受害者。死的。

They shake hands like two acquaintances. Beria knows this character well. It was Stalin's famous confidential secretary, General Alexander Poskrebychev, the same man who rushed to the place where Nadezhda, Stalin's wife, had just been found, victim of acute appendicitis, according to the official press release. , but in reality shot and left for dead.

尽管伤口并不致命，但波斯克列比切夫不允许叫医生。他拿起左轮手枪，命令清理地板上的血迹。娜杰日达不久后就去世了。后来，波斯克列比切夫和斯大林在这位伟大作家去世前不久拜访了高尔基。波斯克列比切夫还陪同斯大林前往列宁格勒，调查由斯大林精心策划的基洛夫刺杀案，如果有人认为这些圈子与独裁者关系密切的话。正是那个胖小个子来他的公寓看望“亲爱的塞尔戈”。奥尔忠尼启则离开后不久就被发现死亡。与波斯克列比切夫的会面总是有意义的，但从来不吸引人。这位官员不仅是斯大林的私人秘书，也是党书记处秘密部特科科长。这就是为什么，作为负责不经审判就清算最重要人物的心腹，他不仅比贝利亚更强大，甚至比秘密警察局长叶若夫还要强大。

Poskrebychev had not allowed a doctor to be called, although the wound was not fatal. He had picked up the revolver and ordered the bloodstains on the floor to be cleaned. Nadezhda died soon after. Later, Poskrebychev, along with Stalin, visited Gorky moments before the great writer died. Poskrebychev had also accompanied Stalin to Leningrad to investigate the assassination of Kirov, orchestrated by Stalin if one believes the circles close to the dictator. And it was the same fat little man who came to see "dear Sergo" in his apartment. Shortly after his departure Ordzhonikidze was found dead. Meeting Poskrebychev is always meaningful, but never engaging. This officer is not only Stalin's private secretary, but also the head of the Special Section of the Secret Department of the Party Secretariat. This is why, being the confidant in charge of liquidating the most eminent personalities without trial, he is not only more powerful than Beria, but even than Yezhov, chief of the secret police.

贝利亚和波斯克列比切夫并排坐在大型豪华轿车里，静静地穿过莫斯科。斯大林的秘书是个沉默寡言的人。他不喜欢八卦。

Beria and Poskrebychev, seated side by side in the big limousine, silently cross Moscow. Stalin's secretary is a taciturn man. He doesn't like gossip.

到达红场后，汽车继续前行，没有转向卢比扬卡监狱所在的捷尔任斯基街，贝利亚感到如释重负。

Beria feels great relief when, having reached Red Square, the car continues on its way without turning towards Dzerzhinsky Street where the Lubyanka prison is located.

他们穿过克里姆林宫的斯帕斯基门，停在主楼前。拉夫连季在波斯克列比切夫的带领下进入大厅，博布罗夫上校紧随其后。一名中尉帮助他们脱下大衣，在克里姆林宫安全负责人、负责斯大林生活的彼得·科辛金将军的注视下，礼貌但坚定地接过贝利亚的公文包。

They go through the Spasski Gate in the Kremlin and stop in front of the main building. Led by Poskrebychev, Colonel Bobrov at his heels, Lavrenti enters the hall. A lieutenant helps them remove their overcoats and, under the watchful eye of General Pyotr Kossynkin, head of Kremlin security and responsible for Stalin's life, politely but firmly takes Beria's briefcase.

波斯克列比切夫上前向斯大林报告他们的到来。贝利亚在博布罗夫上校的陪同下进入前厅。他并没有等太久。很快大厅里的电话就响了，过了一会儿，警卫过来宣布，斯大林同志要见外高加索党委第一书记拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚。

Poskrebychev goes up to announce their arrival to Stalin. Beria, accompanied by Colonel Bobrov, enters the antechamber. He doesn't wait long. Very soon the telephone rang in the hall, and a moment later the guard came to announce that Comrade Stalin would like to see the First Secretary of the Transcaucasian Party Committee, Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria.

贝利亚站起来，跟随警卫来到二楼。警卫敲门，进入独裁者巨大的内阁。斯大林坐在一张老式桌子后面，靠着后墙，从一个黄色油布袋中取出烟草，将烟草装进烟斗。波斯克列比切夫站在他身边，手里拿着一盒火柴，准备点火。

Beria gets up and follows the guard to the second floor. The guard knocks on the door and enters the dictator's enormous cabinet. Leaning against the back wall, seated behind an old style desk, Stalin stuffs a pipe with tobacco which he extracts from a yellow oilcloth pouch. At his side stands Poskrebychev, a box of matches in his hand, ready to give fire.

斯大林点点头，将贝利亚拉近，并把他指到办公桌前的一把椅子上。他用秘书递给他的火柴点燃烟斗，吸了一口。当向贝利亚询问他的旅行时，他回忆起三天火车上的不适，并回忆起他们美丽的乔治亚州宜人的气候。拉夫伦蒂报以谦逊的微笑，就像一个下属因与老板进行了熟悉的交谈而感到荣幸。然而，他知道上级的礼貌幽默毫无意义。然后，斯大林以同样礼貌的语气宣布，他决定将贝利亚从第比利斯的高位调到卢比扬卡监狱……担任主管职务。他将成为叶乔夫的第一副手、现任内政专员和内务人民委员会主席。

With a nod, Stalin brings Beria closer and points him to a chair in front of his desk. He lights his pipe with the match handed to him by his secretary and takes a puff. Asking Beria about his trip, he evokes the discomfort of three days spent by train and recalls the pleasant climate of their wonderful Georgia. Lavrenti responds with the humble smile of a subordinate honored by a familiar conversation with his boss. He knows, however, that his superior's polite humor means nothing. Then, in the same tone of courtesy, Stalin announces that he has decided to transfer Beria from his high position in Tiflis, to the Lubyanka prison… in the directorial service. He will be Yejov's first deputy, the current interior affairs commissioner and head of the NKVD.

拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇将于第二天开始履行他的新职责。听证会结束了。

Lavrenti Pavlovich will have to take up his new post the following day. The hearing is over.

评级

Ratings

第30章

Chapter 30

在大boss的右边

To the right of the big boss

贝利亚乘坐博布罗夫上校提供的豪华轿车抵达精选酒店，并为他预订了房间。他命令两名保镖返回第比利斯。他很快就会跟随他们。

In the limousine provided to him by Colonel Bobrov, Beria arrives at the Select hotel where a room is reserved for him. He orders his two bodyguards to return to Tiflis. He will follow them soon.

拉夫伦蒂坐在酒店餐厅的一角，一边享用午餐，一边独自思考自己在克里姆林宫的谈话，并试图解开这次意外晋升的秘密。斯大林为什么要任命贝利亚来代替这个不久前还想逮捕和镇压他的叶若夫呢？这种逆转不可能是大老板一时兴起的结果，而是根据世界政治形势深思熟虑的决定的结果。

Sitting in a corner of the hotel restaurant and enjoying his lunch, Lavrenti, alone with himself, thinks of his conversation in the Kremlin and tries to unlock the secret of this unexpected promotion. Why did Stalin appoint Beria deputy to this Yezhov who not long ago wanted to arrest and suppress him? This reversal cannot be the effect of a passing whim of the big boss, but the consequence of a decision carefully considered according to the world political situation.

贝利亚一边嚼着烤肉，一边慷慨地喝着啤酒和伏特加，回顾了过去几个月发生的事情。1938年3月，希特勒军队进入奥地利，并在没有抵抗的情况下征服了它。

Chewing on his roast, generously washed down with beer and vodka, Beria reviews the events of the past few months. In March 1938, Hitler's troops entered Austria and conquered it without resistance.

希特勒公开表明，他不会停止向欧洲进军，在这场不流血的胜利之后，他将继续前进。最近，斯大林必须通过他在波兰的特工获取有关波兰政府防御计划的情报，以防第三帝国的袭击。显然，波兰无意让自己被德国吞并，并决心争取独立。

Hitler openly showed that he would not stop his march on Europe and that, after this bloodless victory, he would push forward. Recently, through his agents in Poland, Stalin had to get intelligence on the Polish government's defense plans in case of attack by the Third Reich. It is obvious that Poland has no intention of allowing itself to be swallowed up by Germany and that it is determined to fight for its independence.

斯大林的私人线人之一是波兰地下共产党 KPP 成员、波兰人弗拉迪斯拉夫·哥穆尔卡 (Vladislav Gomulka)。1934 年和 1935 年，他在莫斯科学习了两年的特殊颠覆课程。通过他，斯大林对波兰的政治气氛以及这个坚定的国家盛行的爱国精神有了清晰而准确的了解。显然，欧洲战争不可避免。它的触发只需几个月的时间。斯大林不会默默地或冷漠地接受这些事件的发生。他知道他必须做好准备：粉碎波兰后，希特勒将越过东部边境袭击苏联。然而，俄罗斯并没有做好战争准备。叶若夫进行了大清洗，屠杀了共产党的高级干部、政治“智囊团”、人民委员及其副手以及其他苏联政府高级官员。几个月前，叶若夫对布哈林、鲁科夫和克列斯汀斯基等著名布尔什维克、老派共产党人和列宁政治局成员，以及前内政部长亚戈达和其他一些人进行了一场壮观的审判。其中包括前对外贸易政委阿卡迪·罗森戈尔茨（Arkadi Rosengoltz），她是在阿布哈兹拉科巴别墅被强奸并谋杀的漂亮叶莲娜的父亲。以及其他苏联政府高级官员。几个月前，叶若夫对布哈林、鲁科夫和克列斯汀斯基等著名布尔什维克、老派共产党人和列宁政治局成员，以及前内政部长亚戈达和其他一些人进行了一场壮观的审判。其中包括前对外贸易政委阿卡迪·罗森戈尔茨（Arkadi Rosengoltz），她是在阿布哈兹拉科巴别墅被强奸并谋杀的漂亮叶莲娜的父亲。以及其他苏联政府高级官员。几个月前，叶若夫对布哈林、鲁科夫和克列斯汀斯基等著名布尔什维克、老派共产党人和列宁政治局成员，以及前内政部长亚戈达和其他一些人进行了一场壮观的审判。其中包括前对外贸易政委阿卡迪·罗森戈尔茨（Arkadi Rosengoltz），她是在阿布哈兹拉科巴别墅被强奸并谋杀的漂亮叶莲娜的父亲。

One of Stalin's personal informants is the Pole Vladislav Gomulka, a member of Poland's underground communist party, the KPP. He spent two years, in 1934 and 1935, attending special subversion courses in Moscow. Through him, Stalin had clear and accurate information on the political atmosphere which reigned in Poland and on the patriotic state of mind which prevailed in this determined nation. It is clear that a war in Europe is inevitable. Its triggering is only a matter of months. Stalin will not accept silently or with indifferent detachment that these events occur. He knows he must be ready: after crushing Poland, Hitler will cross the eastern border and strike the Soviet Union. Russia, however, was not prepared for war. Yezhov, with its great purges, decimated the top cadres of the Communist Party, the political "brain trust" as well as People's Commissars and their deputies, and other senior Soviet government officials. A few months earlier, Yezhov staged a spectacular trial against such prominent Bolsheviks as Bukharin, Rukov, and Krestinsky, old guard Communists and members of Lenin's Politburo, as well as Yagoda, former head of Internal Affairs, and a few others. . Among them was the former Commissar for Foreign Trade, Arkadi Rosengoltz, the father of this pretty Yelena who was raped and murdered in the villa of Lakoba in Abkhazia. and other senior Soviet government officials. A few months earlier, Yezhov staged a spectacular trial against such prominent Bolsheviks as Bukharin, Rukov, and Krestinsky, old guard Communists and members of Lenin's Politburo, as well as Yagoda, former head of Internal Affairs, and a few others. . Among them was the former Commissar for Foreign Trade, Arkadi Rosengoltz, the father of this pretty Yelena who was raped and murdered in the villa of Lakoba in Abkhazia. and other senior Soviet government officials. A few months earlier, Yezhov staged a spectacular trial against such prominent Bolsheviks as Bukharin, Rukov, and Krestinsky, old guard Communists and members of Lenin's Politburo, as well as Yagoda, former head of Internal Affairs, and a few others. . Among them was the former Commissar for Foreign Trade, Arkadi Rosengoltz, the father of this pretty Yelena who was raped and murdered in the villa of Lakoba in Abkhazia.

所有这些被告都被指控为托洛茨基主义者、孟什维克、间谍、叛徒和西方国家特务，均被判处死刑并处决。

All these defendants, accused of being Trotskyists, Mensheviks, spies, traitors and agents of Western countries, were condemned to death and executed.

回想起他在苏科米赛马场遇见的罗森戈尔茨被处决的情景，贝利亚忍不住笑了。他曾经是一位有权有势的专员，也是唯一一个能够为女儿被谋杀报仇的人，但他却永远陷入了沉默。

Recalling the execution of Rosengoltz, whom he had met at the horse races in Soukoumi, Beria cannot suppress a smile. Once a powerful commissioner and the only person who can claim revenge for the murder of his daughter, he is reduced to silence forever.

罗森戈尔茨的处决解决了拉夫伦蒂的个人问题。想到国家面临的困难，贝利亚回忆起叶乔夫疯狂的清洗，消灭了许多红军领导人。数十名元帅、数百名将军和数千名上校和少校被逮捕，要么在监狱院子的围墙上处决，要么被驱逐到西伯利亚的劳改营。最优秀的专家、最有天赋的战略家都被淘汰了。被处决的人包括图哈切夫斯基元帅和他的战友科尔克元帅、乌博列维奇元帅、亚基尔元帅、费尔德曼元帅、普里马科夫元帅、艾德曼元帅和普特纳元帅，他们都被指控犯有法西斯主义。不久之后，空军司令阿尔斯克尼斯和海军总司令奥尔洛夫上将被判处死刑，

The execution of Rosengoltz solves Lavrenti's personal problem. Thinking of the difficulties facing the country, Beria remembers that Yejov, with his lunatic purges, wiped out many of the leaders of the Red Army. Dozens of marshals, hundreds of generals and thousands of colonels and majors were arrested and either executed against the walls of prison yards or deported to labor camps in Siberia. The best specialists, the most gifted strategists have been eliminated. Among those executed were Marshal Tukhachevsky and his brothers-in-arms Marshals Kork, Uborevich, Yakir, Feldman, Primakov, Eideman and Putna, all accused of fascism. Shortly after, the head of the air force, Alsknis, and the commander-in-chief of the navy, Admiral Orlov, were sentenced to death,

红军中进行的毫无意义的清洗至少使苏联军事力量减少了百分之三十。对于熟悉情况的人来说，百分之六十或百分之七十的军官被捕，十一名副战争专员和高级战争委员会八十名成员中的七十一名失踪，被驱逐到西伯利亚的劳改营，这已经不是什么秘密了。 。他们还知道，百分之九十的将军，百分之八十的上校都被消灭了。包括特种军官团在内，总共有30,000至35,000人被消灭。

The senseless purges practiced in the Red Army reduced the Soviet military forces by at least thirty percent. To men familiar with the situation, it is no secret that sixty or seventy percent of the officers have been arrested, that eleven Deputy War Commissioners and seventy-one of the eighty members of the Superior War Council have disappeared, deported to labor camps in Siberia. They also know that ninety percent of the generals and eighty percent of the colonels have been eliminated. A total of 30,000 to 35,000 men, including the Specialist Officer Corps, were exterminated.

苏联军队几乎失去了方向。最高指挥部和部队既没有受过训练，也没有纪律。叶若夫的两年权力，被称为“叶若夫希纳”，显然不过是两年的恐怖。

The Soviet army is practically deprived of direction. The high command and the troops are neither trained nor disciplined. Yezhov's two years of power, called Yezhovshchina , are obviously nothing but two years of terror.

当然，这一切都没有得到斯大林的同意。但是，这位独裁者沉迷于与他的生活交织在一起的阴谋，可能受到了耶约夫这条狂犬的影响，他以消灭最重要的人物为乐。

Of course, none of this happened without Stalin's agreement. But, obsessed by the plots woven against his life, the dictator could have been influenced by this rabid dog of Iejov who takes extreme pleasure in exterminating the most important personalities.

但斯大林为何突然决定将贝利亚安置在叶约夫身边呢？很明显，独裁者计划剥夺叶乔夫保护其安全的角色。但出于什么原因呢？贝利亚计算着，寻找解开谜题的钥匙。

But why did Stalin suddenly decide to place Beria with Yejov? It is obvious that the dictator plans to deprive Yejov of the role of guardian of his security. But for what reasons? Beria calculates, looking for the key to the puzzle.

斯大林将如何进行？西班牙内战加速，而缺乏可能为西班牙游击队提供建议的优秀苏联军官将加强佛朗哥将军的法西斯势力。她也会诱惑墨索里尼。所谓的罗马-柏林轴心是希特勒和墨索里尼两年前签署的反共产主义协议。不久之后，纳粹政权与天皇裕仁签署了类似的联盟。第三帝国与日本签订了一项对抗共产国际（共产主义工人国际）的条约。此后，对奥地利的入侵以及纳粹军队以演习为借口缓慢但稳定地集中在波兰边境附近，给苏联带来了真正的危险。

How will Stalin proceed? The civil war in Spain has picked up speed and the lack of good Soviet officers likely to advise the Spanish partisans will strengthen General Franco's fascists. She will also tempt Mussolini. The so-called Rome-Berlin axis is a pact between Hitler and Mussolini signed two years earlier to fight communism. Soon after, the Nazi regime signed a similar alliance with the Mikado Hirohito. The Third Reich established a pact with Japan to fight the Comintern , the Communist Workers' International. Coming after this, the invasion of Austria and the slow, but steady concentration of Nazi troops near the Polish border under the pretext of maneuvers, created a real danger for the Soviet Union.

从现在起，如果斯大林想要生存并确保苏联的拯救，他就不能再接受红军的任何削弱。因此，绝对有必要结束武装部队中的清洗、逮捕和消灭军官，同时必须释放其中那些被驱逐到极北地区的人并恢复其名誉。为了挽回面子，大老板必须在短时间内解雇伊佐夫。斯大林可能不会像对待他的前任亚戈达那样对他进行审判，因为这一逆转将谴责对叶若夫的所有清洗。尽管如此，耶乔夫迟早会被清算。

From now on, if Stalin wants to survive and ensure the salvation of the USSR, he can no longer accept any weakening of the Red Army. It is therefore absolutely necessary to put an end to the purges practiced in the ranks of the armed forces, to the arrests and extermination of officers, while those among them who have been deported to the extreme North must be freed and rehabilitated. To save face, the big boss must dismiss Iezhov at short notice. Stalin will probably not bring him to trial, as he did for his predecessor Yagoda, because this reversal would condemn all the purges of Yezhov. Nevertheless, Yejov will be liquidated sooner or later.

诚然，斯大林并没有停止怀疑他最亲密的朋友想要消灭他。所以他仍然需要像贝利亚这样的人来担任安全局长。但大规模处决应该受到限制并经过深思熟虑。他们需要更有条理地组织起来，旨在获得更多从未犯过的罪行的供词。这很可能就是斯大林把贝利亚带到莫斯科的意图：后者按照独裁者的指示，成功地铲除和消灭了高加索地区所有反对派的细菌。

Admittedly, Stalin did not stop suspecting his closest friends of wanting to eliminate him. So he still needs someone like Beria as Chief of Security. But mass executions should be limited and done with thought. They need to be organized more methodically, designed to get more than confessions to crimes that were never committed. This is very probably the intention with which Stalin brought Beria to Moscow: the latter succeeded, by following the dictator's directives, in uprooting and annihilating all the germs of opposition in the Caucasus.

现在他必须在幅员辽阔的苏联各地做同样的工作。

Now he will have to do the same work all over the vast Soviet Union.

第31章

Chapter 31

净化器中的净化器

The purifier of purifiers

向叶约夫汇报后，贝利亚开始了他的新工作，严肃而平静，仿佛他和新上司之间什么也没发生过。在完美下属的服从下，贝利亚执行了委托给他的所有调查。根据叶若夫的特别命令，拉夫连季突击搜查了共产主义青年团、共青团主席科萨列夫的公寓。，被指控有某些偏差，并亲自逮捕他。贝利亚做这份工作就好像他只是一名警察一样。这是他第一次履行这种职责。但他并不认为这是一种耻辱或低于他的地位。贝利亚并不觉得自己受到了侮辱。他非常清楚，他的处境很快就会改变。当然，斯大林把他从第比利斯召来并不是为了让他成为一个爪牙。

After reporting to Yejov, Beria begins his new job, gravely, calmly, as if nothing had ever happened between him and his new superior. With the submission of a perfect subordinate, Beria carries out all the investigations entrusted to him. On a special order from Yezhov, Lavrenty raids the apartment of Kosarev, chairman of the Communist Youth League, the Komsomol, accused of certain deviations, and arrests him personally. Beria does this job as if he were just a policeman. This is the first time he has fulfilled this kind of duty. But he does not regard it as a dishonor or as something inferior to his rank. Beria does not feel degraded. He knows perfectly well that his situation will soon change. Certainly Stalin did not call him from Tiflis to make him a minion.

事实证明贝利亚的计算是正确的。几个月后，按照拉夫连季的计划，耶约夫被免职，并接受了河运人民委员的新任命。这是走向不可避免的衰落的第一步，因为河运部是一个不重要的行政部门，是一种死胡同。叶约夫的前任亚戈达在受审和处决之前也已调任其他职务。秘密警察局长的空缺职位给了贝利亚。

Beria's calculations turn out to be correct. A few months later, Yejov was removed from his post, as Lavrenty had planned, and received a new assignment as People's Commissar for River Transport. This is the first step towards an inevitable fall, because the Department of River Transport is an administration of little importance, a sort of cul-de-sac. Yejov's predecessor, Yagoda, had also been transferred to another post before being tried and executed. The vacant chair of the head of the secret police is given to Beria.

其新的莫斯科办事处位于捷尔任斯基街的卢比扬卡监狱。贝利亚占据了五个相邻的房间。第一个是打字员，第二个和第三个是贝利亚的助手梅尔库洛夫。第四间是马穆洛夫的办公室，他是梅尔库洛夫的助手，同时也是贝利亚的私人秘书。马穆洛夫的办公室有两扇侧门。左边的通道通往梅尔库洛夫的办公室，右边的通道通往内政委员拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚 (Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria) 居住的房间。

Its new Moscow office is located in the Lubyanka prison, on Dzerzhinsky Street. Beria occupies five adjoining rooms. The first for the typists, the second and the third for Beria's assistant: Merkoulov. The fourth serves as an office for Mamoulov, assistant to Merkulov and, at the same time, private secretary to Beria. Mamoulov's office has two side doors. The one on the left leads to Merkulov's office and the one on the right gives access to the room where the Commissar of Internal Affairs, Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria, is staying.

拉夫伦蒂的办公室很大。主要照明来自安装在角落里的强大的电照明弹。没有窗户。墙壁上挂着厚厚的地毯，以隔音。风扇使空气焕然一新。

Lavrenti's office is huge. The main lighting comes from a powerful electric flare erected in a corner. There are no windows. Thick rugs are hung on the walls to muffle noise. The air is renewed thanks to a fan.

房间中央有一张巨大的桌子，上面有绿色的封面和一盏绿色灯罩的灯。还有三部电话：第一部用于与斯大林直接通话，第二部用于政委和政府行政部门，第三部可拨打苏联任何地区。桌子后面有一张皮革覆盖的大扶手椅。房间里依然摆着一个衣柜、一个大文件柜和两把普通的椅子。扶手椅后面的墙上挂着一幅镶有镀金画框的斯大林大幅肖像，画下方是一张铺着棕色油布的大沙发。

In the middle of the room sits a massive desk with a green cover and a lamp with a green shade. There are also three telephones: the first for a direct line with Stalin, the second for the commissars and the government administration, the third to call any region of the USSR. Behind the desk awaits a large armchair covered in leather. The room is still furnished with a cupboard, a large filing cabinet and two ordinary chairs. A large portrait of Stalin, in a gilt frame, hangs on the wall behind the armchair, and below the picture is a large sofa covered in brown oilcloth.

六周的时间让贝利亚能够以足够有效的方式组织他的工作，让苏联人民看到进步并更自由地呼吸。

Six weeks allows Beria to organize his work in a way efficient enough for the Soviet people to see improvements and breathe more freely.

新任秘密警察负责人采取的第一步就是逮捕了几乎所有前任的合作者以及几名在叶乔夫直接命令下工作的内务人民委员部官员。这一举动让全国人民都松了口气。人们相信，可怕的叶若夫希奇纳时代已经永远消失了。从这一点来看，很快被称为“净化者中的净化者”的贝利亚就以救世主的身份出现了。然而，事实上，拉夫连季将这些官员送进监狱，因为作为叶若夫的人，只要叶若夫还活着，他们实际上就是他的敌人。他也不能指望他们愿意与他合作。对贝利亚来说，净化净化器首先是一种自卫姿态。这就是为什么他没有逮捕或解雇安德烈·维辛斯基（Andrei Vyshinsky），这位检察官在审判老布尔什维克时做得很好。这位俄罗斯法学家才华横溢，但性格却异常残忍，对苏联安全部门的首脑来说是有用的。因此，明智的做法是让他留在自己的位置上，甚至与他成为朋友。贝利亚还饶恕了维克多·阿巴库莫夫（Victor Abakumov）和秘密警察将军谢尔盖·尼基福罗维奇·克鲁格洛夫（Sergei Nikiforovitch Krouglov）的生命，维克托·阿巴库莫夫是一位经验丰富的高级军官，也是一位老契卡斯特。像阿巴库莫夫和克鲁格洛夫这样的人对于新任国家安全委员来说总是非常有用的。

The first step taken by the new head of the secret police was the arrest of almost all of his predecessor's collaborators and several NKVD officers who worked under Yejov's direct orders. This gesture is greeted with great relief by the entire nation. The people believe that the era of the horrible Yezhovshchinais gone forever. From this point of view, Beria, soon called the “purifier of purifiers”, appears as a savior. In reality, however, Lavrenti sends these officials to prison because, being men of Yezhov, they are virtually his enemies as long as Yezhov remains alive. Nor can he count on them to collaborate willingly with him. Purifying the purifiers is above all a gesture of self-defense for Beria. That is why he does not arrest or dismiss Andrei Vyshinsky, the public prosecutor who did such a good job of accusing the old Bolsheviks during their show trials. This Russian jurist, with a brilliant intelligence, but with an extraordinarily cruel character, can prove useful to the head of the Soviet Security. It is therefore wise to keep him in his position and even to make a friend of him. Beria also spared the life of Victor Abakumov, a highly experienced senior officer, an old Chekist, and that of secret police general Sergei Nikiforovitch Krouglov, the executioner who, during the great purges, executed several eminent Soviet personalities, in particular Marshal Tukhachevsky. Men like Abakumov and Krouglov can always be very useful to the new Commissar of State Security.

不久之后，在莫斯科、列宁格勒和基辅以及其他城市，针对数十名前内务人民委员部高级官员提起了一系列堪称典范的诉讼，这些官员在执行叶若夫的命令时，从无辜者那里逼供。对公众的审判毫无疑问地确定了他们的罪行，令苏联人民普遍满意的是，被告被判处死刑并被处决。

Soon after, in Moscow, Leningrad and Kiev, as well as in other cities, a number of exemplary lawsuits were brought against dozens of former senior NKVD officers who, in carrying out Yezhov's orders, extracted confessions from innocent people. Their trials, open to the public, established their guilt without any doubt and, to the general satisfaction of the Soviet people, the accused were condemned to death and executed.

与此同时，贝利亚检查了过去两年被驱逐到西伯利亚和苏联其他地区的囚犯的记录。其中有数以千计的无辜群众，有来自偏远村庄的贫苦文盲农民，还有全国各地小城镇的无害居民。这些人被逮捕和流放只是因为他们没有足够尊重地迎接当地民兵，或者因为有人看到他们与被捕者的父母交谈，或者因为他们喝得有点醉，晚上唱歌太大声。这些叶若夫官员的受害者被释放并被允许返回家园。

Meanwhile, Beria checks the records of prisoners deported to Siberia and other parts of the USSR over the past two years. Among them are thousands of innocent people, poor illiterate peasants from remote villages and harmless inhabitants of small towns all over the country. These people were arrested and exiled simply because they did not greet a local militiaman with enough respect or because they were seen talking with the parents of an arrested person or because, a little drunk, they sang too loudly at night. These victims of Yezhov officials are released and allowed to return home.

贝利亚还免除了集中营中数百名红军军官以及几乎所有被叶若夫驱逐的安全人员和高级官员的责任，因为他们是他前任的忠实支持者。尽管其中一些人因实际犯罪而被判处几年劳教，但他们还是被释放了。贝利亚不仅决定释放这些警察和特工，而且还让他们恢复原来的职位。拉夫连季通过这一举动，使这些人成为他的干部中最忠诚的部分，也是叶若夫政权的死敌。贝利亚作为一名认真的学生，亲自检查了每份文件。

Beria also exonerates and liberates from the concentration camps hundreds of Red Army officers and almost all the Security agents and high officials whom Yezhov had deported because they were loyal supporters of his predecessor. They are released although some of them have been sentenced to several years in a labor camp for actually committing crimes. Not only does Beria decide to free these policemen and agents, but he reinstates them in their former positions. By this gesture, Lavrenty made these men the most devoted elements of his cadres and the mortal enemies of the Yezhov regime. Beria personally examines each file with the meticulous application of the conscientious student that he was.

新任安全负责人与独裁者的关系也不同于其前任。叶若夫只是一名下属，一名顽固的警察，向克里姆林宫发送干巴巴的、军事风格的报告，而贝利亚则不那么正式，但充满了尊重。拉夫连季更喜欢亲自陈述自己的情况，因此时不时地去拜访伟大的同志斯大林。但还不够频繁，不足以造成侵扰。在会谈中，贝利亚提出的行动多于要求的指示。然而，他设法歪曲了自己的建议，让这些建议看起来像是来自他的上级。

The relations of the new head of security with the dictator also differ from those of his predecessor. Whereas Yezhov was just a subordinate, a stubborn policeman who sent dry, military-style reports to the Kremlin, Beria is much less formal, yet full of respect. Preferring to present his accounts himself, Lavrenty went to see the great comrade Stalin from time to time. But not often enough to become intrusive. During their talks, Beria offers actions more than he asks for instructions. However, he manages to twist his suggestions so that they seem to come from his superior.

斯大林比这个悲伤而狂热的侏儒叶若夫更欣赏他的格鲁吉亚同胞，叶若夫对待一切事情都很认真，甚至是关押和消灭私人敌人的命令，而这样一个令人愉快的任务应该让他脸上露出微笑。

Stalin appreciates his Georgian compatriot much more than this sad and fanatical dwarf Yezhov who takes everything seriously, even the order to imprison and liquidate a personal enemy when such a pleasant mission should have brought a smile to his face.

有了贝利亚，大老板不仅可以发号施令，还可以开玩笑、请教。斯大林记得在第比利斯的那次晚宴上，唯一对他用热熨斗烧死反对派的提议做出热情回应的人是拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇。

With Beria, the big boss can not only give orders, but also joke and ask for advice. Stalin remembers that dinner in Tiflis where the only person to respond enthusiastically to his proposal to burn the opposition with a hot iron was Lavrenty Pavlovich.

贝利亚知道如何赢得独裁者的青睐。他代表数千名从监狱和集中营获释的匿名人士采取的自由行动并不意味着拉夫伦蒂完全停止进行夜间逮捕和审讯。除了监禁和处决为叶若夫服务的合作者和刽子手之外，贝利亚还寻找替罪羊，向他的上级证明，他拉夫连季照顾着伟大同志、国家领导人的安全。贝利亚时刻牢记斯大林对被暗杀的恐惧。他也无意治愈他的这种痴迷。

And Beria knows how to insinuate himself into the dictator's good graces. His liberal action on behalf of thousands of anonymous people released from prisons and concentration camps does not imply that Lavrenti completely ceases to carry out arrests and interrogations at night. Besides the incarceration and execution of the collaborators and executioners in the service of Yezhov, Beria still finds scapegoats to prove to his superior that he, Lavrenti, takes care of the security of the great comrade, leader of the nation. Beria constantly kept in mind Stalin's fear of being assassinated. And he has no intention of curing him of this obsession.

尽管新职责繁重，常常迫使他每天工作十八个小时，但贝利亚并没有忽视他的个人事务。他抽出时间返回第比利斯，不仅是为了完成在高加索地区的公务，也是为了将家人和财产转移到莫斯科的新住所。拉夫连蒂在保留格鲁吉亚首都郊区的别墅和市中心舒适的公寓的同时，选择了莫斯科市中心卡恰洛夫街28号的一栋两层大房子和郊区的豪华别墅。首都的。

Despite the heaviness of his new duties, which often force him to work eighteen hours a day, Beria does not neglect his personal affairs. He found time to return to Tiflis, not only to complete his official work in the Caucasus, but also to transfer his family and possessions to his new residence in Moscow. While keeping his villa on the outskirts of the Georgian capital, as well as his comfortable apartment in the city center, Lavrenty chose a large two-storey house at 28 Katchalov Street, in the heart of Moscow, and a luxurious dacha on the outskirts . of the capital.

第比利斯的两栋房屋是贝利亚通过除掉业主而获得的。他在莫斯科附近的别墅也是以同样的方式获得的。

The two houses in Tiflis were obtained by Beria by removing their owners. His villa near Moscow was acquired in the same way.

距离斯大林在昆采沃的住所不远，有一栋房子是乌克兰前布尔什维克领导人弗拉斯·雅科夫列维奇·丘巴尔（Vlas Yakovlevich Chubar）居住的。这座房子是一栋美丽而宽敞的建筑，由一位建筑师建造，他为斯大林建造了几栋别墅。贝利亚决定占用这座住宅。丘巴尔确实是一位忠诚的布尔什维克，革命后不久就成为炮兵委员，然后在乌克兰担任过几个重要职务，最后被调往莫斯科作为政治局候选人。但它有一个缺陷。他是一位老守卫布尔什维克，在革命前十多年前就开始了共产主义活动，他知道斯大林在实现共产主义中所扮演的角色的真相。这不能取悦独裁者。贝利亚毫不费力地说服了他的上级，让他相信丘巴尔是一个危险人物，他正在中央委员会领导一场反对斯大林的运动。乔巴尔在夜间被捕，被带到卢比安卡监狱并由贝利亚亲自审讯。该男子因此得知自己是叛徒，犯下了他从未想过的罪行。然而并没有执行在镜头前也没有被绳之以法。他仍然太杰出了，不会被当场枪杀或被拖入一场壮观的审判。贝利亚凭借全新的自由主义精神赢得了“净化者中的净化者”的绰号，他不想效仿叶若夫。最好是悄悄地、悄悄地将楚巴尔从交通中移除。1938年，他就是这样以世界上最简单的方式消失在西伯利亚。第二天，他的家人被捕并被驱逐到另一个目的地。

Not far from Stalin's residence in Kuntsevo is a house inhabited by Vlas Yakovlevich Chubar, former Bolshevik leader of Ukraine. This house, a beautiful and vast property, was built by an architect who created several villas for Stalin. Beria decides to appropriate this residence. It is true that Chubar is a devoted Bolshevik who became Commissar of Artillery shortly after the Revolution and then occupied several important posts in Ukraine before being transferred to Moscow as a candidate for the Politburo. But it has a flaw. He is an old guard Bolshevik and, having begun his communist activities more than ten years before the Revolution, he knows the truth about Stalin's role in bringing about communism. This cannot please the dictator. Beria had no great difficulty in convincing his superior that Chubar was a dangerous figure who was leading an opposition movement to Stalin in the Central Committee. Tchoubar is arrested at night, taken to the Lubianka prison and interrogated by Beria in person. The man thus learns that he is a traitor, guilty of a crime he never even thought of. However, it is not executedin camera nor brought to justice. He is still too prominent to be shot on the spot or dragged into a spectacular trial. Beria, with the brand-new liberalism that earned him his nickname of "purifier of purifiers", does not want to imitate Yezhov. It is much better to remove Chubar from traffic quietly and quietly. This is how, in 1938, he disappeared in the simplest way in the world, in Siberia. His family was arrested the next day and deported to another destination.

紧接着，贝利亚进入了空置的土地，并从第比利斯带来了他的妻子尼娜和他们的小男孩。

Immediately after, Beria enters the vacant property and brings from Tiflis his wife Nina and their little boy.

第32章

Chapter 32

奴隶贩子

The slave trader

从北部的西伯利亚到南部的中国边境，所有劳改营的指挥官都开始向位于莫斯科的贝利亚总部发送这些报告，这些报告令人担忧。

The reports, which are beginning to be sent to the Beria headquarters in Moscow by the commanders of all the labor camps, from Siberia in the north to the Chinese border in the south, are more than worrying.

虽然在释放命令到达营地之前不久就可以释放被驱逐出境的人，但两年前抵达的囚犯几乎全部死亡。这次非正式特赦的结果是，只有百分之三十以上的罪犯被释放。高死亡率迫使贝利亚调查难民营的生活条件。拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇并不是担心囚犯，而是对人力的流失感兴趣。

While it is possible to release people who were deported shortly before the order to release them reached their camp, the prisoners who arrived two years earlier are almost all dead. As a result of this unofficial amnesty, just over thirty percent of convicts are released. This high mortality pushes Beria to look into the living conditions in the camps. Not that Lavrenti Pavlovich is worried about the prisoners, but he is interested in the loss of manpower.

在重组内务办公室的同时，贝利亚开始研究莫斯科三座监狱：卢比扬卡监狱、莱福尔托沃监狱和布蒂尔基监狱的规定和制度。他发现那里的条件很悲惨。拉夫伦季立即下令立即重新打开按照叶乔夫的命令密封的牢房窗户。贝利亚还改进了食物，在他的前任领导下，食物只有一个面包和一些味道像泔水的汤。然而，这些自由主义措施都不是出于对俘虏的同情。贝利亚认为，虽然囚犯随后将被驱逐到劳改营，但仅仅让他们活着还不够。囚犯必须有足够的力量才能工作。否则，根本不值得喂它们。流放地不是像纳粹集中营那样的灭绝营，而是奴隶必须努力建设更大更强的苏联国家的地方。如果他们虚弱得像苍蝇一样死去，那么把他们送到那里就没有意义了。如果囚犯不能正常工作并且一事无成，那么驱逐越来越多的囚犯是没有意义的。这种体力劳动的收益是首先要考虑的事情。这些营地位于西伯利亚的森林中，人们为了整个国家的利益甚至为了出口而砍伐树木。或者囚犯被送往苏联其他偏远角落，在煤矿、铁矿、铜矿、石棉矿、银矿或金矿工作。他们还在油田工作或修建铁路。因此，有必要尽快分配尽可能多的囚犯来从事这项工作，但这些人不应该发现自己处于精疲力尽的状态，而那些像动物一样被放牧的人却陷入了这种状态。简而言之，政府通过更加人性化地对待这些生物而受益。

While working on the reorganization of his office of Internal Affairs, Beria began to study the regulations and the regime applied in the three prisons of Moscow: Lubyanka, Lefortovo and Boutyrki. He finds miserable conditions there. Lavrenti immediately orders that the windows of the cells, sealed on Yejov's order, be reopened without delay. Beria also improves the food, which under his predecessor consisted only of a bun and some soup tasting like slop. However, none of these liberal measures are dictated by compassion for captives. Beria believes that while the prisoners are to be deported later to a labor camp, it is not enough for them to be alive. Convicts must be strong enough to work. Otherwise, it is not even worth feeding them. The places of exile are not extermination camps like the Nazi concentration camps, but areas where slaves must work to build a bigger and stronger Soviet nation. If they're weak and dying like flies, there's no point sending them there. It makes no sense to deport more and more prisoners if they are not able to work properly and accomplish nothing. The yield from this menial labor is the first thing to consider. The camps are located in the forests of Siberia where men cut down trees for the benefit of the whole country and even for export. Or prisoners are sent to other remote corners of the USSR to work in coal, iron, copper, asbestos, silver or gold mines. They also work in oil fields or build railways. It is therefore necessary to assign as quickly as possible the greatest possible number of prisoners to this work, but these men should not find themselves in the state of exhaustion in which fall those who are herded like animals. In short, the administration benefits from treating these creatures with more humanity.

贝利亚从根源上解决了这个问题。1922年，列宁下令在索洛维茨基岛建立了共产主义政权的第一个集中营。在那里，冬季极地气候特别恶劣，没有营房或足够的衣服，数千名在运输中幸存下来的人在途中丧生。不到一年。从政府的角度来看，这项政策是完全错误的。如果我们想消灭这些人，我们可以在监狱里处决他们。它不那么复杂，花费的时间更少，需要的警卫更少，而且更便宜，因为一颗子弹只需要三个戈比。更奇怪的是，像捷尔任斯基这样的嗜血野兽，

Beria takes up the problem from its origins. The first concentration camps of the Communist regime were established by order of Lenin on Solovetsky Island in 1922. There, in the particularly harsh polar climate in winter and without the help of barracks or adequate clothing, thousands of people who had survived the transport perished in less than a year. From the administration's point of view, this policy was entirely wrong. If we wanted to annihilate these people, we could execute them in prison. It was less complicated, took less time, required fewer guards and was cheaper since a bullet only cost three kopeks. It is even strange that such a bloodthirsty beast as Dzerzhinsky,

在他的继任者门金斯基的领导下，这种情况不会改变。确实，从白海到波罗的海的巨大航道被凿通了，而且完全是由奴隶凿通的。但他们受到了如此严厉的对待，以至于在工程期间不得不更换数千人。

The situation will not change under the authority of his successor Menjinsky. It is true that the enormous channel from the White Sea to the Baltic was pierced, and this entirely by slaves. But they were treated so harshly that thousands of them had to be replaced during the works.

亚戈达统治时期，集中营的生活条件确实是最残酷的。如果有人工作不够努力，就会受到惩罚，不准他们进入所谓的“区域”，即营房和厨房的区域，周围环绕着高大而坚固的铁丝网、铁丝网。我们把他留在外面直到第二天。然后，他必须加倍工作热情，才能从“区域”的好处中受益。然而，大多数情况下，囚犯第二天并没有尝试去拿任何东西，因为他在夜间死于寒冷或被狼杀死35。

It was during the reign of Iagoda that the living conditions in the camps were truly the cruelest. If someone did not work hard enough, they were punished by denying them access to what was called the "zone", the area of ​​barracks and the kitchen, surrounded by a high and powerful fence of iron wires. barbed wire. We left him outside until the next day. He then had to redouble his ardor at work to be able to benefit from the benefits of the “zone”. Most often, however, the prisoner did not try to reach anything the next day because, during the night, he died of cold or was killed by wolves 35 .

当一名绝望的囚犯在苔原上砍伐树木时，用斧头砍断了自己的手指，集中营中的可怕状况被公之于众。他用鲜血在一块布上写下了一条简短的字条，将手指包裹在这条噩梦般的信息中，然后将其传递到芬兰进口的原木中，真诚地想象它们是由共青团志愿者生产的。

The horrific conditions in the camps were revealed to the world when a desperate convict cut off his finger with the ax he was using to cut down trees on the tundra. He wrote a short note on a cloth in his blood, wrapped the finger in this nightmarish message and passed it among the logs that Finland imported, imagining in good faith that they were produced by volunteers from the Communist Youth League.

芬兰媒体报道了这一消息，并在活动期间引起了很大的轰动。芬兰停止进口俄罗斯木材。这是自由世界第一次听说共产主义天堂的奴隶营。有必要防止此类事件再次发生。救亡图存，要求改善劳教所恶劣的生活条件。然而，亚戈达的继任者叶约夫却没有采取任何改革措施。现在，贝利亚决定科学地重组苏联一切繁荣所依赖的奴隶制度。

The Finnish press published this news and made a lot of noise around the event. Finland halted its imports of Russian timber. It was the first time the free world had heard of the slave camps in the communist paradise. It was necessary to prevent such events from happening again. The salvation of the nation required that the unbearable living conditions in the labor camps be improved. However, Yejov, Yagoda's successor, did nothing to reform them. Now, Beria decides to scientifically reorganize the slave system on which all the prosperity of the USSR is based.

从那时起，拉夫连季将大部分时间用于规划和调整新的工作制度以适应苏联的实际需要。苏联经济的这一重要部门在整个国家的生活中发挥着相当大的作用，其主要机构称为古拉格：Glavnoye Upravleniye Lagerei（集中营总局）。贝利亚决定接管它，更换管理层并彻底重组。

From then on, Lavrenty spent most of his time planning and adapting the new work system to the real needs of the Soviet Union. The main agency of this important branch of the Soviet economy, which plays such a considerable part in the life of the whole country, is called GULAG: Glavnoye Upravleniye Lagerei (General Administration of the Camps). Beria decides to take it in hand, replace the management and completely reorganize it.

他正在处理一项艰巨的任务，尤其是因为他必须首先致力于其他任务：国家的安全，以及斯大林和政治局成员的安全。还有相关活动，如逮捕、审讯、审判准备和参加三驾马车学院，该学院谴责被告流放或秘密处决。还有情报部门的重要工作：在国外安插间谍，给他们指示，接受他们的报告，听取他们的报告或者主持对他们在国外的人进行秘密清算，已经显得不够可信了。

He is tackling an enormous undertaking, all the more so since he must devote himself first to other tasks: the security of the country, as well as that of Stalin and the members of the Politburo. There are also related activities such as arrests, interrogations, preparation for trials and participation in the Troika college which condemns the defendants to exile or execution in camera . There is also the important work of the Intelligence Service: placing spies abroad, giving them instructions, receiving their reports, listening to their reports or presiding over the secret liquidation of those of them who are abroad, no longer seem trustworthy enough.

然而，古拉格集中营的重组对贝利亚来说是极其令人兴奋的。这位工程师兼建筑师对建造这个庞大的项目感到非常满意。他照顾到最微小的细节，一一绘制了营地，为它们分配了具体数量的营房，并指定了每个营房的尺寸：厨房、浴室、洗衣房、厕所和仓库。他确定了被驱逐​​者从监狱转移到目的地期间的口粮。在去劳教所的路上，他们得到的面包是他们在监狱里的两倍，还有生鱼、黄油、人造黄油、糖和盐，这些都是他们在监狱里时从未得到过的东西36。到达营地后，他们会按照产量的比例得到食物。

The reorganization of the GULAG is, however, extremely exciting for Beria. The engineer-architect finds great satisfaction in constructing this vast project. He took care of the smallest detail, drew the camps one by one, assigned them a determined number of barracks and specified the dimensions of each of them: kitchen, baths, laundry, latrines and warehouses. He determines the food rations to be given to the deportees during their transfer from prison to their place of destination. On the way to the forced labor camps, they receive a ration of bread double that which they received in prison, as well as raw fish, butter, margarine, sugar and salt, all things that they had never received when they were behind bars 36. After their arrival at the camp, they are fed in proportion to their output.

贝利亚煞费苦心地在劳教所的管理中建立了等级制度，并为每个劳教所和每个地区制定了专门的规定和颁布了生产力标准。他要求营地指挥官提供有关现场所需医生、工程师、专家和技术工人数量的报告。拉夫伦蒂根据这些要求负责供应。例如，一位非农民或工人阶级出身，但在莫斯科或苏联任何其他大城市行医的医生，会在晚上被传唤到内务人民委员部的当地岗位。一位高级军官礼貌地问他是否是一个有良心的苏联公民和一个优秀的爱国者。当男人确认自己是这样的时候 他被告知必须立即前往该劳改营，那里迫切需要医疗援助。这位军官说服他，对于一名优秀的苏联医生来说，在莫斯科行医和在西伯利亚行医应该没有区别，因为他都是在苏联国家行医。因此，他不用担心去哪里治病，只要帮助自己的同胞就可以了。与在拥有一切医疗援助的大城市相比，难民营中更需要一位好医生的帮助。因此，他不用担心去哪里治病，只要帮助自己的同胞就可以了。与在拥有一切医疗援助的大城市相比，难民营中更需要一位好医生的帮助。所以他不用担心去哪里治病，只要帮助自己的同胞就可以了。与在拥有一切医疗援助的大城市相比，难民营中更需要一位好医生的帮助。

With painstaking precision, Beria established a hierarchy in the administration of the labor camps, as well as formulating special regulations and issuing standards of productivity for each camp and each region. He asks the camp commanders for reports on the number of doctors, engineers, specialists and skilled workers needed on site. Depending on these requests, Lavrenti takes care of the supplies. Thus, for example, a doctor who is not of peasant or working-class origin, but who practices in Moscow or in any other large city of the USSR, sees himself summoned at night to the local post of the NKVD. . A senior officer politely asks him if he is a conscientious Soviet citizen and a good patriot. When the man confirms that he is, he is told that he must go immediately to such labor camp where medical assistance is urgently required. The officer persuades him that, for a good Soviet doctor, there should be no difference between practicing in Moscow or practicing in Siberia, because in each case he is practicing in the country of the Soviets. He should therefore not worry about where he heals people, as long as he helps his compatriots. And the help of a good doctor is even more necessary in the camps than in a big city where all medical assistance is available. He should therefore not worry about where he heals people, as long as he helps his compatriots. And the help of a good doctor is even more necessary in the camps than in a big city where all medical assistance is available. He should therefore not worry about where he heals people, as long as he helps his compatriots. And the help of a good doctor is even more necessary in the camps than in a big city where all medical assistance is available.

一名造成事故的卡车司机在警察局被告知，他必须学习成为一名更好的司机，而不是暂时被吊销驾驶执照。为了提高他的训练水平，他将被送往劳教所，在那里他将从事他的职业。然后他被送往一个卡车数量多于能够驾驶卡车的人的营地。

A truck driver responsible for an accident is told at the police station that, instead of being deprived of his driving license for a while, he will have to learn to become a better driver. In order to improve his training, he will be sent to a labor camp where he will practice his profession. He is then sent to a camp that has more trucks than people able to drive them.

同样的事情也发生在鞋匠、木匠、泥瓦匠和其他熟练技工身上，他们因酒后争吵或因轻微犯罪而被捕。审问这些人的警察被当作流氓逮捕判他们三五年劳教后安慰他们说：“别害怕，我的朋友，那里没有人会杀你。你只会被送到劳改营，在那里你从事自己的职业。如果人受到惊吓，警察正好有人情味，他就安慰犯人说：“给你免费吃住，还有又好又暖的衣服。” 您将能够给家人写信并接收信件和包裹。您将拥有洗浴设施、剧院、电影院、广播、书籍、报纸和讲座。俄罗斯的土地到处都是一样的，为了我们国家的光荣建设，到处都需要优秀的工人”。

The same thing happens to shoemakers, carpenters, and masons, and other skilled tradesmen, involved in a drunken quarrel or arrested for minor offences. The officers who interrogate these men arrested as hooligansconsole them after having sentenced them to three or five years of forced labor by telling them: "Don't be afraid, my friend, nobody is going to kill you there. You will only be sent to a labor camp where you will practice your own profession. If the person is frightened and the police officer happens to have human feelings, he comforts the prisoner by saying, "You will be given free board and lodging and you will also have good and warm clothes." You will be able to write letters to your family and receive correspondence and parcels. You will have bathing facilities, theatre, cinema, radio, books, newspapers and lectures. The Russian soil is the same everywhere and everywhere good workers are necessary for the glorious construction of our country”.

最繁重的工作——在苔原上砍伐树木和挖掘地雷——都留给了单纯的农民和因流浪而被捕的吉普赛人，以及过于富有的农民、富农、没有专业知识的人、知识分子、政治罪犯。 ， 老老少少。

The heaviest work – the felling of trees in the tundra and the digging of mines – are left to simple peasants and gypsies arrested for vagrancy, as well as to overly rich farmers, the kulaks, to people without specialization, to l intelligentsia, political criminals, young and old.

贝利亚还为从事采矿、林业、营房或铁路和公路建设等特定项目的旅规定了生产标准。每个旅的每个人也有严格的标准。高效的部队会获得更好的住房或更好的衣服等形式的奖励。对于每个人来说，有十四种烹饪方式，称为锅。第十四个，最好的，是“冠军”：一天内产出两倍于规定标准的人。除了普通的面包口粮外，这些人还得到汤、一块鱼或一块肉排以及甜茶。第一锅，一锅惩罚，由一小片面包和一杯水状的鱼汤组成。而且从第一锅到第十四锅，菜单的改进是渐进的。这种喂养系统使贝利亚能够精明地摧毁囚犯之间的兄弟情谊，因为在努力改善他们的平凡性的过程中，每个人都只是在为自己工作。没有人能够帮助一位无法满足日常规范的同志。

Beria also prescribes production standards for brigades working on particular projects in mining, forestry, construction of barracks or railways and highways. There are also strict standards for each man in each brigade. Efficient brigades receive rewards in the form of better housing or better clothing. For each individual there are fourteen categories of cooking, called pots. The fourteenth, the best, is for “champions”: men who have produced twice the prescribed standard for one day. Besides the ordinary bread rations, these men receive soup, a piece of fish or a cutlet of meat, and sweet tea. The first pot, a pot of punishment, consists of a small piece of bread and a cup of watery fish soup. And from the first to the fourteenth pot, the improvement of the menu is progressive. This feeding system allows Beria to shrewdly destroy any sense of brotherhood between the inmates because, in striving to improve their ordinariness, everyone is only working for themselves. No one can afford to help a comrade unable to meet the daily norm.

另一方面，通过分配惩罚性口粮，导致第二天无法正常工作，贝利亚并没有表现出比伊阿戈达更人性化，伊阿戈达把这些可怜的动物留在了营地外面，让它们成为寒冷和狼群的猎物。 。由于他们的惩罚制度，贝利亚的受害者很快就失去了所有的力量并因营养不良而死亡。

On the other hand, by assigning punitive rations which do not make it possible to work properly the next day, Beria does not show himself to be much more human than Iagoda who left these poor creatures outside the camps, prey to the cold and the wolves . With their regime of punishment, Beria's victims quickly lose all their strength and perish from malnutrition.

但总体而言，新体系运转良好，很快苏联工业的质量和数量都得到了增长。

But, in general, the new system works perfectly and soon Soviet industry grows in quality and quantity.

现在，各种各样的产品正从分布在苏联各地的数百个难民营流入这些中心：来自西伯利亚森林的木材；来自沃尔库塔的铁、镍和铜；来自顿涅茨盆地（Donbas）的煤炭；来自卡拉干达的煤炭、水泥、沥青和砖块；乌赫塔生产石油，科雷马生产石棉、白银和黄金，而幅员辽阔的苏联正在修建数千公里的铁路和高速公路。所有这一切都是数百万被驱逐者的成果：古拉格提供的男人、女人和十岁左右的儿童，而古拉格本身则由安全警察提供劳动力。

Now a wide variety of products are flowing into the centers from hundreds of camps spread across the Soviet Union: timber from Siberian forests; iron, nickel and copper from Vorkuta; coal from the Donets basin (Donbas); coal, cement, asphalt and bricks from Karaganda; oil from Oukhta and asbestos, silver and gold from Kolyma, while thousands of kilometers of railways and highways are being built across the vast USSR. And all of this is the work of millions of deportees: men, women and children of about ten years of age provided by the GOULAG, itself supplied with labor by the Sûreté police.

困扰巴库理工学院学生贝利亚的梦想已经实现。现在他建造城市、堤坝、运河、矿山、工厂、铸造厂、造纸厂、高速公路和铁路。愿望以惊人的准确度实现。迄今为止，在人类历史上，从来没有一个罗马凯撒甚至圣经中的法老能够像内政部长和苏联安全司令拉夫连季政委所统治的那样统治数百万奴隶。巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚.

The dream that haunted Beria, a student at the Technicum in Baku, has come true. Now he builds cities, dykes, canals, mines, factories, foundries, paper mills, highways and railroads. Desire comes true with terrifying accuracy. Until now, in all the history of mankind, there has never been found a Roman Caesar or even a biblical Pharaoh who could reign over as many millions of slaves as those ruled by the Chief of Internal Affairs and the Commander of the Soviet Security: Commissar Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria.

评级

Ratings

35 . 一名在亚戈达政权中幸存下来并被转移到沃尔库塔集中营的囚犯向提交人提出的报告，提交人于 1942 年被转移到该集中营。

35 . Report made to the author by a prisoner who survived the Yagoda regime and transferred to the Vorkuta camp where the author was relegated in 1942.

36 . 撒迪厄斯·维特林 (Thaddeus Wittlin)，《俄罗斯的不情愿的旅行者》，纽约，1952 年。

36 . Thaddeus Wittlin, A Reluctant Traveler in Russia, New York, 1952.

第33章

Chapter 33

“我们生活得更加幸福。»

“We live more happily. »

贝利亚不仅将被前任监禁和驱逐出境的数百名安全局官员从劳改营中解放出来并恢复其部门的职务，而且还释放了一些军队军官和士兵。他们被编入内务人民委员部的团和他正在建立的特别师。作为总司令，贝利亚加强了这些部队的实力，为他们配备了最现代化的武器，并为他们提供了最好的制服、宿舍和给养。他用这种方式培养对他最忠诚的人。

Beria not only liberates from labor camps and reinstates in their post, in his department, the hundreds of functionaries of the Sûreté who were imprisoned and deported by his predecessor, but he also releases a number of officers and soldiers of the army. Rouge and incorporated them into the regiments of the NKVD and the Special Divisions which he was setting up. As commander-in-chief, Beria reinforces these units, equips them with the most modern armament and provides them with the best uniforms, quarters and supplies. In this way he forms men who will be of the greatest fidelity to him.

贝利亚任命他的朋友和支持者担任关键职务。一直值得信赖的萨尔基索夫上校成为了他的副官。除了他在莫斯科的助手梅尔库洛夫和克鲁格洛夫以及他的秘书马穆洛夫之外，贝利亚还任命了格鲁吉亚、阿塞拜疆和亚美尼亚以及列宁格勒、基辅、哈尔科夫和敖德萨等俄罗斯大城市的秘密警察局长。 ，他的巴库技术中心战友，包括戈利泽、德卡诺佐夫、格维希亚尼、梅奇克等人。巴库秘密警察局长巴吉罗夫兼任阿塞拜疆党主席。这些人只有顺从地侍奉他，才能推进自己的事业。

To key positions, Beria appoints his friends and supporters. Colonel Sarkissov, always a trusted man, becomes his aide-de-camp. In addition to Merkoulov and Krouglov, his assistants in Moscow, and Mamoulov, his secretary, Beria installed as chiefs of the secret police in Georgia, Azerbaijan and Armenia, as well as in several large Russian cities such as Leningrad, Kiev, Kharkov and Odessa, his Baku Technicum comrades, including Goglidze, Dekanozov, Gvichyani, Mechik and others. Bagirov, chief of the secret police of Baku, also takes the head of the Party in Azerbaijan. These men can only advance their careers by serving him with obedience.

为了为他的亲密伙伴在格鲁吉亚扫清道路，贝利亚决定永远摆脱斯坦尼斯拉夫·雷登斯。拉夫伦蒂的特工煽动、雷登斯在第比利斯领导的另一场酗酒事件足以宣告他是流氓和流氓。收到贝利亚的报告后，斯大林将雷登斯召回莫斯科内务人民委员部总部。紧接着，雷登斯接到了哈萨克斯坦的新任务，并与妻子离开莫斯科前往阿拉木图。但他并没有在那里呆太久。根据贝利亚的明确命令，雷登斯被传唤回国，随后被捕并被监禁在布蒂尔基监狱中。

In order to clear the way in Georgia for his close associates, Beria decides to get rid of Stanislav Redens for good. Another drinking binge instigated by Lavrenti's agents and led by Redens in Tbilisi is enough to declare him a hooligan and a hooligan . After a report from Beria, Stalin recalled Redens to NKVD headquarters in Moscow. Immediately after, Redens received a new assignment, in Kazakhstan, and left Moscow for Alma-Ata with his wife. But he doesn't stay there long. On an express order from Beria, Redens was summoned to return, arrested and imprisoned in the Boutyrki prison.

通过这一包括安置他的支持者并消灭他的对手的政策，贝利亚控制了整个国家。

Through this policy, which consists of placing his supporters and annihilating his adversaries, Beria takes control of the whole country.

针对杰出党员和红军军官的大清洗和耸人听闻的审判被停止。贝利亚向斯大林提出两次大赦，导致数千名囚犯被释放并返回家园，许多叶若夫刽子手被逮捕并处决后，全国开始相信更好的时代终于到来了。一首歌词鼓舞人心的新歌——“我不知道哪个国家的呼吸更自由”——立即在广播中流行起来。它由小学生、先锋队或红色童子军以及共青团成员演唱。这首歌在红军中广为传唱，也为数百万普通民众所传唱。

The great purges and sensational trials against prominent Party members and Red Army officers are halted. After two amnesties suggested to Stalin by Beria, which resulted in the release and return to their homes of thousands of prisoners, and after the arrest and execution of many of Yezhov's executioners, the nation begins to believe that better times have finally arrived. A new song with inspirational lyrics – "I don't know a country where one breathes more freely" – becomes instantly popular on the radio. It is sung by school children, grouped in units of pioneers or red scouts, and by members of the Communist Youth League. It is sung in the Red Army, as well as by millions of ordinary citizens.

从拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚在莫斯科统治之初，他就成为自由化和黄金时代的明显象征，而伟大的斯大林同志则将这个怪物从叶若夫赶走，并任命贝利亚担任内政委员和安全局长。 ，被尊为人民的救世主。对贝利亚来说，没有什么比成为一个正义的人、一个仁慈而温和的人、一个实际上被他扼住喉咙的人民眼中真正的恩人更令人惊讶的了。他的新角色是不知情的偶像，而不是首席刽子手，这让他非常开心。

From the beginning of his reign in Moscow, Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria became the obvious symbol of liberalization and the golden age, while the great comrade Stalin, who dislodged this monster from Yezhov and appointed Beria to the post of Commissar for Internal Affairs and Chief of Security, is glorified as the savior of the people. There is nothing more surprising for Beria than to become a just man, a humane and moderate personality, and a true benefactor in the eyes of the people whom, in fact, he holds by the throat. His new role as unwitting idol, instead of chief executioner, greatly amuses him.

贝利亚认为大老板讨厌任何形式的竞争，并且打算将所有利润据为己有，因此贝利亚并不期望得到太多认可。他命令几位不知名但报酬丰厚的艺术家画画，让斯大林在快乐的孩子、快乐的工人或衣着优雅的年轻漂亮的农妇中间微笑。不久之后，描绘田园风光的大型彩色海报被挂在工厂、电影院和青年协会的外墙上。

Permeated by the idea that the big boss hates any kind of rivalry and that he intends to amass all the profit for himself, Beria does not expect much recognition. He orders a few unknown but well-paid artists to paint pictures showing Stalin all smiles in the midst of delighted children, happy workers or elegantly dressed young and pretty peasant women. Shortly after, large color posters depicting idyllic scenes were hung on the facades of factories, cinemas and youth associations.

“苏维埃土地上的小太阳”索尔尼奇科·苏维埃斯科伊·弗拉斯蒂成为伟大斯大林同志的新绰号。该节目由贝利亚男子在全国广播。

Solnychko Sovietskoy vlasti "Little Sun of the Land of Soviets" becomes a new nickname for great comrade Stalin. It is broadcast across the country by Beria men.

拉夫伦蒂不仅仅是一名警察和公务员，他还是一个狡猾的人。他知道他可以用生命来换取人气。贝利亚从不追求名誉。他更喜欢呆在阴影里。他的野心不是荣耀，而是权力。唯一应该受到人民爱戴的人就是索尔尼奇科，太阳斯大林，这一想法从未离开过他的脑海。贝利亚仿佛是独裁者的黑人，他将口号“ Jit stalo veseleï ”（“我们生活得更加幸福”）归功于他的上级，尽管他本人提出这个口号是为了让国家向新时代的到来致敬。

Lavrenti is more than just a policeman and a civil servant, he is a cunning man. He knows he can pay for his popularity with his life. Beria never sought fame. He prefers to stay in the shadows. His ambition is not glory, but power. The idea that the only person who should be loved by the people is Solnychko, the sun Stalin, never leaves his mind. As if he were the dictator's negro, Beria credits his superior with the slogan Jit stalo veseleï - "We live more happily" - although he himself proposed it in order to allow the nation to salute the advent of a new era.

在非公开场合，贝利亚和独裁者的表情并不那么甜蜜或富有诗意，而是彻头彻尾的粗俗。拉夫连季（Lavrenti），其夏宫位于斯大林故居Blijni附近在昆采沃，他经常参加大老板为他最好的同志和政治局成员的小圈子举办的晚宴。贝利亚从高加索执行任务期间第一次拜访他的上级时，接待的东道主与他所遇到的东道主不同。“亲爱的谢尔戈”已不复存在，敬爱的阿维尔·叶努基泽也已不复存在，聪明机智的布哈林也已不复存在。他们被处决，布哈林的妻子、斯大林第一任妻子的兄弟亚历山大·斯瓦尼泽和他的妻子玛丽亚都在监狱里。气氛已经不一样了。但斯大林的晚宴总是有他最亲密的朋友参加：伏罗希洛夫元帅和政委米高扬、莫洛托夫和卡冈诺维奇以及他们的妻子。还有斯大林的三个孩子中的两个，斯维特兰娜和瓦西里，以及独裁者家族的其他成员，如斯大林已故第二任妻子纳德日达的父母老谢尔戈和奥尔加·阿利卢耶夫。还有斯大林的情妇，黑人、丰满、性感的罗莎·卡冈诺维奇，政委拉扎尔·卡冈诺维奇的妹妹。

When not in public, Beria's and the dictator's expressions aren't quite as sweet or poetic, but downright vulgar. Lavrenti, whose summer residence is in the vicinity of Stalin's house, Blijni, in Kuntsevo, frequently takes part in the dinners given by the big boss for the restricted circle of his best comrades and members of the Politburo. The hosts are different from those Beria had met during the first visit to his superior, during a mission which brought him from the Caucasus. The "dear Sergo" is no longer there, neither the beloved Avel Yenukidze, nor the intelligent and witty Bukharin. They were executed and Bukharin's wife is in prison, as are Alexander Svanidze, brother of Stalin's first wife, and his wife Maria. The atmosphere is no longer the same. But Stalin's dinners were always attended by his closest friends: Marshal Voroshilov and commissars Mikoyan, Molotov and Kaganovitch accompanied by their wives. There are also two of Stalin's three children, Svetlana and Vassili, and other members of the dictator's family like old Sergo and Olga Allilouïev, parents of Nadezhda, the late second wife of Stalin. There is also Stalin's mistress, the black, buxom and seductive Rosa Kaganovitch, sister of Commissar Lazare Kaganovitch.

在这家公司里，喝了几杯之后，斯大林常常喝醉得像个鞋匠，用下水道的语言和粗鲁的名字称呼客人来取乐。尽管莫洛托夫的妻子保琳娜是犹太人，独裁者的情妇罗莎和她的兄弟拉扎尔也在场，但他仍以最恶毒的方式侮辱犹太人。感叹号Iob tvoiou mat！“ … 你的母亲 ！这是苏联领导人最常用的表达方式。在这些招待会上，他最喜欢讲的笑话是在一个站起来的人的椅子上放一个西红柿，或者强迫另一个人一口气喝下一杯加了胡椒的纯酒精，就像喝普通伏特加一样。

In this company, after several drinks, Stalin often becomes as drunk as a cobbler and amuses himself by speaking the language of a sewer and covering his guests with rude names. He insults the Jews with the most foul insults despite the presence of Molotov's wife, Paulina, who is Jewish, as is Rosa, the dictator's mistress, and her brother Lazare. The exclamation Iob tvoiou mat! " … your mother ! is the expression most often used by the Soviet leader. His favorite jokes during these receptions are to place a tomato on the chair of a person who stands up for a moment or to force another to drink in one gulp a glass of pure alcohol with the addition of pepper like s it was ordinary vodka.

贝利亚很高兴地赞同这种幽默。论词汇量，他并不逊色于他的师父。拉夫伦蒂是老板唯一不侮辱的人。他称他为“我的检察官”。拉夫连季对酒精有抵抗力，即使喝干了也能保持几乎清醒，当独裁者发出他最喜欢的游戏信号时，拉夫伦季并不害怕取笑斯大林：在要求某人评估外部温度后，大老板自己控制它并强迫被审讯者喝下与他在度数上犯的错误一样多的伏特加酒。

Beria happily approves of this kind of humor. He is not inferior to his master in terms of vocabulary. Lavrenti is the only one the boss doesn't insult. He calls him “my prosecutor”. Resistant to liquors and being able to remain almost lucid even while drinking dry, Lavrenti does not fear to amuse Stalin when the dictator gives the signal for his favorite game: after having asked someone to assess the outside temperature, the big boss controls it himself and forces the interrogated person to drink as many glasses of vodka as he made errors in the number of degrees.

这个自由呼吸的时代并不像贝利亚新秩序开始时看起来那么欢乐。

This free-breathing era is not as joyous as it might have seemed at the start of Beria's New Order.

贝利亚任命了由专家、工程师和技术人员组成的团队，对西伯利亚偏远地区和乌拉尔山脉欧洲一侧的许多煤炭、矿石或石油矿藏进行科学勘探。这些地区的开采需要挖掘一定数量的新矿山。换句话说，需要新的集中营来提供更多的人力。贝利亚的目标并不是像他疯狂的前任那样消灭人民，而是根据当地的需要，理性而有条理地充分利用他们。慢慢地，苏联的整个经济生活开始依赖于劳改营——商品的主要供应者。人类物质的供应是恒定的。整支新兵部队都是从相距遥远的村庄或城镇组成的。经过体检和其他适当的军事手续后，他们登上火车，但没有重新加入部队，而是被送往西伯利亚。

Teams of specialists, engineers and technicians are appointed by Beria to scientifically explore many deposits of coal, ore or oil in the remote regions of Siberia and on the European side of the Urals. The exploitation of these regions requires the digging of a certain number of new mines. In other words, new concentration camps are needed to provide more manpower. Beria's goal is not, like his frenzied predecessor, to annihilate people, but to use them for the best, rationally and methodically, according to local needs. Slowly, the entire economic life of the Soviet Union began to rely on the forced labor camps, the main suppliers of goods. The supply of human material is constant. Entire contingents of Army recruits are formed from villages or towns far apart from each other. After the medical examination and other properly military formalities, they board trains but, instead of rejoining their units, they are sent to Siberia.

然后他们得知自己需要接受“临时”服务。此后，如果有任何过错或不服从行为，他们将立即受到纪律处分，即在劳改营内强制劳动五到十年。他们无法与家人沟通，家人不知道这些男孩发生了什么事。

They then learn that they are subject to “temporary” service. Immediately afterwards, for any peccadillo or act of disobedience, they are given disciplinary sanctions of five to ten years of forced labor in the camp. They are unable to communicate with their families, who have no idea what is happening to these boys.

古拉格也认为自己需要女性。她们需要担任护士、裁缝或厨师，以及在田间和工厂工作，甚至与男人一起修路。

The GULAG also sees itself asking for women. They are needed as nurses, seamstresses or cooks, as well as to work in the fields and in the factory, or even to build roads with the men.

任何对农业集体化不满的迹象都会导致整个村庄被驱逐。在镇压了高加索库班哥萨克的短暂起义后，贝利亚将几乎整个部落从阳光明媚的乡村转移到了西伯利亚冰冻的苔原。在持续四天四夜的集会上，2000多名男人、女人和儿童被贝利亚特种师的部队包围，这些部队配备了机枪和半野生的德国牧羊犬。他们被停在无尽的火车运牛车里，然后被驱逐到遥远的北方。在这些大规模驱逐期间，大约 130,000 名格鲁吉亚人也被送往西伯利亚。

Any sign of dissatisfaction with the collectivization of agriculture leads to the deportation of entire villages. After suppressing a brief uprising of Kuban Cossacks in the Caucasus, Beria transfers almost the entire tribe from their sunny countryside to the frozen tundra of Siberia. During a rally that lasted four days and four nights, more than 2,000 men, women and children were surrounded by units of Beria's Special Divisions, armed with machine guns and half-wild German shepherds. They are parked in endless train cattle cars and deported to the Far North. During these mass deportations, some 130,000 Georgians were also sent to Siberia.

根据贝利亚颁布的新规定，我们不能再将家庭安置在同一个中心。当整个社区被流放时，丈夫们会被引导到与妻子不同的地方。孩子们被从父母身边带走。兄弟姐妹分开了。这种残酷的手段并不是暴君邪恶的唯一事实。一定会让亲戚之间的任何互助都变得不可能。根据同样的政策，囚犯在同一营地的停留时间不得超过六个月。他们被从一个中心转移到另一个中心，从苏联的一端转移到另一端。这阻碍了建立真正的友谊和相互信任的纽带，从而导致逃跑、阴谋和骚乱。在苏联，用火车运送囚犯，船、卡车，甚至步行都是不断的。古拉格有一个特殊的运输部门，有详细的时间表和特殊基地和哨所的地图，可以提供食物、衣服和配备武器的警卫和德国牧羊犬37 .

In accordance with the new rules enacted by Beria, we can no longer keep families in the same center. When an entire community is exiled, the husbands are directed to different places than where their wives are placed. Children are taken away from their parents. Brothers and sisters are separated. This cruel method is not the only fact of the wickedness of a tyrant. It must make any mutual assistance between relatives impossible. Under the same policy, convicts never stay more than six months in the same camp. They are moved and tossed from one center to another, from one end of the Soviet Union to the other. This prevents the establishment of real bonds of friendship and mutual trust, which lead to escapes, conspiracies and riots. In the USSR, the transport of prisoners by train, boats, trucks and even on foot are constant. The GULAG has a special transport department with an elaborate timetable and a map of special bases and posts that can provide food, clothing and guards equipped with weapons and German shepherds37 .

当卑微的农民和工人群众对驱逐的规模感到恐惧时，捏造的审判和大清洗却停止了。知识分子、作家、诗人、剧作家和艺术家将新政权视为言论相对自由的时期。

While the humble mass of peasants and workers were terrified by the scale of the deportations, the fabricated trials and the great purges came to a halt. Intellectuals, writers, poets, playwrights and artists see the new regime as a period of relative freedom of expression.

不墨守成规的作者可以在一些文学期刊上发表他们的散文、文章、短篇小说和诗歌。艺术家和雕塑家可以展示他们的现代作品。前卫剧作家和导演上演实验剧。

Non-conformist authors can publish their essays, articles, short stories and poems in some literary journals. Artists and sculptors are allowed to show their modern works. Avant-garde playwrights and directors put on experimental plays.

不幸的是，他们不明白，新的自由浪潮只不过是贝利亚的巧妙挑衅，意在引诱所谓的颠覆分子。在共产主义政权下，文人必须为群众服务，立德树人。他们还必须赞扬苏联及其成就，或者揭露叛徒并嘲笑资本主义国家。但他们无法尝试或效仿颓废的西方。

Unfortunately, they do not understand that the new wave of freedom is nothing more than a deft provocation by Beria intended to lure the supposedly subversive elements. Under the communist regime, men of letters must serve the masses and work out their morals. They must also praise the Soviet Union and its achievements or expose traitors and ridicule capitalist countries. But they cannot experiment or follow the example of the decadent West.

贝利亚知道，斯大林永远不会认可“社会现实主义”以外的任何艺术：实质上是社会主义，形式上是现实主义。

Beria is aware that Stalin will never authorize any art other than "social-realism": socialism for substance, realism for form.

很快，富有创造力的知识分子就为自己的粗心付出了代价。全能的内政部长立即采取行动。他对文人进行了一次非凡的重组。其首批受害者之一是一位 5​​5 岁的作家：鲍里斯·皮尔尼亚克 (Boris Pilniak)。他是一位杰出的小说家和故事讲述者，其作品在苏联广受欢迎。它被翻译成多种语言。皮尔尼亚克是一位坚定的共产主义者，但这并没有多大意义。比他更忠诚的布尔什维克被消灭了。皮尔尼亚克犯下了几项罪过。他是《红森林》一书的作者，在德国国外出版，因此他被迫辞去全俄作家联盟主席的职务。他还出国旅行过很多次。苏联政府从未意识到这一点，因为它认为这有可能引入不良思想。由于除了西欧之外，作者还访问过日本和美国，因此不难指控他为这些国家从事间谍活动。皮尔尼亚克确实在一本名为《好吧》的书中描述了他的印象这是反美宣传，但应该只是其真实态度的伪装。皮利尼亚克在叶约夫政权下已经多次被传唤到内务人民委员部办公室，但现在他被捕了。贝利亚知道，消灭这位作家会让斯大林特别高兴，不仅因为皮尔尼亚克（实际上被称为沃高）是犹太人，而且因为他写了一本虚构的书《月球的历史》，这本书不是不熄灭，也不是月球的死亡。指挥部。这部小说唤起了一个指挥部命名为加维洛夫，灵感来自伟大的苏联英雄米哈伊尔伏龙芝的死亡，他可能是在斯大林的命令下被毒死的。这本书立即被没收，但作者没有受到惩罚。当局认为立即起诉将表明这本书切中要害。但几年后的现在，情况不同了。这一刻已经到来，拉夫伦蒂知道，通过清算这位作者，他会取悦他的老板。

Soon, the creative intellectuals pay for their carelessness. The all-powerful Head of Home Affairs springs into action. He carried out an exceptional reorganization among men of letters. One of its first victims is a fifty-five-year-old author: Boris Pilniak. He is an outstanding novelist and storyteller whose books enjoy great popularity in the Soviet Union. It is translated into several languages. Pilnyak is a staunch communist, but that doesn't mean much. Bolsheviks more devoted than him were annihilated. Pilnyak has committed several sins. He is the author of a book, La forêt rouge, published abroad in Germany, and for this offense he was forced to resign from his position as President of the All-Russian Union of Writers. He has also traveled quite a bit abroad. The Soviet administration never appreciated this, as it saw in it a possibility for the introduction of undesirable ideas. Since, in addition to Western Europe, the writer has also visited Japan and the United States, it is not difficult to accuse him of spying for the benefit of these countries. It is true that Pilnyak described his impressions in a book called Okay, which is anti-American propaganda, but it should only be a camouflage of its true attitude. Pilnyak has already been summoned several times to the NKVD office under the Yejov regime, but now he is arrested. Beria knows that the annihilation of this writer will particularly please Stalin, not only because Pilniak, who is actually called Vogau, is Jewish, but because he has written a fictional book, History of the Moon, which is not extinguished or the death of the Kommandarm . The novel, which evokes a kommandarmnamed Gavilov, is inspired by the death of the great Soviet hero Mikhail Frunze, probably poisoned on Stalin's order. The book was immediately confiscated, but its author was not punished. The authorities felt that an immediate prosecution would show that the book hit the mark. But now, several years later, the situation is different. The moment has arrived and Lavrenti knows that by liquidating this author he will please his boss.

皮尔尼亚克在半夜醒来并被带到卢比扬卡监狱，立即被带到安全负责人的办公室。为美国和日本从事间谍活动的罪行太严重，不能委托给贝利亚以外的任何人。此外，拉夫伦蒂很高兴见到一位杰出的作家。他觉得自己可以主宰他。谈话看起来不像是在进行调查。相反。听起来像是绅士之间的友好讨论。贝利亚礼貌地递上香烟。他向作者询问他即将出版的作品以及他对西方文学界的看法。就在他们漫长而友好的谈话即将结束时，警察局长要求作者承认他正在为日本从事间谍活动。皮尔尼亚克极力否认。采访者接受了这个答案，并指出如果作者想改变主意，他可以随时被护送回办公室发表声明。然后贝利亚按响了门铃，命令警卫陪同他的客人到四楼 16 号房间。斯大林已经将酷刑合法化，作为获取信息或认罪的一种方法。贝利亚很好地实践了这一系统。四楼是监狱药房：诊所、医院、药房等部分。16号室设有牙科室。经理是一位年轻的格鲁吉亚人，毕业于第比利斯大学：维拉。她是一个漂亮的女孩，被贝利亚强迫成为他的情妇，然后带到了莫斯科。她身材高挑，身材苗条，有一双美丽的又黑又亮的大眼睛，还有桃子皮，但她从不笑。她在自己居住的卢比扬卡监狱的医疗队工作。她在那里有一间小公寓。贝利亚有时会在晚上来看望他。下班后，薇拉可以乘坐由官方司机驾驶并配有警卫陪同的黑色豪华轿车外出，但她实际上是贝利亚的囚犯和奴隶。除了牙医的正常工作外，维拉还必须执行贝利亚引入的一些邪恶的折磨。当一个新的受害者被送到她身边时，她接到贝利亚的私人电话，贝利亚命令她应用她的发明。甜美美丽的少妇用悠扬的声音恳求病人坐下来进行例行检查。她在自己居住的卢比扬卡监狱的医疗队工作。她在那里有一间小公寓。贝利亚有时会在晚上来看望他。下班后，薇拉可以乘坐由官方司机驾驶并配有警卫陪同的黑色豪华轿车外出，但她实际上是贝利亚的囚犯和奴隶。除了牙医的正常工作外，维拉还必须执行贝利亚引入的一些邪恶的折磨。当一个新的受害者被送到她身边时，她接到贝利亚的私人电话，贝利亚命令她应用她的发明。甜美美丽的少妇用悠扬的声音恳求病人坐下来进行例行检查。她在自己居住的卢比扬卡监狱的医疗队工作。她在那里有一间小公寓。贝利亚有时会在晚上来看望他。下班后，薇拉可以乘坐由官方司机驾驶并配有警卫陪同的黑色豪华轿车外出，但她实际上是贝利亚的囚犯和奴隶。除了牙医的正常工作外，维拉还必须执行贝利亚引入的一些邪恶的折磨。当一个新的受害者被送到她身边时，她接到贝利亚的私人电话，贝利亚命令她应用她的发明。甜美美丽的少妇用悠扬的声音恳求病人坐下来进行例行检查。维拉可以乘坐由官方司机驾驶并配有警卫陪同的黑色豪华轿车外出，但她实际上是贝利亚的囚犯和奴隶。除了牙医的正常工作外，维拉还必须执行贝利亚引入的一些邪恶的折磨。当一个新的受害者被送到她身边时，她接到贝利亚的私人电话，贝利亚命令她应用她的发明。甜美美丽的少妇用悠扬的声音恳求病人坐下来进行例行检查。维拉可以乘坐由官方司机驾驶并配有警卫陪同的黑色豪华轿车外出，但她实际上是贝利亚的囚犯和奴隶。除了牙医的正常工作外，维拉还必须执行贝利亚引入的一些邪恶的折磨。当一个新的受害者被送到她身边时，她接到贝利亚的私人电话，贝利亚命令她应用她的发明。甜美美丽的少妇用悠扬的声音恳求病人坐下来进行例行检查。她接到贝利亚打来的私人电话，贝利亚命令她应用她的发明。甜美美丽的少妇用悠扬的声音恳求病人坐下来进行例行检查。她接到贝利亚打来的私人电话，贝利亚命令她应用她的发明。甜美美丽的少妇用悠扬的声音恳求病人坐下来进行例行检查。

Awoken in the middle of the night and taken to the Lubyanka prison, Pilniak was immediately taken to the office of the head of security. The crime of spying on behalf of the United States and Japan is too serious to be entrusted to anyone other than Beria. Also, Lavrenti is happy to meet an eminent writer. He feels that he can dominate him. The conversation does not look like an investigation. On the contrary. It sounds like a friendly discussion between gentlemen. Beria courteously offers cigarettes. He questions the writer about what he is about to publish and what he thinks of Western literary circles. Just as their long, amiable conversation is about to end, the chief policeman asks the writer to admit that he is spying for Japan. Pilniak denies with the greatest energy.
