The interviewer accepts this answer, noting that if the writer wanted to change his mind, he could be escorted back into the office at any time to make his statement. Beria then rings the bell and orders the guard to accompany his guest to the fourth floor, room 16. Stalin had already legalized torture as a method of obtaining information or a confession of guilt. Beria acquired a good practice of this system. On the fourth floor is the prison dispensary: ​​clinic, hospital, pharmacy and other sections. Room 16 houses dentistry. The manager is a young Georgian graduate of the University of Tiflis: Vera. She is a pretty girl whom Beria forced to become his mistress, and then took to Moscow. She is tall and slender, and has beautiful big black shiny eyes, as well as a peach skin, but she never smiles. She works in the medical team of Lubyanka prison where she lives. She has a small apartment there. Beria sometimes visits him at night. After office hours, Vera can go out in a black limousine driven by an official driver accompanied by a guard, but she is practically a prisoner and slave of Beria. Besides her normal job as a dentist, Vera has to perform some evil tortures introduced by Beria. When a new victim is sent to her, she receives a personal phone call from Beria who orders her to apply her invention. The sweet and beautiful young woman begs the patient in a melodious voice to sit down for a routine check-up. She works in the medical team of Lubyanka prison where she lives. She has a small apartment there. Beria sometimes visits him at night. After office hours, Vera can go out in a black limousine driven by an official driver accompanied by a guard, but she is practically a prisoner and slave of Beria. Besides her normal job as a dentist, Vera has to perform some evil tortures introduced by Beria. When a new victim is sent to her, she receives a personal phone call from Beria who orders her to apply her invention. The sweet and beautiful young woman begs the patient in a melodious voice to sit down for a routine check-up. She works in the medical team of Lubyanka prison where she lives. She has a small apartment there. Beria sometimes visits him at night. After office hours, Vera can go out in a black limousine driven by an official driver accompanied by a guard, but she is practically a prisoner and slave of Beria. Besides her normal job as a dentist, Vera has to perform some evil tortures introduced by Beria. When a new victim is sent to her, she receives a personal phone call from Beria who orders her to apply her invention. The sweet and beautiful young woman begs the patient in a melodious voice to sit down for a routine check-up. Vera can go out in a black limousine driven by an official driver accompanied by a guard, but she is practically a prisoner and slave of Beria. Besides her normal job as a dentist, Vera has to perform some evil tortures introduced by Beria. When a new victim is sent to her, she receives a personal phone call from Beria who orders her to apply her invention. The sweet and beautiful young woman begs the patient in a melodious voice to sit down for a routine check-up. Vera can go out in a black limousine driven by an official driver accompanied by a guard, but she is practically a prisoner and slave of Beria. Besides her normal job as a dentist, Vera has to perform some evil tortures introduced by Beria. When a new victim is sent to her, she receives a personal phone call from Beria who orders her to apply her invention. The sweet and beautiful young woman begs the patient in a melodious voice to sit down for a routine check-up. she receives a personal phone call from Beria who orders her to apply her invention. The sweet and beautiful young woman begs the patient in a melodious voice to sit down for a routine check-up. she receives a personal phone call from Beria who orders her to apply her invention. The sweet and beautiful young woman begs the patient in a melodious voice to sit down for a routine check-up.

当这名男子坐在椅子上并张开嘴时，警卫牢牢地抓住了他，而牙医开始在一颗健康的牙齿上钻一个洞，然后在另一颗牙齿上钻一个洞。只有当该男子对警卫提出的问题做出肯定的反应时，事情才会停止：他愿意返回调查员办公室并承认自己有罪吗？如果囚犯坚持不懈，穿孔就会继续。

As soon as the man is in the chair and has opened his mouth, the guard grabs him firmly while the dentist begins to drill a hole in a healthy tooth, then in another. It only stops when the man responds with an affirmative sign to the question posed by the guard: would he like to return to the investigator's office and admit his guilt? If the prisoner persists, the perforations continue.

十五分钟后，鲍里斯·皮尔尼亚克在贝利亚的办公室里承认了他被指控的所有罪行。贝利亚以礼貌理解的态度接受了他的证词。案子结束了。拉夫连季认识到，迅速处决皮尔尼亚克并不会让斯大林满意，而慢速死去诽谤他的书的作者则更不讨好。鲍里斯·安德烈耶维奇·皮尔尼亚克未经审判就被判处在西伯利亚东北部科雷马矿山强迫劳动十年。

Fifteen minutes later, Boris Pilniak confesses, in Beria's office, to all the crimes of which he is accused. Beria receives his deposition with polite understanding. The case is over. Lavrenty realizes that a quick execution of Pilniak would not please Stalin as much as a slow death of the author of the book that had smeared him. Boris Andreievitch Pilniak is condemned without trial to ten years of forced labor in the mines of Kolyma, in the North-East of Siberia.

皮尔尼亚克的例子当然不是独一无二的。许多其他作家、诗人、剧作家和艺术家也有同样的命运。

The case of Pilnyak is certainly not unique. Many other writers, poets, playwrights and artists share the same fate.

理查德·斯坦德 (Richard Stande) 是一位波兰诗人，1931 年从家乡华沙移民到苏联，在那里创办并编辑了评论《文学月刊》，他被贝利亚逮捕，唯一的原因是他是另一位波兰作家的密友。布鲁诺·亚森斯基（Bruno Yasenski）已被监禁两年。亚森斯基在法国出版了小说《我的巴黎》（Je brule Paris），该小说被翻译成多种语言并受到评论家的高度评价，后来被法国驱逐，来到俄罗斯，在那里他获得了苏联公民身份并加入了共产党。他立即加入苏联作家协会董事会，并成为《国际文学》杂志的主编。，以四种语言出版并在国外发行的期刊。理查德·斯坦德是他的副手。亚森斯基还出版了《大众文化》杂志，以波兰语出版，在共产党被法律取缔的波兰传播共产主义宣传。亚森斯基因毫无根据的信息被耶约夫逮捕，目前仍在等待受审。对于贝利亚来说，这两个人是波兰知识分子就足够了：他讨厌他们。官方指控他们是波兰间谍。斯坦德在审讯过程中明白自己没有什么可失去的，他的行为不像幼虫。他勇敢地反抗。被摄像头判处死刑，他于当晚在卢比扬卡的地窖中被处决。亚森斯基是一位娇弱的诗人，在狱中患上肺结核，病情严重，在符拉迪沃斯托克附近的劳改营里被关押了十五年。拉夫连季知道，火车运输的艰辛，牛车和监狱船的旅程，以及前往集中营的漫长而疲惫的步行，对于这位波兰文人来说将是致命的，对他们来说，被子弹打死比死还难。怜悯的行为。

Richard Stande, a Polish poet who emigrated in 1931 from his native Warsaw to the Soviet Union where he founded and edited a review, The Literary Monthly , was arrested by Beria for the sole reason that he was the close friend of a another Polish writer, Bruno Yasenski, who has already been imprisoned for two years. Yasenski, expelled from France where he had published a novel, Je brule Paris , translated into several languages ​​and highly acclaimed by critics, came to Russia where he received Soviet citizenship and joined the Communist Party. He immediately joined the board of directors of the Society of Soviet Writers and became editor-in-chief of International Literature., a journal published in four languages ​​for distribution abroad. Richard Stande was his deputy. Yasenski also published the magazine Culture for the masses , published in Polish to spread communist propaganda in Poland where the communist party was banned by law. Arrested by Yejov on unfounded information, Yasenski is still waiting to go to trial. For Beria, it is enough that these two individuals are Polish intellectuals: he hates them. Officially, they are accused of being Polish spies. Stande, who understood during the interrogation that he had nothing to lose, did not behave like a larva. He valiantly resisted. Sentenced to death in camera, he was executed the same night in the cellars of the Lubyanka. Yasenski, a delicate poet, seriously affected by the tuberculosis he contracted in prison, received fifteen years of internment in a forced labor camp near Vladivostok. Lavrenti knows that the rigors of the transport by train, the journey in the cattle car and the prison boat, then the long, exhausting walk to the camp will be fatal to the Polish man of letters for whom death by bullet would not be than an act of pity.

贝利亚还领导了对剧院的袭击。在苏联，董事会世界的生动表达一直被认为是共产主义宣传的最佳工具之一。因此，安全部门对他进行高度关注是适当的。俄罗斯戏剧界最杰出的人物之一弗谢沃洛德·梅耶霍尔德立即成为贝利亚愤怒的目标。梅耶荷德是十月革命后莫斯科艺术剧院伟大导演和支柱康斯坦丁·斯坦尼斯拉夫斯基的杰出弟子，他加入了共产党，抛弃了斯坦尼斯拉夫斯基，创办了自己的剧院。尽管苏联政权在艺术上只相信社会现实主义并且不赞成这种取向，但它很快就成为了一个前卫剧院。然而，梅耶荷德意识到自己是莫斯科艺术界最受欢迎的人物之一，他相信自己可以逃脱惩罚。他是高尔基的朋友，他演过高尔基的戏剧，而且，他也不会像高尔基那样像第一个来的人那样被消灭。但苏联艺术，尤其是戏剧艺术，并没有提供任何实验的空间。在共产主义国家，艺术必须通过将大众的思想提升到马克思主义的思维方式来教育和娱乐大众，而不是危险的创新。剧院必须教育群众并为他们指明道路。但他无法引诱人们进入黑暗曲折的迷宫。多年来，弗谢沃洛德·梅耶霍尔德成为了一个越来越有争议的人物，但他仍然保持自由。这种情况一直持续到贝利亚上台为止。拉夫伦蒂经常去剧院不仅是为了视察剧院，这是他工作的一部分，也是为了自己的享受，以及寻找可能与他产生联系的年轻女演员。他观看了梅耶荷德的几部作品，但对它们并不满意。在他看来，这种戏剧形式并不构成大众文化。拉夫连季毫不怀疑，通过摧毁梅耶荷德这个犹太人，他会取悦斯大林，因为斯大林憎恨一般精英，特别是犹太精英，因为他认为犹太知识分子是不稳定的永久根源。关闭迈尔霍尔德剧院会让独裁者感到满意，他追捕社会现实主义以外的所有艺术形式，并且无法忍受看到一个犹太人在莫斯科指挥一座伟大的剧院。

Beria also leads an attack on the theater. The lively expression of the world of the boards has always been considered in the Soviet Union as one of the best instruments of communist propaganda. It is therefore appropriate that the Security monitors him with the greatest attention. Immediately, Vsevolod Meïerhold, one of the most eminent figures of Russian theater, served as a target for Beria's anger. A remarkable disciple of Konstantin Stanislavski, the great director and pillar of the Moscow Art Theater after the October Revolution, Meïerhold joined the Communist Party, abandoned Stanislavski and founded his own theatre. It quickly became an avant-garde theater despite the fact that the Soviet regime only believed in social realism in artistic matters and disapproved of such an orientation. However, Aware of being one of the most popular figures in artistic life in Moscow, Meïerhold believed he could get away with it. He was a friend of Gorki, whose plays he played, and, no more than Gorki, can he be annihilated like the first comer. But Soviet art in general, and dramatic art in particular, offers no room for experimentation. In a communist country, art must educate and entertain the masses by elevating their minds to the Marxist way of thinking, without dangerous innovation. The theater must educate the masses and show them the way. But he cannot lure the people into the dark twists and turns of a labyrinth. Over the years, Vsevolod Meïerhold became an increasingly controversial figure, but he remained free. This continues until Beria comes to power. Lavrenti frequents theaters not only to inspect them as part of his job, but also for his own enjoyment, as well as to scout young actresses he might bond with. He attends several of Meïerhold's creations, but is not satisfied with them. In his view, this form of theater does not constitute mass culture. Lavrenti has no doubt that by destroying Meïerhold, a Jew, he will please Stalin, who hates the elite in general and the Jewish elite in particular, considering that the Jewish intelligentsia is a perpetual cause of instability. Closing the Meierhold Theater would give satisfaction to the dictator, who hunts down every form of art other than social realism and who cannot bear to see a Jew directing a great theater in Moscow.

1939 年，弗谢沃洛德·梅耶霍尔德 (Vsevolod Meïerhold) 在莫里哀的《唐璜》闭幕之夜后被捕。梅耶荷德独自回家。他的妻子吉娜是一位著名女演员，但她没有出演这部剧。今晚她没有来剧院。在一条荒无人烟的街道上，他们将他推上警车，直接送往卢比扬卡监狱。贝利亚专员向他询问。

In 1939, Vsevolod Meïerhold was arrested after the closing night of Molière's Don Juan . Meïerhold goes home alone. His wife Zina, a famous actress, does not act in this play. She didn't come to the theater tonight. In a deserted street, they push him into a police car and drive him straight to Lubyanka prison. Commissioner Beria questions him.

与此同时，梅耶霍尔德前门的门铃响了。吉娜打开门，看到一名秘密警察和另外两名官员。内务人民委员部特工以寻找武器和反共宣传文件为借口，销毁了梅耶荷德的所有纪念品：同事的亲笔签名照片、海报、剧院门票和新闻剪报，这些都是艺术家最珍贵的瑰宝。当他们找到梅耶荷德日记的手稿时，吉娜恳求他们没收它，如果他们愿意的话，但至少保留它。他的祈祷仍然没有效果。回忆录一页一页地被撕掉。梅耶荷德伟大的图书馆也以同样的方式被毁：珍稀版本和珍贵的作者和私人朋友的亲笔手稿，如安东·契诃夫、马克西姆·高尔基、

At the same time, the doorbell of Meïerhold's front door rang. Zina opens and sees a secret police officer and two other officials. Under the pretext of looking for weapons and anti-communist propaganda documents, the NKVD agents destroy all of Meïerhold's souvenirs: autographed photographs of his colleagues, posters, theater tickets and press clippings, the most precious gems for an artist. When they find the manuscript of Meïerhold's diary, Zina begs them to confiscate it, if they want, but at least preserve it. His prayer remains without effect. The pages of the memoirs are torn out one by one. The great library of Meïerhold is ruined in the same way: rare editions and precious autograph manuscripts of authors and personal friends like Anton Chekhov, Maxime Gorky,

显然，如果官员们没有逮捕迈尔霍尔德的妻子，也没有没收任何文件，那是因为他们是在安全局局长的严格命令下行事的。

It is obvious that if the officials do not arrest Meierhold's wife and seize no papers, it is because they are acting under strict orders from the chief of the Sûreté.

在此期间，拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇与剧院导演进行了一场复杂的讨论，并在谈话结束时向他宣布他的剧院必须关闭。贝利亚还要求囚犯签署协议并接受在阿尔汉格尔斯克地区集中营服刑十五年的判决。

During this time, Lavrenti Pavlovich leads a sophisticated discussion with the theater director and concludes the conversation by announcing to him that his theater must be closed. Beria also asks the prisoner to sign the protocol and accept the sentence of fifteen years of hard labor in a concentration camp in the Arkhangelsk region.

特工们离开梅耶霍尔德的公寓时，已经彻底崩溃了。床垫被撕破，著名艺术家的画作被撕裂，桌子被斧子砍断，椅子被打破，台灯被打碎。唯一完好无损的家具是齐娜躺着的沙发，她的前额中弹身亡。

The agents leave Meïerhold's apartment completely devastated. The mattresses are torn, the paintings of famous artists lacerated, the desk hewn with an axe, the chairs broken, the lamps shattered. The only intact piece of furniture is the sofa on which lies Zina, killed by a bullet in the forehead.

最有天赋的作家和剧作家之一巴贝尔也遭遇了类似的命运。他是一位老布尔什维克，共产党员，内战时期苏军的勇敢军官。他的书深受广大读者的喜爱。有些像红色骑兵，被翻译成法语。他在西方国家的受欢迎程度以及他短暂的法国之行等事实足以让他以为西方利益从事间谍活动的罪名被捕。此外，巴贝尔的名字叫伊萨克，是来自敖德萨的乌克兰犹太人。一些鲜为人知的评论家和二流作家的文章，发表在《真理报》和《消息报》上，指责巴别尔背离苏联艺术和共产主义路线。他们要求禁止他的作品登上舞台和苏联图书馆。这些受到贝利亚启发的公众抱怨足以引发行动。巴贝尔别无选择，只能承认自己的罪行。他被判处在集中营监禁十年。

A similar fate befell one of the most gifted authors and playwrights: Babel. He is an old Bolshevik, member of the Communist Party and brave officer of the Soviet Army during the Civil War. His books enjoy a wide audience. Some like the Red Cavalry , are translated into French. Facts such as his popularity in Western countries and his brief trip to France are enough to arrest him on the charge of spying for the benefit of the West. In addition Babel, whose name is Isaak, is a Ukrainian Jew from Odessa. Some articles by little-known critics and second-rate writers, which appeared in Pravda and Izvestia, accuse Babel of deviating from Soviet art and the communist line. They demand that his works be banned from the stage and from Soviet libraries. These public complaints, inspired by Beria, are enough to bring an action. Babel has no choice but to admit his crime. He is condemned to ten years of internment in a concentration camp.

新任内政委员不仅迫害犹太或波兰文人，还迫害俄罗斯人。他知道，如果不是这样，非犹太作家就会感到安全。但他想让所有知识分子保持警惕。除了皮尔尼亚克、梅耶荷德和巴贝尔之外，他还逮捕了俄罗斯小说家潘捷列蒙·罗曼诺夫，后者因小说《三双丝袜》而闻名于西方，该小说被改编成舞台剧并在国外上映并取得了巨大成功。罗曼诺夫因与外国保持联系和出身贵族的罪名而被贝利亚关押——在共产主义司法看来，这是一种犯罪——罗曼诺夫在镜头前被判处死刑。尼古拉·奥格尼奥夫（Nikolai Ogniov），两部迷人小说的作者，《小学生日记》和《学生日记》在年轻人中太受欢迎了，不能置之不理。贝利亚是一个聪明人，热爱读书。但他也喜欢证明自己对个人的权力。这足以证明对奥格诺夫的惩罚是合理的，他的最后一本书《三维度》，似乎并不认同贝利亚专员眼中的总路线。对于拉夫伦蒂来说，能在半夜把这样一个人从家里抓出来，并在简短的谈话后把他打倒，这是一种极大的快乐，也是一种胜利。贝利亚喜欢把一个几个小时前还是名人的人贬得一文不值。尼古拉·奥格尼奥夫被关在卢比扬卡监狱地下室一间没有灯光的单独牢房里，几周后去世。

The new Commissar for Internal Affairs persecutes not only Jewish or Polish men of letters, but also Russians. He is aware that if this were not so, non-Jewish national authors would feel safe. But he wants to keep all intellectuals on the alert. In addition to Pilniak, Meïerhold and Babel, he arrested the Russian novelist Panteleïmon Romanov, known in the West for his novel Three Pairs of Silk Stockings , adapted for the stage and presented abroad with great success. Locked up by Beria on the accusation of maintaining contacts with foreign countries and of being of aristocratic origin – in the eyes of communist justice, this is a crime – Romanov is condemned to death in camera . Nikolai Ogniov, author of two charming novels,The Diary of a Schoolboy and The Diary of a Student , is too popular among young people to be left alone. Beria, as an intelligent man, loves reading. But he also likes to prove his power over individuals. It is enough to justify the punishment of Ogniov whose last book, The three dimensions, does not seem to agree with the general line in the eyes of Commissioner Beria. It is a great pleasure for Lavrenti, and a triumph, to snatch such a person from his house in the middle of the night and, after a brief conversation, bring him down. Beria likes to reduce to nothing a man who, a few hours earlier, was a celebrity. Kept in a solitary cell without light in the basement of Lubyanka prison, Nikolai Ogniov died a few weeks later.

在红军军官队伍补充期间，内务人民委员部的部队得到了加强，而政治局的队伍和共产党最重要的成员也不再被无意义的清洗所消灭。但构成民族精神的俄罗斯知识分子却被扼住了喉咙。

During the period of replenishment of the Red Army's officer corps, the NKVD troops are reinforced while the ranks of the Politburo and the most prominent members of the Communist Party are no longer wiped out by senseless purges. But the Russian intellectuals, who form the spirit of the nation, are taken by the throat.

现在贝利亚控制着劳改营中的数百万无名奴隶，以及庞大的苏联帝国的艺术精英。从家乡高加索调到莫斯科仅仅一年后，这绝非易事。

Now Beria is in control of millions of anonymous slaves in the labor camps, as well as the artistic elite of the vast Soviet empire. It's no mean feat just a year after being transferred from his native Caucasus to Moscow.

评级

Ratings

37 . 提交人以这种方式被驱逐到远北沃尔库塔的劳改营时亲身经历了这一点。

37 . The author experienced this himself when he was deported in this way to a labor camp in Vorkuta in the far north.

第34章

Chapter 34

工作和娱乐

Work and entertainment

贝利亚还记得布尔什维克第11军入侵阿塞拜疆之前巴库富人居住的美丽白色别墅。他还记得那些迷人房屋的内部装饰，这些房屋在胜利的俄罗斯士兵处决房主后被洗劫一空。贝利亚本人没收了其中一些资产阶级的财产。然后，作为一名契卡官员在当地，他视察了根据他的命令被捕的人的家。他能够欣赏这些房屋的装饰。他在他们的图书馆里看到了法文、德文和英文作品的豪华版本。他看到了餐厅里精致的瓷器、银器和吊灯，以及客厅墙上挂着的珍贵画作。

Beria remembers the beautiful white villas in which the rich people of Baku lived before the invasion of Azerbaijan by the 11th Bolshevik Army. He remembers the interiors of those charming houses that were ransacked by the victorious Russian soldiers after they had executed their owners. Beria himself confiscated the properties of some of these bourgeois. Then, as a Cheka officerlocal, he inspected the homes of people arrested on his orders. He was able to admire the ornamentation of these houses. He saw the luxurious editions of French, German and English works contained in their libraries. He saw the delicate china, silverware and chandeliers of their dining rooms and the precious paintings hanging on the walls of their drawing rooms.

现在贝利亚拥有同样的东西：莫斯科的一栋漂亮的房子和苏联首都郊区的一栋带迷人花园的别墅，距离斯大林住所不远的避暑别墅。这座房子在被贝利亚没收时已经家具齐全了。除了银器和古董外，里面还藏有外国大师的画作，这些画作都是从他在第比利斯统治期间迫害的高贵白人手中没收的。通过苏联驻外大使馆，贝利亚获得了在苏联被禁的法国、德国、英国和美国最优秀作家的作品。他还花钱请家教给儿子教外语。贝利亚将他豪华别墅的一个房间改造成电影院，放映公众无法接触到的外国电影。对于拉夫伦蒂的客人、他的家人和他儿子的朋友来说，这都是一次很棒的娱乐活动。为了供他个人使用，贝利亚在花园的一角建了一个射击场。他喜欢练习使用不同的枪。

Now Beria owns the same things: a beautiful house in Moscow and a villa with a charming garden on the outskirts of the Soviet capital, a summer residence not far from where Stalin lives. This house was already completely furnished when it was confiscated by Beria. Besides silverware and antiquities, it contains paintings by foreign masters, all confiscated from the noble Caucasians he persecuted during his reign in Tiflis. Through Soviet embassies abroad, Beria acquired the works of the best French, German, English and American authors, banned in the Soviet Union. He also pays tutors to teach foreign languages ​​to his son. Beria transforms one of the rooms of his sumptuous villa into a cinema to show foreign films inaccessible to the public. It is a great entertainment for Lavrenti's guests, for his family and for his son's friends. For his personal use, Beria had a shooting gallery built in a corner of the garden. He likes to practice with different guns.

在位于莫斯科卡恰洛夫街的家中，贝利亚在办公桌上锁着的抽屉里藏着大量照片和色情影片。它们由其国外的许多代理商供应，主要在德国、法国、瑞典和丹麦。他还在这个房间的橱柜里放了一系列伏特加和干邑白兰地。他感觉自己越强大，他就越能享受饮酒的乐趣，特别是因为，无论他喝了多少，他总是保持清醒并意识到自己在做什么和说什么。他从来不会说漏嘴的话，以免日后后悔。

In the office of his Moscow house, rue Katchalov, Beria keeps an enormous collection of photographs and pornographic films hidden in a padlocked drawer in his desk. They are supplied to it by its many agents abroad, mainly in Germany, France, Sweden and Denmark. He also keeps a series of bottles of vodka and cognac in a cupboard in this room. The more powerful he feels, the more he takes pleasure in drinking, in particular because, whatever the quantities he absorbs, he always remains lucid and conscious of what he is doing and saying. He never lets slip a word he might regret later.

拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇有一个习惯，就是邀请瓦西里·斯大林喝他最好的外国利口酒，并欣赏他的色情照片。瓦西里是独裁者最喜爱的儿子，独裁者任命他为莫斯科军区空军司令，并在二十四岁时任命他为空军上将。结交这样一位性格的朋友对拉夫伦蒂来说有很大的用处。他知道小斯大林喜欢女人和酒。像贝利亚镇上的房子这样的地方，柜子里装满了饮料、淫秽照片、色情电影，偶尔还有妓女，真是一个天堂。拉夫连季乐意借钱给经常缺乏零用钱的瓦西里·斯大林将军。

Lavrenti Pavlovich has a habit of inviting Vassili Stalin to drink the best of his foreign liqueurs and to contemplate his pornographic photographs. Vasily is the favorite son of the dictator who appointed him chief of the air force of the Moscow Military Region and, at twenty-four, made him an air force general. To make a friend of such a personality is of great use to Lavrenti. He knows that Stalin junior likes women and alcohol. A place like Beria's house in town, with a cabinet full of drinks, obscene photographs, pornographic films, and the occasional prostitute, is a real paradise. Lavrenti willingly lends money to General Vasily Stalin who is constantly short of pocket money.

贝利亚几乎拥有一切：豪华的住所、安静的妻子（如果他愿意的话，他可以侮辱她）和顺从的情妇，在她的办公室里随时听从他的调遣。他是数百万奴隶的主人，他们在矿山和森林中工作，或者按照他的命令建造运河、道路或隧道。他是新闻界的审查者，也是艺术、戏剧和文学的独裁者。他是强大且纪律严明的安全部队的总司令，这支部队拥有最现代化的武器，包括坦克和飞机。如果他愿意的话，他可以逮捕任何他想要的人，并将他们送到他在卢比扬卡监狱的办公室，然后将他们处死。

Beria has almost everything: a sumptuous residence, a peaceful wife whom he can insult if he wants to and a submissive mistress, always at his disposal in her office. He is master of millions of slaves working in the mines and forests or building, on his orders, canals, roads or tunnels. He is the censor of the press and the dictator of the arts, theater and literature. He is the commander-in-chief of the powerful and well-disciplined Sûreté army which has the most modern weapons, including tanks and planes. He can arrest and drive anyone he wants to his office in the Lubyanka prison and put them to death if he pleases.

苏联内务委员兼安全局长拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇·贝利亚（Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria）拥有权力、头衔、金钱和女人。但他还没有完全幸福。他没有到达顶峰。他还没有实现成为第一的野心。没有理由强迫他放弃这个想法。如果斯大林，他的格鲁吉亚同胞，那个来自戈里村的臭嘴，那个拉夫连季鄙视和憎恨的粗野分子，能够做到这一点，那么他，贝利亚，也会做到这一点。

The Commissar of Internal Affairs and Chief of Security of the Soviet Union, Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria, has the power, the titles, the money and the women. But he is not yet fully happy. He didn't reach the top. He has yet to fulfill his ambition of becoming number one. There is no reason forcing him to give up this idea. If Stalin, his fellow Georgian, that smelly muzzle from the village of Gori, that boor whom Lavrenti despises and hates, could do it, then he, Beria, will do it too.

贝利亚现在需要做的就是确保与其他有影响力的人物保持良好的关系，比如小三岁但已经是党中央委员会成员的格奥尔基·马林科夫，或者乌克兰中央委员会第一书记尼基塔·赫鲁晓夫。现在这些人的实力太强大了。我们无法消灭他们。因此，最好与他们保持友好关系，等待时机。然而，其他不占据如此决定性地位的人则是虚拟的敌人，或者他们显然讨厌贝利亚。这个人将利用斯大林的虚荣心和怀疑来清算他们，这种虚荣心和斯大林的怀疑一直发展到了痴迷的地步。

All Beria needs to do for now is make sure to maintain good relations with other influential figures like Georgi Malenkov who, although three years younger, is already part of the Party Central Committee, or like Nikita Khrushchev, first secretary of the Central Committee of Ukraine. These men are too powerful right now. We cannot annihilate them. It is therefore better to bide your time by being friendly with them. Others, however, who do not occupy such decisive positions, are virtual enemies or they obviously hate Beria. This one will liquidate them by using against them the vanity and the suspicion of Stalin, which developed until the obsession.

贝利亚始终牢记这样一个观念：政治家的首要原则是尽可能地为上司服务，只要他继续掌权并能恩待他忠诚的下属。但这位谦虚、高效、永远可用的弟子必须同时保持耐心，并做好准备，在时机成熟时，割断上级的喉咙并取代他的位置。

Beria constantly keeps in mind the idea that the first principle for a statesman is to serve the boss as best as possible as long as this man remains in power and can bestow his favors on his loyal subordinates. But this humble, efficient and perpetually available disciple must at the same time be patient and be ready, when the time comes, to cut his superior's throat and take his place.

贝利亚政委除了担任集中营负责人、内务人民委员部主席和知识分子良心的职务外，还是一个称为特别部门的行政部门的负责人。它是所谓的居民及其下属的网络，换句话说，是分散在世界各地的间谍链条。贝利亚还发现自己是本届政府一个名为“机动小组”的单位的负责人，该单位根据需要被派往国外，镇压主要的托洛茨基主义者并绑架或杀害苏联逃兵。贝利亚重组并完善了他从前任叶约夫那里继承的这些职位。他们的活动，特别是在外国绑架和暗杀苏联的敌人，必须以最小的噪音和尽可能多的预防措施进行，以便将其伪装成自杀或事故。1937 年，来自叶若夫的人在巴黎绑架了两名俄罗斯将军米勒和库特波夫，这件事引起了巨大的丑闻，以至于不允许再使用这种残酷的手段。

In addition to his functions as master of the camps, head of the NKVD and conscience of the intellectuals, Commissar Beria is also head of an administration called the Special Department. It is the network of so-called Residents and their subordinates, in other words, the chain of spies scattered across the world. Beria also found himself at the head of a unit of this administration, called the Mobile Group, which was sent abroad, as needed, to suppress the main Trotskyists and to kidnap or kill Soviet deserters. Beria reorganized and perfected these offices which he inherited from his predecessor Yejov. Their activities, in particular the kidnappings and assassinations in foreign lands of enemies of the Soviets, must be done with the least noise and with the most possible precautions so as to camouflage them as suicide or accident. The kidnapping of the two Russian generals Miller and Kutepov, carried out in 1937 in Paris, by men from Yezhov, caused too great a scandal to allow such brutal methods to be used any longer.

当他通过外交邮袋收到苏联驻比利时大使馆的消息，宣布格奥尔基·阿加别科夫已从巴黎抵达布鲁塞尔时，贝利亚决定立即清算他，而不是公开绑架事件。这个格奥尔基·阿加别科夫正是几年前在莫斯科精选酒店的房间里命令贝利亚逮捕米亚斯尼科夫政委的人。阿加贝科夫成为土耳其格别乌的居民后，前往巴黎避难。

When he receives, via the diplomatic pouch, a message from the Soviet Embassy in Belgium announcing that Georgi Agabekov has arrived in Brussels from Paris, Beria decides to liquidate him promptly without the publicity of a kidnapping. This Georgi Agabekov is the very man who, several years ago, had ordered Beria, in his room at the Select Hotel in Moscow, to seize Commissar Miasnikov. Having become a resident of the GPU in Turkey, Agabekov took refuge in Paris.

在那里，他写了回忆录《苏联政治警察》，其中描述了苏联在东方以及德国、法国和美国的间谍活动的方法。他揭露了GPU最机密的秘密。此外，当他回忆起与拉夫连季·贝利亚一起前往格鲁吉亚时，他将后者描述为一个顽固的警察，对共产党和中央委员会的问题一无所知，只关心“第比利斯的小事，被排除在大政治之外”。

There he wrote his memoirs, GPU, the Soviet Political Police , in which he described the methods of Soviet espionage in the East as well as in Germany, France and the United States. He reveals the most confidential secrets of the GPU . Moreover, when he recalls his trip to Georgia with Lavrenty Beria, he describes the latter as a stubborn policeman, uninformed of the Communist Party and the problems of the Central Committee, and of whom only "the little affairs of Tiflis are of concern, at the exclusion from big politics”.

这本书于 1930 年在巴黎用俄文写成，很快被翻译成法文、德文、英文，并在巴黎、柏林和纽约出版。GPU的人为了追捕阿加别科夫，他们进行了十年的密集追捕，但叛逃者总是设法挫败他们的陷阱。最后，阿加别科夫在布鲁塞尔被追捕，他以假名和假证件住在一家小旅馆里。把阿加别科夫活着带回莫斯科，拉夫连季会得到最好的报复，得到最大的满足，因为他可以一根一根地拔掉牙齿，折断骨头，但苏联安全部部长决定牺牲这长达一小时的快感. 或两个苏联秘密警察的声誉，以防绑架未遂并被外国媒体泄露。

This book, written in Russian in Paris in 1930, was soon translated into French, German, English and published in Paris, Berlin and New York. The men of the GPUlead an intensive hunt for ten years in pursuit of Agabekov, but the defector always manages to thwart their traps. Finally, Agabekov is hunted down in Brussels where, under a false name and with false papers, he lives in a small hotel. Lavrenty would get the best revenge and get the greatest satisfaction from bringing Agabekov back alive to Moscow, because he could pull out his teeth and break his bones one by one, but the head of the Soviet Security Department decides to sacrifice this hour-long pleasure. or two to the reputation of the Soviet secret police, in case an attempted kidnapping did not meet with full success and was leaked by the foreign press.

贝利亚的命令建议以一种不会引起西方注意的方式处决阿加别科夫。而且，这对苏联驻比利时使馆的工作人员，以及分散在世界各地的外交人员同事来说，都是一个很好的警告：逃兵迟早，甚至十年后，都会被暗杀。

Beria's orders recommend executing Agabekov in a way that cannot attract attention in the West. Moreover, it would be a good warning for the employees of the Soviet embassy in Belgium, as well as for their colleagues of the diplomatic personnel scattered throughout the world that sooner or later, even ten years later, a deserter would be assassinated.

由于阿加别科夫已经两天没有出现在酒店走廊里，经理报了进入他房间的警察。他不在那儿，但床头柜上有一封写给当局的信。这位来自巴黎的神秘旅行者写道，他的真名是格奥尔基·阿加别科夫（Georgi Agabekov），前苏联安全部队东段负责人，也是格别乌（GPU）在伊斯坦布尔的秘密驻地，也是《苏联政治警察》一书的作者。他进一步告诉当地政府，他长期以来一直患有精神崩溃，并决定溺水身亡。

As Agabekov has not reappeared for two days in the corridors of the hotel, the manager calls the police who enter his room. He's not there, but on the nightstand is a letter addressed to the authorities. The mysterious traveler from Paris writes that his real name is Georgi Agabekov, former head of the eastern section of the Soviet Security and secret resident of the GPU in Istanbul, and that he is the author of the book GPU, the Soviet political police. . He further informs the local authorities that he has been suffering from a nervous breakdown for a long time and has decided to drown.

比利时警方没有请任何专家来核实这封信是否出自自杀者之手。但几天后，当一具身份不明、衣冠楚楚、但没有证件的男子的尸体从塞纳被移出时，头骨上有被击打的痕迹。

The Belgian police do not call on any expert to verify whether the letter is well written by the hand of the suicide. But when, a few days later, the body of an unidentified man, well dressed, but without papers, is removed from the Senne, there are traces of blows on the skull.

阿加别科夫的暗杀对于移动集团的清算人来说是一个小小的成功。苏联公众完全没有注意到这一点，媒体没有宣布格奥尔基·阿加别科夫（Georgi Agabekov）这个无名人物的去世。然而，苏联驻外代表对夺走阿加别科夫生命的那只手没有任何怀疑。暗杀事件发生几天后，叶夫根尼·杜姆巴泽 (Evgeni Doumbadzé) 被发现死于巴黎。这位来自第比利斯的热心共产主义者、红军志愿者和前契卡员在失望之余前往法国避难。据推测，他是在左岸公寓的小厨房里被煤气窒息而死的。和阿加别科夫一样，他给法国警方留下了一张纸条，解释说，他对自己作为流亡者的贫困生活感到厌恶，决定结束自己的痛苦。像阿加别科夫一样，Na sloujbé Tcheka i Cominterna（为切卡和共产国际服务）。他在那里将贝利亚描述为嗜血的刽子手。苏联内务人民委员拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇·贝利亚不能允许发布此类泄密事件的罪行逍遥法外。

The assassination of Agabekov is a small success for the liquidators of the Mobile Group. It goes completely unnoticed by the public of the Soviet Union where the death of Georgi Agabekov, an obscure character, is not announced by the press. None of the Soviet representations abroad, however, has any doubts about the hand which deprived Agabekov of his life. A few days after this assassination, Evgeni Doumbadzé was found dead in Paris. It was this ardent communist, Red Army volunteer and former Chekist from Tiflis, who, disenchanted, took refuge in France. He is supposed to have asphyxiated himself, by the gas, in the small kitchen of his apartment on the left bank. Like Agabekov, he left a note for the French police explaining that, disgusted with his poor existence as an émigré, he had decided to put an end to his miseries. Like Agabekov,Na sloujbé Tcheka i Cominterna (In the service of the Tcheka and the Comintern) . He describes Beria there as a bloodthirsty executioner. The People's Commissar for Internal Affairs of the USSR, Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria, cannot allow the crime of having published such revelations to go unpunished.

** **

* * *

贝利亚在她的办公室里放了一瓶伏特加。他喜欢吃从内务人民委员部军官食堂给他带来的饭菜。这家豪华餐厅就在附近，位于贝利亚 (Beria) 前精选酒店(Select hotel) 内，现已改建为各个警察部门的办公室。

Beria keeps a bottle of vodka in her office. He likes to wash down the meal brought to him from the NKVD officers' mess. This sumptuous restaurant is nearby, in the former Select hotel that Beria has transformed into offices for various police departments.

喝几杯伏特加通常会给他从清晨到深夜工作所需的热情。伏特加让他头脑清醒，让他更容易想象出一种设置陷阱的方法，对他要审问的人提出意想不到的问题。当他计划举办一场大型狩猎队，旨在为新建成的工作营提供人口，或为新铁路站点或矿井钻探提供劳动力时，这激发了他的想象力。她给了他更多的精力来审问他逮捕的人，并用他放在抽屉里的铁棍打他们。有时酒精会让他坠入爱河。在这种情况下，如果他下午没有重要的会议，他就会拖着他的助手萨尔基索夫上校，在旅途中。他们乘坐贝利亚的政府汽车，一辆黑色帕卡德大车，由穿着制服的司机驾驶，然后进城。

A few shots of vodka usually give him the necessary zest to work from early morning until late at night. The vodka clears his mind and makes it easier for him to imagine a way to set a trap, using unexpected questions to the people he is about to interrogate. It stimulates his imagination when he plans a large hunting party intended to populate a recently built work camp or to provide labor for a new railway site or the drilling of a mine. She gives him more energy to interrogate the people he has had arrested and to hit them with the iron rod he keeps in a drawer. Sometimes alcohol makes him fall in love. In these cases, if he has no important meeting in the afternoon, he drags his assistant, Colonel Sarkissov, on a trip. They take Beria's government car, a big black Packard driven by a uniformed driver, and they go down to town.

他们通常停在苏联陆军剧院附近。附近是陀思妥耶夫斯基街和陀思妥耶夫斯基学院。两点过后不久，课程结束，学生们离开教学楼回家。

They usually stop near the Soviet Army Theater. In its vicinity is Dostoyevsky Street with Fyodor Dostoyevsky College. Shortly after two o'clock, classes end and the students leave the building to go home.

贝利亚在半遮住汽车绿色车窗的窗帘后面观察着这些年轻人，就像一只监视的黑豹，隐藏在灌木丛中，监视着一群小鹿或雄鹿。他看着学生们从黑暗建筑的大门中走出来，就像一群从黑暗中出现的人一样。他坐在埋伏处，安静而耐心。他并不着急。他有所有的时间。

Behind the curtain that half hides the greenish windows of his car, Beria observes the young people like a panther on the lookout who, hidden in a thicket, spies on a herd of fallow deer or stags. He watches the students who come out through the great door of the dark building like a herd emerging from the darkness. He sits in ambush, quiet and patient. He is not in a hurry. He has all the time.

最后，当他看到一个十四十五岁、圆圆的脸蛋、红润如蜜桃般的脸颊、无辜的大眼睛、清新如朝露的嘴唇、笑得无忧无虑的洁白牙齿的少女时，他向她点了点头。

Finally, when he sees a chubby young girl, fourteen or fifteen, with a round face, cheeks rosy and soft as peaches, large innocent eyes, lips fresh as morning dew, white teeth revealed by a smiling carefree, he nods at her.

萨尔基索夫上校下了车，朝年轻女孩走去。他是个高个子男人，四十多岁。他穿着海军蓝色的内务人民委员部军官制服，令人印象深刻，而且看起来很危险。

Colonel Sarkissov leaves the car and walks towards the young girl. He is a tall man, in his forties. In his navy blue uniform of an NKVD officer, he is impressive and seems dangerous.

他向女孩鞠了一躬，请她跟随他。这不是命令，而是礼貌的愿望。表达的语气却不容拒绝。经常使用双筒望远镜的贝利亚在车上可以看到受害者惊恐的眼神中闪过一丝惊恐，仿佛心脏受到了重击。他喜欢。

Approaching the girl with a brief bow, he asks her to follow him. This is not an order, but a polite wish. It is expressed in a tone which, however, does not allow refusal. From his car, Beria, who often uses binoculars, can see a flash of terror in the victim's horrified eyes, as if he had been struck in the heart. He likes it.

女孩明白，拯救或逃跑是不可能的。她必须抛弃那群目瞪口呆的朋友，像奴隶一样低着头，跟随折磨她的人。她知道自己的命运。当女孩上车坐在他旁边时，贝利亚甚至没有看她一眼。他确信她会求他放她走，她会尖叫，孩子气的泪水从她红润的脸颊上滚落，她会尝试亲吻他的手和脚，以表达他的怜悯。这种感官上的愉悦，他想一直保存到他们独处的那一刻。

The girl understands that there is no possible salvation or flight. She must abandon the group of her stunned friends and, her head bent like a slave, follow her torturer. She is aware of her fate. When the girl gets into the car and sits next to him, Beria doesn't even look at her. He's sure she'll beg him to let her go, she'll scream as big childish tears roll down her rosy cheeks and she'll try to kiss his hands and feet for his pity. This sensual pleasure, he wants to preserve it until the moment when they will be alone.

不一会儿，车子就穿过了卢比安卡监狱的大门，停在院子里，停在通向贝利亚办公室的后门前。萨尔基索夫上校紧紧地挽着年轻女孩的手臂，带领着她穿过又长又黑、狭窄的走廊，走廊里只有几个电灯泡照明。最终，她被推进了贝利亚的办公室，贝利亚走在她身后并锁上了门。

A short time later, the car passed through the door of the Lubianka prison and stopped in the courtyard, in front of the back door which gave access to Beria's office. The arm firmly held by Colonel Sarkissov, the young girl is led through the long, dark, narrow corridor lit only by a few electric bulbs. Eventually, she is pushed into Beria's office who walks behind her and locks the door.

他在桌边坐下，用平静、冷漠、几乎毫无表情的声音命令年轻女孩脱掉衣服。如果她仍然站在他面前，浑身颤抖、哭泣，并且不假装服从，贝利亚就会从抽屉里拿出一根马鞭，离开桌子，面对年轻女孩，打她的小腿。她可以随心所欲地尖叫。贝利亚办公室的墙壁和门上铺着厚厚的隔音地毯。即使警卫听到尖叫声，谁在乎呢？贝利亚不在乎。不管怎样，几乎每个人都在他的办公室里大喊大叫。那里没有人笑。

He sits down at his table and in a calm, indifferent, almost inexpressive voice, he orders the young girl to undress. If she remains planted in front of him, trembling and sobbing, and does not pretend to obey, Beria takes a riding crop from a drawer, leaves her table, faces the young girl and hits her in the calves. She can scream as loud as she wants. The walls and door to Beria's office are lined with thick, sound-dampening rugs. And even if a guard heard screaming, who cares? Beria doesn't care. Anyway, almost everyone shouts in his office. Nobody laughs there.

如果女孩跪下来恳求她，贝利亚就会让她哭泣并反击。然后他在她的肩膀上拍了一两下，并以平静而庄重的声音重复了他的命令。最后，年轻的女孩被打败了，开始脱衣服。当她赤身裸体时，贝利亚把她拖到沙发上，用她全身的重量压倒她。如果她本能地挤压她的腿，你就必须用力抓住她。贝利亚用左臂牢牢地抓住她，右手拉着她的头发，把她的头撞在沙发的木框上。女孩很快就彻底崩溃了。接下来是贝利亚最激情的感官享受。当他侵入这年轻无辜的身体，并强奸它的时候。这个可怜、无助、突然失身的少女痛苦地哭喊着。这是他抵抗的终结，也是一切的终结。她被这个男人的体重压垮了，这个男人用他宽阔、毛茸茸的胸膛覆盖着她，把她压在坚硬的层上，吸干她天真的年轻眼睛里的泪水。

If the girl falls to her knees and begs her, Beria lets her sob and fight back. Then he strikes her once or twice on the shoulders and, in a calm, ceremonious voice, repeats his order. Finally, the young girl, defeated, begins to undress. When she is naked, Beria drags her to the sofa and knocks her down, crushing her with all her weight. If she instinctively squeezes her legs, you have to take her by force. Beria, grabbing her firmly with her left arm, pulls her hair with her right hand and bangs her head against the wooden frame of the sofa. The girl is soon completely devastated. Then comes the most passionately sensual pleasure for Beria. When he penetrates this young and innocent body, and rapes it. The poor, helpless, suddenly deflowered teenage girl cries out in pain. It's the end of his resistance, and of everything. She is crushed by the mass of this man who, covering her with his broad hairy chest, presses her against the hard bed and drinks the tears from her innocent young eyes.

一切都结束得很快。男人很满意。他的主要愿望就是强奸本身：征服一个反抗他权力的年轻女孩并征服她。他的快乐在于击倒它并摧毁它。玷污这纯洁的身体是拉夫伦蒂·贝利亚的至高乐趣，比单纯的做爱更令人兴奋，这是每个人都可以做到的。

Everything ends quickly. The man is satisfied. His main desire is rape itself: to subjugate a young girl who resists him to his power and to subdue her. His joy consists in striking it down and destroying it. Defiling this pure body is the supreme pleasure of Lavrenti Beria, much more exciting than simply making love, which is within everyone's reach.

脸被男人的下巴划破了，男人从早上起就没有刮胡子，身体从头到脚都冻僵了，小女孩独自一人，还能站起来。她仍然对疼痛感到困惑，伏特加、大蒜、腐烂的牙齿和毛茸茸的腋窝的气味让她的心剧烈跳动，她被命令拿起内衣，擦掉肚子上的处女血，然后穿好衣服。

Her face scratched by the chin of a man who hasn't shaved since the morning and her body frozen from head to toe, the young girl remains alone and can get up. Still bewildered by the pain, her heart heaving by the smell of vodka, garlic, rotten teeth and hairy armpits, she is ordered to pick up her underwear, wipe her stomach her virgin blood and to dress.

贝利亚随后命令萨尔基索夫上校进入并带走女孩。

Beria then orders Colonel Sarkissov to enter and take the girl away.

有时拉夫伦蒂对他的受害者更加慷慨。当他们单独在他的办公室时，他对他年轻的俘虏温柔地微笑，给她巧克力，并说服她没有理由害怕。他承诺很快就会释放她。然后，等女孩平静下来后，他问她有没有兄弟姐妹，父亲的职业是什么，父母相处是否融洽。当小女孩回答说她在家过得很开心时，他向她保证，如果她服从他的愿望，她就能很快加入他的家人。他向她解释说，她必须脱掉衣服，以令他高兴的方式在身体上满足他。否则，他的父母将在当晚被捕，并被送往苏联两端的集中营，而他的兄弟姐妹也将被驱逐到其他劳教所。她所爱之人的命运取决于她。

Sometimes Lavrenti is more generous to his victims. When they are alone in his office, he smiles softly at his young captive, offers her chocolates and persuades her that she has no reason to be frightened. He promises to free her soon. Then, when the girl calms down, he asks her if she has any brothers and sisters, what her father's profession is, and if her parents get along well. When the young girl replies that she is perfectly happy at home, he promises her that she will be able to join his family quickly if she submits to his wishes. He explains to her that she must take off her clothes and physically satisfy him in the way that pleases him. Otherwise, his parents will be arrested the same night and sent to concentration camps at opposite ends of the Soviet Union, while his brothers and sisters will also be deported to other forced labor centers. The fate of those dear to her depends on her.

她有几秒钟的时间做出决定。当被击败的年轻女孩赤身裸体地跪在他的脚下，被迫接受联姻时，男人凝视着她年轻的脸庞，泪流满面，在侮辱和玷污这个无辜的生物中体验到一种特别的快乐。这还远远不够。该男子特别兴奋，然后将受害者扔到地上并强奸了她，以破坏她的童贞。

She has a few seconds to make her decision. When the defeated young girl kneels, completely naked, at his feet, forced to accept the coupling, the man who contemplates her young face drowned in tears, experiences a particular pleasure in degrading and defiling this innocent creature. This is rarely enough. The man, particularly excited, then throws his victim to the ground and rapes her to destroy her virginity.

有时，贝利亚没有带她回卢比扬卡监狱的办公室，而是带她到她位于莫斯科卡恰洛夫街的家。他向不知情的客人提供了一杯酒。喝完之后，女孩睡着了，拉夫伦蒂占有了她。贝利亚妻子出现在家里​​并没有遏制专员的过激行为。房子很大，有很多房间，有两个入口。他的妻子被一劳永逸地命令不得进入拉夫伦蒂的内阁。

Sometimes, instead of taking her back to her office in Lubyanka prison, Beria takes the girl to her Moscow home on Katchalov Street. He offers a glass of wine to his unwitting guest. After drinking it, the girl falls asleep and Lavrenti possesses her. The presence in the house of Beria's wife does not curb the commissioner's excesses. The house is large, with many rooms and two entrances. And his wife was ordered once and for all not to enter Lavrenti's cabinet.

萨尔基索夫上校将这些年轻女孩赶到一条荒无人烟的街道上，并抛弃了她们，她们中的许多人都羞于回家。第二天要回到学校的想法让他们感到害怕。他们看到的唯一出路就是死亡。他们会随机选择跳进莫斯科河或从一栋大公寓的窗户跳下去自杀。没有解决办法。没有什么可以阻止这位挂满勋章的委员拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚喜欢玩的可怕游戏。

Many of these young girls, whom Colonel Sarkissov drives into a deserted street where he abandons them, are too ashamed to return home. The idea of ​​going back to school the next day terrifies them. The only way out they see is death. And they commit suicide by throwing themselves into the Moskva or by throwing themselves from a window of a large apartment house, chosen at random. There is no solution. Nothing can prevent the horrific game that this commissioner studded with decorations, Lavrenti Pavlovich Beria, likes to play.

没有人知道贝利亚什么时候会想要享受一段美好时光，也没有人知道他会选择哪所学校作为他的狩猎场。首都有很多学校，所有年轻人都必须就读。在开明的俄罗斯，不送孩子上学、不让他接受正规教育都是犯罪行为。这种罪行可能会导致父母被驱逐到强迫劳动营。

No one knows when Beria will feel like having a little good time or which school he will choose as his hunting ground. There are many schools in the capital and all young people must attend them. Not sending a child to school, keeping him out of regular education is a crime in enlightened Russia. This offense can result in parents being deported to a forced labor camp.

即使一个年轻女孩有她的父亲或母亲陪伴，她也不会受到保护，因为她的父母在内务人民委员部上校面前会像她一样无助。

Even if a young girl is accompanied by her father or her mother, she is not protected, because her parents would be as helpless as herself in front of a colonel of the NKVD.

最重要的是，贝利亚正在享受他直接上级的默许。斯大林对他下属的喜好和乌合之众一无所知，但他并不在意。

And above all, Beria is having fun with the tacit approval of his direct superior. Stalin knows all about the tastes and the rabble of his subordinate, but he pays no attention to it.

当斯大林得知贝利亚这种或那种越轨行为的细节时，甚至放声大笑。独裁者需要他，他明白贝利亚在给自己一点快乐的时间后，会更加热情和高效地工作。在斯大林看来，拉夫连季·贝利亚是一位卓有成效的权威，也是对该国有用的人物。它解决了许多国家问题，这一事实比一个小弱点重要得多。每个人都有一个，以这样或那样的方式。所以，如果一个十五岁的傻姑娘能够满足这样一个为政府辛勤工作的杰出人物的感觉，她就不能把这件事闹剧了。所有年轻女孩最终都会失去童贞，所以越早越好。

Stalin even goes so far as to laugh loudly when he learns details of this or that escapade of Beria. The dictator needs him and he understands that Beria, after giving himself a little good time, works with more ardor and efficiency. In Stalin's opinion, Lavrenty Beria is an exceptionally productive authority and a useful personality in the country. It solves many state problems and this fact is much more important than a small weakness. Every human being has one, in one way or another. So if a silly fifteen-year-old girl can satisfy the senses of such a remarkable personality who works so hard for the government, she must not make a drama of it. All young girls eventually lose their virginity, so the sooner the better.

第35章

Chapter 35

服务与奖励

Services and rewards

在克里姆林宫一间几乎空无一人的大房间里，斯大林坐在一张低矮的老式桌子后面。他对面站着政委拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚，他像一名士兵一样对上级十分殷勤。

In a large, nearly empty room in the Kremlin, Stalin sits behind a low, old-fashioned desk. Opposite him stands Commissar Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria, attentive like a soldier to his superior.

早晨是黑暗而沉闷的，就像独裁者的心情一样。

The morning is dark and dreary like the mood of the dictator.

斯大林刚刚打电话给贝利亚，要求他立即汇报。当拉夫伦蒂抵达克里姆林宫时，他不必像往常一样在接待室等待。他一向警卫队长报告，就被送上楼。

Stalin has just telephoned Beria to ask him to report immediately. When Lavrenti arrives at the Kremlin, he does not have to wait in the antechamber as he usually does before being ushered in. As soon as he reports to the head of the guard, he is sent upstairs.

斯大林怒不可遏。他举起一封写给克里姆林宫的编码电报。电报来自墨西哥城，称加略人犹大再次去看医生。

Stalin boils over with anger. He holds up a coded telegram addressed to the Kremlin. The cable is from Mexico City and says Judas the Iscariot has seen his doctor again.

加略人犹大是斯大林和苏联驻墨西哥大使馆给托洛茨基的绰号。

Judas the Iscariot is the nickname that Stalin and the Soviet Embassy in Mexico give to Leon Trotsky.

贝利亚保持沉默，等待命令或解释。当斯大林被激怒时，他的下属所能做的就是闭嘴，直视独裁者的眼睛。回避斯大林的目光可能会导致死刑。贝利亚非常清楚，这个疯子痴迷于他手下的目光。如果有人不看他的眼睛，就意味着他正在策划一个阴谋，他就有被立即逮捕和处决的风险。因此，我们必须像看门狗看待主人一样看待老板。这就是我们能做的。一个笨拙的问题或一个错误的词也同样危险。

Beria is silent, waiting for orders or an explanation. When Stalin is enraged, all his subordinates can do is keep their mouths shut and stare the dictator straight in the eye. Avoiding Stalin's gaze could lead to a death sentence. Beria knows perfectly well that this maniac is obsessed with the eyes of his men. If someone doesn't look him in the eye, it means he's hatching a plot, he risks being immediately arrested and executed. We must therefore look at the boss as a guard dog looks at his master. That's all we can do. A single clumsy question or a single wrong word would be no less dangerous.

斯大林愤怒的原因是极其难以理解的。加略人犹大就是托洛茨基。好的。“他又去看医生了”这句话的意思就是这个意思。换句话说，托洛茨基又病了。所以呢 ？大家都知道，去墨西哥生活的托洛茨基已经患高血压一年甚至更久了，健康状况岌岌可危。看来，托洛茨基的死敌斯大林应该为这个消息感到高兴。相反，他很愤怒。接下来是长时间的沉默。显然，斯大林正在等待内政委员的答复。必须要说点什么的贝利亚嘟囔了几句，说这个soukin syn——托洛茨基那个母狗的儿子——随时都会死，这太愚蠢了。贝利亚知道这是他唯一可以放心地说的一句话。他立即明白，如果这份电报没有阻碍斯大林的计划，他就不会掀起如此轩然大波。

It is extremely difficult to understand the reasons for Stalin's anger. Judas the Iscariot is Trotsky. GOOD. The phrase "he saw his doctor again" means nothing more than what it says. In other words, Trotsky is sick again. So what ? Everyone knows that Trotsky, who went to live in Mexico, has been suffering from high blood pressure for a year, if not more, and that his health is precarious. It seems that Stalin, Trotsky's mortal enemy, should rejoice at this news. Instead, he is furious. A long silence ensues. It is obvious that Stalin is waiting for an answer from the Commissar of Internal Affairs. Beria, who must say something, mutters a few words, saying that this soukin syn– that son of a female dog – of Trotsky could die at any moment and that's too stupid. Beria is aware that this remark is the only one he can safely make. He instantly understands that if this cable did not thwart Stalin's plans, he would not raise such a hurricane.

他的回答是正确的。斯大林完全同意他的观点。托洛茨基的那个糟糕的犹太人，加略人犹大，随时可能死去。没有时间可以浪费了。这混蛋不可能就这样自然死亡。他必须为他对斯大林犯下的所有罪行受到惩罚。你必须杀了他。对于斯大林来说，消灭托洛茨基是一个野心和威望的问题。这件事太重要了，不容忽视。消灭托洛茨基也应该对苏联国家的其他叛徒发出警告：斯大林的手臂可以伸到任何地方。专门从事海外暗杀活动的移动集团必须迅速而有效地采取行动。

His answer is correct. Stalin is in complete agreement with him. That lousy Jew of Trotsky, Judas the Iscariot, could die at any moment. There's no time to lose. This bastard can't die a natural death. He must be punished for all his crimes against Stalin. You have to kill him. Liquidating Trotsky is a question of ambition and prestige for Stalin. The thing is too important to be neglected. Trotsky's extermination must also serve as a warning to the other traitors of the country of the Soviets: Stalin's arm can reach them everywhere. The Mobile Group, which specializes in assassinations abroad, must act quickly and efficiently.

贝利亚响应了这一命令。老板的这几句话足以让他领会整个想法。拉夫连季向斯大林保证，一旦他回到办公室，他将采取一切必要措施组织清算托洛茨基。他，贝利亚，在完成他的前任所承担的、但他们未能完成的任务之前，不会知道休战。

Beria echoes this order. These few words from his boss are suggestive enough to allow him to grasp the whole idea. Lavrenti assures Stalin that as soon as he returns to his office, he will take all necessary measures to organize the liquidation of Trotsky. He, Beria, will not know a truce until he completes the task that his predecessors undertook, but which they could not complete.

离开克里姆林宫，贝利亚意识到他和托洛茨基现在已经生死相连。拉夫连季的整个职业生涯，即使不是他的存在，也取决于对托洛茨基的暗杀。如果那个恶棍因为过度紧张而死的话，贝利亚的未来就在他身后了。因此，他必须赶快行动。

Leaving the Kremlin, Beria realizes that he and Trotsky are now linked for life and death. The whole career, if not the very existence of Lavrenti depends on the assassination of Trotsky. If that villain died of over-tension, Beria's future would be behind him. He must therefore act in haste.

托洛茨基的档案非常庞大。它们本身就构成了完整的文学和完整的图书馆。

Trotsky's files are enormous. On their own, they constitute a whole literature and a whole library.

1929 年，托洛茨基与妻子娜塔莎、女儿齐娜伊达和儿子列夫·谢多夫被流放到土耳其后，立即与他在俄罗斯的追随者取得联系，并恢复了反对斯大林及其政策的斗争。他开始写小册子和小册子，这些小册子在血汗工厂印刷，并被引入俄罗斯。这些颠覆性著作的副本均保存在秘密警察档案中。

Immediately after being banished to Turkey in 1929, along with his wife Natasha, his daughter Zinaïda and his son Lev Sedov, Trotsky made contact with his followers in Russia and resumed the fight against Stalin and his policies. He began to write pamphlets and pamphlets which, printed in sweatshops, were introduced into Russia. Copies of each of these subversive writings are in secret police files.

斯大林的特工多次试图暗杀托洛茨基，但均未成功。居住在伊斯坦布尔的格别乌（GPU）雅各布·布卢姆金（Iacob Bloumkin）是臭名昭著的谋杀德国驻莫斯科大使威廉·冯·米尔巴赫-哈夫伯爵的凶手，他的任务是在土耳其打倒托洛茨基。但是，布卢姆金没有刺杀他，而是成为他忠实的信使，并以各种借口穿梭于伊斯坦布尔和莫斯科之间，与苏联托洛茨基主义者建立联系。

Several assassination attempts perpetrated against Trotsky by Stalin's agents were unsuccessful. The GPU resident in Istanbul, Iacob Bloumkin, the infamous murderer of Count Wilhelm von Mirbach-Harff, German Ambassador to Moscow, was tasked with bringing down Trotsky in Turkey. But, instead of assassinating him, Blumkin became his faithful courier and, under various pretexts, shuttled between Istanbul and Moscow to establish liaison with the Trotskyists of the USSR.

布卢姆金被捕后被判处死刑，并根据斯大林的个人命令秘密处决。托洛茨基觉得生活在土耳其经常让他面临危险。他离苏联太近了，如果他没有在那里被谋杀，他就有被绑架并带回俄罗斯的危险。在那里，经过长时间的折磨，他应该承认自己犯下的所有罪行，甚至那些他没有犯下的罪行。那么，他应该先接受审判，然后才被判处死刑并执行。

Captured, Bloumkin was sentenced to death and, on Stalin's personal order, executed in camera . Trotsky felt that living in Türkiye constantly exposed him to danger. He was too close to the Soviet Union and, if he was not murdered there, he risked being kidnapped and brought back to Russia. There, after a long series of tortures, he should have confessed to all the crimes he had committed, and even those he had not committed. Then, he should have undergone a trial before being sentenced to death and executed.

在出版了自传《我的一生》（从最不利的角度描绘了斯大林）并写了其他反斯大林主义的书籍后，托洛茨基决定离开伊斯坦布尔前往巴黎。然而，获得前往那里的权利并不容易。最终，1933年，法国给予他庇护权，并向他发放了签证。

After publishing his autobiography, My Life , in which he portrayed Stalin from the most unfavorable angle, and after writing other anti-Stalinist books, Trotsky decided to leave Istanbul for Paris. However, it was not very easy to obtain the right to go there. Finally, in 1933, France granted him the right of asylum and issued him with a visa.

到达巴黎后，托洛茨基恢复了反斯大林主义的活动。他出版了小册子：《捍卫恐怖主义》、《恐怖主义与共产主义》、《刺杀基洛夫》、《危机中的苏联经济》、《列宁遗嘱的隐瞒》，以及最重要的《被背叛的革命：苏联是什么？她要去哪里？》

Once in Paris, Trotsky resumed his anti-Stalinist activities. He published pamphlets: Defense of Terrorism, Terrorism and Communism, The Assassination of Kirov, The Soviet Economy in Danger, The Concealment of Lenin's Testament , and above all The Revolution Betrayed: What is the Soviet Union? and where is she going?

托洛茨基在这些著作中断言，斯大林根本不是一个领导者，而只是“一个宣传者和一个偶尔的组织者”。1917年十月革命期间，当所有老近卫军布尔什维克因向人民发表热情洋溢的演讲而“四散而去、声音沙哑”时，斯大林却无法吸引群众。“与十月革命之前一样，在内战结束后，他对群众来说是陌生的、陌生的”。

Trotsky asserted in these works that Stalin had in no way been a leader, but only “a propagandist and an occasional organizer”. During the October Revolution of 1917, when all the Bolsheviks of the Old Guard were “scattering, their voices broken” by the ardent speeches they addressed to the people, Stalin had been unable to attract crowds. “He had emerged from the civil war as unknown and foreign to the masses as before the October Revolution”.

此类言论不可能逃脱惩罚。

Such statements could not go unpunished.

托洛茨基在流亡期间的政治行动不仅限于出版物。在法国期间，他组织了一个规模虽小但充满活力的“共产主义第四国际”，反对斯大林及其政策。

Trotsky's political action in exile was not limited to publications. While in France, he organized a small but vigorous "Communist Fourth International", directed against Stalin and his policies.

托洛茨基不顾一切形式的镇压与斯大林进行斗争。GPU代理他曾多次试图刺杀他，但由于部下的严密看守，他逃脱了所有的企图。然而他发现自己无法保护留在俄罗斯的家人。斯大林毫不犹豫地对这些无辜者进行报复。托洛茨基的第一任妻子亚历山德拉·索科洛夫斯卡娅和她最小的儿子谢尔盖被捕并在监狱中处决。接下来被消灭的是托洛茨基的女儿尼娜、她的丈夫曼·内维尔森和他们的两个孩子。随后普拉顿·沃尔科夫被监禁并被枪决。他是托洛茨基的女儿齐娜伊达的丈夫，她随父亲离开了俄罗斯。她搬到了柏林居住，1933 年，她被移动集团特工枪杀，特工将这次暗杀完美地伪装成自杀。

Trotsky fought Stalin despite all forms of repression. GPU agentstried several times to assassinate him, but, well guarded by his men, he escaped all their attempts. Yet he found himself unable to protect his family, which he had left behind in Russia. Stalin did not hesitate to take revenge on these innocents. Trotsky's first wife, Alexandra Sokolovskaya, and her youngest son Sergei were arrested and executed in prison. Next were exterminated Nina, Trotsky's daughter, her husband Man Nevelson and their two children. Then Platon Volkov was imprisoned and shot. He was the husband of Zinaida, Trotsky's daughter who had left Russia with her father. She had gone to live in Berlin, and in 1933 she was shot dead by Mobile Group agents who perfectly disguised the assassination as suicide.

托洛茨基和他的妻子娜塔莎、儿子列夫·谢多夫和唯一的孙子齐娜伊达的儿子塞武奇卡离开巴黎，躲到格勒诺布尔附近的一个偏远村庄。但即使在那里，他们也很快被斯大林的侦探发现了。由于法国没有为他们提供庇护，托洛茨基一家决定离开。他们的儿子列夫·谢多夫回到了巴黎，因为单身汉更容易躲在大城市。托洛茨基一家渗透到挪威，并试图从他们打算前往海外的地方居住到奥斯陆。1938 年，他们终于获得了前往墨西哥的签证，希望留在巴黎的儿子能够与他们团聚。然而，就在列夫·谢多夫出发前，他被斯大林的特工暗杀了，这一次他们甚至懒得假装自杀。

Trotsky, his wife Natasha, their son Lev Sedov and their only grandson, Sevouchka, son of Zinaïda, left Paris to hide in a remote village near Grenoble. But even there they were quickly spotted by Stalin's sleuths. Since France offered them no safe haven, the Trotskys decided to leave. Their son Lev Sedov returned to Paris, as it was easier for a single man to hide in a big city. The Trotskys infiltrated Norway and tried to live in Oslo from where they intended to go overseas. In 1938, finally, they received a visa for Mexico where they hoped to be joined by their son who remained in Paris. However, immediately before his departure, Lev Sedov was assassinated by Stalin's agents who this time did not even bother to fake a suicide.

托洛茨基的大家庭中只剩下他的妻子和孙子还活着。

Of Trotsky's large family only his wife and grandson remained alive.

从俄罗斯到达西半球并到达托洛茨基的新家并不是一件容易的事。托洛茨基与娜塔莎和小塞武什卡在墨西哥一个名叫科约萨坎的小镇定居。他住在一座难以进入的房子里，房子变成了一座堡垒。该物业周围环绕着高墙，内有铁丝网，并设有沉重的入口大门。城墙的两个角落矗立着炮塔，哨兵手持双筒望远镜和机枪。房子本身配备了加固门，窗户上装有栏杆。托洛茨基的支持者组成的一个排配备了步枪和手枪，每天二十四小时守卫着这个地方，而墨西哥巡逻队则不断地在周围纵横交错。

Reaching out from Russia to the Western Hemisphere and reaching Trotsky in his new home are no easy tasks. Trotsky settled with Natasha and little Sevushka in a tiny Mexican town called Coyosacan. He lives in an inaccessible house transformed into a fortress. The property is surrounded by high walls lined with barbed wire and provided with a heavy entrance gate. At two corners of the wall stand turrets with sentries with binoculars and machine guns. The house itself is equipped with reinforced doors and has bars on the windows. A platoon of Trotsky's supporters, armed with rifles and pistols, guards the place twenty-four hours a day, while Mexican patrols constantly criss-cross the surroundings.

在这种情况下，斯大林向贝利亚发出的消灭托洛茨基的命令似乎无法实现。但它必须被执行。贝利亚没有其他出路，只能接受挑战。

Under such conditions, the order to exterminate Trotsky, which Stalin gave to Beria, seems unrealizable. And yet it must be executed. Beria has no other way out but to accept the challenge.

1939年3月上旬，贝利亚被提名为政治局委员。他是第一位被引入该智库的苏联秘密警察局长。这是一个很大的晋升，因为政治局是苏联的管理机构。它是列宁在十月革命后立即创建的，旨在做出快速决策。它是共产党和苏维埃国家的领导机构。坚持这一原则，即使是作为候选人，也可能很快成为一名正式党员，就意味着一个人达到了党的最高精英阶层。

In early March 1939, Beria was nominated for the Politburo. He is the first secret police chief of the USSR to be introduced into this brain trust . It's a big promotion, because the Politburo is the body that governs the USSR. It was created by Lenin immediately after the October Revolution to make quick decisions. It is the governing body of the Communist Party and the Soviet state. Adhering to it, even as a candidate, likely to become, perhaps soon, a full member, means that one reaches the highest instance of the Party's elite.

1939年，政治局由斯大林、莫洛托夫、伏罗希洛夫、加里宁、卡冈诺维奇、安德烈耶夫、米高扬、契维尔尼克、日丹诺夫以及最近的赫鲁晓夫组成。只有少数替补，包括马林科夫。这个组织原本是政治指导委员会，现在只不过是斯大林手中的一个工具。意识到这一事实，贝利亚认为，他即将发表的演讲，就像任何新候选人一样，只不过是对杰出同志约瑟夫·斯大林荣耀的长篇悼词。拉夫连季记得，他的职业生涯仅归功于他的著作《斯大林的早期著作和最初的活动》。外高加索布尔什维克组织的历史。因此，如果他想要继续取得成功，这次他必须采用同样的流程。1939 年 3 月 15 日，共产党机关报《真理报》刊登了内务人民委员、苏联领导人在前一天在联盟共产党第十八次代表大会上向政治局委员发表的就职演说。苏联秘密警察拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚。《真理报》用贝利亚的照片来阐释这篇讲话，这是对“敬爱的领​​袖”、“人类最伟大的天才”斯大林同志的光荣和他为苏联所取得的伟大成就的伟大颂歌。

In 1939, the Politburo was made up of Stalin, Molotov, Voroshilov, Kalinin, Kaganovich, Andreïev, Mikoyan, Chvernik, Zhdanov and, most recently, Khrushchev. There are only a few alternates, including Malenkov. This organization, originally the directing committee of politics, is now no more than an instrument in the hands of Stalin. Aware of this fact, Beria felt that the speech he was about to deliver, as befits any new candidate, could be nothing more than a long eulogy to the glory of the brilliant comrade Joseph Stalin. Lavrenti remembers that he owes his career only to his work Early Writings and First Activities of Stalin. History of Bolshevik organizations in Transcaucasia. Therefore, if he wants his successes to continue, he must use the same process this time around. On March 15, 1939, the official newspaper of the Communist Party, Pravda , published the inaugural speech delivered the day before before members of the Politburo, at the 18th Congress of the Union Communist Party, by the People's Commissar for Internal Affairs and Chief of the secret police of the Soviet Union, Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria. The address, which Pravda illustrates with a photograph of Beria, is a great ode to the glory of Comrade Stalin, the "beloved leader", "the greatest genius of mankind", and his magnificent achievements in favor of the Soviet Union.

在对老板表示赞扬之后，贝利亚不再怀疑他为自己的职业发展选择了正确的选择。现在一切都取决于他是否有能力留在马鞍上并领导比赛，直到通过解决课程开始时的主要困难：清算托洛茨基而获得最终胜利。拉夫连季没有忘记，他比六十岁的斯大林年轻二十岁，在这个年纪，时间对一个人来说是不利的，而不是对他有利的。斯大林需要一个继任者。没有人是永恒的，但有些人活得很长，有些人活得更短。一个与独裁者交往的人可能会发现自己有能力缩短老板的寿命。政治局的其他成员很快就会被淘汰。加里宁今年六十四岁。所以他已经是一匹老马了。卡冈诺维奇是犹太人，莫洛托夫娶了一位犹太女子。因此，利用斯大林对犹太人的仇恨来消灭他们并不是太困难。即使是卡冈诺维奇的妹妹、斯大林的情妇罗莎，也无法保护她的兄弟免受精心策划的阴谋的影响，尤其是因为斯大林迟早会厌倦她，并很乐意摆脱她。安德烈耶夫虽然比其他人年轻得多，但自1914年以来一直是党员，并积极参加十月革命。因此，他知道斯大林在布尔什维克运动中扮演的真正角色。这并不能帮助他在这个地球上长期行走，特别是因为他的妻子多拉·卡赞是犹太人。还有多次帮助过贝利亚的米高扬。拉夫伦蒂毫不费力地把他击倒。然后是日丹诺夫，他刚刚成为政治局正式委员，这意味着他在斯大林那里享有很高的信誉。但1913年加入布尔什维克并在十月革命期间活跃在乌拉尔地区的日丹诺夫是一位老派布尔什维克。基洛夫遇刺后，他担任列宁格勒党的领导人，这并不是一个令人愉快的职位。其中包括伏罗希洛夫，他从青年时代起就是一名积极的共产主义者。1906年和1907年，他是社会民主党斯德哥尔摩和伦敦代表大会的代表。革命后，他成为军事政委，并晋升为苏联元帅。伏罗希洛夫在军队和全国都很受欢迎。它与他对抗

After this pean in praise of the boss, Beria no longer doubts that he has chosen the right horse for the advancement of his career. Now everything depends on his ability to stay in the saddle and lead the race until the final victory by solving the main difficulty at the start of the course: the liquidation of Trotsky. Lavrenti does not forget that he is twenty years younger than Stalin, who is sixty, and that at this age time works against a man, not for him. Stalin needs a successor. Nobody is eternal, but some live a long time, others much less. And a person who rubs shoulders with the dictator might find himself in a position to shorten the life of the boss. The other members of the Politburo could in turn be eliminated soon after. Kalinin is sixty-four years old. So he's already an old horse. Kaganovich is Jewish and Molotov married a Jewess. It would therefore not be too difficult to use Stalin's hatred of the Jews to eliminate them both. Not even Rosa, Kaganovich's sister and Stalin's mistress, could protect her brother from a carefully crafted plot, especially since sooner or later Stalin would tire of her and be happy to get rid of her as well. Andreyev, although much younger than the others, has been a Party member since 1914 and took an active part in the October Revolution. He therefore knows the true role played by Stalin in the Bolshevik movement. And this is not what will help him to walk on this earth for a long time, especially since his wife, Dora Khazan, is Jewish. Then there is Mikoyan who has helped Beria several times. Lavrenti would have no difficulty knocking him down. Then there is Zhdanov, who has just been made a full member of the Politburo, which implies that he enjoys great credit with Stalin. But Zhdanov, who joined the Bolsheviks in 1913 and operated in the Urals during the October Revolution, is an old guard Bolshevik. He served as Party leader in Leningrad after the assassination of Kirov, and it was not a very happy post. Among the others, there remains Voroshilov, an active communist since his youth. He was a delegate to the Stockholm and London Congresses of the Social Democratic Party in 1906 and 1907. After the revolution, he became Commissar for Military Affairs and was elevated to the rank of Marshal of the Soviet Union. Voroshilov is very popular in the army and the nation. It plays against him

只剩下赫鲁晓夫和刚刚被任命为​​政治局代表的马林科夫。两人都还年轻，不择手段。与他们保持良好关系是明智之举：他们很危险。但任何针对这些政治局成员以及针对大老板的阴谋都只是未来的梦想，是长期计划的一部分。在朝着他们的方向采取任何行动之前，拉夫伦蒂决定首先消灭实力较弱但仍然麻烦的对手。

Only Khrushchev remains, and Malenkov, who has just been appointed deputy to the Politburo. Both are young and unscrupulous. It is wise to be on good terms with them: they are dangerous. But any intrigue against these members of the Politburo, as well as against the big boss, is only a dream of the future, part of a long-term plan. Before undertaking anything in their direction, Lavrenti decides to first exterminate less powerful, but nevertheless troublesome adversaries.

贝利亚没有忘记他的前任尼古拉·伊万诺维奇·叶若夫，斯大林任命他为河运政委。立场没有任何意义。叶乔夫很无奈。但贝利亚记得，当叶乔夫掌权时，他想逮捕他，毫无疑问，还想处决他。为此，这个混蛋必须受到惩罚。

Beria does not forget his predecessor, Nikolai Ivanovitch Yezhov, whom Stalin has appointed Commissar for River Transport. The position means nothing. Yejov is helpless. But Beria remembers that when Yejov was in power, he wanted to arrest him and, no doubt, execute him. For this reason, this bastard must be punished.

在向政治局发表讲话后不到三周，贝利亚说服斯大林，叶若夫患有精神疾病，他遭受挫折，并且他可能成为像刺杀基洛夫的尼古拉耶夫一样危险的疯子。叶乔夫被免职。半夜，一辆救护车停在他家门前。两名护士走进他的家。他们立即将这名“嗜血侏儒”裹上紧身衣，送上救护车，并把他带到莫斯科的塞尔布斯基精神病院，在那里他被关在单独的牢房里。

Less than three weeks after his address to the Politburo, Beria convinces Stalin that Yezhov is mentally ill, that he suffers from frustrations and that he can become as dangerous a lunatic as Nikolayev, Kirov's assassin. Yezhov is removed from office. In the middle of the night, an ambulance stops in front of his house. Two nurses enter his house. They immediately take the “bloodthirsty dwarf” in a straitjacket, put him in the ambulance and take him to the Serbski psychiatric institute in Moscow where he is locked up in a solitary cell.

然而，叶乔夫并没有在那里停留太久。一天早上，一名护士进入他的牢房时发现他已经死了，他被一条变成绞索的内衣挂在窗台上。在精神病院里，病人受到不间断的监控，叶乔夫怎么可能脱掉衣服，把它们绑在绞索上呢？我们从未试图找出答案，也从未透露过。

Yejov did not stay there long, however. One morning, a nurse, on entering his cell, found him dead, hanging from a window bar by an undergarment transformed into a noose. How, in a hospital for the insane, where the patients are constantly monitored, could Yejov take off his clothes and tie them into a noose? We never tried to find out and we never revealed it.

西欧的政治局势表明，德国的扩张不会因征服奥地利、苏台德地区和捷克斯洛伐克而停止。显然，第三帝国将进行新的“东进”，并试图征服德国东部的国家。第一个目标是波兰，第三帝国声称波美拉尼亚和但泽走廊在凡尔赛条约之前属于德国。然而，1939年3月31日，英国和法国正式保证波兰独立。面对这种新的权力联合，斯大林决定采取行动。

The political situation in Western Europe shows that German expansion will not stop with the conquest of Austria, the Sudetenland and Czechoslovakia. It is obvious that the Third Reich will undertake a new Drang nach Osten "push towards the East" and that it will try to conquer the countries located to the east of Germany. The first objective is Poland from which the Third Reich claims Pomerania and the Danzig Corridor which were part of Germany before the Treaty of Versailles. On March 31, 1939, however, Britain and France officially guaranteed Poland's independence. Faced with this new association of powers, Stalin decided to act.

叶约夫运动期间红军队伍进行大清洗之后，苏联军事力量太弱，无力打世界大战。然而，在希特勒与英国和法国作战时，苏联通过巧妙地置身事外，可以获得很多好处。几周后，斯大林解雇了外交部委员马克西姆·李特维诺夫，并以莫洛托夫取而代之。在柏林，这一变化被正确地解释为对第三帝国的善意姿态，因为马克西姆·马克西莫维奇·李维诺夫是来自比亚韦斯托克的波兰犹太人，他的真名是米尔·格诺赫·莫伊塞维奇·瓦拉赫。不久之后，德国外交部副部长冯·魏茨泽克 (von Weizsaecker) 在柏林表示：召集苏联临时代办阿斯塔哈诺夫到他的办公室警告他，元首很乐意不仅就经济问题而且还就政治问题展开谈判。与此同时，莫洛托夫与英国和法国进行谈判。如果苏联遭到德国的攻击，两个西方大国准备向苏联提供援助。为了实现这一联盟计划，英国政府派遣外交部高级官员威廉·斯特朗前往莫斯科。如果苏联遭到德国的攻击，两个西方大国准备向苏联提供援助。为了实现这一联盟计划，英国政府派遣外交部高级官员威廉·斯特朗前往莫斯科。如果苏联遭到德国的攻击，两个西方大国准备向苏联提供援助。为了实现这一联盟计划，英国政府派遣外交部高级官员威廉·斯特朗前往莫斯科。

After the great purges carried out in the ranks of the Red Army during the Yejovshchina, the Soviet military forces are too weak to engage in a world war. However, by the clever move of staying out of the conflict while Hitler fights Britain and France, the Soviet Union can gain a lot. A few weeks later, Stalin dismissed his Commissar for Foreign Affairs, Maxime Litvinov, and replaced him with Molotov. In Berlin, this change is correctly interpreted as a gesture of goodwill towards the Third Reich, since Maxim Maximovitch Litvinov is a Polish Jew from Bialystok, whose real name is Meer Genokh Moissevich Wallach. Shortly afterwards, in Berlin, the Deputy Foreign Minister of Germany, von Weizsaecker, summons the Soviet Chargé d'Affaires Astakhanov to his office to warn him that the Führer would be happy to open negotiations not only on economic problems, but also on political ones. At the same time, Molotov negotiates with Great Britain and France. The two Western powers are ready to give their aid to the Soviet Union in case it is attacked by Germany. With a view to this project of alliance, the British government sent William Strong, a senior official of the Foreign Office, to Moscow. The two Western powers are ready to give their aid to the Soviet Union in case it is attacked by Germany. With a view to this project of alliance, the British government sent William Strong, a senior official of the Foreign Office, to Moscow. The two Western powers are ready to give their aid to the Soviet Union in case it is attacked by Germany. With a view to this project of alliance, the British government sent William Strong, a senior official of the Foreign Office, to Moscow.

拉夫伦蒂·贝利亚作为内务人民委员兼秘密警察局长，接受了最微妙的任务。在任何情况下，驻莫斯科的法国和英国外交官都不应得知克里姆林宫同时与纳粹进行谈判。法国和英国大使馆周围的贝利亚特工数量立即增加了一倍。法国和英国外交人员居住的大楼的门房每两天就会被秘密警察传唤接受询问和指示，特别是如果他们不是简单的警卫，而且还是专业的检查员。同样的措施也适用于大使馆和外交官使用的厨师、仆人和护士。

Lavrenti Beria, in his capacity as People's Commissar for Internal Affairs and Chief of the Secret Police, receives the most delicate mission. Under no circumstances should French and British diplomats in Moscow learn that the Kremlin is negotiating with the Nazis at the same time. The number of Beria agents around the French and British embassies was immediately doubled. The concierges of the buildings where the French and British diplomatic staff live are summoned to the secret police every two days for questioning and instructions, especially if they are not simple guards, but also professional inspectors. The same measures are applied to cooks, servants and nurses used by embassies and diplomats.

电话交谈被截获，每个陌生人都不断被特工跟踪。

Telephone conversations are intercepted and every stranger is constantly tailed by an agent.

贝利亚完美地隔离了外国殖民地。1939 年 8 月 11 日，法英军事代表团抵达莫斯科，开始讨论共同防御德国的问题。第二天，英国、法国和苏联三个国家的代表前往克里姆林宫举行第一次会议，与伏罗希洛夫元帅讨论一旦第三帝国进攻波兰，他们将采取联合行动。就在同一时间，莫洛托夫向希特勒表达了斯大林急于与纳粹德国签署友好条约的愿望。他还提出了瓜分波兰的协议，并邀请希特勒的代表来莫斯科。

Beria perfectly isolates the foreign colony. On August 11, 1939, a Franco-British military mission arrived in Moscow to begin discussions on a common defense against Germany. The next day, the representatives of the three powers, England, France and the Soviet Union, go to the first meeting in the Kremlin to discuss with Marshal Voroshilov their joint action against the Third Reich in the event of an attack on Poland. At exactly the same time, Molotov expresses to Hitler Stalin's impatience to sign a treaty of mutual friendship with Nazi Germany. He also proposed an agreement for the partition of Poland and invited Hitler's representatives to come to Moscow.

这场在两个对立战线上的双重谈判持续了近三周。在贝利亚的永久监视下，克里姆林宫可以延长与法英军事代表的对话，同时在绝对保密的情况下与德国缔结联盟。直到1939年8月23日，德国外交部长约阿希姆·冯·里宾特洛甫才抵达苏联首都。在莫斯科谢列梅捷沃机场，装饰着纳粹万字符旗和苏联锤子和镰刀的旗帜，迎接冯·里宾特洛甫的是纳粹国歌、《霍斯特·韦塞尔之歌》和《国际歌》。苏联外交部副政委接待了他。

This double negotiation on two opposing fronts lasts almost three weeks. Under the permanent supervision of Beria, the Kremlin can prolong its conversations with the Franco-British military delegates and, simultaneously, conclude in the most absolute secrecy an alliance with Germany. It was not until August 23, 1939 that Joachim von Ribbentrop, German Foreign Minister, arrived in the Soviet capital. At Sheremetyevo, Moscow's airport, decorated with Nazi swastika flags and Soviet hammer-and-sickle banners, von Ribbentrop is greeted to the sound of the Nazi anthem, Horst Wessel Lied , and the Internationale . The Deputy Commissar for Foreign Affairs of the USSR welcomes him.

同一天，威廉·斯特朗和法英军事使团离开苏联。在克里姆林宫，第三帝国代表和苏联官员接受了新的德苏十年互不侵犯条约以及秘密附加议定书。冯·里宾特洛甫和莫洛托夫签署的两份文件将东欧分为两个领域，一个是苏联，另一个是德国，并宣布了一场新的战争。纳粹将入侵波兰，击败波兰后，将与俄罗斯瓜分该国。

The same day, William Strong and the Franco-British military mission left the Soviet Union. In the Kremlin, the representative of the Third Reich and Soviet officials accept the new ten-year German-Soviet non-aggression treaty, as well as the secret additional protocol. The two documents, signed by von Ribbentrop and by Molotov, cut Eastern Europe into two spheres, one Soviet, the other German, and announce a new war. The Nazis will invade Poland and, after defeating it, will partition the country with Russia.

晚上，克里姆林宫为德国代表举行了盛大晚宴。正是在这次宴会上，斯大林发表了历史性的祝酒词：“我知道德意志民族有多么热爱它的元首。我想为他的健康干杯”。

In the evening, a gala dinner is given at the Kremlin in honor of the German representative. It was during this banquet that Stalin made his historic toast: “I know how much the German nation loves its Führer. I want to drink to his health”.

随后，在招待会上，斯大林将贝利亚介绍给冯·里宾特洛甫，并开玩笑说：“贝利亚，我的盖世太保头子 。”

Later, during the reception, Stalin will introduce Beria to von Ribbentrop, joking: "Beria, chief of my Gestapo  ."

冯·里宾特洛甫离开后的第二天，贝利亚因在让英国和法国政府对正在发生的事情一无所知方面所做的出色工作而被斯大林授予红星勋章。他前往莫斯科。

The next day, after von Ribbentrop's departure, Beria was decorated by Stalin with the Order of the Red Star for his excellent work in keeping the governments of Great Britain and France in the dark about what was going on. went to Moscow.

第36章

Chapter 36

“苏联士兵永远不会退缩。»

“A Soviet soldier never backs down. »

1939 年 9 月 1 日早上六点，纳粹军队袭击了波兰边境，而德国空军则向开放城市华沙投掷了燃烧弹。几家医院、孤儿院、学校，甚至妇女和儿童避难的教堂都被大火吞没。

On September 1, 1939, at six o'clock in the morning, the Nazi army attacked the Polish border while the Luftwaffe dropped incendiary bombs on the open city of Warsaw. Several hospitals, orphanages, schools and even churches, where women and children have sought refuge, are engulfed in flames.

但波兰预料到了这次袭击。他的部队几个月来一直处于戒备状态。波兰步兵和炮兵阻止了德国的入侵，而空军则勇敢地与敌人作战。1939 年 9 月 3 日，英国和法国根据 3 月 31 日作出的保证对德国宣战。

But Poland expected the attack. His troops have been on alert for several months. Polish infantry and artillery stop the German invasion, while the air force boldly fights the enemy. On September 3, 1939, England and France declared war on Germany in application of the guarantees given on March 31.

波兰人试图抵抗侵略，直到救援到来。英国和法国空军及其机队随时都可能出动。但没有出现帮助。相反：9月17日，斯大林为了履行与希特勒签订的条约，将其主力部队投入到波兰东部边境。

The Poles try to resist the aggression until help arrives. The British and French air forces and their fleets are expected any moment. But help does not appear. On the contrary: on September 17, Stalin, to honor his treaty with Hitler, throws the bulk of his forces against the eastern border of Poland.

数千名波兰军官和士兵被俘并被带到苏联。但自 1932 年 7 月 25 日起，苏联和波兰就签订了十年互不侵犯条约。苏联为了挽回面子，宣布已进入波兰领土，以结束对波兰的袭击和恐慌。与德国的战争。入侵波兰的红军总司令谢苗·季莫申科元帅向被俘官兵承诺，他们将被释放，并且根据每个人的意愿，他们可以返回家园，也可以到达法国，那里有一个新的波兰人。军队是为了对抗纳粹而建立的。季莫申科元帅的助手尼基塔·赫鲁晓夫证实了这一承诺，

Thousands of Polish officers and soldiers are taken prisoner and taken to the Soviet Union. But the USSR and Poland have been bound by a ten-year non-aggression treaty since July 25, 1932. The Soviet Union seeks to save face by declaring that it has entered Polish territory to put an end to the raids and the panic caused by the war with Germany. Marshal Semion Tymoshenko, Commander-in-Chief of the Red Army which invaded Poland, promises the officers and soldiers prisoners that they will be freed and that, according to the wishes of each, they can either return home or reach France where a new Polish army was created against the Nazis. The promise is confirmed by Marshal Tymoshenko's assistant: Nikita S. Khrushchev,

几周后，波兰人分成数百人一组，登上据称开往罗马尼亚和匈牙利的火车。

In a few weeks, the Poles, divided into groups of several hundred men, are embarked on trains supposedly destined for Romania and Hungary.

然而，这些汽车由八名配备机枪和刺刀步枪的苏联士兵看守。他们制服和帽子上缝的徽章表明他们不属于红军正规团，而是内务人民委员会的突击部队。

The cars, however, are guarded by eight Soviet soldiers armed with machine guns and bayonet rifles. The badges sewn on their uniforms and caps show that they do not belong to regular regiments of the Red Army, but to shock troops of the NKVD.

波兰人的运输需要数周时间。大约 15,000 名正规军士兵以及预备役军官被驱逐出境。他们是波兰知识界的精英，是压迫者最痛恨的爱国分子。贝利亚决定对这些人采取严厉措施。

Transportation of Poles takes several weeks. Around 15,000 regular army soldiers, as well as reserve officers, were deported. They constitute the cream of the Polish intelligentsia and the most patriotic element hated by the oppressor. Beria decides to take draconian measures with regard to these people.

经过运牛车、卡车，有时还乘船的长途旅行后，他们被安置在俄罗斯中部的三个彼此相距甚远的集中营。这些中心由拉夫连蒂·贝利亚 (Lavrenti Beria) 亲自监督。这个问题向斯大林提出了关于命运这一难题的问题，建议为这 15,000 人保留这一命运。尽管是秘密警察局长，但他不想在没有独裁者同意的情况下做出如此重要的决定。贝利亚的第一个建议是让波兰人回家，然后将他们一一逮捕并送往劳改营。但存在这样的风险：在再次被捕之前，

After a long journey in cattle cars, trucks and sometimes boats, they are placed in three concentration camps, very far from each other, in central Russia. These centers are under the personal supervision of Lavrenti Beria. This one questions Stalin on the difficult problem of the fate which it is advisable to reserve for these 15.000 men. Although chief of the secret police, he does not want to take a decision of this importance without the agreement of the dictator. Beria's first suggestion is to let the Poles go home, then arrest them one by one and send them to forced labor camps. But there is a risk that, before being arrested again,

贝利亚指出，西方的战争仍在继续，没有人知道海外的波兰军队是否有一天会被用来对付苏联。古语云：“一鸟在手，胜过二鸟在树”。我们越早征服波兰人越好。斯大林感到更加没有顾忌，因为战俘营里的波兰人只吃俄罗斯的面包，而这对红军来说是非常珍贵的。民政事务专员必须亲自处理此事。

Beria observes that the war continues in the West and that no one knows if the Polish forces abroad will not one day be used against the USSR. "A bird in the hand is better than two in the tree", goes the old proverb. The sooner we subdue the Poles, the better. Stalin felt all the less scruples because the Poles in the prison camps only ate Russian bread, so precious for the Red Army. The Home Affairs Commissioner must take matters into his own hands.

贝利亚仔细审视她的新任务。科泽尔斯克、奥斯塔什科夫（“魔鬼岛集中营”）和斯塔罗别尔斯克这三个战俘营均由内务人民委员部管理和看守，其指挥官向他提供了波兰战俘的名单，以及每个人的所有所需信息。他们。在对波兰军官进行了非常详细的审讯后，并感谢集中营里布置的线人，拉夫伦蒂掌握了所有囚犯政治倾向的完整信息。

Beria meticulously examines her new mission. The commandants of the three prisoner camps Kozelsk, Ostashkov (the "devil's island camp") and Starobelsk, all administered and guarded by the NKVD, provided him with lists of Polish prisoners of war, with all the desirable information on each of them. 'them. After a very detailed interrogation of the Polish officers and thanks to informers posted in the camps, Lavrenti has complete information on the political orientation of all the prisoners.

在这些波兰人中，有大量的共产党人，为了自己的利益，他们很乐意让自己的国家成为一个新的苏维埃共和国。这些人根据贝利亚的明确命令被释放，并转移到莫斯科附近的马拉霍瓦（Malakhova），该地区很快将被昵称为“幸福天堂”或“欢乐别墅”。波兰同情者在那里得到了最好的食物和住宿，以及如何将未来的红色波兰转变为第十七苏维埃 共和国的课程。

There are among these Poles a large number of Communists who, in their own interest, would be happy to make their country a new Soviet republic. These men are released on the express order of Beria and transferred to Malakhova, a locality near Moscow which will soon be nicknamed "Haven of bliss" or "Villa of delights". Polish sympathizers received the best food and accommodation there, as well as lessons on how to convert the future red Poland into the 17th Soviet  Republic .

对于其余大约 15,000 名波兰人，贝利亚准备了不同的命运。在关押着大约 5,000 名战俘的科泽尔斯克集中营，从 1940 年 4 月开始，每天都有数百人被点名。这些人被告知，他们将被释放，并由他们酌情决定送往何处，或者回家，或者在匈牙利或罗马尼亚。从那里，他们可以到达法国或英国的新波兰军队。幸运的人告别了他们的朋友，赶上卡车，卡车将把他们带到最近的车站，在那里，专列将把他们带到他们梦想已久的目的地。

For the rest of the Poles, around 15,000 men, Beria prepared a different fate. At the Kozelsk camp, which contained about 5,000 prisoners of war, a few hundred names were called each day from the beginning of April 1940. These men were told that they were being released to be sent, at their discretion, either at home, either in Hungary or in Romania. From there, they can reach the new Polish army in France or Great Britain. The lucky ones say goodbye to their friends and hurry to the trucks which are to take them to the nearest station where special trains are to take them to the destination they have long dreamed of.

这些火车由蜂窝汽车组成，将他们带到斯摩棱斯克车站。

These trains, formed from cellular cars, take them to the Smolensk station.

距离城镇几公里后，火车停了下来。乘客被要求下车。接到军事命令后，黑色小巴士将波兰人分成小组，带到一个名为卡廷的度假胜地附近的树林中。抵达后，他们会排队并接受仔细搜查。金钱、手表、戒指和金婚戒都被没收。在手持刺刀步枪、拴着半野生警犬的内务人民委员部官员的严密看守下，囚犯的手臂被绑在背后。立即开始执行。

A few kilometers after the town, the train stops. Passengers are asked to dismount. After a military call, small black buses take the Poles in small groups into the woods near a sort of holiday resort called Katyn. Upon arrival, they are lined up and carefully searched. Money, watches, rings and gold wedding bands are confiscated. Under the watchful guard of NKVD officials armed with bayonet rifles and leashed with half-wild police dogs, the prisoners have their arms tied behind their backs. Immediately, the execution begins.

早上6点30分，在卡廷森林里，大约5000名波兰官兵被贝利亚的排枪杀。

At 6:30 a.m., in the Katyn forest, about 5,000 Polish officers and soldiers were shot by Beria's platoons.

与此同时，内务人民委员部的其他部队消灭了俄罗斯中部另外两个集中营中的波兰战俘。贝利亚从被囚禁在斯塔罗别尔斯克的 4000 名波兰人中挑选了大约 400 人，将他们转移到格拉佐维茨。苏联当局仍然希望在这些军官和学员中找到一些加入“欢乐别墅”的人。斯塔罗别尔斯克的其余波兰人，即近 3,500 人，与卡廷森林的波兰人一样，被送往行刑队。

Meanwhile, other units of the NKVD exterminate Polish prisoners of war from the other two camps in central Russia. Beria chose about four hundred men from among the 4,000 Poles imprisoned in Starobelsk to transfer them to Grazovets. The Soviet authorities still hope to find among these officers and cadets a few people who would join the group of the "Villa of Delights". The rest of the Poles of Starobelsk, nearly 3,500 people, were sent to the firing squad as were those of the Katyn forest.

奥斯塔什科夫第三集中营的 6,500 名囚犯则经历了完全不同的命运。

The 6,500 prisoners of the third camp, Ostashkov, experience a completely different fate.

内务人民委员部上校告诉他们将被释放后，他们被命令列队前往塞利格尔湖边缘，该湖的水域面积达250平方公里，流入伏尔加河。波兰人乘坐几艘巨型驳船回国。哼着无忧无虑的歌曲，男人们开始了他们的幸福之旅。当驳船到达湖中央时，隐藏在一排卡车后面的内务人民委员部部队向大型棕色船只开火。

After an NKVD colonel tells them that they will be freed, they are ordered to form ranks and go to the edge of Lake Seliger, whose waters, which cover an area of ​​250 square kilometers, flow into the Volga. The Poles embark on several giant barges to return home. Humming carefree songs, the men begin their happy journey. When the barges arrive in the middle of the lake, NKVD units, hidden until then behind a line of trucks, open fire on the large brown boats.

这是最后一批波兰战俘。第二天，贝利亚向伟大的斯大林同志宣布“波兰问题”已经解决。

It was the last group of Polish prisoners of war. The next day, Beria announces to the great comrade Stalin that the "Polish problem" is solved.

九月份的活动已经结束了。德国和苏联共享被征服的波兰。在俄罗斯占领的波兰东部地区，数千名男人、女人和儿童被赶进运牛车，送往西伯利亚、哈萨克斯坦、土耳其斯坦和“苏联”的其他地区。这些波兰人、神父、现役或预备役军官、政府雇员、工人及其家属，在苏联安全部门眼中都是“可疑分子”。她们在没有受到任何审判的情况下就被判处流放：一些人被关进强迫劳动营，另一些人，主要是带着小孩的妇女，与丈夫失散，在俄罗斯偏远的村庄里，必须在田里干活，或者在工厂里干活，赚取最低的工资。工资。
