The September campaign has come to an end. Germany and the USSR share the conquered Poland. In the eastern sector of Russian-occupied Poland, thousands of men, women and children are herded into cattle trucks and sent to Siberia, Kazakhstan, Turkestan and other parts of the 'Soviet Union. These Poles, priests, active or reserve officers, government employees, workers and their families, appear as "doubtful elements" in the eyes of the Soviet Security. They are condemned to exile without the slightest judgment: some in forced labor camps, others, mainly women with small children, separated from their husbands, in remote villages of Russia, where they have to work in the fields. or in the factory for minimal wages.

在波兰的俄罗斯境内，所有私营工业和企业都被贝利亚官员没收并国有化，而其所有者和家人则被逮捕并驱逐到西伯利亚或被处决。同样的命运等待着神职人员和富农。整个事业都是贝利亚以古拉格集中营负责人的身份完成的。旅行通常持续两周，因为军用列车有优先权。关押囚犯的汽车必须在车站或路口等待数天。他们的食物由两杯被称为kipiatok的沸水组成在俄语中，是四分之一磅黑面包和一条小生鱼。这是贝利亚规定的饮食。数以百计的妇女、儿童和老人因无法忍受这个政权的严酷而死在途中。每天，警卫都会来点名，以确保没有人逃脱，然后将尸体移走，扔进赛道附近的坑里。

In the Russian sector of Poland, all private industries and businesses were confiscated by Beria officials and nationalized, while their owners and families were arrested and deported to Siberia or executed. The same fate awaits ecclesiastics and rich peasants. The whole enterprise is the work of Beria in his capacity as head of the GULAG. Trips usually last two weeks, as military trains have priority. The cars where the prisoners are locked up have to wait several days in the stations or at the crossings. Their food consists of two cups of boiling water, called kipiatokin Russian, a quarter pound of black bread and a small raw fish. This is the diet prescribed by Beria. Hundreds of women, children and old people, who cannot bear the harshness of this regime, die on the way. Every day, the guards who come to roll call to make sure no one has escaped remove the bodies and throw them in a pit near the track.

1939 年 9 月底，根据莫洛托夫-里宾特洛甫协议，苏联强迫爱沙尼亚接受苏联在其领土上的基地。占领红军进入后，贝利亚立即派出了秘密警察特种部队。他们对被视为“可疑分子”的整个家庭进行大规模逮捕。一列长长的运牛车满载着人，驶向乌拉尔山脉和中国边境附近的村庄。

At the end of September 1939, in application of the Molotov-Ribbentrop agreement, the USSR forced Estonia to accept Soviet bases on its soil. Immediately after the entry of the occupying red forces, Beria sends special troops of the secret police. They carry out mass arrests of entire families considered to be “doubtful elements”. Long trains of cattle cars filled with people make their way to the Ural Mountains and to the villages near the Chinese border.

不到两周后，另一个波罗的海国家拉脱维亚也遭遇了同样的命运。这个小国还必须根据苏联强加的互助条约将其陆地、空军和海军基地移交给俄罗斯。苏联内政人民委员再次出动军队逮捕并驱逐了数千名无辜者。老人、病人、妇女和儿童被认为对俄罗斯帝国构成危险，因此流亡到哈萨克斯坦北部。

Less than two weeks later, another Baltic country, Latvia, suffered the same fate. This small nation must also hand over its land, air and naval bases to the Russians under a mutual assistance pact imposed by the Soviets. And again the People's Commissar for Internal Affairs of the Soviet Union launched his troops into the arrest and deportation of thousands of innocent people. Old and sick people, women and children, considered dangerous for the Russian Empire, went into exile in the North of Kazakhstan.

苏联是纳粹最好的盟友，它不失时机地致力于吞并波罗的海国家。现在轮到立陶宛经历同样悲惨的闹剧了。被迫与苏联签署互助条约，它必须接受俄罗斯在其领土上建立基地。贝利亚军团再次穿着带有粉红色和蓝色凯皮长袍的深色制服，跟随正规红军，将数千名当地人引导到运牛卡车上，并将他们带到乌拉尔地区。

The USSR, the best ally of the Nazis, wasted no time in its enterprise of absorbing the Baltic countries. It is Lithuania's turn to experience the same tragic farce. Forced to sign a mutual assistance treaty with the Soviet Union, it must accept the installation of Russian bases on its territory. Once again the Beria regiments, in their dark uniforms with pink and blue kepis, follow the regular Red Army in directing thousands of locals to cattle trucks and taking them to the Ural region.

贝利亚的军队也没有让比萨拉比亚平静下来。整个村庄的农民都穿着阳光明媚的国家九月穿的轻便衣服，被驱逐到遥远的北方。他们被突然拦住，以致于他们无法携带更暖和的衣服。一旦他们到达西伯利亚，就会有数百人死亡。

Beria's troops do not leave Bessarabia in peace either. Entire villages of peasants dressed in the light clothes that one wears in September in sunny countries are deported to the far North. They are stopped so abruptly that they cannot take warmer clothes with them. Once they reach Siberia, they die by the hundreds.

通过夺取拉脱维亚、爱沙尼亚和立陶宛的基地，苏联涉足波罗的海国家。几个月后，俄罗斯增援了驻扎在拉脱维亚基地的部队，然后向拉脱维亚全境派遣了红军军团，结束了该国的独立。一周后，立陶宛也采用了同样的方法。在接下来的几个月里，爱沙尼亚失去了自由。这三个被红色势力淹没的国家必须清除那些渴望开展地下运动并奋起反抗的爱国青年。她即将倒下，成为并入苏联的受害者，她已经做好了准备。

By seizing bases in Latvia, Estonia and Lithuania, the Soviet Union set foot in the Baltic countries. A few months later, Russia reinforces the troops stationed in the bases of Latvia then pours regiments of the Red army on all the Latvian territory, putting an end to the independence of the country. A week later, the same method is applied in Lithuania. In the following months, Estonia loses its freedom. These three countries, submerged by the red forces, must be purified of their patriotic youth eager to create an underground movement and to rise up. She is going to fall, a victim of incorporation into the USSR, already prepared.

这项重要任务和众多义务一起落在了贝利亚的肩上。他命令当地报纸的共产主义新闻工作人员在头版报道，告诉人们苏联没有征服他们的国家，而是将他们从法西斯主义和资本主义中解放出来。本身由工人和农民统治的苏联很高兴为工人和农民、拉脱维亚人、立陶宛人和爱沙尼亚人提供更好的生活，这些人迄今为止一直受到资产阶级的冷酷剥削，而资产阶级却靠着苏联发了财。穷人喝了他们的汗水和血。获得解放的波罗的海国家被许诺拥有自己的社会主义和独立政府以及自己的人民军队。

This important task falls, among many obligations, to Beria. He orders Communist news crews from local newspapers to run front-page stories explaining to people that the Soviet Union did not conquer their country, but liberated them from fascism and capitalism. The USSR, itself governed by the workers and peasants, is happy to offer a better life to the workers and peasants, Latvians, Lithuanians and Estonians who, until now, have been cynically exploited by the bourgeois who have made a fortune on the backs of the poor who drank their sweat and their blood. The liberated Baltic countries are promised their own socialist and independent governments, and their own people's armies.

这些社会主义政府立即成立，但它们只是苏联的傀儡和唯唯诺诺的人。人民军团吸收了公民。义务兵役制针对十八岁以上的年轻人。军队装备有条纹和红色徽章的制服和苏联武器，经过一个月的训练后，开始进行演习，最后进行体育比赛，并获得宝贵的奖励。然后男孩们被命令交出枪支。自由独立人民军被配备机枪的内务人民委员部部队包围。他们被停在运牛卡车上，然后被送往西伯利亚的强迫劳动营。39 .

These socialist administrations are immediately set up, but they are only puppets and yes-men of the Soviets. The popular regiments absorb the citizens. Compulsory conscription hits young people from the age of eighteen. Equipped with uniforms with stripes and red insignia and Soviet weapons, the armies, after a month of training, leave for the maneuvers which end in sports competitions to which precious rewards are granted. The boys are then ordered to surrender their guns. The Free and Independent People's Armies are surrounded by NKVD troops, equipped with machine guns. They are parked in cattle trucks and sent to forced labor camps in Siberia.39 .

除年轻人外，秘密警察还逮捕了超过 30,000 个立陶宛家庭、约 20,000 个拉脱维亚家庭和约 40,000 个爱沙尼亚家庭、政治家、政治家、教授、神职人员、政府雇员、工厂和商店老板、农民从贝利亚被驱逐到乌拉尔山脉。

In addition to young people, more than 30,000 Lithuanian families, about 20,000 Latvian families and some 40,000 Estonian families, politicians, statesmen, teachers, clerics, government employees, owners of factories and shops, farmers, are arrested by secret police officials from Beria and deported to the Ural mountains.

一旦被贝利亚清洗，这些国家就可以并入苏联了。苏联首先吞并了立陶宛。两周后，爱沙尼亚遭受了同样的命运，接下来的一个月，拉脱维亚又从自由国家的地图上消失了。

Once cleansed by Beria, these countries are ripe for incorporation into the USSR. The Soviet Union first absorbs Lithuania. Two weeks later, Estonia suffered the same fate and, the following month, Latvia was in turn wiped off the map of free nations.

与此同时，1939 年 11 月 30 日，苏联入侵芬兰。但这一次，行动不会没有火力进行。相反。就像波兰对抗德国一样，芬兰决定捍卫其独立，对抗苏联。他的军队虽小，但勇敢。隐藏在松树林中的排引诱苏联军队，然后在极夜的黑暗中将他们包围，并用芬兰长刀无声无息地将他们一一刺伤。其他芬兰人的巢穴，穿着白布、白色工装裤、白色束腰外衣和白色头饰，在雪中伪装自己，然后骑着滑雪板从许多山丘后面出现，用涂成白色的枪开火，消灭敌人。

Meanwhile, on November 30, 1939, the Soviet Union invaded Finland. But this time, the action does not take place without fire. On the contrary. Like Poland against Germany, Finland decides to defend its independence against the USSR. His army is small, but brave. Platoons concealed in the pine woods lure in the Soviet troops, then, in the dark of the polar night, surround them and, without a sound, stab them one by one with their long Finnish knives. Other nests of Finns, dressed in white cloth, white overalls, white tunics and white headdresses, camouflage themselves in the snow, then arise on their skis from behind the many hills and, opening fire with their guns painted in white, decimate the enemy.

苏联最高统帅部对芬兰所能做的就是派遣数千名军队。但这些群众本身却被恐慌压垮了，正在迅速撤退，把武器留在了战场上。此外，红军此时的战斗力也很差。它仍然缺乏优秀的指挥官、元帅和将军以及其他高级军官。他们中的大多数人被叶乔夫驱逐出境，被处决或死在西伯利亚。贝利亚宣布的大赦并没有填补空白。而且，士兵们缺乏训练，纪律散漫。最重要的是，针对芬兰发起的军团几乎全部由来自乌兹别克斯坦、土库曼斯坦、塔吉克斯坦、阿塞拜疆和亚美尼亚的人员组成，也就是说，温暖、阳光明媚、几乎不知道下雪的国家。这些士兵从未接触过白色死亡的危险。

All the Soviet high command can do against Finland is to pour in troops by the thousands. But these masses themselves are crushed by panic and are rapidly retreating, leaving their weapons in the field. In addition, the Red Army presented a poor combat strength at this time. It still suffers from a shortage of good commanders, marshals and generals, as well as other senior officers. Most of them were executed or died in Siberia deported by Yejov. The amnesty proclaimed by Beria did not fill the gaps. Moreover, the soldiers are poorly trained and undisciplined. And above all, the regiments launched against Finland are almost all made up of men from Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan, Tajikistan, Azerbaijan and Armenia, that is, warm, sunny countries where snow is almost unknown. These soldiers have never been exposed to the peril of the white death.

对芬兰的战争需要几周，然后是几个月。十月、十一月、十二月过去了，战争仍在继续。红军所向无敌的传说成了笑话。苏联作为一个大国的威望受到威胁。

The war against Finland takes weeks, then months. October, November, December pass, the war continues. The legend of the Red Army's invincibility becomes a joke. The prestige of the USSR as a great power is at stake.

拉夫连季·贝利亚明白，巧妙利用政治局势可以为自己的事业服务。在与斯大林的一次谈话中，他概述了一项针对芬兰的新行动计划，并呼吁为内务人民委员部特种部队增派部队和现代化装备。老板答应在下次员工会议上讨论他的提议。

Lavrenty Beria understands that the cleverly exploited political situation can serve his own career. During one of his conversations with Stalin, he outlines a new plan of action against Finland and calls for additional troops and modern equipment for NKVD special forces. The boss promises to discuss his proposal at the next meeting of the staff.

两天后，斯大林向一群将军提出了贝利亚的提议。出席会议的民政事务专员公布了他的计划。然而，他的想法对于正规军官来说显得如此奇怪和可怕，以至于他们无法赞同。此外，他们明白，将精锐部队置于贝利亚的控制之下将赋予他统治他们的权力。他们不愿意表示同意。但贝利亚感觉到斯大林支持他，不再需要扮演礼貌和文明的人。他很早就知道，如果斯大林选择了他，那是因为他取悦了独裁者。将正规军最好的军团转移到安全部门负责人的特种部队的想法对斯大林非常有吸引力。贝利亚肯定会得到他想要的。如果拉夫连季继续留任，那是因为他读懂了斯大林的想法。因此，他可以为了独裁者和他自己的利益而实现这些。此外，斯大林也是通过简单的形式征求军官们的意见。他们似乎不明白。但贝利亚感觉自己足够坚强，可以告诉那些愚蠢的军人他对他们的看法。他一向苍白的脸变成了紫色，他抿着嘴唇，用冰冷的目光俯视着观众，咆哮道：“我要用你们的胆量把他从你们身上撕下来。” » 但贝利亚感觉自己足够坚强，可以告诉那些愚蠢的军人他对他们的看法。他一向苍白的脸变成了紫色，他抿着嘴唇，用冰冷的目光俯视着观众，咆哮道：“我要用你们的胆量把他从你们身上撕下来。” » 但贝利亚感觉自己足够坚强，可以告诉那些愚蠢的军人他对他们的看法。他一向苍白的脸变成了紫色，他抿着嘴唇，用冰冷的目光俯视着观众，咆哮道：“我要用你们的胆量把他从你们身上撕下来。” »

Two days later, Stalin brings up Beria's proposal before a group of generals. The Commissioner for Home Affairs, present at the meeting, unveils his plans. His idea, however, seems so strange and horrible to regular army officers that they cannot approve of it. Furthermore, they understand that placing their elite troops under Beria's control would grant him such power that he would dominate them. They are reluctant to give their consent. But Beria, sensing that Stalin supports him, no longer needs to play the polite and civilized man. He has known for a long time that if Stalin chose him, it is because he pleases the dictator. The idea of ​​transferring the best regiments of the regular army to the special forces of the chief of the Security appealed greatly to Stalin. Beria is sure to get what he wants. If Lavrenty remained in his post, it was because he read Stalin's mind. He can therefore realize these for the benefit of the dictator and for his own. Also, it is by simple formality that Stalin solicits the opinion of the officers. They don't seem to understand it. But Beria feels strong enough to tell those stupid military men what he thinks of them. His usually pale face turns purple and, with his pursed lips, glaring down at the audience with his icy gaze, he barks these words: "I'll tear him from you with your guts." » But Beria feels strong enough to tell those stupid military men what he thinks of them. His usually pale face turns purple and, with his pursed lips, glaring down at the audience with his icy gaze, he barks these words: "I'll tear him from you with your guts." » But Beria feels strong enough to tell those stupid military men what he thinks of them. His usually pale face turns purple and, with his pursed lips, glaring down at the audience with his icy gaze, he barks these words: "I'll tear him from you with your guts." »

这种粗俗的表达方式在俄语中非常流行，当一个既傲慢又强大的人使用它时，就可以从表面上看出来。贝利亚得到了他所要求的。

This vulgar expression, very popular in Russian, can be taken at face value when used by a man who is as arrogant as he is powerful. Beria gets what he asks for.

不久之后，贝利亚政委在军队中推出了新的口号：“苏联士兵永不退缩！” 贝利亚派往芬兰的突击部队将这句格言付诸实践。

Shortly after, Commissar Beria launched a new slogan in the army: "A Soviet soldier never retreats!" This maxim is put into practice by the assault troops that Beria sends to Finland.

红军仍然遭受损失。大多数苏联士兵如果没有在这些骑着滑雪板的芬兰白鬼的伏击中丧生，就会遭受严寒，导致坏疽或死亡。

The Red Army still suffers losses. The majority of Soviet soldiers, if they are not killed in the ambushes set by these white devils of Finns, mounted on their skis, undergo intense cold which causes gangrene or death.

新的内务人民委员部精锐部队加入正规部队，并不是为了在战场上支持或取代他们，而是为了留在前线后方。执行贝利亚的个人命令，精锐部队将枪口对准正规军后方，跟随战斗团。任何试图自救的士兵都会被贝利亚的特种部队射杀。“苏联士兵永远不会退缩！” »

New elite NKVD troops join the regular forces, not to support or replace them on the battlefield, but to stay well behind the front lines. Executing Beria's personal order, the elite troops point their guns behind the regular army men and follow the fighting regiments. Any soldier who tries to save himself is shot by Beria's special forces. "A Soviet soldier never backs down!" »

尽管采用了这种野蛮的方法，苏联还是无法快速战胜勇敢的斯堪的纳维亚国家。

Despite this barbaric method, the USSR could not win a quick victory over the brave Scandinavian country.

第二年二月，战争仍在如火如荼地进行。这种情况又持续了一个月，直到 1940 年 3 月 12 日和平条约结束。苏联仅征服了芬兰一小部分领土。

The war is still in full swing during the following February. It continued for another month until, on March 12, 1940, a peace treaty put an end to it. The USSR conquered only a small part of Finnish territory.

3月15日，斯大林授予贝利亚政委“功勋”奖章，以表彰他在胜利战争中所发挥的作用。

On March 15, Stalin decorated Commissar Beria with the "Merit" medal, a reward for the role he played in the victorious war.

如果说，在芬兰的这次经历之后，庞大的苏联能够避免在世界，特别是其盟友纳粹德国的眼中蒙羞，那么这基本上是贝利亚和他的口号的优点：“苏联士兵不永不退缩！比她必须的。

If, after this experience in Finland, the gigantic Soviet Union was able to avoid discrediting itself in the eyes of the world, and particularly of its ally Nazi Germany, it is essentially to the merit of Beria and his slogan "A Soviet soldier does not never back down! than she must.

评级

Ratings

38 . 关于 1939 年战役期间苏联俘获的波兰战俘的事实和文件（仅私下散发），1946 年 2 月，以及关于卡廷大屠杀事实和文件的补充报告（仅私下散发），1947 年 10 月。

38 . Facts and Documents Concerning Polish Prisoners of War Captured by the USSR during the 1939 Campaign (circulated only privately), February 1946, and Supplementary Report on Facts and Documents Concerning the Katyn Massacre (circulated only privately), October 1947.

39 . 作者在俄罗斯远北地区的一个强迫劳动营里见到了一些拉脱维亚人，尽管当时是冬天，但他们仍然穿着夏季制服。

39 . The author was able to meet some of these Latvians, still dressed in their summer uniforms, although it was winter, in a forced labor camp in the far north of Russia.

第37章

Chapter 37

英俊的雅克·莫纳德和飞翔的荷兰人

The Handsome Jacques Mornard and the Flying Dutchman

除了消灭敌方俘虏和净化占领区外，苏联安全部门还必须警惕内部敌人。由于任何善良的苏联公民，甚至任何热心的共产主义者都可能成为腐败的叛徒和叛徒，因此每个人都必须受到密切监视。这项政策相当于将苏联帝国的每个人置于监视之下。

Besides the annihilation of enemy prisoners and the purification of occupied territories, the Security of the Soviet Union must also keep a watchful eye on internal enemies. As any good Soviet citizen or even any ardent communist can become a corrupt traitor and a renegade, every individual must be watched very closely. This policy amounts to placing everyone under surveillance in the Soviet empire.

作为秘密警察、反情报部门和海外间谍网络的负责人，贝利亚的工作就是监视民众。

Keeping tabs on the people is Beria's job as head of the secret police, counterintelligence department, and overseas spy network.

共产主义间谍活动是列宁在革命前发起的。切卡党和格别乌的历任领导人完善了它。每个苏联大使馆、每个贸易代表团、每个领事馆、每个公使馆、每个驻外使团都是一个组织严密的间谍小组，听从贝利亚总部的命令。每个苏联驻外机构都设有一名内务人民委员部常驻人员，该常驻人员拥有自己的个人密码，可以直接与莫斯科联系，并经常向大使下达命令。然而，贝利亚本人也可能因在一个国家缺乏谨慎或低估地方当局的洞察力而犯下错误。但是，一旦发生丑闻，唯一的罪魁祸首是不幸的苏联官员，他必须在国外当场受到惩罚，或者稍后在祖国受到惩罚。这就是发生在苏联驻法国大使雅科夫·苏里茨身上的事情，他亲自监视法国军界。由于法国当局的怀疑，这位大使被召回莫斯科，并被贝利亚解除了职务，并被送往西伯利亚的一个集中营，不久后就在那里去世。

Communist espionage was instituted by Lenin before the revolution. The successive leaders of the Tcheka and the GPUperfected it. Every Soviet embassy, ​​every trade delegation, every consulate, every legation, and every mission abroad is a well-organized spy cell, working under orders from Beria's headquarters. Each Soviet agency abroad housed a resident of the NKVD who had his personal code to communicate directly with Moscow and who often gave orders to the ambassador. However, Beria himself can make a mistake by lacking caution in a country or underestimating the insight of local authorities. But, in the event of a scandal, the only culprit is the unlucky Soviet official who must be punished either on the spot, abroad, or later, in his homeland. This is what happened to Iacov Souritz, Soviet ambassador to France, who personally spied on French military circles. Discredited by the French authorities, the ambassador was recalled to Moscow where, relieved of his duties by Beria, he was sent to a concentration camp in Siberia where he died shortly afterwards.

还必须对广播、新闻、文学和戏剧进行严格的内部控制，以便任何人都不能传播破坏官方理论的思想。剧作家和作家，甚至那些获得列宁或斯大林奖的人，都生活在被逮捕和驱逐到遥远北方的持续恐惧之中。1940年，苏联著名小说家米哈伊尔·布尔加科夫（Mikhail Bulgakov）被贝利亚逮捕，他是《大师》和《玛格丽特》等多部书籍或莫斯科艺术剧院上演的戏剧的作者。

There must also be strict internal control of radio, the press, literature and the theater so that no one can spread ideas that would undermine official theories. Playwrights and writers, even those who have received Lenin or Stalin prizes, live in constant terror of being arrested and deported to the far north. In 1940, the famous Soviet novelist Mikhail Bulgakov, author of The Master and Margarita and several other books or plays performed by the Moscow Art Theatre, was arrested by Beria.

监禁、驱逐出境、秘密处决或威胁逮捕罪犯所爱的人、母亲、妻子、孩子，并不是内政专员用来恐吓人民的唯一方法。贝利亚还亲自或通过他的一名手下在办公室使用酷刑。众所周知，拉夫连季随身携带马鞭和不同长度的警棍。

Imprisonment, deportation and execution in camera or the threat of arrest of a person dear to the offender, mother, wife, child, are not the only methods used by the Commissioner for Internal Affairs to terrorize the people. Beria also resorts to torture which he applies in his office either himself or through one of his men. It is common knowledge that Lavrenty keeps a riding crop and batons of different lengths close to him.

正如他在莫斯科郊区的别墅里锻炼眼睛用手枪射击一样，在卢比扬卡监狱，他用一把由小铅球制成的武器锻炼了手，武器上覆盖着皮革，并通过环连接到绳子上。

Just as he exercises his eye, in his villa on the outskirts of Moscow, to shoot with a pistol, in Lubyanka prison he exercises his hand with a weapon made of a small ball of lead covered in leather and attached to a rope through a ring.

有时，在摄像机中判处一名囚犯死刑后，贝利亚会跟随被判处死刑的人和他的看守来到地下室行刑室的门口。他下令将该男子带入牢房，将他脸朝下靠在墙上，然后留在那里。士兵一出来，拉夫连季就进入了死亡室并关上了门。贝利亚一只手插在装有铅球的口袋里，停在距离受害者两三步远的地方。于是，他瞬间抓起枪，以狙击手般的精准命中了那人的右耳后面。受害人如遭雷击，倒地不起。贝利亚离开牢房，命令警卫向倒地男子的后颈开枪。按照官方规定，处决必须通过枪决进行。

Sometimes, after condemning a prisoner to death in camera , Beria follows the condemned man and his guard to the door of the basement executions cell. He gives the order to bring the man into the cell, place him face down against the wall and leave him there. As soon as the soldier is out, Lavrenty enters the death chamber and closes the door. One hand in the pocket containing the lead ball, Beria stops two or three paces from his victim. So, in a flash, he grabs his gun and hits the man behind the right ear with the precision of a sniper. The victim collapses thunderstruck. Beria leaves the cell and orders the guard to shoot the collapsed man in the back of the neck. Officially, executions must be carried out by shooting.

为了达到这种精度，贝利亚用他家柜子里的假人进行训练。拉夫连季只是偶尔在活人身上测试他的技能，以向自己证明他的技能没有丧失，而且他的一击可以立即杀死。

To achieve this precision, Beria trains on a dummy that he keeps in the cabinet of his house. Lavrenty only occasionally tests his skill on a living person, to prove to himself that he has lost none of his skill and that his blow can kill instantly.

在审讯期间，贝利亚仍然施加其他酷刑，除了让漂亮的维拉给她钻出健康的牙齿。有一个完整的清单，列出了各种残酷行为。有些看起来无辜、无害。贝利亚命令受审者，无论男女，都要在警卫的监督下，举起双臂站在角落里。就这样。如果受害者试图放下手臂，警卫会命令他不要移动，并用手枪击打他的腋下。与此同时，政委拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚正忙于日常工作。经过几个小时的节食后，精疲力竭的受害者准备承认他被指控的所有罪行。

During the interrogations, Beria still applies other tortures than that which consists in having healthy teeth drilled by the pretty Vera. There is a whole list of various cruelties. Some look innocent and harmless. Beria orders the interrogated person, male or female, to stand in a corner with their arms raised, under the supervision of a guard. That's all. If the victim tries to lower his arms, the guard commands him not to move and hits him under the arm with his pistol. Meanwhile, Commissar Lavrenti Pavlovich Beria is busy with routine work. After a few hours of this diet, the exhausted victim is ready to admit all the crimes of which he is accused.

有时，为了打破这些审讯的单调性，会使用这种练习的变体。囚犯不能举起双臂，而必须保持半蹲状态，既不能站立，也不能坐在脚后跟上。还有类似于摄影师的特殊暗室里的审讯。它配备了一个装置，该装置装有电灯，放置在黑色金属板前面。审讯人员站在防护罩后面，而囚犯必须双手放在背后坐在灯泡前。当看守点燃灯时，囚犯会感受到强烈的光的全部力量。有时，囚犯会受到将手指插在门上的威胁，如果他坚持这样做，贝利亚就会命令警官执行威胁。

Sometimes, to break the monotony of these interrogations, a variation of this exercise is used. The prisoner, instead of raising his arms, must remain half squatting, neither standing nor sitting on his heels. There are also interrogations in a special darkroom similar to those of photographers. It is equipped with a device fitted with an electric lamp placed in front of a black metal sheet. The interrogating officer stands behind this protective shield while the prisoner must sit in front of the light bulb, hands behind his back. When the guard lights the lamp, the prisoner receives the full force of an intense light. Sometimes the prisoner is threatened with having his fingers stuck in a door, and if he persists, Beria orders the officer to carry out the threat.

其他时候，贝利亚命令警卫将一个金属废纸篓放在囚犯的头上，并用刺刀刺击它。骚乱一直持续到受审者供认为止。

At other times, Beria orders the guard to place a metal wastebasket over the prisoner's head and strike it with his bayonet. The uproar continues until the interrogated person confesses.

拉夫伦蒂喜欢亲自实施某些暴行。由于民政事务专员太有尊严了，无法继续爬上他的桌子并跳到受害者的胸口上，所以他正在玩不同的游戏。他命令囚犯打开裤子，将阴茎放在桌子上，然后用尽手指的力量将其压碎40。然后，当囚犯被脱掉内裤并由一名内务人民委员部士兵看守时，贝利亚打开了他办公桌上的一个抽屉，将受害者的睾丸插入其中，然后突然关上抽屉。他继续缓慢地打开和关闭抽屉。犯人快要晕过去的哭声和惊恐的表情，让专员和属下觉得好笑，笑得停不下来。

There are certain atrocities that Lavrenti likes to accomplish personally. Since the Home Affairs Commissioner is too dignified to keep climbing on his desk and jumping on his victim's chest, he's having fun playing a different game. He orders the prisoner to open his pants and put his penis on the table, then he crushes it with all the strength of his fingers 40. Then, while the prisoner, stripped of his underpants and guarded by an NKVD soldier, stands next to the chief of the secret police, Beria opens a drawer in his desk, inserts the victim's testicles into it, then abruptly closes the drawer. He slowly continues to open and close the drawer. The cries of the prisoner about to faint and the expression on his terrified face seem so funny to the commissioner and his subordinate, that they cannot stop laughing.

然而，1940年中期，贝利亚的主要任务仍然是执行几个月前斯大林交给他的特殊使命。秘密警察头子日以继夜地花费几个小时精心准备问题。

However, in the middle of 1940, Beria's main task remained the execution of the special mission that Stalin had entrusted to him a few months earlier. The head of the secret police spends several hours a day and night meticulously preparing the question.

这个任务是在墨西哥清算托洛茨基。

This mission is the liquidation of Leon Trotsky in Mexico.

现在是结束自己生命的时候了，因为托洛茨基已经写了一年多的斯大林传记，几乎已经完成了这项工作，现在可以随时将手稿送到印刷厂。既然斯大林是他的死敌，毫无疑问，托洛茨基的著作将是一个完全反面的叙述，揭露斯大林所犯下的一切罪行。它还将凸显斯大林在十月革命之前和十月革命期间的作用的微不足道，这与贝利亚阐述的斯大林传奇相反。

It is high time to end his life, because Trotsky, who has been working on a biography of Stalin for more than a year, has almost finished this work and can send the manuscript to the printer any day now. . Since Stalin is his mortal enemy, there is no doubt that Trotsky's work will be an entirely negative account, revealing all the crimes committed by Stalin. It will also highlight the insignificance of Stalin's role before and during the October Revolution, which is contrary to the legend of Stalin as elaborated by Beria.

拉夫连季考虑了两种摧毁托洛茨基的方法：用他的精简机枪进行攻击，或者，如果这意味着失败（这是可能的），则采取更复杂的计划，该计划在前一年被证明对不同的目标非常有效。这次是关于杀害一名苏联驻中东国家大使的事件，根据当地内务人民委员部居民的报告，这名大使已决定叛逃。这项必须完美执行的秘密任务被委托给了一位名叫博科夫的内务人民委员会秘书，他曾是一名水手。贝利亚把他叫到办公室，问他是否有能力用一根铁棍一击杀死一个人。当博科夫做出肯定的回答后，他获得了国书，并被派去见大使。采访前，博科夫遇到了内务人民委员部的一位居民，这位居民给了他一根足够短的铁棍，可以藏在夹克下面。随后博科夫和他的助手去见了大使。在讨论过程中，当大使转头回答另一位对话者提出​​的问题时，博科夫击中了他的头部，当即杀死了他。两人在内务人民委员部居民的帮助下，将尸体抬出城，埋在一个已经挖好的坑里。整个事情进行得很顺利，使馆里没有人产生任何怀疑。就连大使办公室的血迹斑斑的地毯也被搬走了。看门人被告知有人带他出去清洁。事实上，大使的尸体就滚在里面。大使的妻子被告知，她的丈夫突然被召回莫斯科，以至于他没有时间警告她，但已要求他的一名副手告诉她带着两个孩子跟随他。妻子和两个孩子在前往莫斯科的途中被内务人民委员部逮捕。他们被从铺位上拖下来，转移到一辆运牛车上，开往西伯利亚的一个强迫劳动营。大使和他的家人消失得无影无踪，而贝利亚则向博科夫表示祝贺，授予他银质勋章，并因他所提供的服务而升职。但他要求他的一位助手让他带着两个孩子跟着他。妻子和两个孩子在前往莫斯科的途中被内务人民委员部逮捕。他们被从铺位上拖下来，转移到一辆运牛车上，开往西伯利亚的一个强迫劳动营。大使和他的家人消失得无影无踪，而贝利亚则向博科夫表示祝贺，授予他银质勋章，并因他所提供的服务而升职。但他要求他的一位助手让他带着两个孩子跟着他。妻子和两个孩子在前往莫斯科的途中被内务人民委员部逮捕。他们被从铺位上拖下来，转移到一辆运牛车上，开往西伯利亚的一个强迫劳动营。大使和他的家人消失得无影无踪，而贝利亚则向博科夫表示祝贺，授予他银质勋章，并因他所提供的服务而升职。

Lavrenty considered two methods of destroying Trotsky: an attack from his reduced machine-gun or, if that means failed, which was possible, a more elaborate scheme which, the previous year, had proved quite effective against a different target. This time it was about killing a Soviet ambassador to a Middle Eastern country, who, according to reports from the local NKVD resident, had decided to defect. This secret mission, which had to be carried out to perfection, was entrusted to an NKVD secretary named Bokov, a former sailor. Beria had summoned him to his office to ask him if he was capable of killing a man with a single blow of an iron bar. When Bokov replied in the affirmative, he was provided with credentials and sent on a special mission to the ambassador. Before the interview, Bokov had met the resident of the NKVD who had given him an iron bar short enough to be concealed under a jacket. Then Bokov and his assistant went to see the ambassador. During the discussion, as the ambassador turned his head to answer a question posed by the other interlocutor, Bokov struck him in the head, killing him instantly. The two men, with the help of the NKVD resident, carried the body out of town and buried it in an already dug pit. The whole affair had been carried out so smoothly that no one at the embassy had formed any suspicions. Even the bloody carpet had been removed from the ambassador's office. The janitor was told that men were taking him out to clean him. In fact, the ambassador's body was rolled into it. The ambassador's wife was informed that her husband had been recalled to Moscow so suddenly that he had not had time to warn her, but had asked one of his deputies to tell her to follow him with their two children. The wife and two children, on their way to Moscow, were arrested by the NKVD. Torn from their bunks, they were transferred to a cattle car bound for a forced labor camp in Siberia. The ambassador and his family disappeared without a trace while Beria congratulated Bokov, decorated him with a silver medal and granted him a promotion for services rendered. but that he had asked one of his assistants to tell him to follow him with their two children. The wife and two children, on their way to Moscow, were arrested by the NKVD. Torn from their bunks, they were transferred to a cattle car bound for a forced labor camp in Siberia. The ambassador and his family disappeared without a trace while Beria congratulated Bokov, decorated him with a silver medal and granted him a promotion for services rendered. but that he had asked one of his assistants to tell him to follow him with their two children. The wife and two children, on their way to Moscow, were arrested by the NKVD. Torn from their bunks, they were transferred to a cattle car bound for a forced labor camp in Siberia. The ambassador and his family disappeared without a trace while Beria congratulated Bokov, decorated him with a silver medal and granted him a promotion for services rendered.

贝利亚决定对托洛茨基采取类似的策略，但不是使用铁柄，而是使用冰斧。然而，事情并不像看起来那么简单。相反。她的心情很复杂。这需要大量的工作和精心策划的计划，对每一个细节进行研究并保留以防万一攻击失败。

Beria decides to resort to a similar ruse against Trotsky, but instead of using an iron handle, to use an ice axe. However, the matter is not as simple as it seems. On the contrary. She is very complicated. It requires a lot of work and a meticulously planned plan, studied in every detail and kept in reserve in case the attack fails.

1940 年 5 月 23 日墨西哥炎热的夜晚，距托洛茨基私人堡垒不远的科约阿坎镇正在举办一场盛大的节日。几个穿着传统服装的漂亮乡村妇女邀请看守托洛茨基的年轻人陪她们去参加舞会，在那里她们可以尽情享受葡萄酒和啤酒。这些漂亮的女孩看起来并不害羞，人们可以希望，喝了几杯之后，她们不会拒绝，在树下的某个地方。一些年轻门将无法抗拒。他们去跳舞。

In the heat of the Mexican night of May 23, 1940, a big fiesta animates the town of Coyoacan, not far from Trotsky's private fortress. A few attractive village women in traditional costume invite the young people who guard Trotsky to accompany them to the ball where they can gorge themselves on wine and beer. These pretty girls hardly seem shy and one can hope that, after a few drinks, they will not refuse, somewhere under a tree. Some of the young goalkeepers cannot resist. They go dancing.

凌晨两点，一辆军用卡车载着由一名军官指挥的一排墨西哥警​​察停在托洛茨基的堡垒前。该军官要求见卫队指挥官。当美国托洛茨基主义者罗伯特·谢尔登·哈特出现时，他收到了一份墨西哥官方文件，规定应增派部队来增援该哨所。

At two o'clock in the morning, a military truck carrying a platoon of Mexican policemen commanded by an army officer stops in front of Trotsky's fortress. The officer asks to see the commander of the guard. When American Trotskyist Robert Sheldon Harte appears, he is handed an official Mexican document stipulating that the post should be reinforced with additional troops.

当门打开，他们走进去时，军官一枪打死了哈特，而他的手下则制服了哨兵。立刻儿子的报警信号响起，电话和电力都被切断。袭击者继续前往托洛茨基的卧室并用冲锋枪开火。袭击只持续了几分钟。卡车运走了哈特的尸体和阴谋者以及他们的墨西哥“官员”，一位名叫大卫·阿拉法罗·西凯罗斯的画家，墨西哥共产党人和斯大林的支持者。

When the door opens and they step inside, the officer kills Harte with a single shot while his men overpower the sentries. Immediately the wires of the alarm signal, telephone and electricity are cut. The assailants continue on their way to Trotsky's bedroom and open fire with the submachine gun. The assault only lasted a few minutes. The truck takes away Harte's corpse and the conspirators with their Mexican "officer", a painter named David Alafaro Siqueiros, a Mexican communist and supporter of Stalin.

然而这次攻击失败了。托洛茨基和他的妻子在黑暗中设法钻到床底下。他们只受了轻伤，他们的孙子塞乌什卡也受了轻伤。

The attack is however a failure. Trotsky and his wife managed to slip under their bed in the dark. They are only slightly injured, as is their grandson Sevushka.

这次暗杀行动的失败并不意味着这是唯一一次或最后一次。托洛茨基知道这一点。他的堡垒得到了真正的援军的巩固。报警系统得到改进，高压电线沿围墙铺设。托洛茨基迫不及待地想尽快完成他关于斯大林的著作，他把所有的时间都花在了写作上，除了他的少数最好的朋友和追随者之外，拒绝了所有来访者。他最热心的追随者之一是年轻的俄裔美国人西尔维娅·阿格洛夫（Sylvia Agelov），她在巴黎遇见了托洛茨基和他的妻子，并在他们逃离法国前往挪威时跟随他们。托洛茨基的家人都非常爱她并盲目信任她，特别是因为她帮助他们为逃亡海外做准备。

The failure of this assassination attempt does not mean that it is the only one or the last. Trotsky knows it. His fortress is consolidated with real reinforcements. The alarm system is improved and high voltage electric wires are placed along the perimeter wall. Trotsky, impatient to finish his work on Stalin as soon as possible, devotes all his time to writing it and rejects all visitors except a handful of his best friends and followers. One of his most ardent followers was a young Russian-American, Sylvia Agelov, who met Trotsky and his wife in Paris and followed them when they fled France for Norway. All of Trotsky's family love her very much and trust her blindly, especially because she helped them prepare for their escape overseas.

阿格洛夫小姐在瑞士遇见了一位年轻的登山家：雅克·莫纳德。他是一名共产党员，而且正如她高兴地了解到的那样，他有托洛茨基主义倾向。她爱上了山里的男人。他们很快就结婚了。西尔维娅自豪地宣布与她最好的朋友莱昂·托洛茨基和娜塔莉亚·托洛茨基结婚。

Miss Agelov meets a young mountaineer in Switzerland: Jacques Mornard. He is a Communist and, as she learns with joy, of Trotskyist leanings. She falls in love with the mountain man. They get married quickly. Sylvia proudly announces her marriage to her best friends, Leon and Natalia Trotsky.

返回纽约后，西尔维娅带着她的丈夫去了墨西哥，把他介绍给托洛茨基家族。这对年轻夫妇多次参观科约阿坎的防御工事房屋，在露台或客厅里聊天度过了漫长的夜晚。雅克·莫纳德是一位才华横溢、真诚的人，渴望倾听托洛茨基的讲话，并从他的口中学习尽可能多的东西。他们养成了坐在托洛茨基的书房里的习惯，里面摆满了书籍、照片、剪报、笔记、手稿和纪念品。

Upon her return to New York, Sylvia takes her husband to Mexico to introduce him to the Trotskys. The young couple paid several visits to the fortified house of Coyoacan, spending long evenings chatting on the patio or in the living room. Jacques Mornard is a brilliant and sincere man, eager to listen to Trotsky and to learn as many things as possible from his mouth. They got into the habit of sitting in Trotsky's study, filled with books, photographs, newspaper clippings, notes, manuscripts and memorabilia.

有一天，两人在书房里。托洛茨基正在阅读他的年轻客人写的一篇文章的手稿，而后者则站在他身后，回头看去。突然，莫纳德从夹克里拿出一把特制锋利的高山冰斧，击中了托洛茨基的头部。这一击不会导致立即死亡。托洛茨基一边呼救，一边按下了办公桌下的报警按钮。哨兵抓住了刺客，并把他带到监狱看守。托洛茨基的手稿被保存下来。但第二天，即 1940 年 8 月 21 日，列昂·托洛茨基在医院去世。

One day, the two men are in the study. Trotsky reads the manuscript of an article by his young guest, while the latter stands behind him, looking over his shoulder. Suddenly, Mornard pulls a specially sharpened alpine ice ax out of his jacket for this purpose and hits Trotsky in the head. The blow does not result in immediate death. Calling for help, Trotsky managed to press the alarm signal button under his desk. The sentries take the assassin and lead him to prison under guard. Trotsky's manuscript is saved. But Leon Trotsky died in hospital the next day, August 21, 1940.

贝利亚还向雅克·莫纳德提供了一本名为弗兰克·杰克逊的加拿大护照，他实际上是西班牙斯大林主义者拉蒙·梅卡德，他的母亲在西班牙内战期间为内务人民委员部工作。托洛茨基被谋杀后不久，她受邀前往莫斯科，成为贝利亚的贵宾。骄傲的母亲卡里达·梅卡德女士获得了奖励拉蒙功绩的奖章。

Jacques Mornard, to whom Beria also provided a Canadian passport in the name of Franck Jacson, is actually a Spanish Stalinist, Ramón Mercader, whose mother worked for the NKVD during the Spanish Civil War. Shortly after Trotsky's murder, she was invited to Moscow where she was Beria's guest of honor. The proud mother, Señora Caridad Mercader, receives the medal that rewards the exploit of Ramón.

在这次招待会期间发生了一件令人难忘的事情：作为对这位真正杰出的建筑师精心策划的国际阴谋杰作的奖励，人民委员拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚从亲爱的伟大的斯大林同志手中获得了最高的官方荣誉——列宁勋章。

During this reception a memorable event took place: as a reward for this masterpiece of international intrigue masterfully conducted by a truly remarkable architect, People's Commissar Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria received from the hands of the dear and great comrade Stalin's highest official honour, the Order of Lenin.

作为负责国家安全的贝利亚必须密切关注所有俄罗斯外交官，甚至是最高级别的外交官。拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇经常利用这一点来满足自己的设计。1940 年 11 月 12 日至 13 日，当外交政委莫洛托夫受邀在柏林会见希特勒时，贝利亚没有错过这个监视苏联代表的机会。莫洛托夫与斯大林的关系太密切，他是一位优秀的心理学家，也太聪明，他可以挫败贝利亚的阴谋，这对贝利亚来说是危险的。现在贝利亚有机会控制柏林的莫洛托夫。在与斯大林的一次讨论中，拉夫连季建议任命弗拉基米尔·德卡诺佐夫为莫洛托夫在柏林的副手。他是一名高级秘密警察 经验丰富；他将担任莫洛托夫保镖的队长，同时能够观察德国首都的事件。斯大林同意了这个建议，这样贝利亚就可以确信，他的下属和最忠实的合作者杰卡诺佐夫会向他报告莫洛托夫的一举一动，这可能会导致这位外交官的英年早逝。

Being in charge of State Security, Beria must keep an eye on all Russian diplomats, even those of the highest rank. Lavrenti Pavlovich often takes advantage of this to satisfy his own designs. When Molotov, Commissar for Foreign Affairs, is invited to meet Hitler in Berlin on November 12 and 13, 1940, Beria does not miss this opportunity to spy on the Soviet delegate. Molotov is too close to Stalin, too fine a psychologist and too intelligent not to be dangerous for Beria whose intrigues he could thwart. And now Beria has the chance to control Molotov in Berlin. During one of his discussions with Stalin, Lavrenty suggested appointing Vladimir Dekanozov as Molotov's deputy in Berlin. He's a senior secret police officer, full of experience; he will be head of Molotov's bodyguards and at the same time will be able to observe the events in the German capital. Stalin agrees to the suggestion, so Beria can be sure that Dekanozov, his subordinate and his most loyal collaborator, will report to him on Molotov's every move, which could bring about the diplomat's untimely demise.

莫洛托夫回国后，杰卡诺佐夫立即在贝利亚的推荐下被任命为驻柏林大使，而贝利亚的另一位朋友和特工科布洛夫则正式加入大使馆担任顾问，实际上是一名常驻秘密警察、苏联情报部门负责人以及苏联情报部门的监督者。驻柏林的所有俄罗斯外交人员。这一变化使得拉夫伦蒂能够将他最好的两名线人安置在德国。

Immediately after Molotov's return, Dekanozov was appointed ambassador to Berlin on Beria's recommendation, while another of Beria's friends and agents, Kobulov, joined the embassy officially as an adviser, in fact as a resident secret police, head of the Soviet intelligence services and watchdog of all Russian diplomatic staff stationed in Berlin. This change allows Lavrenti to place two of his best informants in Germany.

莫洛托夫回国后，贝利亚并没有暂停对他的监视。利用他对斯大林的优势，他成功任命司法部长安德烈·维辛斯基为莫洛托夫的第一副手。维辛斯基已经成为拉夫连季的得力助手，他的职业生涯现在更多地取决于贝利亚，而不是其他任何人。

Beria does not suspend Molotov's surveillance upon his return. Using his ascendancy over Stalin, he managed to appoint Attorney General Andrei Vyshinsky as Molotov's first deputy. The career of Vyshinsky, who has become Lavrenti's right-hand man, now depends more on Beria than on anyone else.

贝利亚还必须完成其前任所承担的一些重要事务，特别是清算出国的苏联高级公务员，但直到现在才幸免，因为他们的清算人叶若夫本身也被清算了。其中包括沃尔特·克里维茨基（Walter Krivitski），他是前苏联西欧情报部门负责人、内务人民委员会驻巴黎常驻人员、苏联间谍大师。他广泛游历了奥地利、意大利和荷兰。尽管他多次往返莫斯科，但他还是设法逃避了外国情报部门的调查。在维也纳，沃尔特·克里维茨基建立了一个庞大的苏联特工网络。在罗马，由于他与一名法西斯海军军官的关系，他获得了最后一艘意大利潜艇的设计图。在巴黎，在他的总部所在的地方，克里维茨基同时以不同的名字居住在不同的地方。与此同时，他在海牙开了一家豪华书店，出售珍本书籍，并把自己伪装成一位和平的奥地利古董商。他和他美丽的妻子塔尼亚（Tania）以及他们的小男孩亚历克斯（Alex）住在那里。克里维茨基多次前往柏林，其中一次获得了有关德日谈判的绝密文件，并通过他在荷兰的古董店将其发送到苏联。为了协助他经营这家商店，他得到了一位密友的帮助：年轻英俊的荷兰共产党人汉斯·布鲁斯(Hans Bruesse)。

Beria must also conclude a certain number of important businesses undertaken by its predecessor, in particular the liquidation of high Soviet civil servants gone abroad, but spared until now because their liquidator, Yezhov, was itself liquidated. Among them is Walter Krivitski, former head of Soviet Intelligence in Western Europe, resident of the NKVD in Paris and master Soviet spy. He traveled extensively in Austria, Italy and Holland. Despite his many back and forth trips to Moscow, he managed to evade foreign intelligence services. In Vienna, Walter Krivitski set up a large network of Soviet agents. In Rome, thanks to his relations with a Fascist naval officer, he was able to obtain the plans for the last Italian submarine. In Paris, where his headquarters was, Krivitsky simultaneously lived in different places under different names. At the same time he kept a luxurious bookstore in The Hague, where he sold rare books, and passed himself off as a peaceful Austrian antique dealer. He lived there with his beautiful wife Tania and their little boy Alex. During one of his many trips to Berlin, Krivitski obtained top-secret documents relating to the German-Japanese negotiations and sent them to the Soviet Union through his antique shop in Holland. To assist him in this store, he had the services of a close friend: the young and handsome Dutch communist Hans Bruesse.

在克里维茨基多次访问巴黎期间，他受到了内务人民委员会机动小组负责人的拜访。他不是来找克里维茨基的，而是来找他以前的合作者伊格纳斯·赖斯的，后者拒绝服从返回莫斯科的命令，并与他的主人决裂。机动大队的特工前来给他一个教训，以此作为对任何拒绝服从莫斯科中央政府命令的海外苏联政要的惩戒。然而，克里维茨基对他们没有任何帮助。他通知了逃往瑞士的朋友。但他享受自由的时间并不长。克里维茨基知道轮到他了，决定带着妻子和儿子逃跑。但在他们逃跑之前，两次针对他的暗杀企图。幸运的是，克里维茨基设法拯救了自己。在这两种情况下，潜在的刺客都是同一个人：汉斯·布鲁斯这位英俊、真诚、忠诚的助手，从第一天起就让他成为内务人民委员部的看门人。克里维茨基明白，在接下来的几天里，不仅是他，还有他的妻子和儿子都会被删除。他拥有足够重要的关系，能够向法国总理莱昂·布鲁姆陈述自己的情况并请求他庇护的权利。不久前，苏联特工在巴黎绑架了两名俄罗斯将军米勒和库特波夫，震惊了法国公众舆论。法国外交部长通过苏联驻巴黎大使馆向克里姆林宫提出了强烈抗议，

During one of his many stays in Paris, Krivitski was visited by the head of the Mobile Group of the NKVD. He did not come for Krivitski, but for his former collaborator Ignace Reiss who had refused to obey the order to return to Moscow and had broken with his masters. The agents of the Mobile Group came to teach him a lesson such that it could serve as an exemplary punishment for any Soviet dignitary abroad who refused to obey the orders of the central administration in Moscow. Krivitsky was of no help to them, however. He informed his friend who fled to Switzerland. But he does not enjoy his freedom for long. Krivitski understood that his turn was coming and decided to run away with his wife and son. But before their flight, two assassination attempts were directed against him. Fortunately, Krivitski managed to save himself. In both cases, the would-be assassin was the same person: that handsome, sincere and so faithful assistant that was Hans Bruesse, made him a watchdog of the NKVD from day one. Krivitsky understood that not only he, but also his wife and their son would be deleted in the next few days. He enjoyed sufficiently important connections to be able to present his case to the French Prime Minister Léon Blum and to ask him for the right of asylum. Shortly before, the kidnapping in Paris, by Soviet agents, of two Russian generals, Miller and Koutepov, had scandalized French public opinion. The French Minister for Foreign Affairs had presented to the Kremlin, through the intermediary of the Soviet Embassy in Paris, an energetic protest,

1938年，克里维茨基和家人抵达纽约。他们在美国感到安全。这位与斯大林私交的苏联前西欧情报负责人着手帮助美国当局对抗共产主义，但这是一项吃力不讨好的工作。当时在美国，说苏联坏话并不流行。在美国的俄罗斯间谍为他们的行动找到了有利的基础。

In 1938, Krivitski and his family arrived in New York. They felt safe in the United States. The former head of Soviet intelligence in Western Europe, who had known Stalin personally, set about helping the American authorities fight communism, but it was a thankless job. To speak ill of the Soviet Union was not very popular in America at that time. Russian spies in the United States found favorable ground for their operations.

克里维茨基靠一些期刊发表的文章为生。1938年底，当叶若夫被解除内政部长职务时，克里维茨基松了一口气。他了解到，内务人民委员部新任主席拉夫连季·贝利亚宣布对叶约夫起诉的高级官员实行某种特赦。但这一次，熟练的克里维茨基错了。不管怎样，他被判处死刑，不仅因为他叛逃，还因为他在苏联情报机构中的地位太重要了。他对苏联在海外、特别是海外的间谍网络了解太多，他急于将这件事告诉华盛顿。而且，他已经在美国报刊上发表了多篇文章，揭露了苏联的做法。

Krivitski lived on articles published by a few journals. When, at the end of 1938, Yezhov was relieved of his post as Chief of Internal Affairs, Krivitsky breathed a sigh of relief. He learned that the new chief of the NKVD, Lavrenty Beria had proclaimed a kind of amnesty for the high officials prosecuted by Yejov. But this time the skilful Krivitsky was wrong. He was sentenced to death anyway, not only because he had defected, but also because he had been too important a figure in Soviet Intelligence. He knew too much about the network of Soviet spies abroad, especially overseas, and he was eager to tell Washington about it. Moreover, he had already published several articles in the American press, which exposed the Soviet methods.

克里维茨基在几个月内写下了他的回忆录。这不仅是对他叛逃的描述，而且还揭露了与克里姆林宫和斯大林的罪行有关的事实，而自由世界对此一无所知。这些章节涉及诸如“斯大林安抚希特勒”、“斯大林在西班牙的手”、“斯大林为什么射杀他的将军”等耸人听闻的事件。该书的副本，由哈珀出版，标题为“斯大林的特勤局”。《揭露俄罗斯秘密政策》由苏联驻美国大使馆获得并送往莫斯科。贝利亚向纽约的机动特别任务组发出了清算克里维茨基的密码命令。在斯大林的特勤局很快成为畅销书，并为克里维茨基带来了足够的钱来养家至少一年。然而，有一天，克里维茨基在百老汇大街上散步时，发现了两名他认识的人，他们是内务人民委员会的职业杀手。42号他们从一家餐馆出来 街道。时代广场一侧的大型自助餐厅当时是苏联特工繁忙的聚会场所。它宽敞的房间使得可以用托盘占据一百张桌子中一张或另一张桌子上剩余的空位，即使桌子上的其他椅子已经被陌生人占据了。然后我们就可以一边吃饭一边开始聊天。这种做法为交换机密信息而不引起怀疑创造了良好的条件。正在寻找克里维茨基的两名特工看到了他。光天化日之下，在百老汇的人群中，他们无法伤害他，但他们却跟着他。俄罗斯叛逃者意识到了这一点。过马路时，其中一名特工，他叫谢尔盖·巴索夫（Sergei Basov），找到他并告诉他，他的母亲和他岳母已在莫斯科被捕，并作为叛国罪罪犯的家人被处决。克里维茨基设法逃脱了折磨他的人，但他知道他们不会放弃追捕。他前往华盛顿寻求帮助和保护，并提出利用自己对苏联在美国颠覆活动的了解为美国当局服务。但没有人愿意听他的。提出将他对苏联在美国颠覆活动的了解为美国当局服务。但没有人愿意听他的。提出将他对苏联在美国颠覆活动的了解为美国当局服务。但没有人愿意听他的。

Krivitski wrote his memoirs in a few months. It was not only the account of his defection, but also the exposition of facts relating to the Kremlin and Stalin's crimes, of which the free world was ignorant. The chapters dealt with such sensational events as "Stalin appeases Hitler", "Stalin's hand in Spain", "Why Stalin shot his generals". A copy of the book, published by Harper under the title In Stalin's Secret Service. An Exposé of Russia's Secret Policies , was acquired by the Soviet Embassy in the United States and sent to Moscow. Beria gave the coded order to the Mobile Special Missions Group in New York to liquidate Krivitski. In Stalin's Secret Servicequickly became a bestseller and brought in enough money for Krivitski to support his family for at least a year. However, one day while walking down Broadway, Krivitski spotted two men he knew were professional NKVD killers. They were coming out of a restaurant on 42nd Street. The large self-service restaurant on the side of Times Square was then a busy meeting place for Soviet agents. Its vast rooms made it possible to occupy with a tray one of the places left free at one or other of the hundred tables, even if the other chairs at the table were already occupied by strangers. We could then start a conversation while eating. This practice created good conditions for the exchange of confidential information without arousing suspicion. The two agents, who were looking for Krivitski, saw him. In the crowd on Broadway, in broad daylight, they could do him no harm, but they followed him. The Russian defector was aware of this. Crossing a street, one of the agents, whom he knew as Sergei Basov, approached him and let him know that his mother and his wife's mother had been arrested in Moscow and executed as part of the family of a criminal guilty of treason. Krivitski managed to outrun his torturers, but he knew they would not give up the hunt. He traveled to Washington to ask for help and protection, offering to serve the American authorities with his knowledge of Soviet subversive activities in the United States. But no one wanted to listen to him. offering to put his knowledge of Soviet subversive activities in the United States at the service of the American authorities. But no one wanted to listen to him. offering to put his knowledge of Soviet subversive activities in the United States at the service of the American authorities. But no one wanted to listen to him.

克里维茨基随时可能被杀，他的妻子被谋杀，或者他们的孩子被带走。有一天，这位前苏联政要得知年轻的荷兰人汉斯·布鲁斯已经抵达纽约。克里维茨基明白，现在这将是他的前朋友和他自己之间的一场生死斗争，尤其是一个已经失败了两次的职业杀手必须不择手段地完成他的使命。否则的话，他自己也会被清算。他们每个人都必须为挽救自己的生命而奋斗。

Krivitski could be killed at any moment, his wife murdered or their child taken away. One day, the former Soviet dignitary learned that the young Dutchman Hans Bruesse had arrived in New York. Krivitsky understood that now it would be a life-and-death struggle between his former friend and himself, especially since a professional assassin who has already failed twice must accomplish his mission by any means possible. . Otherwise, he himself will be liquidated. Each of them had to fight to save his life.

逃兵从纽约前往弗吉尼亚州的一个小镇，在那里他可以在没有许可证的情况下购买枪支和子弹。回来的路上，他不得不在华盛顿转车。但他没有接受信件。第二天，即 1941 年 2 月 10 日，沃尔特·克里维茨基 (Walter Krivitski) 被发现死于一家二等酒店贝尔维尤 (Bellevue) 。，靠近华盛顿联合车站。他被枪杀了。地上躺着他刚买的左轮手枪，警察在他的一个口袋里发现了一些信件。他们透露，叛逃者已决定自杀。然而，他的遗孀了解丈夫的风格，能够读懂言外之意。她说这些笔记是在受到威胁的情况下写的。她的丈夫绝不会想要剥夺她和她的孩子的保护。她还告诉华盛顿警方和美国媒体，她的丈夫曾多次告诉她，永远不要相信，如果他被发现死亡，那就是自杀。

From New York the deserter went to a small town in Virginia where he could buy a gun and bullets without a permit. On the way back, he had to stop in Washington to change trains. But he did not take the correspondence. The next day, February 10, 1941, Walter Krivitski was found dead in a second-class hotel, the Bellevue., near Union Station in Washington. He was shot dead. On the ground lay the revolver he had just bought and in one of his pockets the police found some letters. They revealed that the defector had decided to commit suicide. His widow, however, knew her husband's style and could read between the lines. She stated that these notes had been written under threat. Her husband would never have wanted to deprive her and her child of his protection. She also told the Washington police and the American press that her husband had told her several times never to believe that if he was found dead, it would be suicide.

克里维茨基很可能在等火车时被荷兰人搭讪，荷兰人告诉他，如果他不写下口述给他的信，如果他不自杀，即使是他心爱的妻子和儿子会被谋杀。他已经做出了选择。

It is probable that, while waiting for the train, Krivitski was accosted by the Dutchman and that the latter told him that if he did not write the letters that were dictated to him and if he did not kill himself- even his beloved wife and son would be murdered. He had made his choice.

《斯大林特勤局》的作者、前红军将军、前苏联西欧情报负责人、叛逃者沃尔特·克里维茨基的神秘死亡，与内政委员拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇政府中的任何其他例行事件一样，被记录在莫斯科内务人民委员部档案中斯大林不久前任命贝利亚为国家安全总政委。

The mysterious death of In Stalin's Secret Service author , former Red Army general and former Soviet intelligence chief in Western Europe, defector Walter Krivitsky, is recorded in the Moscow NKVD archives like any other a routine affair in the administration of Commissar for Internal Affairs Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria, whom Stalin had appointed Commissar General for State Security a short time before.

评级

Ratings

40 . 弗拉迪斯拉夫·安德斯 (Wladislav Anders) 将军在其著作《流放中的军队》（An Army in Exile ）（伦敦，1949 年）中也描述了这种审讯方法。

40 . This method of interrogation is also described by General Wladislav Anders in his book An Army in Exile , London, 1949.

第38章

Chapter 38

间谍去死！

Death to spies!

1941年6月22日，德国进攻苏联。冲击如此猛烈，俄罗斯的防御如此脆弱，以至于攻势越过苏联边境，像飓风一样在境内推进。德国进攻苏联三天后，芬兰加入了德国的行列。

On June 22, 1941, Germany attacked the Soviet Union. The shock is so violent and the Russian defenses so vulnerable that the offensive crosses the Soviet border and progresses inside the territory like a hurricane. Finland joins the Germans three days after they attacked the USSR.

斯大林任命自己为最高统帅和国防委员，并担任一个新机构的负责人，该机构立即被他命名为苏联国防国家委员会。这个“五巨头”委员会除斯大林外还有四名成员：伏罗希洛夫、马林科夫、莫洛托夫和贝利亚。

Stalin appoints himself Supreme Commander and Commissar of Defense, as well as head of a new body immediately named by him the State Committee for the Defense of the Soviet Union. This “big five” committee includes four members besides Stalin: Voroshilov, Malenkov, Molotov and Beria.

战线从白海延伸至黑海3000多公里。希特勒的军队连同他的意大利、匈牙利、罗马尼亚和芬兰盟友，人数超过 3,000,000 人。不到两周，德军就占领了白俄罗斯首都明斯克、格罗德诺、布列斯特-立托夫斯克、维尔纳和拉脱维亚首都里加，以及拉脱维亚、立陶宛和乌克兰西部的其余地区。不久之后，他们到达洛加，占领斯摩棱斯克，结束“基辅之战”并开始围攻列宁格勒。整个手术不到三个月就完成了。斯大林呼吁西方列强提供帮助。英国立即做出反应，并与苏联签署了互助条约。斯大林惊慌失措，呼吁开辟第二战线。这就是为什么在 1941 年 7 月 30 日，苏联驻英国大使伊万·麦斯基在伦敦与波兰流亡政府总理弗拉迪斯拉夫·西科尔斯基将军签署协议。该协议除其他外规定，苏联承认德苏关于波兰领土变更的条约是无效的，并同意在其领土上组建一支由波兰指挥的波兰军队。波兰共和国政府。同日签署的议定书规定，“苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟政府将特赦目前在苏联境内被剥夺自由的所有波兰公民，无论是作为战俘还是因其他原因。» 与波兰流亡政府总理弗拉迪斯拉夫·西科尔斯基将军在伦敦签署协议。该协议除其他外规定，苏联承认德苏关于波兰领土变更的条约是无效的，并同意在其领土上组建一支由波兰指挥的波兰军队。波兰共和国政府。同日签署的议定书规定，“苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟政府将特赦目前在苏联境内被剥夺自由的所有波兰公民，无论是作为战俘还是因其他原因。» 与波兰流亡政府总理弗拉迪斯拉夫·西科尔斯基将军在伦敦签署协议。该协议除其他外规定，苏联承认德苏关于波兰领土变更的条约是无效的，并同意在其领土上组建一支由波兰指挥的波兰军队。波兰共和国政府。同日签署的议定书规定，“苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟政府将特赦目前在苏联境内被剥夺自由的所有波兰公民，无论是作为战俘还是因其他原因。» 波兰流亡政府总理。该协议除其他外规定，苏联承认德苏关于波兰领土变更的条约是无效的，并同意在其领土上组建一支由波兰指挥的波兰军队。波兰共和国政府。同日签署的议定书规定，“苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟政府将特赦目前在苏联境内被剥夺自由的所有波兰公民，无论是作为战俘还是因其他原因。» 波兰流亡政府总理。该协议除其他外规定，苏联承认德苏关于波兰领土变更的条约是无效的，并同意在其领土上组建一支由波兰指挥的波兰军队。波兰共和国政府。同日签署的议定书规定，“苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟政府将特赦目前在苏联境内被剥夺自由的所有波兰公民，无论是作为战俘还是因其他原因。» 该协议除其他外规定，苏联承认德苏关于波兰领土变更的条约是无效的，并同意在其领土上组建一支由波兰指挥的波兰军队。波兰共和国政府。同日签署的议定书规定，“苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟政府将特赦目前在苏联境内被剥夺自由的所有波兰公民，无论是作为战俘还是因其他原因。» 该协议除其他外规定，苏联承认德苏关于波兰领土变更的条约是无效的，并同意在其领土上组建一支由波兰指挥的波兰军队。波兰共和国政府。同日签署的议定书规定，“苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟政府将特赦目前在苏联境内被剥夺自由的所有波兰公民，无论是作为战俘还是因其他原因。» 同日签署的议定书规定，“苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟政府将特赦目前在苏联境内被剥夺自由的所有波兰公民，无论是作为战俘还是因其他原因。» 同日签署的议定书规定，“苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟政府将特赦目前在苏联境内被剥夺自由的所有波兰公民，无论是作为战俘还是因其他原因。»

The front extends from the White Sea to the Black Sea over more than 3,000 kilometers. Hitler's forces, with his Italian, Hungarian, Rumanian and Finnish allies, number more than 3,000,000 men. In less than two weeks, the German armies took Minsk, capital of Belarus, Grodno, Brest-Litovsk, Vilna and Riga, capital of Latvia, as well as the rest of Latvia, Lithuania and western Ukraine. Shortly after, they reach the Louga, take Smolensk, end the "battle of kyiv" and begin the siege of Leningrad. The whole operation is completed in less than three months. Stalin calls on the Western powers for help. Great Britain responds immediately and signs a mutual assistance pact with the USSR. Stalin, panicked, calls for a second front. That is why, on July 30, 1941, the Soviet ambassador to Great Britain, Ivan Maïski, signs an agreement in London with General Wladislav Sikorski, Prime Minister of the Polish Government in exile. The agreement stipulates, among other things, that the Soviet Union recognizes the futility of the German-Soviet treaties relating to the territorial changes of Poland and that it gives its consent to the constitution on its territory of a Polish army under Polish command designated by the government of the Republic of Poland. The protocol signed the same day establishes that "the government of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics will grant an amnesty to all Polish citizens who are currently deprived of their liberty on the territory of the USSR, either as prisoners of war or for other reasons. » signs an agreement in London with General Wladislav Sikorski, Prime Minister of the Polish Government in exile. The agreement stipulates, among other things, that the Soviet Union recognizes the futility of the German-Soviet treaties relating to the territorial changes of Poland and that it gives its consent to the constitution on its territory of a Polish army under Polish command designated by the government of the Republic of Poland. The protocol signed the same day establishes that "the government of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics will grant an amnesty to all Polish citizens who are currently deprived of their liberty on the territory of the USSR, either as prisoners of war or for other reasons. » signs an agreement in London with General Wladislav Sikorski, Prime Minister of the Polish Government in exile. The agreement stipulates, among other things, that the Soviet Union recognizes the futility of the German-Soviet treaties relating to the territorial changes of Poland and that it gives its consent to the constitution on its territory of a Polish army under Polish command designated by the government of the Republic of Poland. The protocol signed the same day establishes that "the government of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics will grant an amnesty to all Polish citizens who are currently deprived of their liberty on the territory of the USSR, either as prisoners of war or for other reasons. » Prime Minister of the Polish Government in exile.
