Between the lines, however, Beria let his superior know that Zhdanov might raise some objections to reading Stalin's Collected Works and the new edition of the History of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union. His doubts about certain facts could be of the same order as those of Yenukidze, Bukharin, Zinoviev, Trotsky and dozens of other old-guard Bolsheviks. But of course Beria is convinced that Zhdanov is too respectful of Stalin to utter a single word that could tarnish the legend of the great dictator. Beria also expresses the opinion that the head of the Leningrad section of the Party and his supporters are preparing their own economic policy, different from that of Comrade Stalin. As he is practically a successor to Stalin, Zhdanov, like all heirs, is probably eager to receive his inheritance as soon as possible. This last remark of Beria is used only very rarely and with great caution, but it is one of his most effective insinuations. Given Stalin's obsession with assassination, even by one of his closest friends, these insinuations administered in microscopic doses, but systematically, can only lead to an inescapable result.

贝利亚元帅最终得到了老板的全权委托。拉夫连季选择了他的前任之一伊阿戈达已经使用过的方法来镇压他的顶头上司：格别乌主席门金斯基。将几滴某种物质倒入一杯茶中，在一两个小时内就能完美发挥作用。

Marshal Beria ends up receiving carte blanche from the boss. Lavrenty chose the method that had already been used by one of his predecessors, Iagoda, to suppress his immediate superior: Menjinsky, head of the GPU . A few drops of a certain substance poured into a cup of tea work perfectly in an hour or two.

1948 年 8 月 31 日，安德烈·日丹诺夫 (Andreï Zhdanov) 死于心脏病，但他从未出现过任何症状。当他在五十二岁时达到权力的顶峰时，他却意外去世了。死亡后不进行医学检查。毫无疑问，日丹诺夫的命运是由贝利亚安排的，由斯大林决定的。莫洛托夫在葬礼上发表的悼词可以证明日丹诺夫的死刑是斯大林下令并由刽子手贝利亚执行的。在一段异常简短而冷酷的讲话中，莫洛托夫将死者描述为最忠诚、最有功绩的布尔什维克之一，“党的一位熟练的战士”，仅此而已。

On August 31, 1948, Andreï Zhdanov died of a heart disease of which he had never presented the slightest symptom. He was in flourishing health when, having reached the height of his power at the age of fifty-two, he died unexpectedly. No medical examination is performed after death. There is no doubt that Zhdanov's fate, arranged by Beria, was sealed by Stalin. The proof that Zhdanov's death had been ordered by Stalin and carried out by his executioner Beria is evident from the eulogy pronounced at the funeral by Molotov. In an abnormally short and cold speech, Molotov describes the deceased as one of the most devoted and meritorious Bolsheviks, as “a skilful militant of the Party”, nothing more.

斯大林指定的继任者安德烈·日丹诺夫（Andrei Zhdanov）的去世对于贝利亚来说是一个太重要的事件，在他的掌权进程中不能不利用这一事件。如果贝利亚成为克里姆林宫的大老板，日丹诺夫的所有同伙都必须尽快消失，他们可能成为虚拟的敌人。对于贝利亚来说，说服他的上级并不难，日丹诺夫被判处死刑，他的追随者也应该面临同样的命运。

The death of Andrei Zhdanov, Stalin's designated successor, is too important an event for Beria not to exploit in his march to power. All associates of Zhdanov, who could become virtual enemies, if Beria became the big boss of the Kremlin, must disappear as soon as possible. It is not too difficult for Beria to convince his superior that, Zhdanov having been sentenced to death, his followers should meet the same fate.

列宁格勒的党领导人显然不走运。第一个是季诺维也夫，根据斯大林的命令被捕，并在莫斯科公开审判后被判处死刑并处决。他的继任者基洛夫在斯大林精心策划的阴谋后被暗杀。现在，同样的事情也发生在接替基洛夫位置的日丹诺夫身上。每次，场景都是一样的。只是舞台不同：季诺维也夫被正式谴责，基洛夫被受贿的精神病患者杀害，而丹诺夫则因不明原因的心脏病突然去世。

The Party leaders in Leningrad are obviously unlucky. The first, Zinoviev, was arrested on Stalin's orders and, after a public trial in Moscow, condemned to death and executed. His successor Kirov was assassinated following a plot masterfully prepared by Stalin. Now the same thing is happening to Zhdanov who has taken Kirov's place. Each time, the scenario is the same. Only the staging differs: Zinoviev is officially condemned, Kirov is killed by a bribed psychopath and Jdanov dies suddenly of an unexplained heart attack.

在每一起案件中，受害者周围的一些人也丧生。与季诺维也夫同时，他的一些最亲密的合作者也被排除在托派之外。在基洛夫之后，他忠实的秘书在一场模拟事故中丧生，而其他一些人则消失得无影无踪。同样的事情也发生在日丹诺夫身上，他已经组建了一个由党内甚至政治局知名人士组成的派系，等待接替斯大林执掌国家政权。这些人必须被消灭，但清算他们并不简单，也不容易。它必须伴随着新一轮的清洗浪潮而来。

In each of these cases, a number of people around the victim also lose their lives. At the same time as Zinoviev, some of his closest collaborators qualified as Trotskyists were eliminated. After Kirov, it is his devoted secretary who dies in a mock accident, while a few others disappear without a trace. The same thing happened to Zhdanov, who had formed a clique of outstanding Party and even Politburo personalities, waiting to succeed Stalin in the government of the country. These people must be eliminated, but their liquidation is neither simple nor easy. It must come in the wave of a new purge.

贝利亚将这项任务交给了他的合作者维克多·阿巴库莫夫。然而，拉夫连季太精明了，他不可能仅凭斯大林的默许就实施这一行动。还有一些仍然有权势的人，如果他们不赞成这一行动，就会变得危险。他们应该站在他一边。其中最重要的是马林科夫。贝利亚虽然讨厌他的对手，但还是决定邀请他参与阴谋。说服被日丹诺夫赶下马林科夫并成为他的敌人的马林科夫并不难。日丹诺夫的死和他同伙的消灭将为马林科夫报仇。他有望获得一些权力。贝利亚竭尽全力挑衅马林科夫的友谊。

Beria assigns this task to his collaborator Victor Abakumov. However, Lavrenty was too shrewd to carry out this action with Stalin's tacit agreement alone. There remain other people, still powerful, who, if they disapprove of the action, can become dangerous. They must be on his side. The most important is Malenkov. Although Beria hates his rival, he decides to invite him to participate in the plot. It is not very difficult to convince Malenkov who, having been ousted by Zhdanov, has become his enemy. Zhdanov's death and the elimination of his associates will give Malenkov his revenge. He can hope to get some power. Beria does everything he can to provoke Malenkov's friendship.

阿巴库莫夫发起了所谓的“列宁格勒事件”，并准备了一份因各种指控而被禁止的名单。半夜，内务人民委员部官员敲响指定人员的门：日丹诺夫的支持者。其中包括中央政治局委员、计划委员会主任尼古拉·沃兹涅先斯基，他的弟弟列宁格勒大学校长阿列克谢·沃兹涅先斯基，中央书记处书记阿列克谢·库兹涅佐夫，俄罗斯社会主义联邦共和国部长会议主席罗迪奥诺夫。 （俄罗斯联邦苏维埃社会主义共和国）、红军政治局局长四世奇金将军、列宁格勒国防博物馆馆长拉霍夫少校（博物馆已关闭）、列宁格勒党支部书记彼得·波普科夫和其他一些。为了领导列宁格勒党内的这场清洗，贝利亚任命了马林科夫的得力助手瓦西里·安德里亚诺夫。波普科夫被赶下台后，拉夫连季建议斯大林任命安德里亚诺夫担任空缺的列宁格勒支部第一书记。这一变化为贝利亚赢得了马林科夫及其支持者的青睐。

Abakumov mounts what is called "the Leningrad affair" and prepares a list of names proscribed under various charges. In the middle of the night, NKVD officers knock on the doors of designated men: Zhdanov's supporters. Among them are Nikolai Voznesensky, member of the Politburo and head of the Planning Commission, his brother Alexei Voznesensky, rector of the University of Leningrad, Alexei Kuznetsov, secretary of the Central Committee, MI Rodionov, chairman of the Council of Ministers of the RSSFR (Russian Federated Soviet Socialist Republic), General IV Chikine, Head of the Political Directorate of the Red Army, Major Rahov, Director of the Leningrad Defense Museum (the museum is closed), Piotr Popkov, Secretary of the Section of Leningrad from the Party and some others. To lead this purge in the Leningrad Party, Beria appointed Vasili Andrianov, Malenkov's right-hand man. After Popkov's ousting, Lavrenty suggested that Stalin appoint Andrianov to the vacant post of first secretary of the Leningrad branch of the Party. This change earned Beria the favor of Malenkov and his supporters.

所有被捕的人士都被监禁或送往西伯利亚的集中营。它们不会立即删除，而是暂时保留，以备其他用途需要。再说了，处决已经入狱的人也不是什么问题。我们可以随时这样做。

All the personalities arrested are imprisoned or sent to concentration camps in Siberia. They are not immediately deleted but held temporarily in reserve in case they are needed for another purpose. Besides, it is not a problem to execute someone who is already behind bars. We can do this anytime.

这次新的大清洗是由贝利亚元帅发起的，由伟大的斯大林授权，由国家安全部长拉夫连季·贝利亚实施，其组织方式与贝利亚的前任尼古拉·叶若夫实施的动乱不同。当时，试演在联合大厦的圆柱大厅进行。在苏联最高法院军事委员会进行的这些可怕的审判中，被告承认了自己的罪行，总检察长安德烈·维辛斯基提出了响亮的起诉书，而苏联媒体则收到了法院的现成文章。

This new great purge, inspired by Marshal Beria, authorized by the great Stalin and carried out by the Minister of State Security, Lavrenty Beria, is organized in a different way from the upheaval carried out by Beria's predecessor, Nikolai Yezhov . At that time, the show trials took place in the Great Hall of Columns of the Union Building. During these monstrous trials, conducted by the Military Council of the Supreme Court of the USSR, the defendants confessed their crimes and the Prosecutor General Andrei Vishinsky delivered a resounding indictment while the Soviet press received ready-made articles from the court.

相反，贝利亚组织的清洗行动没有受到任何宣传，而是秘密进行，并尽可能不让公众知晓。拉夫伦蒂的活动不寻求任何赞扬和利润，至少在他接替大老板之前是这样。在这一刻到来之前，他更愿意代表斯大林扮演“无名同志”的角色。在“列宁格勒事件”的特殊情况下，贝利亚应该专门为拯救独裁者而努力，并让马林科夫成为斯大林的继承人，排除其他所有人，包括他自己。

On the contrary, the purge organized by Beria receives no publicity, takes place in secret and is kept as far as possible from public knowledge. Lavrenti seeks no praise, no profit for his activities, at least until he succeeds the big boss. Before this moment comes, he prefers to play the role of "comrade Nobody" on behalf of Stalin. In the particular case of the "Leningrad affair", Beria is supposed to work exclusively for the salvation of the dictator and to bring Malenkov to become Stalin's heir, to the exclusion of everyone else, including himself.

那一年克里姆林宫的日子很艰难。共产党正在经历一场比表面上看起来更加痛苦的危机。斯大林比大清洗审判时紧张得多。这些事务是斯大林亲自准备的，他个人也享受镇压布哈林和李可夫、加米涅夫、季诺维也夫、拉狄克和罗森戈尔茨等老派布尔什维克、托洛茨基主义者，尤其是犹太人的乐趣。

Times were tough in the Kremlin that year. The Communist Party is going through a more painful crisis than it appears on the surface. Stalin is much more nervous than during the Great Purge trials. These affairs had been prepared by Stalin himself and he had enjoyed the personal pleasure of suppressing old-guard Bolsheviks like Bukharin and Rykov or like Kamenev, Zinoviev, Radek and Rosengoltz, Trotskyists, and, above all, Jews.

“列宁格勒事件”是有人向他建议的，而不是他自己决定的。随着年龄的增长和对死亡的痴迷，他宁愿推翻他年轻的合作者，也不愿让他的虚拟继任者一直在视野中，这清楚地表明斯大林很快就会成为过去的人物。

The "Leningrad affair" was suggested to him more than he decided on it. As he grows old and is obsessed with his death, he would rather overthrow his young collaborators, rather than keep his virtual successor constantly in view, a clear sign that Stalin will soon be nothing more than a figure of the past.

在日丹诺夫的支持者遭到清洗的日子里，斯大林比以往任何时候都更加病态、不耐烦和残暴。除了他的保镖伏罗希洛夫、贝利亚、马林科夫、赫鲁晓夫和几位内阁成员外，他不支持任何人。他尤其对年长的女性、他的家庭成员（主要是犹太人）的妻子或他妻子纳德日达的朋友感到恼火。这些坐在他桌边的女人不停地说话，让他心烦意乱。它们让他想起了他的第一任妻子叶卡捷琳娜·斯瓦尼泽 (Ekaterina Svanidze) 或第二任妻子纳德吉达·阿利卢耶娃 (Nadejda Allilouïeva)。看到这些留在他身边的老亲戚，独裁者很不高兴。她让他发疯。

During the days of the purge of Zhdanov's supporters, Stalin is more morbid, impatient and brutal than ever before. Apart from his bodyguards Voroshilov, Beria, Malenkov, Khrushchev and a few members of his cabinet, he does not support anyone. He is particularly annoyed by older women, the wives of members of his family, mainly Jews, or friends of his wife Nadezhda. These women, who sit at his table, talk incessantly and get on his nerves. They remind him of his first wife, Ekaterina Svanidze, or Nadejda Allilouïeva, his second wife. The sight of these old relatives who remained with him displeased the dictator. She drives him crazy.

斯大林的坏脾气被贝利亚利用，为自己谋取利益。虽然拉夫连季主要出于政治原因对小官员进行了小规模的清洗和处决，但现在，为了为进入克里姆林宫“上议院”铺平道路，贝利亚抓住机会除掉那些已经或可能成为他私人的人。敌人。拉夫连季利用斯大林激进的反犹太主义，摆脱了这位大同志的几位令人讨厌和吵闹的客人。这是与受人尊敬的上级进行简短而熟练的交谈的结果，他暗示他可以清理房子里的所有这些人。

Stalin's bad temper is used by Beria for his own benefit. While minor purges and executions of lesser officials have been carried out by Lavrenti, mostly for political reasons, now, to pave the way to the "upper chamber" in the Kremlin, Beria seizes the opportunity to remove people who are or could become his personal enemies. Playing on Stalin's radical anti-Semitism, Lavrenty rids the big comrade of several of his disagreeable and noisy guests. It's the result of a brief and skillful conversation with the revered superior, where he insinuates that he could clean the house of all these people.

几周后，贝利亚逮捕了共产主义工会国际秘书长、前外交事务副专员洛佐夫斯基。这位老卫士布尔什维克，是斯大林的常客，也是一家人的朋友，很机智，总是心情很好。他不断的笑声让这位忧郁的独裁者感到不安，他再也无法忍受所罗门·阿布拉莫维奇·洛佐夫斯基喜欢讲的犹太笑话了。

A few weeks later, Beria arrested Lozovski, secretary general of the Profintern – the International of Communist Trade Unions – and former deputy foreign affairs commissioner. This Bolshevik of the old guard, frequent guest of Stalin and friend of the family, is witty and always in a good mood. His incessant laughter gets on the nerves of the morose dictator who can no longer bear the Jewish jokes that Solomon Abramovich Lozovski likes to tell.

贝利亚毫不费力地关押了这个人，指责他“世界主义”。

Beria has no difficulty locking up this man, accusing him of “cosmopolitanism”.

不久之后，斯大林的另一位常客发现自己身陷囹圄。这就是莉娜·陈（Lina Chtern），她从日内瓦大学毕业后，成为莫斯科生理学研究所的教授和所长。监禁她也是一种游戏，因为莉娜·索罗门诺芙娜·赫特恩 (Lina Solomonovna Chtern) 是来自拉脱维亚的犹太人。通过指责她“世界主义”，贝利亚找到借口逮捕了生理学家安娜·阿利卢耶娃和叶夫根尼娅·阿利卢耶娃的两个最好的朋友，后者将莉娜·施特恩介绍给了斯大林的随从。安娜是斯大林第二任妻子的妹妹，嫁给了切卡家族的权贵斯坦尼斯拉夫·雷登斯还有贝利亚在密谋反对他后向斯大林告发的对手，斯大林将其关押在布蒂尔基监狱并在监狱地窖中处决。拉夫伦蒂毫不怀疑安娜对他的仇恨，他很高兴能够压制住这种仇恨。

Shortly after, another regular guest of Stalin finds himself behind bars. This is Lina Chtern who, after graduating from the University of Geneva, became a professor and director of the Institute of Physiology in Moscow. Imprisoning her is also a game, since Lina Solomonovna Chtern is a Jew from Latvia. By accusing her of “cosmopolitanism”, Beria finds an excuse to also arrest the two best friends of the physiologist, Anna and Evgenia Alliluyeva, who introduced Lina Shtern into Stalin's entourage. Anna, sister of Stalin's second wife, had married Stanislav Redens, the dignitary of the Tchekaand the adversary whom Beria had denounced to Stalin after plotting against him, and whom he had incarcerated in the Boutyrki prison and executed in the prison cellars. Having no doubt about Anna's hatred for him, Lavrenti is happy to be able to suppress it.

几年前被处决的斯大林妹夫帕维尔·阿利卢耶夫的遗孀叶夫根尼娅·阿利卢耶娃的入狱对贝利亚来说是个人的胜利。拉夫伦蒂讨厌叶夫根尼娅，因为她太多地谈论了警长与他在街上绑架的女学生睡觉的事情。叶夫根尼娅的舌头很尖刻，她嘲笑贝利亚的越轨行为，她称之为卡萨诺瓦。叶夫根尼娅猜到贝利亚对自己的丑陋情有独钟，并以此取笑他，说他是一个英俊、浪漫的唐璜。贝利亚无法忘记这些戏弄。叶夫根尼娅必须受到惩罚。

The imprisonment of Evgenia Allilouïeva, widow of Pavel Allilouïev, brother-in-law of Stalin executed a few years earlier, is a personal triumph for Beria. Lavrenti hates Evgenia, because she talks too much about the superintendent sleeping with the schoolgirls he kidnaps in the street. Having a sharp tongue, Evgenia mocks Beria's escapades which she calls Casanova. Evgenia has guessed that Beria has complexes about his ugliness and she teases him about it, saying he is a handsome, romantic Don Juan. Beria cannot forget these teasing. Evgenia must be punished.

所有这些逮捕都是在斯大林的默许下进行的。因此，他们和以前的人一样谨慎，特别是斯大林第一任妻子的兄弟亚历山大·斯瓦尼泽（Alexander Svanidze）和他的妻子米里亚姆·玛丽亚（Miriam-Maria）。斯大林讨厌这对夫妇，他认为这对夫妇总是无聊，总是抱怨，这让他想起了他的两个妻子：第一个妻子是叶卡捷琳娜，与这对夫妇有亲戚关系；第二个妻子是娜杰日达，他们非常爱她。此外，玛丽亚的娘家姓氏是科罗娜，她属于一个非常富有的犹太家庭，应该被收服。因此独裁者给予贝利亚全权委托。他们被捕并每人被判处十年强迫劳动。亚历山大和他的妻子立即被驱逐到截然相反的集中营，亚历山大在远北地区，玛丽亚在哈萨克斯坦。斯大林很高兴不再需要忍受他们的麻烦，而贝利亚一如既往地很高兴能够清除他上级的家人。

All these arrests are made with the tacit agreement of Stalin. They are therefore as discreet as the previous ones, in particular those of Alexander Svanidze, brother of Stalin's first wife, and his wife Miriam-Maria. Stalin hated the couple whom he considered to be bores always complaining and who reminded him of his two wives: the first, Ekaterina, to whom the couple was related, and the second Nadezhda, whom they loved very much. In addition, Maria, whose maiden name is Korona, belongs to a very wealthy Jewish family that should be subdued. The dictator therefore gives carte blanche to Beria. They are arrested and each sentenced to ten years of forced labor. Alexandre and his wife are immediately deported to diametrically opposed concentration camps, Alexandre in the Far North and Maria in Kazakhstan. Stalin is delighted to no longer have to put up with their hassles and Beria, as always, is delighted to be able to remove members of his superior's family.

与此同时，贝利亚对莫洛托夫造成了打击，如果马林科夫失败，莫洛托夫将成为斯大林的继任者。贝利亚认为，在事情发生之前，莫洛托夫的地位必须有所动摇。他的妻子保琳娜是娜杰日达·阿利卢耶娃·斯大林、她的妹妹安娜、亚历山大·斯瓦尼泽的犹太妻子玛丽亚、莉娜·施特恩和齐娜伊达·布哈林的红颜知己。，被指控托洛茨基主义并被处决。保琳娜·莫洛托夫本人就是犹太人。尽管她在十月革命前就加入了共产党，并被授予苏联最高荣誉之一——列宁勋章，但她必须受到谴责。这个身体虚弱、阴郁、不太有吸引力的小女人，在娜杰日达·斯大林还活着的时候，经常去独裁者的家里拜访。她太活泼了，说了太多的话，知道的事情比天底下的任何人都多，而且常常想自己是对的。宝琳娜不像卡冈诺维奇政委的妹妹罗莎，那个守口如瓶、赞扬斯大林的庸俗女人，她满足了斯大林的本能。

At the same time, Beria deals a blow to Molotov who would become Stalin's successor if Malenkov failed. Beria believes that before anything happens, Molotov's position must be shaken somewhat. His wife Paulina was a confidante of Nadezhda Alliluyeva Stalin, of her sister Anna, of Maria, the Jewish wife of Alexander Svanidze, of Lina Shtern and of Zinaida Bukharin, another Jewess, widow of Nikolai Bukharin, director of Izvestia, accused of Trotskyism and executed. Paulina Molotov is Jewish herself. Although she joined the Communist Party before the October Revolution and was decorated with one of the highest Soviet honors, the Order of Lenin, she must be condemned. This frail, gloomy little woman, not very attractive, often visited the dictator's house when Nadezhda Stalin was still living. She's too lively, makes too many remarks, knows too many things far better than anyone under the sun, and too often wants to be right. Paulina is not like Rosa, Commissar Kaganovitch's sister, that vulgar woman who keeps her mouth shut and praises Stalin whose instincts she satisfies.

贝利亚毫不费力地了解了保琳娜·莫洛托夫。第二次世界大战前几年，她作为苏联化妆品信托基金会的董事前往美国，研究那里的化妆品行业。访问期间，宝琳娜·莫洛托夫甚至受到了美国第一夫人埃莉诺·罗斯福的接见，并在白宫度过了整个下午。回到苏联后，宝琳娜养成了赞扬美国女性在着装上表现出的高品味以及化妆技巧的习惯。

Beria had no trouble getting an idea about Paulina Molotov. A few years before World War II, she traveled to the United States, as the director of the Soviet Cosmetics Trust, to study the cosmetics industry there. During her trip, Paulina Molotov was even received by the first lady of the United States, Eleanor Roosevelt, with whom she spent a whole afternoon at the White House. Back in the Soviet Union, Paulina got into the habit of praising American women for the good taste they showed in their dress and for the art with which they applied makeup.

只要指控保琳娜·莫洛托夫是反社会主义、亲西方、危险的资产阶级犹太复国主义者和人民的敌人，逮捕她并将她驱逐到西伯利亚的一个集中营就足够了。然而，她的丈夫仍然是一位非常重要的政治家，不能被清算。作为外交部长，维亚切斯拉夫·莫洛托夫表现出色，是一位有价值的代表。斯大林并不觉得让他继续担任职务感到尴尬，特别是在宝琳娜被捕后，莫洛托夫感谢斯大林逮捕了她并给予了她应有的待遇。这种态度让莫洛托夫保住了自己的职位一段时间。但他失去了威望，不再被邀请参加斯大林在他家里举办的私人会议和晚宴。斯大林的常客现在包括贝利亚、马林科夫、赫鲁晓夫、米高扬、布尔加宁和卡冈诺维奇。贝利亚讨厌莫洛托夫这个具有西方礼仪的人。目睹他的耻辱和羞辱让拉夫伦蒂感到双重满足。

It was enough to accuse Paulina Molotov of being anti-socialist, pro-Western, dangerous bourgeois Zionist and enemy of the people, to arrest her and deport her to a camp in Siberia. Her husband, however, remains too important a statesman to be liquidated. As Minister of Foreign Affairs, Vyacheslav Molotov does an outstanding job and is a valuable representative. Stalin felt no embarrassment in keeping him in his post, especially since, after Paulina's arrest, Molotov came to thank Stalin for having arrested her and giving her the treatment she deserved. This attitude allowed Molotov to retain his position for some time. But he loses prestige and is no longer invited to private meetings and dinners that Stalin gives at his home. Stalin's group of regular guests now consists of Beria, Malenkov, Khrushchev, Mikoyan, Bulganin and Kaganovich. Beria hates Molotov, this man with Western manners. Witnessing his disgrace and his humiliation gives Lavrenti a double satisfaction.

妻子被捕几个月后，莫洛托夫被解除外交部长职务。他成为部长会议副主席。外交部的职务由贝利亚的得意门生安德烈·维辛斯基（Andrei Vyshinsky）担任。

A few months after his wife's arrest, Molotov was relieved of his duties as Minister of Foreign Affairs. He becomes vice-president of the Council of Ministers. The Foreign Ministry portfolio is assigned to Andrei Vyshinsky, Beria's protege.

拉夫连季·贝利亚针对“犹太复国主义中心”的反犹太主义浪潮是迅速、系统、不公开地进行的。

The wave of anti-Semitism directed against the "Zionist center" by Lavrenty Beria is carried out quickly, systematically and without any publicity.

因反对“世界主义”行动而被捕、监禁和处决的人中包括意第绪语国家剧院的导演、伟大的莎士比亚演员所罗门·米科尔斯。米霍尔斯既没有被捕、受审，也没有被处决。它只是被清算了。根据一个版本，他在一条荒无人烟的街道上遭到暴徒袭击。根据另一个故事，他被一辆卡车撞了。众所周知，事实是他是被贝利亚特工杀害的。

Among those arrested, imprisoned and then executed in connection with the action against "cosmopolitanism" is Solomon Mikhoels, director of the Yiddish State Theater and a great Shakespearian actor. Mikhoels is neither arrested, brought to trial, nor executed. It is simply liquidated. According to one version, he was attacked by thugs in a deserted street. According to another story, he was hit by a truck. The truth, obvious to everyone, is that he was killed by agents of Beria.

米霍埃尔斯还是贝利亚于 1941 年建议成立的世界犹太人反希特勒委员会主席团的成员。该组织的主要目的是吸引国外的犹太人，特别是美国和英国的犹太人，以便他们用金钱和药品支持苏联军队。为此，米霍尔斯被派往伦敦和纽约，他的使命取得了成功。但这个委员会是贝利亚的一个陷阱，目的是吸引和惊讶俄罗斯犹太人，从而暴露他们的“犹太复国主义”情绪。贝利亚任命维克多·阿尔特和亨里克·埃利希为该委员会的联合主席，这两位波兰犹太人在战前曾是崩得的领导人。，波兰犹太工人总工会，一个社会主义组织。1939年红军入侵波兰时，阿尔特和埃利希被苏联秘密警察逮捕，带到莫斯科并囚禁在卢比扬卡。当苏联宣布对所有波兰公民进行大赦时，贝利亚释放了这两个人，并要求他们成立反对希特勒主义的犹太世界委员会。他们同意了，并前往古比雪夫，即波兰驻苏联大使馆所在地，该大使馆已与整个外交使团撤离莫斯科。新组织立即开始活动。许多著名的苏联犹太人，包括所罗门·米霍尔斯，都加入了。然而几个月后，即 1942 年，

Mikhoels had also been a member of the praesidium of the World Jewish Committee against Hitlerism, which Beria had suggested in 1941. The main purpose of this organization was to appeal to Jews abroad, particularly those in the United States and of England, so that they support the Soviet army with money and medicine. Mikhoels was delegated for this purpose to London and New York, and his mission was crowned with success. But this committee was a trap of Beria intended to attract and surprise the Russian Jews who thus revealed their "Zionist" feelings. As co-chairmen of this committee, Beria had appointed Victor Alter and Henrik Ehrlich, two Polish Jews who, before the war, were leaders of the Bund., the General Union of Jewish Workers in Poland, a socialist organization. When the Red Army invaded Poland in 1939, Alter and Ehrlich were arrested by the Soviet secret police, taken to Moscow and imprisoned in Lubyanka. When an amnesty was proclaimed for all Polish citizens of the USSR, the two men were released by Beria who asked them to create the Jewish World Committee against Hitlerism. They agreed and went to Kuybyshev, where the Polish Embassy in the Soviet Union was located, which had evacuated Moscow with the entire diplomatic corps. The new organization immediately began its activities. Many prominent Soviet Jews, including Solomon Mikhoels, joined. A few months later, however, in 1942,

现在轮到米霍尔斯了。不久之后，贝利亚逮捕了犹太人约瑟夫·莫罗佐夫（Joseph Morozov），尽管他的名字很俄罗斯化。这个人恰好是约瑟夫·斯大林大元帅的女儿斯维特兰娜第一任丈夫的父亲。

Now came the turn of Mikhoels. Shortly after, Beria arrested Joseph Morozov, a Jew despite his very Russian name. This man happens to be the father of the first husband of Svetlana, the daughter of Generalissimo Joseph Stalin.

** **

* * *

1949 年 12 月 21 日是整个苏联庆祝的伟大日子：斯大林七十岁了。虽然政治罪或普通法罪没有得到特赦，但与囚犯们的希望相反，工厂和作坊被准予休息一天，工人们可以尽情地开会。分配到每个工厂的政治领导人发表讲话后，接下来是娱乐活动和招待会。剧院和电影院对领取门票的工人和组织成员免费。报刊上充斥着颂扬苏联创始人、不朽英雄、战胜希特勒和第二次世界大战的斯大​​林的文章和诗歌。所有这些故事和诗歌，

December 21, 1949 is a great day of celebration throughout the Soviet Union: Stalin is seventy years old. Although there was no amnesty for political or common law offenses, contrary to what the prisoners had hoped, the factories and workshops were granted a day off which the workers devoted to merry meetings. After their speeches delivered by the political leaders assigned to each factory, come entertainment and receptions. Theaters and cinemas are free for workers and members of organizations to whom tickets are distributed. The press is full of articles and poems glorifying Stalin, founder of the Soviet Union and immortal hero, victor over Hitler and the Second World War. All these stories and poems,

晚上，名人们出席在莫斯科大剧院举行的盛大演出，斯大林、他的女儿斯维特兰娜以及所有内阁成员、政治局以及外交使团都在贵宾席上出席。演出结束后，克里姆林宫举行招待会。一场丰盛的宴会上，人们举杯数次，祝愿独裁者万寿无疆，幸福安康。晚宴结束后，宣读了向苏联领导人表示祝贺和敬意的电报。他们来自世界各地的国王、总统和总理。拉夫连季·贝利亚元帅接替了他的位置，开始朗诵一首赞美诗，以纪念他亲爱的上司。

In the evening, the celebrities attend a gala show at the Bolshoi, in the presence of Stalin, his daughter Svetlana and all the members of the Cabinet, the Politburo as well as the diplomatic corps, installed in the boxes of honor. The show is followed by a reception at the Kremlin. During a sumptuous banquet, several toasts are made, wishing the dictator to live a hundred years, to know happiness and prosperity. The dinner over, telegrams are read, which offer congratulations and pay homage to the leader of the USSR. They come from kings, presidents and prime ministers around the world. Marshal Lavrenti Beria takes his place and begins to recite a pean in honor of his dear superior.

“伟大的斯大林的名字被世界各国的工人热切地念诵着，他们将他与实现他们古老的希望和抱负联系在一起。

“The name of the great Stalin is pronounced with fervor by the workers of all the countries of the world, who associate him with the realization of their age-old hopes and aspirations.

走上建设社会主义道路的人民民主国家的工人阶级，怀着深深的感激之情，念叨着斯大林同志的名字。他的名字也为摆脱了殖民主义压迫的中国工农所崇敬。斯大林同志的名字激励着欧美工人阶级反对资本主义的斗争。这个名字也激励着殖民主义、半殖民主义枷锁下的国家人民争取民族自由和独立的正义斗争。

The name of Comrade Stalin is pronounced with a feeling of deep gratitude by the workers of the countries of people's democracy, who have entered the road of building socialism. His name is also revered by the workers and peasants of China which has shaken off the yoke of colonialist oppression. The name of Comrade Stalin inspires the workers of Europe and America in their struggle against capitalism. This name also inspires the peoples of countries subjected to the colonialist or semi-colonialist yoke in their just struggle for national freedom and independence.

“斯大林同志的一生都与为创建和加强布尔什维克党、为无产阶级革命的胜利、为工人的福祉、为共产主义的胜利而进行的斗争密不可分……”

"Comrade Stalin's whole life is inextricably linked with the struggle for the creation and strengthening of the Bolshevik Party, for the victory of the proletarian revolution, for the well-being of the workers and for the victory of communism..."

贝利亚用这种语气持续了一刻钟多，最后以这样的感叹结束了他的悼词：“光荣归于斯大林同志！在伟大的斯大林的领导下，向新的胜利前进！»

Beria continued in this tone for more than a quarter of an hour and concluded his eulogy with this exclamation: “Glory to Comrade Stalin! Forward to new victories under the leadership of the great Stalin! »

克里姆林宫墙外，整座城市灯火辉煌。在贝利亚的明确命令下，聚集在街道上的一大群人目睹了不寻常的景象。冬日夜空中高高地浮现出祖国之父、有史以来最伟大人物的形象：约瑟夫·维萨里奥诺维奇·斯大林。一张幻灯片展示了身穿制服、头戴军用头饰的老板的半身像，肩章上装饰着大元帅的徽章，防空探照灯的巨大光束将其投射到红场上空的乌云上。

Outside the Kremlin walls, the whole city sparkles with illuminations. On the express order of Beria, the huge crowd that throngs the streets witnesses an unusual spectacle. High in the winter night sky appears the image of the Father of the Fatherland, the greatest personality of all time: Joseph Vissarionovitch Stalin. A slide showing the bust of the boss in uniform and with military headdress, the epaulets decorated with his insignia of generalissimo, is projected by the enormous beam of light from an anti-aircraft searchlight on a dark cloud which dominates Red Square.

苏维埃俄罗斯的独裁者从天上，远在圣巴西尔球状圆顶上方，远在克里姆林宫上方，凝视着他的人民，就像一个无情的新神正在注视着他的数百万奴隶。

From the heavens, far above the bulbous domes of St. Basil, far above the Kremlin, the dictator of Soviet Russia gazes upon his people like a ruthless new god watching over his millions of slaves.

第45章

Chapter 45

有点疏忽

A little negligence

作为有史以来最大的间谍网络的负责人，拉夫伦蒂·贝利亚被证明是一个真正的邪恶天才。正是通过贝利亚的经验，美国的间谍活动和苏联对美国几乎每个政府机构的渗透才得以发展并变得如此有效。通过驻美联络官、苏联驻华盛顿大使馆负责军事情报的红军军官鲍里斯·贝科夫上校和美国共产党线人惠特克·钱伯斯，贝利亚获得了宝贵的信息。钱伯斯正在与财政部长助理哈里·德克斯特·怀特和其他几位高级政府官员保持联系。来自国务院的秘密信息由司法部特别检察官阿尔杰·希斯（Alger Hiss）传递，他后来成为副国务卿弗朗西斯·B·塞尔（Francis B. Sayre）的助理。希斯也是富兰克林·罗斯福总统周围的聪明年轻人之一。他还陪同他参加了雅尔塔会议。

As head of the biggest spy network of all time, Lavrenty Beria proves to be a true evil genius. It was through Beria's experience that espionage activities in the United States and Soviet penetration into almost every government agency in the United States was able to grow and become so effective. Through liaison officers stationed in the United States, Colonel Boris Bykov, a Red Army officer assigned to military intelligence at the Soviet Embassy in Washington, and Whittaker Chambers, an American communist informant, Beria received valuable information. Chambers is in contact with Harry Dexter White, Assistant to the Treasury Secretary, and several other senior administration officials. Secret information from the State Department is transmitted by Alger Hiss, special prosecutor of the Department of Justice, who later became assistant to Under Secretary of State Francis B. Sayre. Hiss is also one of the bright young people who surrounded President Franklin D. Roosevelt. He also accompanied him to the Yalta conference.

贝利亚从亚伯拉罕·乔治·西尔弗曼那里获得有关美国空军的信息，从爱德华·菲茨杰拉德和约翰·阿伯特那里获得有关美国军工委员会的信息。陆军部少校威廉·路德维希·乌尔曼向贝利亚提供了有关陆军情报局战争计划和联邦调查局调查的信息。

Beria gets information on the United States Air Force from Abraham George Silverman and the American War Industry Council from Edward Fitzgerald and John Abt. Major William Ludwig Ullmann of the War Department provides Beria with information on Army Intelligence's war plans and FBI investigations.

贝利亚仍然吸引其他人士成为他的线人。其中包括国务院的罗伯特·T·米勒（Robert T. Miller）、农业部的哈罗德·韦尔（Harold Ware）、陆军部反情报部门的唐纳德·尼文·惠勒（Donald Niven Wheeler）、经济管理局的菲利普·基皮（Philip Keepey）、国外的诺曼·伯斯特（Norman Burster）、司法部的海伦（Hellen）。战略服务办公室的 Tenney 和 Duncan Lee 以及美洲事务协调员 Joseph Greeg 54。

Beria still attracts other personalities who become his informants. Among them are Robert T. Miller of the State Department, Harold Ware of the Department of Agriculture, Donald Niven Wheeler of the War Department's counterintelligence, Philip Keepey of the Economics Administration. for foreign countries, Norman Burster, from the Department of Justice, Hellen Tenney and Duncan Lee, from the Office of Strategic Services, and Joseph Greeg, coordinator of Inter-American Affairs 54 .

多亏了这些人和其他一些人，拉夫伦蒂·贝利亚甚至能够渗透到美国政府。他被告知了其中的秘密。

Thanks to these people, and a few others, Lavrenti Beria can infiltrate even the American government. He is informed of its secrets.

贝利亚在英国的主要间谍是两位有价值的英国人：盖伊·伯吉斯和唐纳德·麦克莱恩。当他们的面具被揭开后，贝利亚将组织他们逃往苏联。

Beria's main spies in England are two valuable Britons: Guy Burgess and Donald McLean. When they are unmasked, Beria will organize their escape to the USSR.

在西方的原子研究领域，贝利亚建立了一系列大规模的间谍链：他在美国拥有像意大利著名科学家布鲁诺·庞泰科尔沃一样重要的特工，贝利亚最终帮助他经法国避难到苏联。 1949 年和芬兰。贝利亚还设法从美国人中招募特工，例如朱利叶斯和埃塞尔·罗森伯格、哈里·戈尔德和大卫·格林格拉斯。在英国，其联络官是两名核研究人员，艾伦·纳恩·梅医生和克劳斯·福克斯医生。这些人只是贝利亚办公室在西欧、加拿大和美国建立的几个间谍团伙中的一小部分。但最重要的是，拉夫连季·贝利亚手下最有价值的间谍头子是愤世嫉俗的英国人哈罗德·“金”·菲尔比。这位共产主义特工成功成为英国情报部门负责人，负责打击苏联在美国的间谍活动，也是华盛顿中央情报局的组织者之一。从1945年上任到几年后成功逃往莫斯科，菲尔比向贝利亚提供了大量详细信息。

In the field of atomic research in the West, Beria set up a chain of large-scale spies: he had, in America, agents as important as the famous Italian scientist Bruno Pontecorvo, whom Beria would eventually help to take refuge in USSR via France and Finland in 1949. Beria also managed to recruit agents from among the Americans, for example Julius and Ethel Rosenberg, Harry Gold and David Greenglass. In England, its liaison officers are two nuclear researchers, doctors Allan Nunn May and Klaus Fuchs. These people are just a few of several spy rings spun by Beria's office across Western Europe, Canada and the United States. But above all, the most valuable of Lavrenty Beria's spymasters is a cynical Englishman, Harold "Kim" Philby. This communist agent succeeds in becoming head of the British intelligence service in charge of fighting against Soviet espionage in the United States and one of the organizers of the CIA (Central Intelligence Agency) in Washington. From taking charge in 1945 until his successful escape to Moscow a few years later, Philby provided Beria with a great deal of detailed information.

贝利亚将间谍网络扩展到海外的技巧使他能够向克里姆林宫提供有价值的信息，并使他成为斯大林不可替代的人。由于拉夫连季总是成功地完成交给他的任务，因为他不寻求公众关注，因为他在任何场合都夸大独裁者的形象，因为他总是让独裁者知道可能敌人的存在，所以斯大林比任何人都更信任贝利亚别的。结果，拉夫连季被要求安装特殊的安全网络来保护斯大林的隐私。

The art with which Beria extends his spy networks abroad allows him to provide the Kremlin with information of great value and makes him an irreplaceable man for Stalin. As Lavrenti always successfully accomplishes the missions entrusted to him, as he does not seek publicity and as he magnifies the person of the dictator on all occasions and as he always keeps him informed of the existence of possible enemies, Stalin more trust in Beria than anyone else. As a result, Lavrenti is asked to install a special security network to protect Stalin's privacy.

从斯大林召唤他到莫斯科担任内政委员的那一刻起，贝利亚就将他的间谍介绍给了领导人的直接随从。这些特工中就有亚历山德拉·纳卡奇泽（Alexandra Nakachidze），她是一名秘密警察少校级别的安全官员。她成为斯大林在克里姆林宫私人公寓的家庭教师。她是来自第比利斯附近村庄的格鲁吉亚人。在第比利斯工业学院学习一段时间后，她成为一名安全官员。亚历山德拉是一位迷人的年轻女子，黑发，中等身高，二十多岁。贝利亚让她成为他的情妇。当他被转移到莫斯科时，他带着她。

From the moment Stalin summoned him to Moscow to take up the post of Commissar of Internal Affairs, Beria introduced his spies into his leader's immediate entourage. Among these agents is a certain Alexandra Nakachidze, a security officer with the rank of major in the secret police. She became governess of Stalin's private apartments in the Kremlin. She is a Georgian from a village near Tiflis. After studying for some time at the Tbilisi Industrial Institute, she became a security officer. Alexandra is an attractive young woman, brunette, of average height, in her twenties. Beria made her his mistress. He took her with him when he was transferred to Moscow.

在斯大林家里，亚历山德拉·纳卡奇泽密切关注斯大林的个人生活、斯大林的孩子瓦西里和斯维特兰娜的朋友、信件和电话交谈，她搜查他们的个人物品，甚至检查他们的阅读书籍和学校笔记本。她还监视斯大林的其他随从，并将其报告给贝利亚，贝利亚随后可以利用这些信息。除了亚历山德拉·纳卡奇泽之外，贝利亚还任命伊万·克里文科、亚历山大·沃尔科夫和米哈伊尔·克里莫夫作为斯维特兰娜的看门狗。所有这些都告诉他斯大林家庭私生活的最小细节，并允许他完成他为个人使用而编制的文件。这些文件与他的潜在敌人有关，包括斯大林。

At Stalin's, Alexandra Nakachidze keeps an eye on Stalin's personal life, on the friends, letters and telephone conversations of Stalin's children, Vasily and Svetlana, whose personal belongings she searches, going so far as to examine their books of reading and their school notebooks. She also spies on Stalin's other familiars and reports them to Beria who can then make use of this information. Besides Alexandra Nakachidze, Beria places Ivan Krivenko, Alexander Volkov and Mikhail Klimov as Svetlana's watchdogs. All inform him down to the smallest details of the private life of Stalin's family and allow him to complete the files he compiles for his personal use. These files relate to his potential enemies, including Stalin.

三名特工和亚历山德拉·纳卡奇泽成功地完成了他们的使命，直到斯大林在斯维特兰娜结婚时消灭了他们。斯维特兰娜的第一任丈夫格里戈里·莫罗佐夫是犹太人。斯大林责备斯维特兰娜的家庭教师没有阻止她的女儿爱上犹太人。

The three agents and Alexandra Nakachidze fulfill their mission successfully until the day Stalin liquidates them, at the time of Svetlana's wedding. Svetlana's first husband, Grigori Morozov, is Jewish. Stalin reproaches Svetlana's governess for not having prevented her daughter from falling in love with a Jew.

失去线人并没有让贝利亚感到太大的困扰，因为从斯大林手中接过职责的人伊万·博罗达乔夫也是他的部下之一，苏雷特少校。在续集中，通过巧妙地利用斯大林对被叛徒和潜在刺客包围的挥之不去的恐惧，拉夫连蒂成功地监禁了独裁者最有价值的保镖尼古拉·弗拉西克将军，他不属于内务人民委员部，独立于贝利亚。取代他的是贝利亚的坚定支持者瓦西里·赫鲁斯塔列夫，后者成为斯大林私人卫队的负责人。

The loss of his informants does not trouble Beria much, because the person who takes over their duties from Stalin, Ivan Borodachev, is also one of his men, major of the Surete. In the sequel, by skillfully playing on Stalin's haunting fear of being surrounded by traitors and potential assassins, Lavrenty manages to imprison the dictator's most valued bodyguard, General Nikolai Vlasik who, not belonging not in the NKVD, is independent of Beria. He is replaced by a staunch supporter of Beria, Vasily Khrustalev, who becomes head of Stalin's personal guard.

意识到真正不可替代的人并不存在，特别是在苏联，拉夫连季决定，为了实现他的目标，即一有机会坐上老板的椅子，他必须清除任何构成政治障碍的人斯大林和他之间。他已经解雇了日丹诺夫和莫洛托夫。还有一些重要人物需要清除，例如独裁者的私人秘书和心腹波斯克列比切夫，或者卡冈诺维奇、米高扬、布尔加宁、马林科夫和赫鲁晓夫。

Aware of the fact that truly irreplaceable people do not exist, particularly in the Soviet Union, Lavrenty decides that in order to achieve his goal of sitting in the boss's chair at the first opportunity, he must remove anyone who constitutes a political obstacle between Stalin and him. He has already dismissed Zhdanov and Molotov. There are still a few important personalities to be eliminated, such as Poskrebychev, the dictator's private secretary and confidant, or like Kaganovitch, Mikoyan, Bulganin, Malenkov and Khrushchev.

当布尔加宁说在斯大林的招待会结束后，没有人知道他会在家里还是在监狱里结束这个夜晚时，布尔加宁知道他在说什么。然而，贝利亚还没有强大到可以自愿消灭这些人的程度。还是要看独裁者，最高的暴君。制定计划的是斯大林。贝利亚只能提出建议。这些建议的提出方式必须不会与作者背道而驰。熟练的卡冈诺维奇是犹太人，也是守旧派的布尔什维克。因此，从逻辑上讲，它是第一个目标。然而，他的妹妹罗莎是独裁者的情妇，只要斯大林将她纳入自己的床上，攻击她的兄弟就是糟糕的政策。米高扬也是一位布尔什维克的老卫士。但斯大林对这个谦虚、微笑的亚美尼亚人有一个弱点，他从不记得自己对革命运动的贡献。贝利亚明白，要削弱这个人的地位是很困难的。但阿纳斯塔斯·米高扬有一个弟弟，阿尔乔姆，比他小十岁。他是一位航空工程师，著名的米格战斗机的发明者。贝利亚决定首先策划针对阿尔乔姆，指控他叛国并在他在伦敦学习喷气技术时与英国情报部门有联系。拉夫伦蒂的计划还规定逮捕该装置的共同作者、著名数学家米哈伊尔·古列维奇。MIG 模型的名字来源于 Mikoyan 和 Gourevich。由于后者是犹太人，斯大林不会反对逮捕他。在狱中，古列维奇会承认所有罪行以及阿尔乔姆·米高扬的罪行。贝利亚知道如何进行调查。他甚至还吹嘘这一点。有一天，他心情好的时候，说道：“把一个人交给我二十四小时，我就让他承认自己是英国国王。55 . 阿尔乔姆·米高扬和古列维奇的被捕将削弱著名布尔什维克革命家阿纳斯塔斯·米高扬的地位。当莫洛托夫的妻子宝琳娜被监禁时，类似的阴谋对莫洛托夫来说非常成功。然而，贝利亚推迟了针对米高扬的计划的执行。

Bulganin knows what he is talking about when he says that after a reception at Stalin's, no one knows whether he will end the evening at home or in prison. Beria, however, is not yet powerful enough to liquidate these personalities of his own volition. It still depends on the dictator, the supreme despot. It was Stalin who drew up the plans. Beria can only make suggestions. And these suggestions must be presented in such a way that they do not turn against their author. The skilful Kaganovitch is a Jew and a Bolshevik of the old guard. It is therefore logically the first target. His sister Rosa, however, is the dictator's mistress and as long as Stalin accepts her into his bed, it would be bad policy to attack her brother. Mikoyan is also a Bolshevik of the old guard. But Stalin has a weakness for this modest and smiling Armenian who never recalls his contribution to the revolutionary movement. Beria understands that it would be difficult to undermine this man's position. But Anastase Mikoyan has a brother, Artem, ten years younger than him. He is an aeronautical engineer, inventor of the famous MIG fighter. Beria decides to first plot against Artem by accusing him of treason and contacts with British Intelligence when he was studying jet technology in London. Lavrenti's plan also provides for the arrest of the famous mathematician Mikhail Gourevich, co-author of the device. The MIG model takes its name from those of Mikoyan and Gourevich. As the latter is Jewish, Stalin would see no objection to his arrest. In prison, Gourevich would recognize all the crimes and those of Artem Mikoyan. Beria knows how to conduct an investigation. He even brags about it. One day when he was in a good mood, he said: "Give someone to me for twenty-four hours and I will make him confess that he is the King of England.55 . The arrest of Artem Mikoyan and Gourevich would weaken the position of the famous Bolshevik revolutionary Anastas Mikoyan. A similar intrigue succeeded perfectly against Molotov when his wife Paulina was imprisoned. Beria, however, postpones the execution of his plan against Mikoyan.

布尔加宁已经知道会发生什么。因此它会保持在原位并且不会造成任何问题。赫鲁晓夫也被贝利亚视为小人物，他更喜欢首先击败那些构成重大威胁的人。对拉夫连季来说最危险的人可能是比贝利亚年轻的马林科夫。马林科夫是一位一丝不苟、顺从且谨慎的工人。他在红军军官中很受欢迎，是伏罗希洛夫元帅的私人朋友。贝利亚对苏联士兵对他的蔑视不抱任何幻想。他知道他们有理由恨他。是贝利亚，而不是其他人，将秘密警察部队安排在苏联步兵后面，向任何试图后退的人开枪。贝利亚创造了SMERCH，这个单位决定所有陆军、海军和空军军官的命运。是贝利亚把他的每个团、每个驻军、每个排都有政治间谍——向导和政治间谍。正是贝利亚向斯大林建议逮捕并驱逐二战期间被俘的苏联士兵和军官的家属，并提议没收他们的全部财产。贝利亚为自己的内务人民委员部部队配备了最好的制服、最好的食物、最好的住宿，并给予他们其他特权，尽管他们并不是在现场作战。正是贝利亚，而不是国家国防委员会政治局委员中的其他人，公开表现出对正规军军官的蔑视，让他们知道他只是对他们的智力评价不高。

Bulganin already knows what to expect. So it stays in place and doesn't cause any problems. Khrushchev is also seen as small fry by Beria who prefers to defeat people who pose a significant threat first. The most dangerous man for Lavrenti could be Malenkov who is younger than Beria. Malenkov is a scrupulous worker, submissive and discreet. His popularity is great among Red Army officers and he is Marshal Voroshilov's personal friend. Beria has no illusions about the contempt that the soldiers of the Soviet forces have for him. He knows they have reason to hate him. It was Beria, and no one else, who placed secret police troops behind the Soviet infantry to shoot anyone who tried to take a step back. It was Beria who created the SMERCH, the unit that decides the fate of all officers of the land, naval and air forces. It was Beria who placed hispolitrouks – guides and political spies – in every regiment, every garrison, every platoon. It was Beria who suggested to Stalin that he arrest and deport the families of Soviet soldiers and officers taken prisoner during World War II, and who proposed the confiscation of all their property. It was Beria who outfitted his own NKVD forces with the best uniforms, the best food, the best lodgings, and granted them other privileges despite the fact that they did not fight on the spot. battle. And it is Beria, and no one else among the Politburo members of the State Committee for Defense, who openly displays contempt for regular army officers, letting them know that he only has a low opinion of their intelligence.

拉夫连季·贝利亚知道苏联军队对他的敌对态度，但他以安全部队总司令的身份，配备了大炮、坦克和飞机，并在红军各部队中拥有特工。他确信自己总是能及时获知任何针对他的敌意行动，并能够控制局势。贝利亚不仅足够强大，而且对于独裁者来说太必要了，不能被他镇压。贝利亚出版了新的《共产党史》，他在书中表明，在十月革命期间，与斯大林相比，列宁几乎扮演了次要的角色。贝利亚收集了斯大林的著作并准备出版。

Lavrenty Beria is aware of the hostile attitude of the Soviet army towards him, but in his capacity as commander-in-chief of the security forces, equipped with artillery, tanks and planes, and possessing agents in all units of the Red Army, he is certain of always being informed in good time of any movement of hostility towards him and of being able to control the situation. Not only is Beria powerful enough, he is too necessary to the dictator to be suppressed by him. It was Beria who published the new History of the Communist Party in which he showed that during the October Revolution Lenin had played an almost secondary role in comparison with that of Stalin. It was Beria who collected Stalin's works and prepared them for publication.

拉夫连季的计算只有一个弱点。他没有注意到斯大林充分意识到，使他成为英雄的党史的伪造是贝利亚的杰作。这个辉煌过去的发明者，充满了独裁者从未完成的功绩，成为神秘化的危险见证者，从而使自己面临被清算的危险。

There is only one weak point in Lavrenti's calculations. He pays no heed to the fact that Stalin is fully aware that the falsifications of Party history which turn him into a hero are the work of Beria. The inventor of this magnificent past, filled with exploits that the dictator has never accomplished, becomes a dangerous witness to the mystification and, thereby, exposes himself to the dangers of liquidation.

评级

Ratings

54 . James Burnham，《颠覆之网：美国政府的地下网络》，纽约，1959 年。另请参阅 David J. DALLIN，《苏联间谍活动》，纽黑文，1955 年；以及 Ronald SETH，《揭露 ！》纽约，1965 年。

54 . James Burnham, The Web of Subversion: Underground Networks in the US Government , New York, 1959. See also David J. DALLIN, Soviet Espionage , New Haven, 1955, and Ronald SETH, Unmasked  ! New York, 1965.

55 . 赫鲁晓夫，尼基塔，《纪念品》，巴黎，1971 年。

55 . Khrushchev, Nikita, Souvenirs , Paris, 1971.

第46章

Chapter 46

最后一次谈话

The last conversation

贝利亚的主要政府职责是斯大林指定给他作为优先事项的原子研究计划。除此工作外，他还担任苏联元帅、部长会议第一副主席、中央委员会主席团成员和内务部长（MVD）等职务。在这些义务的重压下，贝利亚将国家安全部（MGB）负责人的职责委托给了他最信任的人之一：弗谢沃洛德·梅尔库洛夫（Vsevolod Merkulov）。

Beria's main governmental responsibility is the atomic research program that Stalin assigned to him as the priority of priorities. In addition to this work, he has other functions as Marshal of the Soviet Union, First Deputy Chairman of the Council of Ministers, member of the Central Committee Presidium and Minister of Internal Affairs (MVD). Under the weight of these obligations, Beria delegated his responsibilities as head of the Ministry of State Security (MGB) to one of his trusted men: Vsevolod Merkulov.

这位身材矮胖、肤色黝黑的男子，在贝利亚的支持下晋升为将军，随后将被派往国外，他的职位将委托给维克多·阿巴库莫夫，他的职业生涯也取决于内务部长，贝利亚也可以依靠。有信心。

This stocky, dark man, who holds the rank of general thanks to Beria's support, will later be sent abroad and his post will be entrusted to Victor Abakumov, whose career also depends on the Minister of Internal Affairs and on whom Beria can also rely on with confidence.

独裁者认为原子武器的发展非常重要，因此他要求每周提交报告。战争已经结束五年多了，但事情的进展就像斯大林大同志渴望得到最致命的武器一样。独裁者的随从们对这种获得炸弹的焦虑感到好奇：斯大林会毫不犹豫地挑起一场针对对新的大屠杀毫无准备的自由世界的战争吗？然而，原子研究的进展并不像斯大林希望的那么快，贝利亚面临着成为上级不耐烦的牺牲品的危险。

The development of the atomic weapon is considered of such importance by the dictator that he asks for weekly reports. The war has been over for more than five years, but things are going as if big comrade Stalin is eager to get the deadliest of weapons. The dictator's entourage wonders about this anxiety to obtain the bomb: would Stalin not hesitate to provoke a war against the free world which is as unprepared as possible for a new holocaust? Progress in atomic research, however, was not as rapid as Stalin wanted, and Beria was in danger of falling victim to his superior's impatience.

多年来，特别是自他七十岁生日以来，斯大林变得越来越痴迷于暗杀，刺杀者可能是他最亲密的同事之一。怕中毒，只在Blijni吃饭，他在孔塞沃的郊区住所。但即便如此，尽管饭菜是由他的老厨师马特里奥娜·彼得罗夫娜准备的，由一位既忠诚又忠诚的老仆人、家庭教师瓦伦蒂娜·伊斯托米娜“瓦列奇卡”服务，斯大林还是希望每道菜、每片面包都是第一位的。由医生检查。接受这一使命的是迪亚科夫医生等最值得信赖的医生，而多年来关注独裁者健康状况的医生则是著名的弗拉基米尔·维诺格拉多夫医生。

Over the years, especially since his seventieth birthday, Stalin became increasingly obsessed with assassination, perhaps by one of his closest associates. Afraid of being poisoned, he only eats at Blijni, his suburban residence in Kounsevo. But even then, despite the fact that the meals were prepared by his old cook Matriona Petrovna, served by an old servant, the governess Valentina Istomina "Valechka", both faithful and devoted, Stalin wanted every dish and that each piece of bread be first examined by a doctor. It is the most trustworthy doctors, such as Doctor Diakov, who receive this mission, while the practitioner who has watched over the health of the dictator for years is the famous Doctor Vladimir Vinogradov.

这些医生以及测试斯大林食物和撰写报告的毒物专家，在安全局特工的持续监视下工作，这些特工仔细审查他们私生活的各个方面。由于这项调查工作交由内务部长负责，贝利亚得出的明显结论是，大老板并没有对他失去信心。

These doctors, as well as the poison specialists who test Stalin's food and who write the reports, work under the constant surveillance of special agents of the Sûreté who carefully scrutinize all facets of their private lives. As this investigative work is left in the hands of the Minister of Internal Affairs, Beria draws the obvious conclusion that the big boss has not lost confidence in him.

然而，独裁者所表现出的偏执症状正在取得惊人的进展。显然，斯大林将不得不让位给一个精神健全的人。这位继任者无疑将属于年轻一代，而不是以旧世界衰落为标志的布尔什维克老卫士。所以将会是赫鲁晓夫、马林科夫或贝利亚。谁跑得最快、最不顾忌、准备最充分，谁就能赢得比赛。拉夫伦蒂是一位娴熟的战略家。他非常了解政治局同仁的思想和国民的心理。

The paranoid symptoms exhibited by the dictator, however, are making alarming progress. It is clear that Stalin will have to give way to a mentally sound man. This successor will undoubtedly belong to the younger generation rather than to the old guard of the Bolsheviks marked by the decline of the old world. So it will be Khrushchev or Malenkov or Beria. Whoever is the fastest, the least scrupulous and the best prepared will win the race. Lavrenti is a skilful strategist. He is well acquainted with the thoughts of his colleagues in the Politburo and the psychology of the nation.

作为一位经验丰富的政治家，贝利亚知道夺取权力本身并不是目的。接替克里姆林宫独裁者的人必须以一个计划开始他的统治，这是一个现成的计划，不仅会引起该国的关注，而且会引起外界的关注。

As an experienced statesman, Beria knows that seizing power is not an end in itself. The man who will take the place of the dictator in the Kremlin will have to begin his reign with a programme, a ready-made project which will capture the attention not only of the country, but also of the outside world.

贝利亚制定的计划涉及工业、农业和外交政策问题。对于国内市场，贝利亚毫不怀疑劳教所里被关押者生产的商品将不再能够作为长期供应国家的基础。这个国家需要比难民营里经营的更多的车间和工厂。他建议减少重工业、武器和战争物资的生产，转而发展轻工业和糖、肥皂或纸张等日常消费品。在这一领域，必须在一定程度上允许私人主动性。即使回归新经济政策又有什么关系呢？至少，在新经济政策时期，

The plan that Beria draws up deals with problems of industry, agriculture and foreign policy. For the domestic market, Beria has no doubt that the goods produced by the detainees of the forced labor camps will no longer be able to serve as the basis for supplying the country for long. The nation needs more workshops and factories than those operating in the camps. He proposes to reduce the production of heavy industry, arms and war material in favor of light industry and daily consumer goods such as sugar, soap or paper. In this area, private initiative must be permitted to some extent. Even if it is a return to the NEP, what does it matter? At least, at the time of the NEP,

至于农产品市场，贝利亚决定做点什么来改变那里的悲惨现状。令人遗憾的是，俄罗斯这个有着农业传统、拥有最好土地的国家却面临面包问题，被迫从国外进口小麦，以换取劳改营中受剥削的奴隶生产的木材和矿物。

As for the agricultural market, Beria decides to do something to change the deplorable situation that prevails there. It is a shame that Russia, a country with an agricultural tradition, endowed with the best land, has a bread problem and is forced to import wheat from abroad in exchange for wood and minerals produced by the slaves exploited in labor camps.

集体农场的农民定期交付一定数量小麦的义务只不过是一种要求。这是最残酷的之一，因为如果集体农场中缺乏规定的数量，经理和一些工人就会被逮捕并流放到西伯利亚。这种方法也必须改变。俄罗斯农民从来没有习惯集体农庄和国营农场的制度，这是斯大林通过武力强加的，通过处决富农、富裕农民和清算私人庄园，使村民们的土地被掠夺，成千上万的人被饿死。

The obligation of periodical deliveries of a certain quantity of wheat by the peasants of the collective farms is nothing other than a requisition. And one of the most brutal, because if, in a collective farm, the prescribed quantity is lacking, the manager and some workers are arrested and exiled to Siberia. This method too must change. Russian peasants never got used to the system of collective farms and state farms, which Stalin imposed by force by having the kulaks , the well-to-do peasants, executed and by liquidating the private estates so that the villagers, despoiled of their lands, died by the thousands of starvation.

很久以后，第二次世界大战后，在集体农庄制度引发的另一场粮食危机中，对农业一无所知的年迈的斯大林决定采用一种新的想法。他将集体农场与国营农场合并，并将它们统一成大型“农业城镇”，类似于小麦工厂，而不是农村定居点。这个项目将使苏联的粮食状况比现有的系统更加严重，尽管它本来就很贫穷。这个计划的作者是尼基塔·赫鲁晓夫，尽管他本人是乌克兰农民，并且充分意识到他的想法会给苏联农业带来灾难，但他提出这个计划是为了取悦斯大林。

Much later, after the Second World War, during another food crisis caused by the system of collective farms, the aging Stalin, who knew nothing about agriculture, decided to apply a new idea. He merged the collective farms with the state farms and united them into large "agro-towns", sorts of wheat factories rather than rural settlements. This project was to make the food situation in the Soviet Union even more serious than the system already in place, poor as it was. The author of this program was Nikita Khrushchev who, although himself a Ukrainian peasant and fully aware of the disaster his idea would entail for Soviet agriculture, had proposed this project to please Stalin.

贝利亚决定停止实施这一农业城镇计划和集体农庄合并计划的任何尝试并减轻集体农场制度的影响。他还推算，如果苏联真要从农业国家迈向工业国家，其生产不再依赖集中营里的劳动，就必须有足够的面包来养活城市里的工人。 .. 如果必须将小麦换成外国机器，则交易不得以牺牲人民利益为代价，就像斯大林政权下的情况一样。最后，并非最不重要的是，在苏联还存在一个不可或缺的阶级，它什么也不生产，但必须比其他任何阶级都得到更好的喂养：这些部门是秘密警察部门、民兵部门和警察部门。红军。解决粮食和农业问题是主要目标。贝利亚建议通过诉诸斯大林前的方法，即新经济政策，并根据战后形势进行一些必要的调整来实现这一目标。

Beria decides to stop any attempt to implement this program of agricultural towns and the incorporation of kolkhozesand to mitigate the system of collective farms. He also calculates that if the Soviet Union is really to move from the stage of an agricultural country to that of an industrial nation whose production would no longer be based on labor in the camps, there must be enough bread to feed the workers in the cities. . And if it has to exchange its wheat for foreign machines, the transactions must not be made at the expense of the population, as is the case under the Stalin regime. And finally, which is not the least important, there also exists in the Soviet Union an indispensable class which produces nothing at all, but which must be fed much better than any other: these are the divisions of the Police secret, the Militia and the Red Army. The solution of food and agricultural problems is the main objective. Beria proposes to achieve it by resorting to pre-Stalin methods, those of the NEP, with some adaptations made necessary by the post-war situation.

贝利亚对外交政策也有完全个人的看法。首先，他要尽快放弃斯大林成为最强国的狂热，配备能够讹诈自由世界、不费一枪一弹就能迫使其投降的原子武器库。相反，克里姆林宫统治的候选人拉夫连蒂·贝利亚希望与西方国家保持良好关系，这些国家将由自己的共产党从内部逐步按照共产主义模式重建。这些将执行指令并接受苏联的援助，就像巴黎的法国共产党和罗马的意大利共产党——苏联以外世界上最大的共产党——或者像美国的美国共产主义团体。贝利亚的这个项目已经开始接受申请。他派往国外的特工，包括美国、英国或其他西方国家，使他能够秘密执行一些初步步骤。贝利亚的特使以“改善与西方的关系”的口号接近华盛顿和伦敦最有影响力的负责人。贝利亚在国外的“居民”包括弗拉基米尔·彼得罗夫（真名乔罗霍夫）和他的妻子叶夫多基亚（Evdokia），她在苏联驻悉尼大使馆工作，化名“塔玛拉”。苏联驻东京使团第二秘书兼内务人民委员部上校伊乌里·拉斯托罗夫（Iouri Rastorov）、苏联驻维也纳大使馆“常驻者”彼得·德里亚宾（Piotr Deriabin）以及驻德国的尼古拉·霍赫洛夫（Nikolai Khokhlov）。后来，贝利亚垮台后，这些人拒绝返回莫斯科，在那里他们将被逮捕并处决。弗拉基米尔·彼得罗夫和叶夫多基亚·彼得罗夫将在澳大利亚寻求庇护，拉斯托罗夫将在日本寻求庇护，德里宾将在奥地利寻求庇护，霍赫洛夫将在西柏林寻求庇护。

Beria also has an entirely personal perspective on foreign policy. First of all, he wants to give up Stalin's mania for becoming the greatest power as soon as possible, equipped with an arsenal of atomic weapons capable of blackmailing the free world and forcing it to surrender without firing a single shot. On the contrary, Lavrenti Beria, a candidate for the domination of the Kremlin, would like to maintain good relations with the Western countries which would be gradually rebuilt on the communist model, from within, by their own communist parties. These would carry out instructions and receive aid from the Soviet Union, like the French Communist Party in Paris and the Italian Communist Party in Rome – the largest Communist Party in the world outside that of the Soviet Union – or like the American Communist Group in the United States. This project of Beria has already received a beginning of application. The agents he sent abroad, to the United States as well as to Great Britain or other Western countries, enabled him to secretly carry out some preliminary steps. Beria's emissaries approach the most influential responsible figures in Washington and London with the slogan "Better relations with the West". Among Beria's "residents" abroad are Vladimir Petrov, whose real name is Chorokhov, and his wife Evdokia, who works under the name "Tamara" at the Soviet Embassy in Sydney, Iouri Rastorov, second secretary of the Soviet mission in Tokyo and also colonel of the NKVD, Piotr Deriabin, "resident" of the Soviet embassy in Vienna, and Nikolai Khokhlov in Germany. Later, after the fall of Beria, these people refused to return to Moscow where they would be arrested and executed. Vladimir and Evdokia Petrov will ask for asylum in Australia, Rastorov in Japan, Deriabine in Austria and Khokhlov will take refuge in West Berlin.

贝利亚还打算与铁托恢复关系。他反对斯大林主义对乌克兰、乌兹别克斯坦、塔吉克斯坦、哈萨克斯坦等非俄罗斯国家和共和国进行俄罗斯化的政策。

Beria also intends to renew relations with Tito. He opposes the Stalinist policy of Russification of non-Russian nations and republics such as Ukraine, Uzbekistan, Tajikistan, Kazakstan and others.

当然，1951年制定的这些计划的实现必须等待独裁者去世，以及权力竞赛的胜利者拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇穿上这位伟大同志的靴子的那一刻。斯大林今年七十二岁了。他撑不了多久了。如果他尽管年事已高，仍能保持非凡的活力和巨大的能量，我们总能帮助大自然将他带回怀抱。如果列宁的存在可以被他的弟子斯大林缩短，为什么他的弟子贝利亚不能为斯大林保留同样的命运呢？

Of course, the realization of these projects formulated in 1951 must await the death of the dictator and the moment when Lavrenti Pavlovich, winner of the race for power, will put on the boots of the great comrade. Stalin is seventy-two years old. He won't last much longer. And if, despite his age, he retains his extraordinary vitality and prodigious energy, we can always help mother nature to bring him back to her bosom. If Lenin's existence could be cut short by his disciple Stalin, why shouldn't the same fate be reserved for Stalin by his disciple Beria?

但与此同时，必须继续扮演忠诚下属的角色。1951年11月6日，十月革命三十四周年纪念日，拉夫连季·贝利亚元帅发表讲话。《真理报》发表了这篇长篇偶像崇拜文章，并被全国其他报纸转载，它告诉苏联各地数百万人，在整个普遍历史中，没有比“人类的杰出天才、和平旗手”更伟大的人物了。伟大的领袖和教育家：约瑟夫·维萨里奥诺维奇·斯大林”。

In the meantime, however, one must continue to play the role of loyal subordinate. During the thirty-fourth anniversary of the October Revolution, on November 6, 1951, Marshal Lavrenty Beria gave a speech. This long piece of idolatry, published by Pravda and picked up by other newspapers across the country, teaches millions throughout the Soviet Union that in all of universal history there is no greater personality than "the brilliant genius of humanity, the standard-bearer of peace, the great leader and educator: Joseph Vissarionovitch Stalin".

为了讨好老板，贝利亚在演讲中穿插了大量的反美反英言论，并打出“美利坚合众国是帝国主义阵营的首领，是所有侵略者和所有国家的吸引力中心”的口号。世界反动派试图发动新的战争，意图掠夺和奴役其他人民”，“美利坚合众国正在坚持不懈地试图将联合国变成战争工具”，并且英国撒克逊集团走上了准备和发动新战争的道路。

To please the boss, Beria interspersed his speech with numerous anti-American and anti-British traits, and with slogans affirming that "the United States of America is at the head of the imperialist camp, the center of attraction for all aggressors and of all the reactionaries of the world trying to unleash a new war with the intention of plundering and enslaving other peoples", that "the United States of America is trying with perseverance to transform the United Nations into an instrument of war", and that the Anglo-Saxon bloc has taken the road of preparing for and unleashing a new war.

然而，没有什么能让独裁者完全满意。大老板对他的内务部长表现出坏幽默的第一个迹象是，内务部长在原子研究计划中表现得不够有效，就是罢免了贝利亚人阿巴库莫夫的国务部长职务。安全并任命谢苗·杰尼索维奇·伊格纳季耶夫 (Semion Denisovitch Ignatiev) 担任这些职务，他自 1926 年以来一直是党员，也是斯大林在白俄罗斯、乌兹别克斯坦和蒙古的得力助手。通过这一任命，国家安全部长自贝利亚离开第比利斯以来首次成为内务部的独立官员。

However, nothing can entirely satisfy the dictator. The first sign of bad humor from the big boss against his Minister of Internal Affairs, who is not proving sufficiently effective in the atomic research program, is the ousting of a man from Beria, Abakumov, from the post of head of the Ministry of State Security and the appointment to these functions of Semion Denisovitch Ignatiev, a member of the Party since 1926 and Stalin's right-hand man in Belarus, Uzbekistan and Mongolia. With this appointment, the Head of State Security becomes, for the first time since Beria left Tiflis, an independent official of the Ministry of Internal Affairs.

谢米恩·伊格纳季耶夫（Semion Ignatiev）是一位从不微笑的狂热分子，秃顶，颧骨像亚洲人一样突出，是一位经验丰富的布尔什维克。他很容易理解，他的提名即使不是冷落，也是对贝利亚的一种警告。作为以已故日丹诺夫为代表的路线的支持者，他是贝利亚的不共戴天的敌人。我们可以预见，伊格纳季耶夫的出现将标志着新一轮的清洗浪潮。伊格纳季耶夫的任命很容易被解读为拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇终结的开始。

Semion Ignatiev, a fanatic who never smiles, with a bald head and cheekbones as prominent as those of an Asian, is an experienced Bolshevik. He easily understands that his nomination constitutes a kind of warning for Beria, if not a snub. As a supporter of the line represented by the late Zhdanov, he is an implacable enemy of Beria. We can predict that the appearance on the scene of Ignatiev will mark a new wave of purges. Ignatiev's appointment can easily be interpreted as the beginning of the end of Lavrenti Pavlovich.

攻击贝利亚阵地的第一个目标是捷克斯洛伐克。所有关键职位都掌握在贝利亚同事手中。贝利亚坚信能够依靠他的团队，他将这个小而顽强的国家视为他的个人堡垒。在扬·马萨里克被暗杀和贝内斯总统去世后，贝利亚通过他的捷克斯洛伐克秘密警察和由他的爪牙组成的傀儡政府统治了这个高度文明和工业化的国家。

The first target in the attack on Beria's positions is Czechoslovakia. All the key positions there are in the hands of Beria associates. Convinced of being able to rely on his team, Beria considers this small but tenacious country as his personal fortress. After the assassination of Jan Masaryk and the death of President Benes, Beria ruled this highly civilized and industrialized nation through his men of the Czechoslovakian secret police and a puppet government made up of his minions.

伊格纳季耶夫一就任安全局长，就对贝利亚堡垒发起了进攻。突然的逮捕浪潮席卷了布拉格的苏联机构，在贝利亚的命令下，捷克斯洛伐克的高级秘密警察也被逮捕。这次清洗的主要受害者是苏联内务部长的同谋。这些官员以间谍、破坏、偏离和叛国罪为借口被捕，但由于他们是贝利亚人，因此指控间接针对他们的老板。一个引人注目的事实标志着这一行动。几乎所有被捕的警官，甚至包括鲁道夫·斯兰斯基（真名扎尔兹曼）这样的领导人，以及他的同伙贝德里奇·杰明德、鲁道夫·马戈利乌斯、安德烈·西蒙、阿图尔·伦敦和其他九名贝利亚门徒，都是犹太人。

As soon as he was installed as head of the Security, Ignatiev struck a blow at the Beria bastion. A sudden wave of arrests overwhelmed the Soviet apparatus in Prague, reaching senior Czechoslovak secret police officers under Beria's orders. The main victims of this purge are the accomplices of the Soviet Minister of Internal Affairs. These officials are arrested on the pretext of espionage, sabotage, deviation and high treason, but, as they are men of Beria, the accusation indirectly targets their boss. A striking fact marks this action. Almost all of the officers arrested, even leaders like Rudolph Slansky, whose real name is Zaltzman, and his associates Bedrich Geminder, Rudolph Margolius, André Simone, Artur London, and nine other Beria proteges are Jewish.

审讯的方式使得被告不知道真正的酷刑者是谁。这个策略让他们陷入被抛弃的感觉。他们相信他们的保护者拉夫伦蒂·贝利亚背叛了他们，并将他们目前所遭受的磨难归咎于他。

The interrogations are conducted in such a way that the accused do not know who their real torturer is. This stratagem plunges them into a feeling of abandonment. They believe that their protector Lavrenti Beria has betrayed them and they blame him for their present ordeals.

新的清洗运动散发出明显的反犹太主义气味。它显然是斯大林设计的。执行伟大独裁者命令的政委伊格纳季耶夫太强大了，贝利亚无法消灭他。

The new purge spreads a distinctly anti-Semitic scent. It was obviously engineered by Stalin. Commissar Ignatiev, executing the orders of the great dictator, is too strong for Beria to liquidate him.

然而，拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇仍然拥有足够的权力，不会感到受到一个简单的安全局长的威胁。他已经习惯了危险的处境。他总是设法控制他们。在这种情况下，最好的策略是保持沉默，观察和等待，然后猛烈而快速地出击。

However, Lavrenti Pavlovich remains powerful enough not to feel threatened by a simple chief of the Security. He is used to dangerous situations. He always managed to control them. The best strategy in such cases is to remain silent, watch and wait, then strike hard and fast.

但现在情况很严重。没过多久，贝利亚的另一边脸颊就挨了一击。在第一次逮捕捷克领导人的同时，伊格纳季耶夫领导了对贝利亚的另一个城堡的袭击：他的祖国格鲁吉亚。伊格纳季耶夫下令逮捕格鲁吉亚共产党第一书记科特·查尔克维亚尼。贝利亚让他担任这个职位，自 1939 年以来他一直担任这个职位。他是他在第比利斯最亲密、最忠诚的合作者之一。查克维亚尼还控制着白人秘密警察。晚上，他在从办公室回家的路上被绑架，之后被关在这里。

But now the situation is serious. Beria does not take long to receive a blow on the other cheek. At the same time as the first arrests of Czech leaders, Ignatiev leads an attack against another citadel of Beria: his native Georgia. Ignatiev orders the arrest of the first secretary of the Georgian Communist Party, Koté Tcharkviani. Beria had placed him in this position, which he had held since 1939. He was one of his closest and most devoted collaborators in Tiflis. Tcharkviani also controlled the Caucasian secret police. Here he is locked up after being kidnapped at night on the way back from his office to his home.

这一事件在格鲁吉亚引发了一场新的行动，这次是针对居住在格鲁吉亚西部地区黑海沿岸的明格里安人。斯大林虽然自己是格鲁吉亚人，但只要能达到他的目的，他就不愿意屠杀他的同胞。多年前，他曾劝诫同胞们用热熨斗拔除杂草，当时还是年轻学徒的贝利亚致力于将这些话转化为行动。现在斯大林再次使用同样的过程。新任安全局局长捏造了明格勒利安人的民族主义阴谋：一项在查尔克维亚尼领导下的格鲁吉亚起义的虚构计划。叛乱的最终目标是脱离苏联并与资本主义土耳其结盟。明显地，整个“明格勒阴谋”本质上是针对贝利亚及其格鲁吉亚支持者的。这是安全局局长伊格纳季耶夫的发明，就像“列宁格勒事件”是贝利亚针对日丹诺夫的发明一样。

This event sets in motion a new action in Georgia, this time against the Mingrelian people who inhabit the western region of Georgia, on the shores of the Black Sea. Stalin, although he himself was a Georgian, did not care to decimate his compatriots if it served his purposes. Years earlier, he had exhorted his compatriots to uproot weeds with a hot iron, and Beria, then a young apprentice, had applied himself to translating these words into deeds. Now Stalin is using the same process again. The new head of the Sûreté fabricates a nationalist conspiracy of the Mingrelians: an imaginary plan for the uprising of Georgia under the leadership of Tcharkviani. The ultimate goal of the rebellion would be secession from the Soviet Union and alliance with capitalist Turkey. Obviously, the whole “Mingrelian plot” is essentially directed against Beria and his Georgian supporters. It is an invention of the head of the Security, Ignatiev, just as the "Leningrad affair" was an invention of Beria directed against Zhdanov.

贝利亚在格鲁吉亚安全部门有自己的人脉，其中最主要的就是查尔克维亚尼。明热利安人或任何其他高加索部落不会发生起义。但贝利亚的祖国，即他掌权的国家，是他最强大的堡垒，是他小小的个人领地，在某种程度上，他的直属下属几乎享有完全的行动自由。贝利亚的助手以独立领主的身份进行统治。斯大林不能容忍这种自由。如果他的攻击是针对明热利安人，而排除任何其他民族，那是因为他们以爱国情怀和对自由的热爱而闻名。因此，他们受到的指控是可能的，甚至是可能的。此外，重要的是贝利亚本人就是明热利安人，而他的母亲出生在 Merkheouli 村附近一个叫 Ouria Sopeli 的地方，人口主要是犹太人，可能有一半犹太人血统。因此，拉夫伦蒂的血管里可能流淌着犹太血统。

Beria has his own creatures in Georgian Security, the main one being Tcharkviani. No uprising of the Mingrelians or any other Caucasian tribe can occur. But Beria's homeland, the country from which he came to power, is his most powerful bastion, his small personal fiefdom in a way, in which his immediate subordinates enjoy almost total freedom of action. Beria's aides rule as independent lords. Stalin cannot tolerate such freedom. If his attack is against the Mingrelians, to the exclusion of any other people, it is because they are known for their patriotic feelings and for their love of freedom. The accusation which strikes them is therefore probable and even probable. Furthermore, it is significant that Beria is Mingrelian himself, while his mother, born near the village of Merkheouli in a locality called Ouria Sopeli and largely populated by Jews, could be half-Jewish. Lavrenti, therefore, might have a bit of Jewish blood in his veins.

这又是一块石头砸向他​​了。这两项打击，一项针对捷克斯洛伐克的犹太人，另一项针对高加索地区的明格勒人，可能会打倒拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇·贝利亚。

This is another stone being thrown at him. Together, these two blows, one directed against the Jews of Czechoslovakia, the other against the Mingrelians of the Caucasus, could bring down Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria.

安全局的新任负责人工作很有耐心。贝利亚仍然是苏联元帅、原子研究负责人以及历史上最大间谍网络的主人。他还是苏联内务部长和 GOULAG（构成苏联工业主要动力的劳改营管理机构）的最高官员。而且他还是政治局委员。换句话说，拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚不仅在名义上，而且在事实上甚至可能比斯大林更强大。为了苏联的利益，不能贸然清算。它的坠落必须是逐渐地、几乎是不知不觉地准备好的。

The new head of the Sûreté works with patience. Beria is still Marshal of the USSR, head of atomic research and master of the largest spy network in history. He is also Soviet Minister of Internal Affairs and the highest official of the GOULAG, the administration of the labor camps which constitute the mainspring of Soviet industry. And he's still a member of the Politburo. In other words, Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria is, not only in title, but also in fact, perhaps even more powerful than Stalin. For the sake of the Soviet Union, it cannot be liquidated abruptly. Its fall must be prepared gradually, almost imperceptibly.

在格鲁吉亚共产党第一书记被捕并清算所谓的明格勒民族主义组织之后，第比利斯的清洗行动需要几个月的时间。在此期间，伊格纳季耶夫逮捕了最忠于贝利亚的官员，如格鲁吉亚中央委员会第二书记巴拉米亚、格鲁吉亚共和国总检察长BI乔尼亚、格鲁吉亚司法部长AM拉帕瓦和领导人格鲁吉亚共青团成员佐德拉瓦，以及几名当地高级秘密警察和许多其他属于“贝里亚帮”的人。

The purge of Tbilisi, which follows the arrest of the first secretary of the Georgian Communist Party and the liquidation of the so-called Mingrelian nationalist organization, takes several months. During this period, Ignatiev arrested officials most devoted to Beria, such as the second secretary of the Central Committee of Georgia, IM Baramiya, the prosecutor general of the republic of Georgia, BI Choniya, the Georgian Minister of Justice, AM Rapava and the leader of the Georgian Communist Youth League, Zodelava, as well as several senior local secret police officers and many others who belonged to the “Beria gang”.

除此之外，还有数百名无辜者被捕。然而，他们对莫斯科的政治不感兴趣。他们唯一的缺点是成为真正的爱国者并深深热爱他们阳光明媚的家园：高加索地区。

Besides these, hundreds of innocent people are arrested. However, they are not interested in the politics of Moscow. Their only fault is to be authentic patriots and to deeply love their sunny homeland: the Caucasus.

伊格纳季耶夫反对贝利亚转眼间制造并清算“列宁格勒事件”的做法，将明格勒问题拖了六个多月。然而，在格鲁吉亚，逮捕的人数多于处决的人数，一些囚犯在被拘留几个月后被释放，甚至恢复了以前的职能。

Ignatiev, in opposition to Beria's method, which set up and liquidated the "Leningrad affair" in the twinkling of an eye, dragged out the Mingrelian problem for more than six months. However, in Georgia, there are more arrests than executions and after a few months of detention, some of the prisoners are released and even restored to their former functions.

拉夫连蒂·贝利亚很狡猾，从中看到了他在格鲁吉亚的“团伙”面临考验的迹象。既然这件事是在他没有亲自干预的情况下发生的，那么这一定是斯大林设下的陷阱。尽管如此，仍然担任内政部长的贝利亚是可以支持他的内务人民委员部部队的总司令。拉夫连季可以信赖他的军官们。他们会支持他，不是因为他们忠于他们的领袖，而是因为他们知道，当贝利亚陷落时，他的数百名部下将被处决，而数千人将被送往西伯利亚。最重要的是，贝利亚觉得他的结局还不是现在。只要他是斯大林渴望看到成果的原子发展计划的监督者，只要他掌控着间谍网络，我们就会留住他。但如果他的势力一点一点崩溃，失去高位也只是时间问题。作为精明的政治家，贝利亚认为斯大林的新策略可能会在一夜之间改变方向。为了生存，他必须迅速采取行动。

Lavrenty Beria is cunning enough to see in this the sign of a test for his "gang" in Georgia. As this happened without his personal intervention, it must be a trap set by Stalin. Be that as it may, Beria, who remains interior minister, is the commander-in-chief of the NKVD forces that can support him. Lavrenti can count on his officers. They will support him, not because they are devoted to their leader, but because they know that when Beria falls, hundreds of his men will be executed, while thousands more will be sent to Siberia. And above all, Beria feels that his end is not for now. We will keep him as long as he is the watchdog of the atomic development program that Stalin is eager to see bear fruit and as long as he holds the strings of the spy network. But if his power crumbles little by little, the loss of his high position is only a matter of time. As a shrewd statesman, Beria assumes that Stalin's new tactic may change course overnight. To survive, he must act quickly.

日丹诺夫遇刺和“列宁格勒事件”后，贝利亚与马林科夫走得更近了。他的动机是马林科夫在将军中的声望以及他的友谊将为他赢得红军的支持。通过这种方式，贝利亚-马林科夫二元经济体创造了一种甚至能够对抗独裁者的新权力。另一方面，斯大林可能是为了贝利亚而任命伊格纳季耶夫，以维护他在格鲁吉亚人民心目中的形象。斯大林可能更愿意选择其他人来清洗白人爱国者：来自贝利亚的独立官员。因此，他不能被视为是其同胞的刽子手。对捷克斯洛伐克犹太人的清洗也许只是病态反犹太主义的表现之一，随着年龄的增长，斯大林日益遭受这种反犹太主义的困扰。由于贝利亚在捷克斯洛伐克迫害自己的人是愚蠢的，独裁者可能更愿意将这项任务委托给新任安全局长。贝利亚的这些假设基于一个最重要的事实：斯大林似乎仍然百分百信任他，因为他总是考虑拉夫连季的言论。

After the assassination of Zhdanov and the "Leningrad affair", Beria became closer to Malenkov. His motives are Malenkov's popularity among the generals and the support of the Red Army that his friendship would earn him. In this way, a Beria-Malenkov duumvirate creates a new power capable of confronting even the dictator. On the other hand, Stalin may have appointed Ignatiev for the sake of Beria, in order to preserve his image in the eyes of the Georgian people. Stalin may have preferred to choose someone else to purge the Caucasian patriots: an independent official from Beria. He could therefore not be considered the executioner of his compatriots. The purge of Jews from Czechoslovakia is perhaps only one of the manifestations of the pathological anti-Semitism from which Stalin increasingly suffers as he grows older. And since it would be foolish for Beria to undertake a persecution of his own men in Czechoslovakia, the dictator may have preferred to entrust this mission to the new chief of the Security. Beria bases these assumptions on a fact of primary importance: Stalin still seems to trust him one hundred percent, because he always takes into consideration Lavrenti's remarks.

1952年10月5日，斯大林召开共产党第十九次代表大会。在所发表的讲话中，有三场特别重要。第一个是马林科夫，他谴责某种疏忽精神侵入党内：党员不再足够专心，他们失去了对自己的控制，沉迷于自己的成功，忘记了国家的利益。这种态度必须受到污蔑和惩罚。

On October 5, 1952, Stalin convened the 19th Congress of the Communist Party. Among the speeches delivered, three are particularly significant. The first is that of Malenkov, who denounces the intrusion of a certain spirit of negligence into the Party: its members are no longer attentive enough, they have lost control of themselves and are intoxicated by their successes, forgetting the interests from the country. This attitude must be stigmatized and punished.

这种批评暴露了一些高级官员的不足和他们苏维埃意识的缺陷，总是受到上级的欢迎。

Such criticism, which underlines the inadequacy of some senior officials and the shortcomings of their Soviet consciousness, is always welcomed by the superior.

以下是赫鲁晓夫的讲话。尽管像马林科夫一样，赫鲁晓夫没有点名，但赫鲁晓夫还是批评了那些警惕性不够、在履行职责时表现出一定马虎、忽视党和党的国家秘密的党员。赫鲁晓夫没有具体说明泄露了哪些秘密，也没有具体说明是由谁泄露的，也没有具体说明向谁泄露的。他只是提醒国会，苏联的敌人正在蜂拥而至，苏联被资本主义国家包围，这些国家到​​处都安插着自己的代理人，甚至在党的队伍中，因此，任何一个粗心大意的俄罗斯共产党人，说话太多就要承担后果。

The following speech is delivered by Khrushchev. Although, like Malenkov, he does not mention any names, Khrushchev scolds Party members who do not keep themselves sufficiently on their guard, who show a certain sloppiness in the performance of their duties and who neglect the Party and the secrets of state. Khrushchev does not specify what kind of secrets are divulged, neither by whom nor to whom. He is simply reminding the Congress that the enemies of the USSR are swarming and that the Soviet Union is surrounded by the capitalist countries who place their agents everywhere, even in the ranks of the Party, so that any Russian communist who will be careless and who will speak too many will have to suffer the consequences.

这篇演讲的风格是为了取悦性格可疑、到处嗅探陷阱、特工、间谍、阴谋、叛乱、未遂政变或暗杀的独裁者。

This speech is written in a style intended to please the dictator who has a suspicious character and who everywhere sniffs out traps, agents, spies, conspiracies, rebellions, attempted coups or assassination.

然而，这一次却无法让这位依然坐着、阴郁而严厉的大老板满意。他没有对整个大会说一句话。贝利亚也没有：他更愿意观望。

However, nothing this time can satisfy the big boss who remains seated, dark and stern. He does not utter a word of the whole congress. Neither does Beria: he prefers to wait and see.

斯大林的秘书亚历山大·波斯克雷比切夫（Alexander Poskrebychev）代表独裁者发言，他被称为他的屏幕或翻译。演讲者颂扬伟大领袖和指导者斯大林，将经济错误和偏差等同于对苏联国家的叛国和间谍活动。它的字里行间宣告了斯大林准备的党内新的、令人不寒而栗的演变。

Speaking on behalf of the dictator, Alexander Poskrebychev, Stalin's secretary, known to be his screen or his interpreter, takes the floor. Extolling Stalin, the great leader and instructor, the speaker equates economic mistakes and deviations with treason and espionage against the Soviet nation. It announces between the lines a new and chilling evolution in the Party, prepared by Stalin.

很难弄清楚独裁者究竟有什么阴谋，但很明显，可怕的事情即将发生。

It's hard to make out exactly what the dictator has up his sleeve, but it's obvious that something terrible is about to happen.

议程上的最后一项是党的中央机构的选举。然后，10 月 14 日，国会解散。

The last item on the agenda is the election of the central bodies of the Party. Then, on October 14, Congress broke up.

学员们怀着忐忑不安的心情回到家。

The participants return home with heavy hearts of apprehension and anxiety.

两天后，新当选的中央委员会全体会议召开。这一次，斯大林表明了立场。办公桌前，面对着马林科夫、贝利亚、莫洛托夫、伏罗希洛夫、赫鲁晓夫、布尔加宁、卡冈诺维奇、米高扬和其他一些人——踮起脚尖，让自己看起来比现实中更高、更胖、更矮胖，斯大林举起手来。他用声音向下属提出他们的偏差、过错和罪行，无论是真实的还是想象的。与马林科夫、赫鲁晓夫和波斯克列比切夫在上次会议上坚持泛泛而谈不同，这位大老板并没有拐弯抹角。他引用了一个又一个名字。斯大林用有限的俄语词汇和浓重的格鲁吉亚口音指责莫洛托夫犯有几项罪行。这些罪名离使他成为人民公敌不远了。莫洛托夫一处理完，这位独裁者就攻击了坐在前排的米高扬。他开始用最严厉的言辞猛烈抨击这位老卫士、党内最忠诚的激进分子之一的布尔什维克，谴责他的罪过、他的罪行、他的颠覆活动，并提出如此荒唐、毫无根据的指控，如果这些指控是可笑的。他们并没有那么可怕。

Two days later, the Plenum of the recently elected Central Committee was convened. This time, Stalin takes a stand. At the desk facing the members of the Praesidium Malenkov, Beria, Molotov, Voroshilov, Khrushchev, Bulganin, Kaganovich, Mikoyan and a few others – standing on tiptoe to appear taller, less fat and less stocky than he looks is in reality, Stalin raises his voice to throw in the face of his subordinates their deviations, their faults and their crimes, real or imaginary. Unlike Malenkov, Khrushchev and Poskrebychev, who had stuck to generalities at the previous meeting, the big boss is not beating around the bush. He cites one name after another. Speaking with a limited Russian vocabulary and a heavy Georgian accent, Stalin accuses Molotov of several crimes. These charges are not far from making him an enemy of the people. As soon as he is done with Molotov, the dictator attacks Mikoyan who is seated in the front row. He begins to lash out at this Bolshevik of the old guard, one of the Party's most devoted militants, with the harshest words, denouncing his sins, his crimes, his subversive activities and making accusations so fantastic and so baseless that they would be laughable if they weren't so terribly macabre.

那不是全部。斯大林举起明显比左手更长的右臂，用食指指向伏罗希洛夫元帅的方向。斯大林的麻子脸因愤怒的鬼脸而扭曲，气得发绿，他击倒了这位早在革命前就已获得革命思想的老共产主义者，一位热心的斯大林主义者和第二次世界大战期间列宁格勒的捍卫者。按照他的上级的说法，伏罗希洛夫只是一个愚蠢的英国间谍，一个笨手笨脚的傻瓜，甚至无法阻止纳粹围攻列宁格勒。斯大林宣称，他后来被派往匈牙利进行苏维埃化，他的活动也不令人满意，甚至他作为部长会议副主席的工作也不尽如人意。总之，伏罗希洛夫一无是处。他只是一个老阉人

That's not all. Raising his right arm, which is visibly longer than his left, Stalin points his index finger in the direction of Marshal Voroshilov. His pockmarked face, twisted by a furious grimace, green with rage, Stalin strikes down the old communist who had acquired revolutionary ideas long before the revolution, an ardent Stalinist and defender of Leningrad during the Second World War. According to his superior, Voroshilov is just a stupid British spy, a clumsy fool who was not even able to prevent the Nazis from besieging Leningrad. His activities in the Sovietization of Hungary, where he was then sent, were not satisfactory either, Stalin declared, nor even his work as Vice-President of the Council of Ministers. In short, Voroshilov is good for nothing. He's just an old castrato,

伏罗希洛夫并不是最后一个被打上肥皂泡的人。大老板继续说道。还剩下一个人：另一位苏联元帅、内务部长拉夫连季·贝利亚。

Voroshilov is not the last to get soaped up. The big boss continues. There is someone else left: another Marshal of the Soviet Union, Minister of Internal Affairs Lavrenty Beria.

确实，贝利亚并不像这个无能的士兵那样心胸狭隘。斯大林认识到这一点。但拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇的高位似乎让他的光头转了过来。贝利亚显然将自己视为格鲁吉亚和捷克斯洛伐克的领导人。他在那里表现得像一个国家元首。苏联不需要这样的领主。大老板还斥责贝利亚背叛了铁托这个与苏联决裂的流氓。

It is true that Beria is not as narrow-minded as this incapable soldier. Stalin recognizes this. But Lavrenty Pavlovich's high position seems to have turned his bald head. Beria clearly sees himself as a leader in Georgia and Czechoslovakia. He behaves there as a head of state. The Soviet Union has no use for such lords. The big boss also reproaches Beria for the betrayal of this scoundrel Tito who broke with the Soviet Union.

独裁者在演讲结束时说，这四位被点名的人，加上其他一些未具体说明的人，但足够微妙地明白批评者也是针对他们的，仍然可以纠正他们的错误，纠正他们的偏差。但如果他们不想后悔的话，他们就会立即受到惩罚。

The dictator ends his speech by saying that the four named men, plus a few others unspecified, but subtle enough to understand that the critics are aiming at them too, can still correct their mistakes and rectify their deviations. But if they don't want to regret anything, they will receive their punishment right away.

斯大林完了。他离开了办公桌。一致的援助起立，热烈鼓掌。会议结束了。斯大林在他的秘书亚历山大·波斯克列比切夫将军、克里姆林宫安全负责人彼得·科辛金将军和他的警卫队长瓦西里·赫鲁斯塔列夫的陪同下离开了房间。毫无疑问，独裁者的话并不是空洞的威胁。新一轮的恐怖浪潮和一系列新的清洗可能会压垮政府的最高职位，摧毁这位伟大同志的几位最好的合作者。

Stalin is done. He leaves the desk. The unanimous assistance rises and applauds vigorously. The meeting is over. Followed by his secretary, General Alexander Poskrebychev, the head of Kremlin security, General Piotr Kossynkine and the chief of his guard, Vassili Khrustalev, Stalin leaves the room. There is no doubt that the dictator's words are not idle threats. A new wave of terror, a new series of purges will probably overwhelm the highest positions in the administration, destroying several of the great comrade's best collaborators.

猜测、假设和忧虑很快就得到了证实，尽管像这种情况下通常发生的那样，恐怖事件的发展与预期完全不同。这或许只是一场血腥大清洗的前奏，但目前仅限于斯大林对犹太人仇恨的新爆发。

Guesses, hypotheses and apprehensions are quickly confirmed, although, as is usual in such cases, the terror takes an entirely different turn than expected. This is probably only the prelude to a great bloody purge, but for the moment it is limited to a new outburst of Stalin's hatred against the Jews.

1952年11月，经过长期监禁，捷克斯洛伐克十三名领导人、捷克斯洛伐克共产党第一书记以及副总理鲁道夫·斯兰斯基被绳之以法。对“斯兰斯基及其同伙”的审判持续了数天。尽管西方记者被禁止参加听证会，但它还是被广播和拍摄的。根据州法院的命令，斯兰斯基和他的十名最亲密的助手被判处绞刑，而其他三名被告则被判处无期徒刑。

In November 1952, after a long stay in prison, the thirteen Czechoslovak leaders and the first secretary of the Communist Party of Czechoslovakia, as well as Deputy Prime Minister Rudolph Slansky, were brought to justice. The trial of “Slansky and his accomplices” lasted several days. It is broadcast and filmed, although Western journalists are barred from hearings. By state court order, Slansky and ten of his closest aides were sentenced to death by hanging, while the other three defendants received life sentences.

同月，毫无疑问是根据斯大林的命令，专业资格可疑的医疗助理莉迪亚·蒂马舒克（她出现在国家安全部的工资单上）写信给克里姆林宫，谴责几名医生。他们绝大多数是犹太人。他们应该准备策划一场针对最杰出人物的阴谋，特别是针对亚历山大·华西列夫斯基元帅和伊万·科涅夫元帅。据这位线人透露，不久前去世的其他布尔什维克领导人，例如安德烈·日丹诺夫，就是这些负责健康的医生下毒的受害者。十五名“克里姆林宫医生”，其中包括斯大林的家庭医生弗拉基米尔·维诺格拉多夫教授，被独裁者伊格纳季耶夫逮捕。他们的档案被委托给里乌米内安全局局长、国家安全最重要案件调查科科长伊格纳季耶夫的助手。

The same month, and no doubt on Stalin's orders, Lidia Timashuk, a medical assistant of dubious professional qualification – she appears on the pay slips of the Ministry of State Security – wrote to the Kremlin to denounce several doctors. The vast majority of them are Jews. They are supposed to prepare a conspiracy against the lives of the most eminent personalities, in particular against Marshals Alexander Vasilevski and Ivan Konev. According to this informant, other leading Bolsheviks, who died shortly before, such as Andrei Zhdanov, were victims of a poison administered by these doctors who were in charge of their health. The group of fifteen "Kremlin doctors", among whom was Stalin's family doctor, Professor Vladimir Vinogradov, is arrested by Ignatiev on the dictator's order. Their file is entrusted to an assistant of Ignatiev, the General of the Riumine Security, chief of the Section of investigation on the most important cases of State Security.

在大老板明确下令的严刑拷打下，留民逼迫医生承认所有被指控的罪行。他们的证词立即转交给斯大林。苏联媒体在头版披露，国家安全部门揭露了一群恐怖分子医生，他们利用专业知识杀害了苏联政界的几位知名人士。这些犯罪分子中的大多数承认与美国情报部门创建的国际犹太组织“联合”有联系，该组织为苏联的破坏和间谍活动提供资金。被捕的非犹太医生承认，他们长期以来一直是英国和美国的特工。他们的审判很快就会公布。

Under torture expressly ordered by the big boss, Riumin extorts doctors to confess to all the crimes they are accused of. Their depositions are immediately transmitted to Stalin. The Soviet press reveals on its front page that State Security unmasked a gang of terrorist doctors who, making perverse use of their professional knowledge, killed several eminent personalities of the political world of the USSR.
