The majority of these criminals acknowledge having contacts with the international Jewish organization Joint , created by American Intelligence, which finances sabotage and espionage in the Soviet Union. The arrested non-Jewish doctors confess that they have long been British and American agents. Their trial will be announced soon.

1953年1月13日，苏联两大主要报纸《真理报》和《消息报》同时刊登了这条消息。一周后，举报人莉迪亚·蒂马舒克被斯大林授予苏联最高荣誉列宁勋章。

This news was published simultaneously by the two main Soviet newspapers, Pravda and Izvestia , on January 13, 1953. A week later, whistleblower Lidia Timashuk was decorated by Stalin with the Order of Lenin, the highest Soviet honour.

贝利亚很聪明，他意识到整个“白大褂阴谋”事件都是针对他的，因此他可以指责他玩忽职守。根据苏联法律，贝利亚应该因这种疏忽而被逮捕，并作为犯罪分子的共犯受到审判。

Beria is smart enough to realize that the whole "white coat conspiracy" affair is directed against him, so that he can accuse him of negligence in his duties as commissioner of the Sûreté. According to Soviet law, Beria should be arrested for this lack of attention and tried as an accomplice of the criminals.

2月中旬，当一件不祥的事件发生时，被告的起诉书仍在准备中，这表明政治局高级成员和斯大林最亲密的同志正在被定罪。这就是斯大林前秘书、时任红军副国防委员兼政委列夫·梅赫利斯将军的被捕和处决。如果梅赫利斯成为大老板的牺牲品，这必须被视为独裁者疯狂反犹太主义的表现，这种反犹太主义多年来不断增长，以至于大同志不再支持犹太人，即使是他最热心的支持者之一，或者是迷惑政治局成员的巧妙策略的一部分。

In mid-February, the indictment of the defendants was still being prepared when an ominous event occurred, a sign that senior members of the Politburo and Stalin's closest comrades were being convicted. This is the arrest and execution of General Lev Mekhlis, Stalin's former secretary, then deputy defense commissioner and political commissar of the Red Army. If Mekhlis falls victim to the big boss, this must be seen as a manifestation of the dictator's insane anti-Semitism, which grows over the years to the point that the big comrade can no longer support a Jew, even one of his most ardent supporters, or part of a clever ploy to confuse members of the Politburo.

贝利亚将处决梅赫利斯解释为另一次个人警告，因为军队政治行政首长梅赫利斯将军是他最得力的合作者之一。

Beria interprets the execution of Mekhlis as another personal warning, because General Mekhlis, chief of the political administration of the army, was one of his most effective collaborators.

毫无疑问，这位伟大领袖的其他弟子和其他老布尔什维克很快就会被清算：犹太人卡冈诺维奇，在最近的全会上已经受到谴责的米高扬，娶了犹太人的伏罗希洛夫，叶卡捷琳娜·达维多夫娜，以及莫洛托夫。犹太妻子宝琳娜仍在集中营里。还有一位政治局委员娶了一位犹太女子：安德烈·安德烈耶夫娶了多拉·哈赞，而赫鲁晓夫的女婿是犹太人。

There is no doubt that other disciples of the great leader and other old Bolsheviks will soon be liquidated: the Jew Kaganovich, Mikoyan, who was already condemned at the recent Plenum, Voroshilov, who married a Jewess, Ekaterina Davidovna , as well as Molotov whose Jewish wife, Paulina, is still in a concentration camp. Yet another member of the Politburo married a Jewess: Andrei Andreyev married Dora Khazan, while Khrushchev's son-in-law is Jewish.

几天后，赫鲁晓夫的犹太秘书被捕，显然是为了从他那里套取有关赫鲁晓夫涉嫌犯下的政治罪行的信息。这应该导致他被捕。据说贝利亚的血管里也有一点犹太血统，很明显他很快就会身陷囹圄。在捷克斯洛伐克和格鲁吉亚对他的部下进行清洗之后，他被指控叛国和破坏，很容易被指控在履行职责时犯有危险的疏忽行为。他犯罪的证据就是他无法挫败克里姆林宫医生的阴谋以及其他阴谋。新的失败将证明伊格纳季耶夫取代他是合理的。

A few days later, Khrushchev's Jewish secretary was arrested, obviously with the intention of extracting information from him about the political crimes that Khrushchev is alleged to have committed. This should lead to his arrest. As Beria is also said to have a little Jewish blood in his veins, it is clear that he will soon find himself behind bars. After the purge of his men in Czechoslovakia and Georgia, accused of treason and sabotage, he can easily be accused of dangerous negligence in the exercise of his functions. The proof of his crime would be his inability to thwart the conspiracy of the Kremlin doctors, as well as other conspiracies. A new failure would justify his replacement by Ignatiev.

贝利亚深知，在斯大林的直属下属中，波斯克列比切夫并不是他唯一的敌人。还有克里姆林宫安全部门负责人科辛金。如果新的清洗开始，贝利亚将成为第一个受害者。

Beria is well aware that, among Stalin's immediate subordinates, Poskrebychev is not his only enemy. There is also Kosynkin, the head of Kremlin security. If a new purge begins, Beria will be its first victim.

当然，这些预测只是猜测。然而，如果没有意外事件阻止他，那么假设斯大林将以与之前的清洗相同的方式进行新的清洗是完全有道理的。1953年2月17日，科辛金将军意外去世。他的死因是心脏病发作。

Of course, these forecasts are only guesses. It makes perfect sense, however, to assume that Stalin will administer the new purge in the same way as the previous ones, if no unexpected events stop him. On February 17, 1953, the unexpected death of General Kossynkine was announced. His death is attributed to a heart attack.

尽管斯大林已经七十三岁了，但他并没有显得衰弱或衰老，他的健康状况似乎也没有引起他的任何担忧。他的心情也很好，这似乎并不预示着他的老伙伴会遇到什么不愉快的事情。相反。他和他们一起在莫斯科大剧院观看歌剧演出，尽管过去他很少有耐心停留到演出结束。他在招待外国外交官时欢迎他们来到克里姆林宫，并在孔采沃的别墅中与内阁成员共进晚餐。

Although seventy-three years old, Stalin does not seem diminished or senile and his health does not seem to cause him any concern. He is also in an excellent mood which does not seem to bode anything unpleasant for his old companions. On the contrary. He attends performances of operas with them at the Bolshoi, although in the past he rarely had the patience to stay until the end of the performance. He welcomes them to the Kremlin when he gives receptions in honor of foreign diplomats and he dines with the members of his cabinet in his villa in Kountsevo.

就在梅赫利斯令人不安的死亡消息被宣布两周后，斯大林与一些内阁成员从克里姆林宫电影院返回，并在布利尼与他们共进晚餐。他在孔采沃的乡间别墅里独自一人与贝利亚在一起，贝利亚的别墅就在附近。他们在斯大林的办公室里随意闲聊，就像他们在美餐后经常做的那样。现在是三月初。公园里的雪还很厚，窗后，光秃秃的树枝在风中摇曳。房间里，火柴噼啪作响，红色和蓝色的火焰升起。它温暖、平静、舒适。这位高个子同志迈着缓慢而坚定的步伐，在房间里踱步，从仍然恭敬地站着的忠诚弟子走到窗边。在夜幕降临时，玻璃后面的花园景色让人想起一幅蓝色的画作，一幅被棕色木框玻璃保护的风景。斯大林转过身，凝视着这幅活生生的画。背对着他的下属，独裁者展示了他粗壮的脖子，以及右耳骨正后方的弱点。贝利亚随身携带的金属球精确而快速的打击可以产生与他多次对卢比扬卡号囚犯所获得的效果相同的效果。

Exactly two weeks after the announcement of the disturbing death of Mekhlis, Stalin, returned from the Kremlin cinema with some members of his cabinet and after having dined with them in Blijni, his country house in Kountsevo, remains alone with Beria, whose villa is nearby. They gossip casually in Stalin's office, as they often do after a good meal. It's the beginning of March. The snow is still thick in the park, behind the windows, and the bare branches sway in the wind. In the room, the logs of the fire crackle as the red and blue flames rise. It is warm, calm, cozy. With his slow but firm step, the tall comrade paces the room, going from his devoted disciple, who remains standing with due respect, to the window. The view of the garden in the falling darkness, behind the glass, is reminiscent of a bluish painting, of a landscape protected by glass in a brown wooden frame. Stalin turns for a moment and contemplates this living painting. Turning his back on his subordinate, the dictator showcases his stocky neck and, just above, the weak spot that is immediately behind the right ear bone. A precise, rapid blow of the metal ball that Beria always carries in his pocket can give the same result as that which he obtained so many times on the prisoners of the Lubyanka.

正确的时刻，或许也是唯一的时刻，已经到来。贝利亚会抓住机会吗？没有人能这么说。

The right moment, and perhaps the only one, has arrived. Does Beria take his chance? Nobody can say that.

第47章

Chapter 47

独裁者死了

The dictator is dead

1953年3月2日上午，斯大林的女儿斯维特兰娜赶赴昆采沃。马林科夫打来电话，要求他尽快过来。当她到达时，她发现父亲卧床不起，生命垂危。房间里站着马林科夫、赫鲁晓夫、布尔加宁和贝利亚。他被告知，斯大林前一天晚上被发现在他的图书馆里，躺在沙发旁的地毯上，并被从那里带到了他的卧室。家里有几位医生，但由于伟大同志斯大林身边最优秀的医生都被斯大林逮捕了，所以接替他们的都是一些没有经验的年轻学徒，连带来的人工肺都不会使用。他们所做的就是刺破大老板的喉咙并进行敷料：自远古以来，村庄里就采用了一种原始疗法。全家人，还有赫鲁晓夫、布尔加宁和马林科夫假装喊叫。只有贝利亚什么也没做。尽管很激动，他还是站在斯大林的床边，仔细地观察着他，试图弄清楚这个大老板是否真的快要死了，以及瘫痪是否足以阻止他说出那几句话来揭示他即将死亡的真正原因。 。但即使在这些时刻，贝利亚也足够精明，表现出僵硬的悲伤表情，很可能让垂死的人相信拉夫连季·贝利亚，只有他一个人，是他忠实的追随者。只有贝利亚什么也没做。尽管很激动，他还是站在斯大林的床边，仔细地观察着他，试图弄清楚这个大老板是否真的快要死了，以及瘫痪是否足以阻止他说出那几句话来揭示他即将死亡的真正原因。 。但即使在这些时刻，贝利亚也足够精明，表现出僵硬的悲伤表情，很可能让垂死的人相信拉夫连季·贝利亚，只有他一个人，是他忠实的追随者。只有贝利亚什么也没做。尽管很激动，他还是站在斯大林的床边，仔细地观察着他，试图弄清楚这个大老板是否真的快要死了，以及瘫痪是否足以阻止他说出那几句话来揭示他即将死亡的真正原因。 。但即使在这些时刻，贝利亚也足够精明，表现出僵硬的悲伤表情，很可能让垂死的人相信拉夫连季·贝利亚，只有他一个人，是他忠实的追随者。

On the morning of March 2, 1953, Svetlana, Stalin's daughter, rushed to Kuntsevo. A phone call from Malenkov asked him to come as soon as possible. When she arrives, she finds her father bedridden, dying. In the room stand Malenkov, Khrushchev, Bulganin and Beria. He is told that Stalin had been discovered the previous night in his library, lying on the rug by the sofa, and was taken from there to his bedroom. There are several doctors in the house, but as the best of those who were attached to great comrade Stalin have been arrested by him, their replacements are only young apprentices without experience, not even able to use the artificial lung which has been brought. All they do is prick and apply compresses to the big boss's throat: a primitive treatment used since time immemorial in the villages. The whole household, as well as Khrushchev, Bulganin and Malenkov pretend to shout. Only Beria does nothing. Although very agitated, he stands by Stalin's bed, watching him carefully, trying to find out if the big boss is really dying and if the paralysis is enough to prevent him from uttering the few words that would reveal the real cause. of his impending death. But even in these moments, Beria is shrewd enough to wear an expression of stiff sadness, likely to convince the dying man that Lavrenty Beria, and he alone, is his faithful follower. Only Beria does nothing. Although very agitated, he stands by Stalin's bed, watching him carefully, trying to find out if the big boss is really dying and if the paralysis is enough to prevent him from uttering the few words that would reveal the real cause. of his impending death. But even in these moments, Beria is shrewd enough to wear an expression of stiff sadness, likely to convince the dying man that Lavrenty Beria, and he alone, is his faithful follower. Only Beria does nothing. Although very agitated, he stands by Stalin's bed, watching him carefully, trying to find out if the big boss is really dying and if the paralysis is enough to prevent him from uttering the few words that would reveal the real cause. of his impending death. But even in these moments, Beria is shrewd enough to wear an expression of stiff sadness, likely to convince the dying man that Lavrenty Beria, and he alone, is his faithful follower.

此时，斯大林陷入昏迷。贝利亚已经没有任何理由再玩游戏了，他要立即夺取权力，成为主人。他兴奋极了，命令斯大林的女儿出去。然后他离开别墅，派已故独裁者的警卫队长赫鲁斯塔列夫去取他的豪华轿车，就好像这个人从现在开始就是他的仆人一样。贝利亚冲进她的办公室来处理混乱的局势。他很清楚，如果他不第一个上台，他就会被马林科夫或赫鲁晓夫赶下台。

At this moment, Stalin slips into a coma. Beria no longer has any reason to play the game. He wants to seize power and become the master right away. Excited to the extreme, he orders Stalin's daughter out. Then he leaves the villa, sending the head of the late dictator's guard, Khrustalev, to fetch his limousine, as if this man were his servant from now on. Beria rushes into her office to take charge of the tumultuous situation. He knows very well that if he is not the first to take the reins, he will be ousted by Malenkov or by Khrushchev.

斯大林快死了。他似乎没有意识。他所遭受的攻击是致命的。但突然，他睁开了眼睛，开始审视周围的面孔，似乎在寻找他想要惩罚的人。他举起左臂，仿佛要指出罪魁祸首。然而，他在人群中找不到他，也无法说话。但他的姿态表达了对敌人的愤怒和热情。下一分钟，斯大林去世了。

Stalin is dying. He seems unconscious. The attack he suffered is deadly. But suddenly, he opens his eyes and begins to scrutinize the faces around him, as if looking for someone he wants to punish. He raises his left arm as if to point out the culprit. However, he cannot find him in the crowd and he is unable to speak. But his gesture expresses anger and passion against the enemy. The next minute, Stalin dies.

贝利亚坐在卢比扬卡监狱的办公桌前，立即致电卫生部和莫斯科医学科学院，要求由教授和专家签署诊断书。拉夫伦蒂随后命令一辆车从昆采沃运来尸体进行尸检。然后尸体必须秘密转移到克里姆林宫。由于担心孔采沃意外事故的线索仍然存在，贝利亚决定改变公众的活动安排，他说袭击发生时伟大的同志斯大林正在他的莫斯科总部独自工作。拉夫伦蒂还要求几个装甲团的指挥官派遣配备机枪的坦克和汽车。

Sitting at his desk in Lubyanka prison, Beria immediately telephoned the Ministry of Health and the Moscow Academy of Medical Sciences, asking that the medical certificate be signed by professors and specialists. Lavrenti then orders a car to fetch the body from Kuntsevo for autopsy. The body will then have to be secretly transferred to the Kremlin. Fearing that clues remain of the unexpected accident in Kuntsevo, Beria decides to change the setting of the event for the public and he says that the attack took place while the great comrade Stalin was working alone in his headquarters. from Moscow. Lavrenti further asks the commanders of several armored regiments to send tanks and cars equipped with machine guns.

此后，贝利亚邀请媒体不要表现出任何哀悼的迹象，甚至只是从专栏中删除轻松或幽默的文章，同时禁止广播电台播放葬礼音乐。剧院和电影院被指示照常开放，直到消息正式宣布。

After that, Beria invites the press not to show any sign of mourning, even by simply removing light or humorous articles from their columns, while the radio is prohibited from broadcasting funeral music. Theaters and cinemas are instructed to open as usual until the news is officially announced.

这些指示以及其他一些指示花费了贝利亚几个小时的时间。尽管如此，他最终还是抽出了时间将亚历山大·波斯克雷比切夫带到了他的办公室，他一回到卢比扬卡就下令逮捕他。审讯并没有问太多问题。贝利亚命令斯大林的私人秘书坐下，警卫将他的手臂放在椅子后面，贝利亚一次又一次地打他的嘴，用最粗鲁的名字覆盖他。当拉夫伦蒂失去理智，在嚎叫和攻击中耗尽了自己的力量时，他的受害者的脸就像一块生肉。他裂开的嘴唇正在大量流血。他的下巴和鼻子都骨折了。最终，贝利亚命令警卫将囚犯带到单独的地下室牢房。

These instructions, and a few others, take Beria several hours. He nevertheless ended up finding the time to have Alexander Poskrebychev brought to his office, whose arrest he had ordered as soon as he returned to Lubyanka. The interrogation does not include many questions. Beria orders Stalin's private secretary to sit down, and while the guard holds his arms behind the chair, Beria punches him on the mouth again and again, covering him with the crudest names. When Lavrenti, beside himself, has exhausted his strength in howling and striking, his victim's face resembles a piece of raw meat. His split lips are bleeding profusely. He has a broken chin and nose. Eventually, Beria orders the guard to take the prisoner to the solitary basement cell.

安全部门代理负责人伊格纳季耶夫也被捕。但是，由于他是马林科夫的门生，他的生命得以幸免。同样的命运也留给了他的助手鲁敏。自治的国家安全部失去独立性，重新回到贝利亚的控制之下。

The acting head of the Security, Ignatiev, is also arrested. But, as he is a protege of Malenkov, his life is spared. The same fate is reserved for his assistant Riumin. The autonomous Ministry of State Security loses its independence and returns to Beria's control.

3 月 2 日至 3 日晚上，贝利亚召集了所有被叫到斯大林床边的治疗学和神经病理学教授。拉夫伦蒂告诉他们，在新政府接管之前，为了国家的利益，这位伟大同志的去世必须严格保密。然后他命令医生准备一份公告，宣布斯大林病情严重，但并非无药可救。该声明此前已提交贝利亚批准，将通过广播播出，并在两天后（即 3 月 4 日）发送给苏联媒体和外国记者。随后又发布了其他几则公报，对斯大林康复的希望越来越小，并让苏联人民和全世界做好了接受他去世的消息的准备。具体日期将在新制度实施后立即确定。国家机器就能以足够的效率运作来主导局势并顺利地治理国家。

On the night of March 2-3, Beria summoned all the professors of therapy and neuropathology who had been called to Stalin's bedside. Lavrenti tells them that until a new administration takes over, the death of the great comrade must remain strictly secret for the good of the country. He then orders the doctors to prepare a bulletin announcing Stalin's serious but not hopeless illness. This statement, previously submitted to Beria for approval, will be broadcast by radio and delivered to the Soviet press and to foreign correspondents two days later, on March 4. It would be followed by several other bulletins expressing less and less hope for Stalin's recovery and preparing the Soviet people and the whole world for the news of his death. The exact date will be chosen immediately after the implementation of the new regime. The state apparatus will then be able to work with sufficient efficiency to dominate the situation and to run the country smoothly.

1953年3月4日，莫斯科广播电台宣布了新的悲剧：两天前的傍晚，斯大林同志在克里姆林宫的公寓里脑溢血。伟大的教育家、国父失去了知觉。他的右侧瘫痪了。他已经失语，呼吸困难。这份健康报告由九名医生签署，播音员宣读了他们的名字。

On March 4, 1953, Radio Moscow announced the new tragedy: two days earlier, at the end of the evening, Comrade Stalin had suffered a cerebral hemorrhage in his apartment in the Kremlin. The great educator, the father of the nation has lost consciousness. He is paralyzed on the right side. He has lost speech and breathing is difficult. This health report is signed by nine doctors whose names are read by the announcer.

由于贝利亚的预防措施，3月2日去世的斯大林仍然为世界舆论而活，当广播报道了这种疾病时，事实上，这种疾病在两天前就夺去了他的生命。随着新政府的成立，第一个公告之后又发布了另外两个公告。1953年3月5日，也就是这位独裁者去世三天后，贝利亚授权正式宣布伟大同志斯大林的逝世。

Thanks to Beria's precautions, Stalin, who had been dead since March 2, was still living for world opinion when the radio revealed the illness which, in fact, had killed him two days earlier. The first bulletin was followed by two others as the new government was formed. Beria authorizes the official announcement of the death of great comrade Stalin on March 5, 1953, three days after the death of the dictator.

新一届政府由马林科夫担任总理，贝利亚、莫洛托夫担任部长会议副主席，伏罗希洛夫、卡冈诺维奇、米高扬、赫鲁晓夫担任领导集体。

The new administration consists of Malenkov as prime minister, Beria and Molotov as vice-chairmen of the Council of Ministers, and Voroshilov, Kaganovich, Mikoyan and Khrushchev as members of the collegiate leadership.

贝利亚知道自己作为首席刽子手和集中营主人的角色并不会让他受欢迎，因此决定将马林科夫推向前进，以避免麻烦。拉夫连季认为，目前最好优先考虑他非自愿的朋友，他也反对斯大林在去世时准备的新清洗。为什么不让马林科夫暂时领导一下，也就是巩固新秩序所需的时间呢？无论如何，内政和国家安全部长贝利亚仍然是秘密警察总司令，手中掌握着事实上的权力。贝利亚要选择合适的时机，推翻那个猫头鹰头的胖太监马林科夫，和那个虚荣的乌克兰人赫鲁晓夫一起，并将他们两人作为危险分子逮捕。米高扬在拉夫连季在巴库时为他提供了很多帮助，因此贝利亚特别讨厌他。这三个低能儿将被关在卢比安卡监狱，通过向他们的头部注射几克铅，他们将在单独的牢房中彻底治愈他们的愚蠢行为。莫洛托夫将永远是贝利亚的人，因为贝利亚下令释放他的妻子并让她返回莫斯科，而且因为拉夫连季，他再次成为外交部长。这三个低能儿将被关在卢比安卡监狱，通过向他们的头部注射几克铅，他们将在单独的牢房中彻底治愈他们的愚蠢行为。莫洛托夫将永远是贝利亚的人，因为贝利亚下令释放他的妻子并让她返回莫斯科，而且因为拉夫连季，他再次成为外交部长。这三个低能儿将被关在卢比安卡监狱，通过向他们的头部注射几克铅，他们将在单独的牢房中彻底治愈他们的愚蠢行为。莫洛托夫将永远是贝利亚的人，因为贝利亚下令释放他的妻子并让她返回莫斯科，而且因为拉夫连季，他再次成为外交部长。

Knowing that his role as chief executioner and master of the concentration camps did not make him popular, Beria decided, to avoid trouble, to push Malenkov forward. Lavrenti thinks it best to give priority for the moment to his involuntary friend who was also opposed to the new purge that Stalin was preparing at the time of his death. Why not let Malenkov exercise the leadership for a little while, the time needed to reinforce the new order? In any event, Beria, Minister of Internal Affairs and State Security, is still commander-in-chief of the secret police and holds de facto power in his hands. It's up to Beria to pick the right moment to overthrow that fat owl-headed eunuch Malenkov, together with that vain boor of a Ukrainian, Khrushchev, and to arrest them both as dangerous individuals. With Mikoyan, who rendered Lavrenti so many services when he was in Baku and who is therefore particularly hated by Beria. These three imbeciles will be locked up in the Lubianka prison where they will be definitively cured of their stupidity in the solitary cell, by injecting a few grams of lead into their heads. Molotov will forever be Beria's man, because the latter ordered his wife to be freed and let her return to Moscow, and because, thanks to Lavrenti, he again became Minister of Foreign Affairs. These three imbeciles will be locked up in the Lubianka prison where they will be definitively cured of their stupidity in the solitary cell, by injecting a few grams of lead into their heads. Molotov will forever be Beria's man, because the latter ordered his wife to be freed and let her return to Moscow, and because, thanks to Lavrenti, he again became Minister of Foreign Affairs. These three imbeciles will be locked up in the Lubianka prison where they will be definitively cured of their stupidity in the solitary cell, by injecting a few grams of lead into their heads. Molotov will forever be Beria's man, because the latter ordered his wife to be freed and let her return to Moscow, and because, thanks to Lavrenti, he again became Minister of Foreign Affairs.

3月5日晚，贝利亚在返回自己的住所时，开车经过斯大林位于孔采沃的别墅Blijni 。拉夫连季决定夷平他上级的房子，在这所房子里，他，贝利亚，不得不忍受这个尖锐的约瑟夫·维萨里奥诺维奇·朱加奇维利-约瑟夫·斯大林的愚蠢笑话成千上万次，他必须在那里假装笑声和欢乐，同时知道如果他不直视暴君的眼睛，老板就会清算他。这个见证贝利亚耻辱的地方必须永远消失。

On the night of March 5, while returning to his property, Beria drove past Blijni , Stalin's villa in Kuntsevo. Lavrenty decides to raze his superior's house, this house where he, Beria, had to undergo thousands of times the stupid jokes of this razor-sharp Iosif Vissarionovitch Dzhugashvili-Joseph Stalin and where he had to simulate laughter and joy while knowing that if he didn't look the tyrant straight in the eye, the boss would liquidate him. This place, witness to the shame and humiliation of Beria, must disappear forever.

第二天，贝利亚前往昆采沃，召集了斯大林的所有文职人员，以及厨师和女佣。他用尖锐的声音命令他们收拾好主人的所有东西，并且快点，因为他电话呼叫的军用卡车随时都会到达。已经有几辆车停在门前，几名秘密警察正开始往车上装上已故伟大同志、苏联国家的太阳、已故约瑟夫·斯大林的家具和个人物品。所有这些都将运往莫斯科郊区的一个仓库，那里存放着从被捕、流放或处决者身上没收的财产。然后贝利亚再次召集全家人，尖叫道：让他知道他们不再被需要，他们可以下地狱，因为他不在乎这些人。昆采沃的军事单位、哨兵和保镖全部被捕，除了贝利亚派驻在那里监视斯大林的人。

The next day, Beria goes to Kuntsevo and gathers all of Stalin's civilian servants, as well as the cooks and maids. In a piercing voice, he orders them to pack up everything that belonged to their master and to hurry, because the military trucks he called by telephone will arrive any moment. Already a few vehicles are stopping in front of the door, and several secret police officials are beginning to load them with the furniture and personal items of the great comrade, the sun of the Soviet nation, the late Joseph Stalin. All of this is destined for a warehouse on the outskirts of Moscow, where property confiscated from those arrested, exiled or executed is deposited. Then Beria gathers the whole household again and, screaming, lets him know that they are no longer needed and that they can go to hell, because he doesn't care about these people. Kuntsevo's military unit, sentries and bodyguards were all arrested, except those Beria had posted there to spy on Stalin.

最后，别墅被清空，只剩下墙上挂着的最后一幅画。灯泡和地毯被拆除。贝利亚命令他的手下锁上废弃的房子，并用木板钉在门窗上。

Finally, the villa is emptied down to the last picture hanging on the wall. Light bulbs and carpets are removed. Beria orders his men to lock the deserted house and to barricade doors and windows by nailing planks to them.

当这项工作完成后，满载的卡车开往仓库，工作人员散去，贝利亚回到他的帕卡德前往他的办公室。

When this work is finished, the loaded trucks leave for the depot, the staff is dispersed and Beria gets back into his Packard to reach his office.

下午，斯大林的灵柩被大张旗鼓地转移到联邦院圆柱大厅，全部挂着黑色。尸体暴露三天三夜，供群众瞻仰。独裁者的脸在仪式前进行了防腐处理。在贝利亚的监督下，化妆非常彻底，不仅天花痕迹看不见，脸上永远阴沉的表情也被一种面无表情的平静所取代。这项工作完成得非常熟练，甚至斯维特兰娜都几乎认不出自己父亲的面容。现在没有人看到任何暴力死亡的迹象。数千名民兵在贝利亚的命令下并肩站立，阻止悲伤的游客在棺材前停留，哪怕只是一会儿。人们被迫向前，只能短暂地看一眼二流商店橱窗里那像倒塌的人体模型一样的蜡像脸和身体。

In the afternoon, Stalin's coffin was transferred with great fanfare to the Hall of Columns of the House of Union, all hung in black. The body is exposed for three days and three nights to the homage of the crowds. The dictator's face was embalmed before the ceremony. The make-up, done under Beria's supervision, is so thorough that not only are the marks of the smallpox invisible, but also the eternally sullen expression on the face has given way to a kind of inexpressive serenity. The work is done with such skill that even Svetlana can barely recognize the features of her own father. No one now could see the slightest sign of violent death. Thousands of militiamen under Beria's orders, standing side by side, prevent grieving visitors from stopping in front of the coffin, if only for a moment. People are forced forward, so they can only take a brief look at the wax face and body that looks like a collapsed mannequin in the window of a second-rate store.

莫斯科人的阵线绵延两公里多。棺材附近的仪仗队由内阁成员组成。这次守夜活动是为新闻摄影师举办的。贝利亚和马林科夫站在棺材头的两侧，仿佛贝利亚想表明他们都以平等的权力组成了执政的二人领导层。一支小型军乐队演奏着格鲁吉亚民间传说中的古老旋律。音乐轻柔而哀伤。

The queue of Muscovites stretches for more than two kilometers. The honor guard, near the casket, is mounted by members of the cabinet. This vigil is intended for press photographers. Beria and Malenkov stand on either side of the head of the coffin, as if Beria wanted to show that they both form, with equal powers, the ruling duumvirate. A small military band plays old melodies from Georgian folklore. The music is soft and funereal.

官方尸检结果将于第二天公布。约瑟夫·斯大林同志的死因之一是严重的脑溢血。这份由九名医生和教授签署的文件于 3 月 7 日公布，尽管尸检是在四天前进行的，警惕的贝利亚也在场。这份公报是一份精确而详细的诊断，其书写方式排除了任何暗杀的可能性。语气如此舒缓，拉夫伦蒂开始怀疑——鬼知道为什么！——如果那些该死的医生没有闻到什么不对劲，如果他们没有伪造报告，声称相信斯大林是自然死亡的话。对于贝利亚来说，这个意见的措辞太好了，无法反对在媒体上发表，但他决定记住那些帮助过他的医生。

The results of the official autopsy are published the following day. Among the causes of the death of Comrade Joseph Stalin is a severe cerebral hemorrhage. The document, signed by nine doctors and professors, was made public on March 7, although the autopsy had taken place four days earlier in the presence of the vigilant Beria. The bulletin, a precise and detailed diagnosis, is written in such a way that it excludes any possibility of assassination. The tone is so soothing that Lavrenty begins to wonder – the devil knows why! – if those damned doctors didn't smell something wrong and if they didn't fake the report by claiming to believe that Stalin had died a natural death. The opinion is too well worded for Beria to oppose its publication in the press, but he decides to remember the doctors who do him a favor.

举行历史性葬礼的日子是 1953 年 3 月 9 日。灵柩从柱廊中走出来，肩上扛着马林科夫和贝利亚领导的新内阁成员，以及空军上将瓦西里·斯大林（瓦西里·斯大林）的儿子。已故独裁者。他占据着一个战略位置，就在马林科夫的后面和莫洛托夫的前面，如果他绊倒或跌倒，莫洛托夫可以支持他，因为小斯大林是一个永远处于醉酒状态的酒鬼。他们将棺材放在炮架上，然后排成一排。庞大的送葬队伍向红场行进。第一排走的是新政权的八位代表，还有握着炉子绳子的瓦西里·斯大林。这一排由葬礼组织委员会主席赫鲁晓夫和贝利亚领导。

The day chosen for the historic funeral is March 9, 1953. The coffin comes out of the hall of columns on the shoulders of the members of the new cabinet led by Malenkov and Beria, as well as Air Force General Vasily Stalin, son of the late dictator. He occupies a strategic position, just behind Malenkov and in front of Molotov who could support him if he stumbles or falls, because Stalin junior is an alcoholic in a permanent state of inebriation. They place the coffin on a gun carriage, then form ranks. The huge funeral procession moves towards Red Square. In the first row walk the eight representatives of the new power, as well as Vassili Stalin, who hold the cords of the stove. This row is led by Khrushchev, chairman of the funeral organizing committee, alongside Beria.

当游行队伍到达列宁陵墓附近的红场时，马林科夫、贝利亚和莫洛托夫发表讲话。第一篇是马林科夫的悼词，是典型的悼词，充满了对国家最杰出公民死者荣耀的陈词滥调。另一方面，贝利亚的演讲听起来更像是新君主向新臣民概述他的议程的登基演讲。

When the procession reaches Red Square, near Lenin's mausoleum, speeches are made by Malenkov, Beria and Molotov. The first, that of Malenkov, is the typical eulogy, full of cliches to the glory of the deceased, the most eminent citizen of the nation. Beria's speech, on the other hand, sounds more like the throne speech of a new monarch outlining his agenda to his new subjects.

在莫斯科这个灰蒙蒙的冬日，贝利亚沙哑、带着鼻音的声音以一种沉闷而单调的方式划破纯净的空气。胖政委戴着大黑帽，穿着大外套，看上去就像一只巨大的、后腿站立、嗡嗡作响的巨大蟑螂。

On this gray Moscow winter day, Beria's hoarse, nasal voice cuts through the pure air in a dull and monotonous way. The fat commissar, with his big black hat and big coat, looks like a huge, monstrous cockroach standing on its hind legs and buzzing to himself.

听众庄严的沉默不时被瓦西里·斯大林打断，他从口袋里的瓶子里抽了几口伏特加，喝了几口后，已经喝醉了，变得好战，他称演讲者是“svolotch”，是个无礼的人。soukin 同义词“乌合之众，妓女，狗娘养的”以及刺杀他父亲伟大的约瑟夫·维萨里奥诺维奇·斯大林的人。

The solemn silence of the listeners is interrupted from time to time only by Vasili Stalin who, after several swigs of vodka drawn from a bottle he carries in his pocket, has become drunk and belligerent, and who calls the speaker a svolotch , of blad and soukin syn "rabble, whore, son of a bitch" as well as the assassin of his father, the great Joseph Vissarionovitch Stalin.

然而，葬礼的庄严性中的这种虚假注释并不是影响仪式的唯一事实。更令人沮丧的是贝利亚所营造的气氛，作为负责参加这场历史性葬礼的人员安全的内政专员，他做了一些不寻常的事情。为了国家安全，贝利亚在游行途中的所有街道上动员了特种部队，包括坦克、装甲车、配备机枪和火焰喷射器的步兵。贝利亚希望通过这一行动组织一次阅兵式，展示自己的权力，同时警告他的同僚以及任何对此表示怀疑的人，拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚元帅是苏联最有权势的人，

This false note in the majesty of the funeral is not, however, the only fact that weighs on the ceremony. Far more depressing is the atmosphere created by Beria who, as Home Affairs Commissioner responsible for the safety of people attending this historic funeral, did some unusual things. For the safety of the State, Beria mobilized its special forces, with tanks, armored cars, infantry armed with machine guns and flamethrowers, in all the streets on the way of the procession. Beria wants, by this action, to organize a kind of military parade which illustrates his own power while warning his associates, and anyone who would have doubts on this point, that Marshal Lavrenti Pavlovich Beria is the most powerful man in Soviet Union,

然而，这个决定是一个严重的错误。他没有给敌人留下深刻的印象和恐惧，而是让他们看到了他权力的危险。在他的自信中，拉夫伦蒂忘记了那句古老的格言：低估敌人是走向失败的第一步。通过炫耀自己的军事实力，贝利亚向他的同事们表明，他只将他们视为少数实际上的囚犯，他陪同已故独裁者前往他的陵墓。他的军队不仅占领街道、大道和广场，甚至包围城市，切断首都与全国其他地区的联系。通过本次部署，拉夫伦蒂显然让他的内阁伙伴知道，安全部队举行的阅兵只不过是贝利亚正在表演的一场演出开幕前最后一次盛装彩排。而这篇文章的标题是：政变。

This decision, however, is a serious mistake. Instead of impressing and frightening his enemies, he opens their eyes to the danger of his power. In his self-assurance, Lavrenti forgets the old maxim that underestimating one's enemy is a first step towards defeat. By flaunting his military might, Beria shows his colleagues that he only sees them as a handful of virtual prisoners, with whom he accompanies the late dictator to his mausoleum. His troops not only occupy the streets, avenues and squares, but they even surround the city, cutting off the capital from the rest of the nation. Through this deployment, Lavrenti obviously lets his Cabinet partners know that the military parade given by the Sûreté army is nothing more than the last rehearsal in costumes before the opening night of a show that Beria is performing. to disassemble. And the title of this piece is:Coup d'etat .

在这场盛大而隆重的葬礼上，第三位也是最后一位发言者是莫洛托夫，他的讲话采用了老派布尔什维克向他的上级例行致敬的形式。但没有人在意这个赞美。

The third and final speaker at this grand and ceremonial funeral is Molotov, whose speech takes the form of a routine tribute by an old-guard Bolshevik to his superior. But no one cares about this praise.

第48章

Chapter 48

政变前两天

Two days before the coup

很快，正常的生活就恢复了正常，就好像苏联公民沉闷乏味的生活中什么也没发生过一样。这又是同样的工作，有铁的纪律和无情的规定，杂货店和其他商店同样的短缺，报刊、广播和电影院同样乏味的宣传。自斯大林时代以来，一切都没有改变。

Soon normal life resumes its course, as if nothing had happened in the dreary and dull existence of Soviet citizens. It is again, exactly, the same work, with its iron discipline and its implacable regulations, the same shortage in the grocers and other stores, the same boring propaganda in the press, on the radio and in the cinema. Nothing has changed since the days of Stalin.

在克里姆林宫，由马林科夫、贝利亚和莫洛托夫组成的新三巨头并没有偏离之前的政治路线。当马林科夫与经济问题作斗争时，贝利亚以建筑工程师般的精准度，为他迈向顶峰奠定了最后的梯级。

In the Kremlin, the new triumvirate of leaders, Malenkov, Beria and Molotov, does not deviate a hair from the previous political line. While Malenkov struggles with economic problems, Beria, with the precision of an architectural engineer, lays the last rungs that will lead him to the top.

集中营系统必须重组。自从斯大林去世的消息公布以来，数百万囚犯一直在等待他们的政权软化，而普遍的乐观气氛正在削弱他们的有效性。他们中的大多数人认为，他们的不幸是斯大林造成的，现在斯大林去世了，他们正在等待大赦，或者至少是对他们的判决进行审查。当然，并非所有被拘留者都是无辜的：政治犯或无害的农民。还有职业罪犯、杀人犯、窃贼、绑匪、小偷和暴徒。这些人正在寻找任何放松营地中严格规定的迹象。他们希望允许一些囚犯回家。这正是发动叛乱的最佳时机

The concentration camp system must be reorganized. Since the announcement of Stalin's death, millions of convicts have been waiting for a softening of their regime and the general atmosphere of optimism is undermining their effectiveness. Most of them believe that their misfortune was caused by Stalin and, now that he is gone, they are waiting for an amnesty or at least a review of their sentences. Of course, not all detainees are innocent: political prisoners or harmless peasants. There are also professional criminals, murderers, burglars, kidnappers, thieves and thugs. These men are on the lookout for any sign of softening of the harsh rules enforced in the camps. They expect some convicts to be allowed to go home. This would be the right time to start a revolt,

在给古拉格集中营的报告中，集中营指挥官迫切要求增援和装备，以及提高生产率的新指示。贝利亚需要尽快解决这个问题。

In their reports to the GULAG, the camp commanders desperately ask for reinforcements and equipment, as well as new instructions to raise the rate of productivity. Beria needs to resolve this issue as soon as possible.

为了平息强迫劳改营中的紧张气氛，贝利亚宣布对未成年罪犯进行小额特赦：包括被判处五年以下徒刑的罪犯、酒鬼和扒手。然而，政治犯和知识分子不能指望得到任何赦免。贝利亚还致力于国际舞台上的重要变化。尽管莫洛托夫是外交部长，但拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚对驻外大使和外交人员的任命拥有最终决定权，因为所有这些人都是代表贝利亚担任安全部门的特工和间谍。后者还决定，他的男人维辛斯基最近不得不辞去外交部长职务，将被提升为苏联驻联合国代表团团长，并将从莫斯科调往纽约。他将在那里领导美国的红色间谍网络。

To calm the tension that reigns in the forced labor camps, Beria proclaims a small amnesty for minor delinquents: criminals, drunks and pickpockets sentenced to less than five years. Political prisoners, however, and the intelligentsia cannot expect any pardon. Beria is also dedicated to important changes on the international scene. Despite the fact that Molotov is Minister of Foreign Affairs, Lavrentiy Pavlovich Beria has the final say in the appointment of ambassadors and diplomatic personnel abroad, since all these people work as agents and spies of the Security on behalf of Beria. The latter also decides that his liege-man, Vyshinsky, who had recently had to resign from his post as Minister of Foreign Affairs, will be elevated to the rank of head of the Soviet delegation to the United Nations and that he will be transferred from Moscow to New York. There he will head the network of red spies in America.

贝利亚回忆起斯大林的几位门徒，尽管他们并不是他公开的支持者，但他不得不接受他们。他以如此高超的技巧和谨慎进行了这次重组，以至于没有引起自由世界的注意，也没有改变苏联外交管理的结构。这次“改组”也没有引起苏联驻外高层人员太多的倒戈。

Beria recalls several of Stalin's proteges, whom he had had to accept even though they were not his declared supporters. He carried out this reorganization with so much skill and discretion that it did not attract the attention of the free world or change the structure of the Soviet foreign administration. This “reshuffling” did not cause too many defections from the upper echelons of Soviet personnel abroad either.

安全警察和高级民兵官员的队伍也受到贝利亚的考验，并清除了任何不安全因素，特别是前安全部长塞米恩·伊格纳季耶夫的追随者，他虽然被解除了职务，但作为贝利亚的私人朋友仍然享有一定的重要性。马林科夫。

The ranks of the Security Police and senior militia officials are also being tested by Beria and purged of any insecure elements, particularly the henchmen of former Security Minister Semion Ignatiev, who , although relieved of his duties, still enjoys some importance as a personal friend of Malenkov.

斯大林的尸检仍然是一个问题，由九名医生进行。尽管他们的报告写得讨好所有人，尤其是贝利亚，但很难相信这些专家和知识渊博的专业人士未能找出斯大林脑溢血和右侧瘫痪的根本原因。 。这样的目击者总是危险的，特别是如果他们中的一个人选择自由并设法在西方避难。这些信息可能会毁掉苏联主人贝利亚的地位。就在拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇得出这个结论后不久，签署死亡证明的医生之一罗萨科夫教授突然去世。几天后，这个教授团队的主席特列季亚科夫博士，公共卫生部长于夜间从家中失踪，并被带到贝利亚位于卢比扬卡的办公室。在那里，医生得知了他的新任务：一家拥有 2000 张床位的大型医院的主任医生，这家医院刚刚在沃尔库塔建成，沃尔库塔是远北地区最大的工作营之一。当晚，特列季亚科夫医生被送往监狱火车，在一辆载有六十名囚犯的牛车上，他遇到了库佩林教授和其他八名同事中的两名，他们一起检查了斯大林的尸体。尸检委员会的其他四位医生都是不太重要的学者。贝利亚决定推迟解决他们的命运。在那里，医生得知了他的新任务：一家拥有 2000 张床位的大型医院的主任医生，这家医院刚刚在沃尔库塔建成，沃尔库塔是远北地区最大的工作营之一。当晚，特列季亚科夫医生被送往监狱火车，在一辆载有六十名囚犯的牛车上，他遇到了库佩林教授和其他八名同事中的两名，他们一起检查了斯大林的尸体。尸检委员会的其他四位医生都是不太重要的学者。贝利亚决定推迟解决他们的命运。在那里，医生得知了他的新任务：一家拥有 2000 张床位的大型医院的主任医生，这家医院刚刚在沃尔库塔建成，沃尔库塔是远北地区最大的工作营之一。当晚，特列季亚科夫医生被送往监狱火车，在一辆载有六十名囚犯的牛车上，他遇到了库佩林教授和其他八名同事中的两名，他们一起检查了斯大林的尸体。尸检委员会的其他四位医生都是不太重要的学者。贝利亚决定推迟解决他们的命运。在一辆载有 60 名囚犯的运牛车里，他遇到了库佩林教授和其他八位同事中的两位，他们一起检查了斯大林的尸体。尸检委员会的其他四位医生都是不太重要的学者。贝利亚决定推迟解决他们的命运。在一辆载有 60 名囚犯的运牛车里，他遇到了库佩林教授和其他八位同事中的两位，他们一起检查了斯大林的尸体。尸检委员会的其他四位医生都是不太重要的学者。贝利亚决定推迟解决他们的命运。

There remains the question of Stalin's autopsy, performed by nine doctors. Despite the fact that their report was written in a way that would please everyone, and especially Beria, it is hard to believe that these expert and knowledgeable professionals were not able to uncover the root cause. of Stalin's cerebral hemorrhage and paralysis of his right side. Such witnesses are always dangerous, especially if one of them, choosing freedom, manages to take refuge in the West. The information could ruin the position of Beria, master of the USSR. It was shortly after Lavrenty Pavlovich came to this conclusion that one of the doctors who signed the death certificate, Professor Rousakov, died suddenly. A few days later, the president of this team of professors, Doctor Tretyakov, Minister of Public Health, disappeared from his home at night and was taken to Beria's office in Lubyanka. There, the doctor learns of his new assignment: head doctor of the huge hospital with two thousand beds which has just been built in Vorkuta, one of the largest work camps in the Far North. The same night, Doctor Tretyakov is driven to a prison train where, in a cattle car occupied by sixty prisoners, he meets Professor Kuperin and two of the eight other colleagues with whom he examined Stalin's body. The four other doctors on the autopsy commission are scholars of lesser importance. Beria decides to postpone settling their fate until later. There, the doctor learns of his new assignment: head doctor of the huge hospital with two thousand beds which has just been built in Vorkuta, one of the largest work camps in the Far North. The same night, Doctor Tretyakov is driven to a prison train where, in a cattle car occupied by sixty prisoners, he meets Professor Kuperin and two of the eight other colleagues with whom he examined Stalin's body. The four other doctors on the autopsy commission are scholars of lesser importance. Beria decides to postpone settling their fate until later. There, the doctor learns of his new assignment: head doctor of the huge hospital with two thousand beds which has just been built in Vorkuta, one of the largest work camps in the Far North. The same night, Doctor Tretyakov is driven to a prison train where, in a cattle car occupied by sixty prisoners, he meets Professor Kuperin and two of the eight other colleagues with whom he examined Stalin's body. The four other doctors on the autopsy commission are scholars of lesser importance. Beria decides to postpone settling their fate until later. in a cattle car occupied by sixty prisoners, he meets Professor Kouperine and two of the eight other colleagues with whom he examined Stalin's body. The four other doctors on the autopsy commission are scholars of lesser importance. Beria decides to postpone settling their fate until later. in a cattle car occupied by sixty prisoners, he meets Professor Kouperine and two of the eight other colleagues with whom he examined Stalin's body. The four other doctors on the autopsy commission are scholars of lesser importance. Beria decides to postpone settling their fate until later.

拉夫连季在几个晚上内迅速完成了整个行动，没有大张旗鼓，其方式与伊格纳季耶夫和他的得力助手留明解决斯大林命令中的“白大褂阴谋”的方式不同。然而，公共卫生部长特列季亚科夫博士、医学委员会主席库佩林教授以及另外两名专家（莫斯科医学科学院院士）等人物被驱逐，此外，第五位医生，不能被忽视。所有这些医生的名字在尸检时被媒体和广播提及，现在已为大众所熟知。

Lavrenti carries out this whole operation promptly, in a few nights, without fanfare, in a different way from that with which Ignatiev and his right-hand man Riumin settled the "plot of white coats" mounted on Stalin's order. However, the ousting of personalities such as Dr Tretyakov, Minister of Public Health, Professor Kuperin, President of the Medical Council, and two other specialists, members of the Moscow Academy of Medical Sciences, to which is added the unexpected and rather mysterious death of a fifth doctor, cannot go unnoticed. All these doctors, whose names were mentioned by the press and the radio at the time of the autopsy, are now known to the masses.

“白大褂阴谋”是由当时不属于贝利亚管辖的原国家安全部策划的。但人们可以将这一阴谋归咎于拉夫连季，因为后者是内务部长。因此，他决定谴责医生的整个事件，将其视为与他无关的神秘事件，但必须揭露并谴责这一事件。贝利亚也毫不怀疑，如果斯大林活得更久，医生的阴谋，即独裁者策划的反犹太和反美事件，将会引发一场新的大清洗，而他，拉夫连季，也会遭到这场清洗。最早也是主要的受害者之一。通过宣称医生是无辜的，拉夫连季采取了一种可能破坏斯大林作为祖国之父的神话的策略，人们必须崇拜的天才。他还可以通过这种方式诋毁斯大林主要针对西方、美国和英国的外交政策。

The "white coat conspiracy" had been set up by the former Ministry of State Security, which at the time was not under Beria's authority. But the people could attribute this plot to Lavrenti, because the latter was Minister of Internal Affairs. He therefore decides to denounce the whole affair of the doctors as a mystification with which he has nothing to do, but which must be unmasked and condemned. Beria also has no doubt that, had Stalin lived longer, the doctors' plot, an anti-Jewish and anti-American affair set up by the dictator, would have set in motion a new great purge of which he, Lavrenty, would have been one of the first and main victims. By proclaiming the innocence of the doctors, Lavrenty resorts to a stratagem likely to undermine the myth of Stalin as the father of the fatherland, genius that the people must adore. He can also, in this way, denigrate Stalin's foreign policy, directed essentially against the West, the United States and Great Britain.

然而，由于伊格纳季耶夫仍处于马林科夫的保护之下，替罪羊必然是伊格纳季耶夫的副手：留明。这位官员是斯大林私人秘书处安全部门的负责人，也是波斯克列比切夫的部下，可以说是已故独裁者的产物。他站在伊格纳季耶夫的身后，只是他手中的傀儡。Riumin，根据斯大林的明确命令“殴打、殴打、殴打克里姆林宫医生，直到他们承认所有罪行56 亲自折磨受害者。但他只是一名警察，没有人会关心他，甚至他的前上司伊格纳季耶夫也不会关心他，为了保住自己的性命，他还有很多事情要做。Riumin 因此被捕并被关在 Lefortovo 监狱。

However, since Ignatiev is still under Malenkov's protective wing, the scapegoat must be Ignatiev's deputy: Riumin. This official, who was head of the security section in Stalin's personal secretariat and who was Poskrebychev's man, can be considered the creature of the late dictator. He stood behind Ignatiev and was just a puppet in his hands. Riumin, under Stalin's express order "beat, beat and beat the Kremlin doctors until they confess all their crimes 56 had personally tortured the victims. But he's just a policeman and no one will care about him, not even his former superior Ignatiev, who will have a lot more to do to save his own head. Riumin is therefore arrested and locked up in the Lefortovo prison.

1953 年 4 月 3 日晚，伊格纳季耶夫的特工、医疗助理莉迪亚·蒂马舒克（Lidia Timashuk）给斯大林写了一封导致克里姆林宫医生被捕的信，她被带到卢比扬卡，贝利亚命令她摘下列宁勋章。斯大林送给她作为奖励。然后她被安置在单独的地下室牢房中，等待转移到劳改营。

On the night of April 3, 1953, Lidia Timashuk, the medical assistant who, as an agent of Ignatiev, wrote Stalin the letter which caused the arrest of the Kremlin doctors was brought to the Lubyanka where Beria ordered her to remove the Order of Lenin that Stalin gave her as a reward. She is then placed in a solitary basement cell awaiting transfer to a forced labor camp.

第二天，《真理报》发布了苏联内务部的官方新闻稿。本新闻稿宣布对毫无根据的被起诉和指控的医生进行平反。他还谴责当时不受他控制的前国家安全部是一个使用苏联法律禁止的不可接受的调查方法的机构。

The next day, Pravda publishes an official press release from the USSR Ministry of Internal Affairs. This press release announces the rehabilitation of the doctors prosecuted and accused without foundation. He also denounced the former Ministry of State Security, which was not under his control at the time, as an agency using inadmissible investigation methods prohibited by USSR law.

《真理报》还宣布莉迪亚·蒂马乔克失去了她的荣誉。现在，没有人怀疑贝利亚为这位斯大林的门生挑衅者准备的命运。

Pravda also announces that Lidia Timachouk has lost her distinction . No one now has any doubts about the fate that Beria has in store for this provocateur who was Stalin's protege.

日复一日，《真理报》向读者呈现一个又一个耸人听闻的故事。这些社论显然是受贝利亚的启发和指挥，谴责他的敌人伊格纳季耶夫是一个政治无知者，受到他的副手、犯罪分子鲁明的操纵。

Day after day, Pravda delivers to its readers one sensational story after another. The editorials, inspired and apparently dictated by Beria, denounce his enemy Ignatiev as a political ignoramus manipulated by his deputy Riumin, a criminal personality.

不久之后，Riumin 被捕的消息被公开。他被认为是罪魁祸首，对克里姆林宫医生的指控和监禁负有责任。其中包括苏联医学界的领军人物，其中包括著名的71岁医生弗拉基米尔·维诺格拉多夫，他曾被留明用铁链锁住、殴打和折磨，直至失去知觉。尽管苏联宪法禁止这种残暴的方法，但还是如此。成千上万的苏联公民可以阅读这篇《真理报》的文章贝利亚透露，“……一群被指控对苏联现役政治家进行破坏、间谍和恐怖活动的医生……被前苏联国家安全部错误地逮捕，没有任何法律依据”。

Shortly after, Riumin's arrest is made public. He is presented as the main culprit, responsible for the accusation and imprisonment of the Kremlin doctors. Among them are the leading medical figures of the Soviet Union, including the famous seventy-one-year-old doctor Vladimir Vinogradov, whom Ryumin chained, beat and tortured until he lost consciousness. And this despite the fact that such atrocious methods are prohibited by the Soviet constitution. Thousands of Soviet citizens can read in this Pravda articlea revelation from Beria that “…a group of doctors accused of sabotage, espionage and terrorist activities against serving statesmen in the USSR…were wrongly arrested by the former Ministry of Security of the State of the USSR, without any legal justification”.

与此同时，在一次审讯中，留明遭到了贝利亚的殴打，贝利亚明显满意地用双拳打掉了斯大林前秘书的所有牙齿，却没有记住这些审讯方法本应吓坏善良的拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇。留明前老板伊格纳季耶夫被解除仍担任苏共中央书记处职务。不过，多亏了总理马林科夫和赫鲁晓夫这两位强有力的保护者，伊格纳季耶夫才躲过了贝利亚的打击。他被流放到遥远的乌拉尔地区的巴什基里亚苏维埃共和国。

At the same time, during an interrogation, Riumin was beaten by Beria who, with obvious satisfaction, knocked out all the teeth of Stalin's former secretary with both fists, not remembering that these interrogation methods were supposed to horrify the good Lavrenty Pavlovich. Ignatiev, Riumin's former boss, is relieved of the duties he still holds as secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union. However, thanks to his two powerful protectors, Prime Minister Malenkov and Nikita Khrushchev, Ignatiev escaped Beria's blows. He is exiled in the distant Soviet republic of Bashkiria, in the Urals.

拉夫连季也没有忘记他的另一个仇敌。这种事从来没有发生在他身上。他记得瓦西里·斯大林在他父亲葬礼上的态度。虽然他自己没有听到醉汉对他喊什么，但他的经纪人的报告对他来说已经足够了。

Nor does Lavrenti forget another of his personal enemies. It never happens to him. He remembered Vassili Stalin's attitude at his father's funeral. Although he himself did not hear what the drunk was shouting at him, the reports of his agents are sufficient for him.

贝利亚与他的一位内阁同事、国防部长布尔加宁进行了友好会谈。他告诉她，像瓦西里这样的酒鬼仍然是空军将军，这是令人无法容忍的。多年来一直害怕贝利亚的布尔加宁欣然接受了。瓦西里·斯大林立即被传唤到国防部，并被告知他必须交出军事证件，并被红军和空军不光彩地开除。但这还不是全部。无论瓦西里去哪里喝伏特加，贝利亚的侦探都会跟踪他。几周后，他们逮捕了他，而年轻的斯大林则在醉酒状态下参加了歌舞表演的争吵。这场战斗是由贝利亚的特工挑起的，贝利亚因此得到了他想要的东西。小斯大林被称为houligan，因此可以这样对待。一名普通的苏联公民因在酒馆里醉酒骚乱而被捕，被判处三年苦役，但斯大林的儿子必须受到更严厉的对待。

Beria has a friendly talk with one of his Cabinet colleagues, Defense Minister Bulganin. He tells her that it is intolerable that an alcoholic like Vassili is still a general in the air force. Bulganin, who for years had feared Beria, eagerly accepted. Vassili Stalin was immediately summoned to the Ministry of Defense where he was told that he had to surrender his military papers and that he was expelled and dismissed without honor from the Red Army and the Air Force. But that's not all. Beria's sleuths follow Vassili wherever he goes to drink his glass of vodka. A few weeks later, they arrest him, while the young Stalin, in a state of intoxication, takes part in a quarrel of cabaret. The fight is provoked by the agents of Beria who thus obtains what he seeks. Stalin Junior is referred to ashouligan and can therefore be treated as such. While a simple Soviet citizen arrested for drunken uproar in a tavern is sentenced to three years of hard labor, Stalin's son must be treated more severely.

对莫斯科地区空军前司令瓦西里·约瑟夫维奇·斯大林将军的审判简短且不复杂。在听取了一些证人的证词后，法官根据贝利亚的指示，判处瓦西里·斯大林八年监禁。这位已故独裁者的儿子在重兵看守下，被从法庭直接带到远离莫斯科的弗拉基米尔小镇一座黑暗潮湿的前监狱。

The trial of the former head of the Moscow Region Air Force, General Vasily Josephovich Stalin, is brief and uncomplicated. After hearing a few witnesses, the judges, on instructions from Beria, sentence Vassili Stalin to eight years in prison. The son of the late dictator is led under heavy guard straight from the courtroom to a dark and damp former prison in the small town of Vladimir, far from Moscow.

在战胜了亲爱的伟大同志斯大林的儿子之后，在镇压了伊格纳季耶夫和留明之后，贝利亚元帅开始通过苏联和东欧追捕他信任的人，以修复这两个对手给他造成的伤害。贝利亚飞往第比利斯，伊格纳季耶夫在那里发动了针对他和他的同伙的“明格勒起义”。拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇没有提出任何指控来证明新的清洗是合理的，他解雇了所有新官员并恢复了他的支持者，任命他的私人朋友科特·查尔克维亚尼为格鲁吉亚共产党第一书记。

After this victory over the son of dear and great comrade Stalin and after the crushing of Ignatiev and Riumin, Marshal Beria begins to repair the damage that these two adversaries have caused him by chasing his trusted men through the Union Soviet and Eastern Europe. Beria flies to Tbilisi where the "Mingrelian uprising" had been staged against him and his associates by Ignatiev. Without producing the slightest accusation to justify a new purge, Lavrenty Pavlovich dismissed all the new officials and restored his supporters, installing his personal friend Koté Tcharkviani as the first secretary of the Georgian Communist Party.

返回莫斯科后，贝利亚将格鲁吉亚使用的方法介绍给其他苏联加盟共和国。在乌克兰、白俄罗斯、拉脱维亚、立陶宛和爱沙尼亚，拉夫伦蒂将人们重新命名为他。他加强了与保加利亚、阿尔巴尼亚、罗马尼亚、捷克斯洛伐克、匈牙利和波兰等被征服国家安全部门的联系。他可以确信东德的忠诚，因为他知道那个国家永远不会有麻烦。他通过他最忠诚的弟子来管理它：德意志民主共和国傀儡总理奥托·格罗特沃尔、贝利亚人兼苏联高级专员弗拉基米尔·谢苗诺夫、威廉·扎伊塞尔和博格丹·科布洛夫。德国陆军上校威廉·扎伊塞尔，一位老共产党员，在苏联避难，他就读于专门研究苏联间谍活动的军事学院。当贝利亚从高加索调到莫斯科后，扎伊塞尔立即为他工作，并成为他的心腹。希特勒战败后，贝利亚派遣扎伊塞尔前往东德并帮助他被任命为国防部长。拉夫伦蒂确信，他的下属和酒友扎伊塞尔是一个值得他信赖的德国人。百分百确定的是，贝利亚保留了他的俄罗斯下属博格丹·科布洛夫，他是东柏林臭名昭著的“贝里亚帮”最忠诚的成员之一。贝利亚派扎伊塞尔前往东德并帮助他任命为国防部长。拉夫伦蒂确信，他的下属和酒友扎伊塞尔是一个值得他信赖的德国人。百分百确定的是，贝利亚保留了他的俄罗斯下属博格丹·科布洛夫，他是东柏林臭名昭著的“贝里亚帮”最忠诚的成员之一。贝利亚派扎伊塞尔前往东德并帮助他任命为国防部长。拉夫伦蒂确信，他的下属和酒友扎伊塞尔是一个值得他信赖的德国人。百分百确定的是，贝利亚保留了他的俄罗斯下属博格丹·科布洛夫，他是东柏林臭名昭著的“贝里亚帮”最忠诚的成员之一。

Returning to Moscow, Beria introduced the methods used in Georgia to other Soviet republics. In Ukraine, Belarus, Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia, Lavrenti renames people to himself. He tightened the links with the security departments of the conquered countries: Bulgaria, Albania, Romania, Czechoslovakia, Hungary and Poland. He can be sure of East Germany's loyalty, because he knows there will never be trouble in that country. He governs it through his most devoted disciples: Otto Grotewohl, puppet Prime Minister of the German Democratic Republic, Vladimir Semionov, Beria man and Soviet high commissioner, Wilhelm Zaisser and Bogdan Kobulov. Colonel in the German army, Wilhelm Zaisser, an old communist, took refuge in the USSR where he attended the military academy devoted to Soviet espionage. When Beria was transferred from the Caucasus to Moscow, Zaisser immediately worked for him and became his confidant. After Hitler's defeat, Beria sent Zaisser to East Germany and helped get him appointed Minister of Defense. Lavrenti is sure that Zaisser, his subordinate and his drinking companion, is a German on whom he can count. To be 100 percent sure, Beria kept his Russian subordinate Bogdan Kobulov, one of the most loyal members of the infamous "Beria gang," in East Berlin. Beria sent Zaisser to East Germany and helped him get himself appointed defense minister. Lavrenti is sure that Zaisser, his subordinate and his drinking companion, is a German on whom he can count. To be 100 percent sure, Beria kept his Russian subordinate Bogdan Kobulov, one of the most loyal members of the infamous "Beria gang," in East Berlin. Beria sent Zaisser to East Germany and helped him get himself appointed defense minister. Lavrenti is sure that Zaisser, his subordinate and his drinking companion, is a German on whom he can count. To be 100 percent sure, Beria kept his Russian subordinate Bogdan Kobulov, one of the most loyal members of the infamous "Beria gang," in East Berlin.

在通往最高权力的艰难道路上，拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚正在准备最后阶段。这是他精心铺就的一条道路，符合一位有远见的政治家、一位精明的战略家的身份，他在战胜第三帝国的战争中担任过苏联国防五大委员会的副主席，尤其符合他的要求。一位称职的建筑工程师，他知道一个小错误可能会毁掉长期计算的结构。贝利亚像一只巨大的蜘蛛一样，在莫斯科上空、在其他政府部长的头顶上编织了他的杀戮之网，准备凯旋进入红场，在克里姆林宫前面，克里姆林宫很快将成为他的个人宫殿。

On the difficult path to supreme power, Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria prepares the final stage. It is a path he paves meticulously, as befits a far-sighted statesman, a shrewd strategist who, during the victorious war against the Third Reich, was vice-chairman of the Big Five Committee for the Defense of the USSR, and especially as befits a competent architectural engineer who knows that a small error can ruin a long-calculated structure. Like a gigantic spider, Beria weaves his murderous web over Moscow, over the heads of the other ministers of the government in place, preparing his triumphal entry into Red Square, in front of the Kremlin which will soon become his personal palace.

内阁成员知道即将发生的事情，但他们无能为力。贝利亚拥有自己的军事力量，是无所不能的。与斯大林一样残暴，但他比已故的精神变态独裁者更冷静，更精于算计。马林科夫、莫洛托夫、米高扬、伏罗希洛夫、卡冈诺维奇、布尔加宁和赫鲁晓夫都惊恐万状，在夜间聆听街上最轻微的杂音，窗下最轻微的沙沙声，因为他们知道，如果一辆汽车停在他们家门前，如果有人敲门，就会有一名秘密警察带着两名警卫来逮捕他们，并将他们带到卢比扬卡监狱。贝利亚将在那里“审问”他们，打碎他们的牙齿，将他们打昏，然后将他们带到地窖处决。相机内。

Cabinet members are aware of what is coming, but they are powerless. Beria, with its own military forces, is all-powerful. As brutal as Stalin, he has more composure, is more calculating than the late psychopathic dictator. Frozen with terror, Malenkov, Molotov, Mikoyan, Voroshilov, Kaganovich, Bulganin and Khrushchev listen at night to the slightest murmur in the street, the slightest rustling under their windows, for they know that if a car stops in front of their house and that if someone knocks at the door, it will be an officer of the secret police, accompanied by two guards, who has come to arrest them and take them to the Lubyanka prison. Beria will "interrogate" them there by breaking their teeth and beating them unconscious before having them led to the cellar and executed.in-camera .

在他们看来，莫斯科的秘密警察驻军似乎只是在等待开始程序的信号。安全部一些精明的高级官员预测，贝利亚政变的零时将是1953年6月19日早上六点。

The secret police garrison in Moscow seems to them to be waiting only for a sign to begin the procedure. Some shrewd senior officers in the Ministry of Security predict that the zero hour for the Beria coup will be June 19, 1953 at six o'clock in the morning.

两天前的6月17日，东柏林爆发了反对苏联占领的起义。

Two days before, on June 17, an uprising broke out in East Berlin against the Soviet occupation.

56 . 尼基塔·赫鲁晓夫于 1956 年 2 月 25 日在苏共第二十次 代表大会上提交的关于斯大林的秘密报告，自由冠军版，巴黎，1970 年。

56 . Nikita Khrushchev's secret report on Stalin presented on February 25, 1956 at the XXth Congress  of the CPSU , Éditions Champ libre, Paris, 1970.

第49章

Chapter 49

结局的开始

The beginning of the end

6月16日，东柏林多家工厂举行群众集会后，德国工人对生产率的提高感到恼火，抗议恶劣的工作条件，并宣布第二天举行总罢工。他们涌上街头，要求更高的工资、更多的食品和更低的价格。人群很快就达到了十万多人。组织示威活动反对共产主义政权。波茨坦广场的苏联宣传办公室的窗户被砸碎，建筑物被纵火焚烧。德国共产党政要的几辆汽车被掀翻。勃兰登堡门上方高高的桅杆上飘扬着巨大的红色苏联国旗，被锤子和镰刀击打，被带进来，撕破并烧毁。

After mass meetings held in several factories in East Berlin on June 16, German workers, annoyed by the increase in production rates, protest against poor working conditions and declare a general strike for the next day. Demanding higher wages, more food and lower prices, they spill into the streets. The crowd soon reached over 100,000 people. Demonstrations are organized against the communist regime. The windows of the Soviet Propaganda Office, Potsdamer Platz, are smashed and the building is set on fire. Several cars of German Communist dignitaries are overturned. The great red Soviet flag, struck with the hammer and sickle, which flies on a tall mast above the Brandenburg Gate, is brought in, lacerated and burned.

驻扎在柏林苏区的俄罗斯军队对这些骚乱毫无准备，完全迷失了方向。出现在波茨坦广场的少数苏联坦克受到了冰雹般的石头和砖块的欢迎。人们担心，这些石头很快就会出现燃烧弹。起义使东柏林陷入混乱。下午两点之前，苏军才抵达增援邻近基地。两百多辆重型坦克和一万多人随即冲入城内。苏联机枪扫射导致数十名抗议者死亡，数百人受伤。主要街道、大道和广场斯大林大道，苏联大使馆所在的马克思恩格斯广场和菩提树下大街被军用卡车和装甲车封锁。德国人民警察进行大规模逮捕。通过扩音器宣布戒严令。

The Russian troops stationed in the Soviet zone of Berlin, ill-prepared for these riots, are completely disoriented. The few Soviet tanks that appear at Potsdamer Platz are greeted by a hail of stones and bricks. It is feared that the stones will soon be followed by Molotov cocktails. The revolt plunges East Berlin into chaos. It was not before two o'clock in the afternoon that the Soviets arrived to reinforce the neighboring bases. More than two hundred heavy tanks and more than ten thousand men then rush into the city. Soviet machine gun fire kills dozens of protesters and injures hundreds. The main streets, avenues and squares Stalin Allee, Marx-Engels Platz and Unter den Linden where the Soviet embassy is located are blocked by military trucks and armored cars. The Volkspolizei, the German people's police, carry out mass arrests. Martial law is proclaimed over loudspeakers.

但事态尚未得到遏制。相反，尽管苏联占领者态度残暴，叛乱还是蔓延到了东德的其他几个城市。在德累斯顿、莱比锡和马格德堡，工人们发起罢工，焚烧公共建筑和红旗。他们消除了俄罗斯统治的任何明显迹象。

But the situation is not yet contained. On the contrary, despite the brutal attitude of the Soviet occupiers, the revolt spread to several other cities in East Germany. In Dresden, Leipzig and Magdeburg, workers call strikes, burn public buildings and red flags. They remove any apparent signs of Russian domination.

叛乱持续了几天才被完全平息。没有人怀疑骚乱对克里姆林宫的苏联领导人来说是一件幸事，因为他们的存在受到了贝利亚的威胁。东德的局势，许多建筑物和工厂的灰烬仍在冒烟，使得莫斯科不可能发动政变。如果德国起义蔓延到其他被苏联奴役的国家，如捷克斯洛伐克、匈牙利、波兰、罗马尼亚和保加利亚，如果得到西方盟国的支持，对于还没有做好准备的苏联来说将是一场灾难。面对美国及其核武器。在这种情况下，贝利亚独裁统治将很快结束。他目前的主要任务是 是给东柏林和整个德国苏区带来秩序。还需要向所有被俄罗斯人占领的东欧国家派遣增援部队。东德是西欧唯一一个居民超过 1800 万、受苏联管辖的国家，东德的起义极大地损害了苏联的声誉。这是一个可能削弱苏联针对西方列强的政策的挫折。东柏林的骚乱摧毁了德意志民主共和国的幸福传说，这是苏联宣传为西方利用而构建的神话。唯一一个拥有超过 1800 万居民、受苏联管辖的西欧国家，极大地损害了苏联的声誉。这是一个可能削弱苏联针对西方列强的政策的挫折。东柏林的骚乱摧毁了德意志民主共和国的幸福传说，这是苏联宣传为西方利用而构建的神话。唯一一个拥有超过 1800 万居民的西欧国家受苏联管理，极大地损害了苏联的声誉。这是一个可能削弱苏联针对西方列强的政策的挫折。东柏林的骚乱摧毁了德意志民主共和国的幸福传说，这是苏联宣传为西方利用而构建的神话。

The revolt lasts several days before being completely subdued. No one suspects that the riots are a blessing for the Soviet leaders in the Kremlin, whose existence is threatened by Beria. The situation in East Germany, where the ashes of many buildings and factories still smoke, makes a coup in Moscow impossible. If the German uprising spreads to other countries enslaved by the USSR, such as Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Poland, Romania and Bulgaria, and if it is supported by the Western Allies, it will be a disaster for the Soviet Union which is not yet ready to face the United States and its atomic weapons. Under such conditions, the Beria dictatorship would come to a swift end. His main task, for now, is to bring order to East Berlin and the entire Soviet zone of Germany. It is also necessary to send reinforcements to all the countries of Eastern Europe occupied by the Russians. The uprising in East Germany, the only country in Western Europe with more than 18 million inhabitants to be under Soviet administration, considerably discredited the USSR. It is a setback that can weaken Soviet policy vis-à-vis the Western powers. The riots in East Berlin destroy the legend of happiness that would know the German Democratic Republic, a myth built by Soviet propaganda for the use of the West. the only Western European country with more than 18 million inhabitants to be under Soviet administration, considerably discredits the USSR. It is a setback that can weaken Soviet policy vis-à-vis the Western powers. The riots in East Berlin destroy the legend of happiness that would know the German Democratic Republic, a myth built by Soviet propaganda for the use of the West. the only Western European country with more than 18 million inhabitants to be under Soviet administration, considerably discredits the USSR. It is a setback that can weaken Soviet policy vis-à-vis the Western powers. The riots in East Berlin destroy the legend of happiness that would know the German Democratic Republic, a myth built by Soviet propaganda for the use of the West.

为了平息东德的骚乱，贝利亚增派了秘密警察部队，并撤换了驻扎在那里的几名高级官员和国家安全部官员，以及间接依赖他的德国红警指挥官。拉夫连季还邀请他的门生科布洛夫将军和东德高级专员等人物离职，但他没有逮捕其中任何人。

To quell the unrest in East Germany, Beria sent more secret police troops and replaced several senior officers and Ministry of State Security (MGB) officials stationed there, as well as commanders of the German red police, who indirectly depend on him. Lavrenti also invites personalities like his protege General Kobulov and the high commissioner in East Germany to leave their posts, but he does not arrest any of them.

东德革命并不是唯一损害苏联声誉的事件。整个自由世界仍然处于由已故斯大林策划、最近被贝利亚谴责为阴谋的克里姆林宫医生事件所引起的情感震撼之中。5月31日针对马林科夫总理的刺杀事件也引起关注。在这些事件尘埃落定之前，在国际媒体和西方国家公众忘记它们之前，贝利亚必须放弃他职业生涯中的任何进展。

The revolution in East Germany is not the only event that undermines the reputation of the Soviet Union. The whole of the free world is still reeling from the emotion caused by the affair of the Kremlin doctors, set up by the late Stalin and recently denounced by Beria as a plot. The assassination attempt against Prime Minister Malenkov on May 31 is also attracting attention. As long as the dust raised by these events has not settled, as long as they have not been forgotten by the international press and by the general public of Western nations, Beria must give up any progress in his career.

1953年6月26日，拉夫连季·贝利亚前往克里姆林宫参加党中央委员会和政治局书记处联席会议。很难确定他是被莫斯卡连科将军枪杀的，还是被赫鲁晓夫枪杀的，或者是被他的内阁同僚米高扬和莫洛托夫在三名红军将军的帮助下勒死的，他们跳到他身上并掐住了他的喉咙，正如也低声说的那样。同样无法确定贝利亚是否是在 6 月 28 日前往莫斯科大剧院的途中被捕，还是如《赫鲁晓夫回忆录》所报道的那样，是在波兰驻莫斯科大使馆的招待会或在克里姆林宫举行的普雷西德会议后被捕。，或者如果贝利亚真的将在1953年12月18日正式宣布审判时站在被告席上，或者如果他将在12月23日听到判处他死刑的判决，则该判决同样适用夜晚。根据华沙共产主义审查机构授权的《波兰大百科全书》，也许他的替身将在法庭上向公众展示，而真正的贝利亚将在五个月前，也就是七月份被清算。由于赫鲁晓夫对拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚之死给出了多个版本，而且每个故事都与前一个故事不同，因此很难相信他的任何说法。然而，贝利亚从政治舞台上消失的第一个迹象是在报纸上的一张纸条上出现的。6月28日《真理报》 ：该报公布了出席歌剧《十月派》演出的政治人物的完整名单，但省略了苏联第一副总理拉夫连季·巴甫洛维奇·贝利亚元帅的名字。

On June 26, 1953, Lavrenty Beria went to the Kremlin for a joint meeting of the Praesidium and the Politburo of the Party Secretariat. It is difficult to establish whether he was shot there by General Moskalenko, or by Khrushchev, or whether he was strangled by his Cabinet colleagues, Mikoyan and Molotov, with the help of three Red Army generals who leap upon him and take him by the throat, as is also whispered. It is equally impossible to know if Beria was arrested on his way to the Bolshoi on June 28 or if he was apprehended after a reception at the Polish Embassy in Moscow or a meeting of the Praesidium in the Kremlin, as reported by Memories by Khrushchev, or if it is really Beria who will stand in the dock when his trial is officially announced on December 18, 1953, or if it is he who will hear, on December 23, the sentence condemning him to death, the sentence applicable the same night. It is perhaps his double who will be shown to the public in the courtroom, while the real Beria will have been liquidated five months earlier, in July, according to the Great Polish Universal Encyclopedia authorized by the communist censor in Warsaw . Since Khrushchev will give several versions of the death of Lavrentiy Pavlovich Beria, and each story differs from the previous one, it is difficult to believe any of his accounts. However, the first hint of Beria's disappearance from the political scene comes in the form of a note in theJune 28 Pravda : the newspaper publishes the full list of political figures who attended the performance of the opera The Decabrists , but omits the name of the First Deputy Prime Minister of the Soviet Union, Marshal Lavrentiy Pavlovich Beria.

关于贝利亚陷落的第一份官方公报于 1953 年 7 月 10 日出现在《真理报》的头版上。其措辞如下：

The first official communiqué relating to the fall of Beria appeared on the front page of Pravda on July 10, 1953. It was worded as follows:

苏联共产党中央委员会全体会议公报。

Bulletin of the Plenary Session of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the USSR.

苏联共产党中央委员会全体会议日前举行。

A plenary session of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the USSR was held a few days ago.

听取并讨论了吉姆·马林科夫同志向中央主席团提交的关于LP·贝利亚为外国资本利益而进行的危害党和国家犯罪活动的报告，揭露了由于他企图将苏联内务部凌驾于苏联政府和苏联共产党之上，苏联共产党中央委员会全体会议决定开除LP贝利亚的职务。苏联共产党。

Having heard and discussed a report from the Presidium of the Central Committee presented by Comrade GM Malenkov on criminal activities against the Party and the State, aimed at undermining the security of the Soviet Union for the benefit of foreign capital, perpetrated by LP Beria and revealed by his wicked attempts to place the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the USSR above the Soviet government and the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, the plenary session of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union decided to expel LP Beria from the ranks of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.

在苏联最高苏维埃主席团

At the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR

鉴于最近发现LP贝利亚从事危害国家的犯罪活动，其目的是破坏苏维埃国家并最大程度地为外国资本的利益服务，苏联最高苏维埃主席团在审议了苏联最高苏维埃提交的报告后苏联部长苏维埃就此事决定：

In view of the recent discovery of criminal activities against the state, intended to undermine the Soviet state and best serve the interests of foreign capital, committed by LP Beria, the Presidium of the Supreme Council of the USSR, after deliberation of the report presented by the Soviet of Ministers of the USSR on this matter, decided:

1. 解除LP·贝利亚的苏联部长会议第一副主席职务和苏联内务部长职务；

1. to relieve LP Beria from the post of First Deputy Chairman of the Council of Ministers of the USSR and from the post of Minister of the Interior of the USSR;

2. 将LP Beria的犯罪活动案件提交苏联最高法院判决。

2. to submit the case of the criminal activities of LP Beria to the judgment of the Supreme Court of the USSR.

在同一期《真理报》发表了一篇长而详细的评论，标题为：

In the same issue, Pravda publishes a long and detailed commentary under the title:

苏联党和政府的团结是坚不可摧的。随后发表声明：莫斯科和莫斯科地区共产党人一致批准苏联共产党中央委员会全体会议通过的决议。与此同时，《消息报》7月10日发表社论：党、政府和苏联民族的团结不可动摇。

The unity of the Party and the government of the Soviet Union is indestructible. It is followed by a statement: the Communists of Moscow and the Moscow region unanimously approve the resolution adopted by the plenary session of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the USSR. At the same time, the Izvestia of July 10 publishes an editorial: the unity of the Party, the government and the Soviet nation is unshakable.

第二天，对贝利亚的袭击仍在继续。《真理报》发表社论，题为：党的声音就是国家的声音。

The next day, the attack on Beria continues. Pravda publishes an editorial entitled: THE VOICE OF THE PARTY IS THE VOICE OF THE NATION .

马林科夫让群众平静了四个星期，然后，8月9日至10日，新闻界提醒全国人民，苏联人民的敌人拉夫连季·贝利亚（Lavrenty Beria）的存在，他是资本主义和腐败西方的挑衅者和特工。

Malenkov let the masses calm down for four weeks, then, on August 9 and 10, the press reminded the nation of the existence of this enemy of the Soviet people, Lavrenty Beria, provocateur and secret agent of the capitalist and corrupt West.

苏联总检察长表现得好像贝利亚还活着并等待审判一样，于 1953 年 12 月 17 日在《真理报》和《消息报》上发表了他对贝利亚及其最亲密的助手和追随者进行调查的正式报告，俗称“贝利亚帮”，尽管媒体将他们描绘成他的同谋。这是一份了不起的文件：

Behaving as if Beria was still alive and awaiting trial, the Prosecutor General of the Soviet Union published on December 17, 1953, in Pravda and Izvestia , the official report of his investigation into Beria and his closest aides and followers, popularly known as the "Beria gang", although the press portrays them as his accomplices. This is an amazing document:

致苏联总检察长办公室

AT THE OFFICE OF THE PROSECUTOR GENERAL OF THE USSR

1953年6月26日，苏联最高部长会议主席团审议了苏联部长会议关于外国资本代理人LP贝利亚旨在破坏苏联政府的犯罪活动的报告。决定解除LP贝利亚的苏联部长会议第一副主席职务和苏联内务部长职务，并对其进行审判。1953年8月8日，苏联最高苏维埃批准了苏联最高苏维埃主席团6月26日发布的法令。

On June 26, 1953, the Presidium of the Supreme Council of Ministers of the USSR, after considering the report of the Council of Ministers of the USSR on the criminal activities of LP Beria, an agent of foreign capital, aimed at undermining the Soviet government, decided to relieve LP Beria from the post of First Deputy Chairman of the USSR Council of Ministers and from the post of Minister of Internal Affairs of the USSR and, in addition, to bring him to trial. On August 8, 1953, the Supreme Council of the USSR approved the decree issued by the Presidium of the Supreme Council of the USSR on June 26.

苏联总检察长办公室现已完成对叛国者LP·贝利亚案的调查。

The Office of the Prosecutor General of the USSR has now completed the investigation into the case of LP Beria, a traitor to his country.

调查表明，贝利亚利用职务之便，组织了一批敌视苏联政府的阴谋分子，具有利用中央和内政部地方机关反党反政府的犯罪意图。苏联为外国资本的利益服务，企图用他们的邪恶图谋，将内务部凌驾于党和政府之上，以夺取政权，废除工农苏维埃制度，复辟资本主义，建立资产阶级政权。

The investigation showed that Beria, taking advantage of his position, organized a group of conspirators, hostile to the Soviet government, with the criminal intention of using central as well as local organs of the Ministry of Internal Affairs against the Party and against the government of the USSR, to serve the interests of foreign capital, to attempt, by their villainous plan, to place the Ministry of Internal Affairs above the Party and the government with the intention of seizing power and to abolish the Soviet system of workers and peasants so as to restore capitalism and establish the power of the bourgeoisie.

被告是俄罗斯前国家安全部长 VN Merkulov，是这一邪恶阴谋集团的积极参与者，他们多年来与贝利亚在内务人民委员部或内务部机构内进行联合犯罪活动。苏联国家监察部部长 V. G. 杰卡诺佐夫 (V. G. Dekanozov)、前苏联内务人民委员部部长以及最近的格鲁吉亚苏维埃社会主义共和国内务部部长 B. A. 科布洛夫 (B. A. Kobulov) ，前格鲁吉亚苏维埃社会主义共和国内务国家委员，时任苏联国家安全部副部长，最近，苏联内务部副部长 S. A. Goglidze、格鲁吉亚苏维埃社会主义共和国内务部前国家委员，最近担任苏联内务部部长、前国家部部长 P. I. Mechnik苏联安全部部长，最近担任乌克兰苏维埃社会主义共和国内务部长，最后是苏联内务部重大案件调查科前科长 LE Vlodzimirski。前苏联国家安全部部长，最近担任乌克兰苏维埃社会主义共和国内务部部长，最后是前苏联内务部重大案件调查处处长 LE Vlodzimirski。前苏联国家安全部部长，最近担任乌克兰苏维埃社会主义共和国内务部部长，最后是前苏联内务部重大案件调查处处长 LE Vlodzimirski。

Active participants in this group of villainous conspirators, who for several years have collaborated with Beria in joint criminal activities within the bodies of the People's Commissariat of Internal Affairs or the Ministry of Internal Affairs, are the defendants VN Merkulov, former Minister of State Security of the USSR and, more recently, Minister of State Control of the USSR, V. G. Dekanozov, former Head of Department of the People's Commissariat of Internal Affairs of the USSR and, more recently , Minister of Internal Affairs of the Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic, B. A. Kobulov, former National Commissar of Internal Affairs of the Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic, then Deputy Minister of State Security of the USSR and, more recently,Deputy Minister of Internal Affairs of the USSR, S. A. Goglidze, former National Commissar of Internal Affairs of the Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic and, more recently, Head of Department at the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the USSR, P. I. Mechnik, former Head Department of State Security of the USSR and, more recently, Minister of Internal Affairs of the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic and finally LE Vlodzimirski, former head of the Major Cases Investigation Section of the Ministry of Internal affairs of the USSR.former Head of State Security Department of the USSR and, more recently, Minister of Internal Affairs of the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic and finally LE Vlodzimirski, former Head of the Major Cases Investigation Section of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the USSR.former Head of State Security Department of the USSR and, more recently, Minister of Internal Affairs of the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic and finally LE Vlodzimirski, former Head of the Major Cases Investigation Section of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the USSR.

贝利亚和他的同伙多年来精心伪装和掩盖他们的敌对和邪恶活动。斯大林逝世后，当反动列强和帝国主义列强对苏联政府发动阴险阴谋时，贝利亚加紧进行颠覆活动，以达到其犯罪目的，主要是利用内务部机关夺取政权。 。然而，这使得能够迅速揭露一个叛国者的可憎嘴脸，并采取果断措施制止他的敌对活动。

Beria and his associates carefully camouflaged and concealed their hostile and wicked activities for years. After the death of JV Stalin, when the reactionary and imperialist powers activated their insidious plots against the Soviet government, Beria intensified his subversive work with the intention of achieving his criminal aims, mainly by using the organs of the Ministry of Internal Affairs to seize power. This, however, made it possible to quickly expose the loathsome face of a traitor to his country and to take decisive measures to put an end to his hostile activities.

1953年3月，贝利亚就任苏联内务部部长后，开始努力提拔他的阴谋集团成员，并让他们担任内务部的领导职务。阴谋者因拒绝执行贝利亚的犯罪命令而对内政部的诚实雇员进行迫害和消灭。

Assuming the post of Minister of Internal Affairs of the USSR in March 1953, Beria began his efforts to elevate and place members of his group of conspirators in leading positions in the Ministry of Internal Affairs. The conspirators subjected honest employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs to persecution and elimination because they refused to carry out Beria's criminal orders.

贝利亚以破坏集体农庄制度、给国家粮食供应制造困难为目的，千方百计地破坏和阻挠党和政府为加强集体农庄经济而采取的最重要措施的实施。国营农场，以及显着增加苏联繁荣的措施。

With the aim of undermining the system of collective farms and creating difficulties in supplying the country with food, Beria sabotaged in every possible way and obstructed the implementation of the most important measures taken by the Party and the government to strengthen the economy of collective farms and state farms, as well as measures to significantly increase the prosperity of the Soviet Union.

人们还认识到，贝利亚及其同伙采取的步骤旨在复兴苏维埃各加盟共和国的资产阶级和民族主义分子的残余，其目的是在苏联各国之间制造敌对和不和，首先是破坏苏联的政权。苏联各民族对伟大俄罗斯民族的友谊。

It was also recognized that Beria and his accomplices took steps aimed at regenerating the remnants of the bourgeoisie and nationalist elements of the Soviet republics, aimed at developing hostility and disharmony between the nations of the USSR and, in the first place place, to undermine the friendship of the nations of the USSR for the great Russian nation.

在苏联境内没有丝毫社会支持的情况下，贝利亚及其同伙的犯罪阴谋指望着国外反动帝国主义列强对他们阴谋的支持。

Without the slightest social support inside the USSR, Beria and his accomplices counted, in their criminal designs, on the support that the reactionary and imperialist powers abroad would give to their conspiracy.

现在，调查已确定贝利亚在内战期间与外国情报部门有联系。1919年，当时在巴库的贝利亚犯下了叛国罪，成为阿塞拜疆穆萨瓦蒂政府反革命部门的特工，该政府在英国特工部门的控制下行事。1920年，贝利亚在格鲁吉亚再次犯下叛国罪，他与格鲁吉亚孟什维克的秘密政治警察部门（英国情报部门的一个分支）建立了秘密联络。

Now, the investigation has established that Beria had contacts with foreign intelligence services during the civil war period. In 1919, Beria, then in Baku, perpetrated an act of treason by becoming a secret agent in the counter-revolutionary services of the Musavatist government of Azerbaijan which acted under the control of the British secret services. In 1920, Beria was in Georgia where he again committed an act of treason by establishing a clandestine liaison with the secret political police department of the Mensheviks of Georgia, which was a branch of the British intelligence services.

调查证明，在接下来的几年里，贝利亚通过从国外派遣的间谍继续并扩大了与外国特工部门的秘密犯罪联系，他总是设法将他们从被捕和应得的惩罚中解救出来。

The investigation proved that during the following years Beria continued and extended his clandestine criminal contacts with the foreign secret services through spies sent from abroad, whom he always managed to save from capture and well-deserved punishment.

贝利亚作为受外国情报机构收买的间谍和叛徒，在其同伙的帮助下，在整个犯罪期间，还继续与反革命的格鲁吉亚孟什维克移民、几个外国情报机构的特工进行秘密联络。活动。

Acting as a spy and a traitor in the pay of foreign intelligence services, Beria, with the help of his accomplices also continued to communicate secretly with the counter-revolutionary Georgian Menshevik émigrés, agents of several foreign intelligence services, throughout the period of his criminal activities.

贝利亚巧妙地掩盖和掩饰自己的犯罪过去以及与外国情报部门的恶性联系，对阻碍实现“独立”目标的诚实党员和苏联工人采取了诽谤、阴谋、各种挑衅和激进的方法。他的计划敌视苏联政府并干预他的掌权。

Skillfully covering up and camouflaging his criminal past and his pernicious connections with the intelligence services of foreign countries, Beria adopted slander, intrigue, various provocations and a radical method of dealing with honest Party members and Soviet workers who stood in the way of the accomplishment of his designs hostile to the Soviet government and intervening in his rise to power.

通过这些犯罪方法，贝利亚及其同伙在格鲁吉亚和整个外高加索地区，然后在苏联内务部，进一步试图夺取权力，以实现其邪恶的目标，他们对待那些草率地向他们表现出敌意，对他们的专断、违法行为毫不畏惧，对党和政府进行了卑鄙的欺骗。

Having reached positions of responsibility, by means of these criminal methods in Georgia and throughout Transcaucasia, then in the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the USSR, further trying to seize power with the intention of achieving his villainous goals, Beria and his accomplices treated people who showed enmity to them summarily, never being frightened by acts of arbitrariness and illegality, thus vilely deceiving the Party and the government.

调查揭露了贝利亚的一些犯罪阴谋，旨在实现促进他的职业生涯并防止他的敌对计划被揭露的目标。事实上，调查证实，贝利亚在同伙的帮助下，在数年的时间里，秘密地对共产党和苏联政府的杰出人物谢尔戈·奥尔忠尼启则进行了一场运动，因为他在他身上看到了一个一心想要实现目标的人。他的进步之路和他的敌对计划的实现。正如现在所证实的那样，谢尔戈·奥尔忠尼启则对贝利亚怀有政治上的不信任感。谢尔戈·奥尔忠尼启则死后，阴谋者继续对其家人进行残酷报复。

The investigation revealed a number of Beria's criminal intrigues, tending to achieve the objectives that were to facilitate his career and prevent his hostile designs from being exposed. Indeed, the investigation established that Beria, for a period of several years and with the help of accomplices, secretly maintained a campaign against Sergo Ordzhonikidze, a prominent figure in the Communist Party and the Soviet government, because he saw in him a man set on the path of his advancement and the realization of his hostile plans. As is now established, Sergo Ordzhonikidze harbored a sense of political distrust of Beria. After the death of Sergo Ordzhonikidze, the conspirators continued to take cruel revenge on his family members.

调查还证实了这样一个事实：共谋者对他们担心会暴露的人实施了恐怖谋杀。因此，贝利亚及其同伙暗杀了自 1902 年起成为共产党员、前全俄反革命和破坏活动特别委员会成员以及捷尔任斯基领导下的格别乌团队成员的凯德罗夫女士。共谋者有理由相信克德罗夫拥有有关贝利亚犯罪历史的信息。关于阴谋者实施恐怖谋杀的其他事实也已确定，其犯罪意图是消灭致力于共产党和苏联政府事业的诚实干部。

The investigation also established the fact that the conspirators committed terrorist murders on people they feared would be exposed. Thus, Beria and his accomplices assassinated MS Kedrov, a member of the Communist Party since 1902, a former member of the All-Russian Extraordinary Commission for Combating Counter-Revolution and Sabotage and of the GPU team under FE Dzerzhinsky . The conspirators had reason to believe that Kedrov had information regarding Beria's criminal past. Other facts have also been established about the terrorist murders committed by the conspirators with the criminal intent to destroy the honest cadres, devoted to the cause of the Communist Party and the Soviet Government.

调查还显示，贝利亚及其同伙犯下了多项叛国行为，企图削弱苏联的防御能力。

The investigation also showed that Beria and his accomplices committed a number of acts of treason, attempting to weaken the defense capabilities of the Soviet Union.

调查提供的证据表明，该犯罪团伙的成员，被告梅尔库洛夫、杰卡诺佐夫、科布洛夫、戈格利泽、梅赫尼克和弗洛济米尔斯基，多年来与贝利亚的犯罪活动有关联，他们执行了向他们发出的任何刑事命令贝利亚的指控，从而帮助他隐瞒和掩饰自己的犯罪过去，并犯下了几起极其严重的危害国家罪行，如上所述。

The evidence provided by the investigation shows that the members of this villainous group, the defendants Merkulov, Dekanozov, Kobulov, Goglidze, Mechnik and Vlodzimirsky, were associated with Beria in criminal activities over many years, which they carried out any criminal orders given to them by Beria, thus helping him to conceal and camouflage his criminal past, and committing several extremely serious crimes against the State, as has been demonstrated above.

由此可以确定，被告人贝利亚、梅尔库洛夫、杰卡诺佐夫、科布洛夫、戈格利泽、梅什尼克和弗洛季米尔斯基背叛了自己的国家，是国际帝国主义的特务，是苏联民族最大的敌人。

From this it could be established that the defendants Beria, Merkulov, Dekanozov, Kobulov, Goglidze, Meshnik and Vlodzimirsky, by betraying their country, acted as secret agents of international imperialism and as the worst enemies of the Soviet nation.

调查还揭露了贝利亚犯下的其他罪行的事实、证明他道德极度堕落的事实、以及他从事雇佣军犯罪活动和滥用权力的事实。

The investigation also revealed facts about other crimes perpetrated by Beria, facts that attest to his extreme moral degradation, as well as facts about his criminal mercenary activities and his abuse of power.

经侦查过程中众多证人的证言和公认准确的精确数据指控，被告人对自己犯下的一些特别严重的国家罪行的过失供认不讳。

Having been denounced by the testimony of numerous witnesses during the investigation and by precise data recognized as accurate, the defendants confessed to the fault they committed by perpetrating a certain number of particularly serious State crimes.

贝利亚因组织反苏阴谋、实施恐怖行为以及积极反对工人阶级和革命工人运动而犯有叛国罪，并受到审判。内战期间在反革命穆萨瓦政府情报机构中担任特工，行为符合《中华人民共和国刑法》第 58-1 B、58-8、58-13、58-11 条规定俄罗斯联邦苏维埃社会主义共和国。

Beria is brought to trial on the charge of treason against the state committed by organizing an anti-Soviet conspiracy, by carrying out terrorist acts, and by active opposition to the working class as well as to the movement revolutionary worker, which he manifested when he served as a secret agent in the intelligence agencies of the counter-revolutionary Mussavatist government during the period of the civil war, acts covered by articles 58-1 B, 58-8, 58- 13, 58-11 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federated Soviet Socialist Republic.

Merkulov、Dekanozov、Kobulov、Goglidze、Mechnik 和 Vlodzimirsky 根据防止恐怖主义行为和参与反革命阴谋集团的规定，即根据防止第 58-1 B 条所述罪行，被绳之以法，俄罗斯联邦苏维埃社会主义共和国刑法典第58-8条、第58-11条。

Merkulov, Dekanozov, Kobulov, Goglidze, Mechnik and Vlodzimirsky are brought to justice under the prevention of terrorist acts and participation in a counter-revolutionary group of conspirators, that is, under the prevention of the crimes referred to in articles 58-1 B, 58-8, 58-11 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federated Soviet Socialist Republic.

根据苏联最高苏维埃主席团颁布的法令，对贝利亚、梅尔库洛夫、杰卡诺佐夫、科布洛夫、戈格利泽、梅奇尼克和弗洛济米尔斯基的指控的案件提交由苏联最高法院决定的特别法庭审理。苏联，根据1934 年12 月 1 日法律成立 。

Pursuant to the decree issued by the Praesidium of the Supreme Council of the USSR, the case concerning the charges against Beria, Merkulov, Dekanozov, Kobulov, Goglidze, Mechnik and Vlodzimirsky is submitted to the appreciation of the Special Court depending on the Supreme Court of the USSR, established under the law of December 1, 1934  .

这是为拉夫连季·帕夫洛维奇·贝利亚案下一阶段制定的法案。

This is the act set up for the next stage of the case of Lavrenty Pavlovich Beria.

结语

Epilogue

人民的声音

The people's voice

贝利亚起诉书公布后，苏联各地工农群众纷纷采取行动，就像大清洗时期一样。已故的斯大林从来不想以一个可怕的暴君的形象出现在全国人民的眼中，他在疯狂中处决了最优秀的爱国者。他想以国家的救世主和同胞的守护天使的身份出现，保护同胞免受不共戴天的敌人的侵害。在判处他的亲密朋友死刑之前，他下令在每个工厂、每个集体农场都配备看门狗，正式名称为“ politrouks”- 专门驻扎在农场或工厂的政治指导员和宣传官员 - 组织群众集会，在会上发表讲话，揭露被告的罪恶。在演讲结束时，演讲者要求听众发表声明谴责受害者。这份宣言由在场所有人签署，表达了全国人民的愿望。被赶来参加这些会议的工人和农民必须按照演讲者的要求去做，即使有时他们同情受害者或从​​未听说过受害者。任何反对的企图显然都是不可能的。这样，被告不仅受到斯大林的公开谴责，

The publication of Beria's indictment was followed by general action among the working-peasant masses throughout the Soviet Union, as in the days of the great purges. The late Stalin never wanted to appear in the eyes of the nation as a formidable tyrant who, in his madness, executed the best of patriots. He wanted to appear as the savior of his country and the guardian angel of his compatriots whom he protected from their mortal enemies.
